review: Always the right choice, Embassy Suites  Price Point, Amenities (Manager's special reception, Individual rooms between parents and kids, two Tv's and All You Can Eat Breakfast cooked to order) and the Hilton Standards.

title: Great Location
review: Great hotel! Clean and new renovated. The Hotel has a straight clean look to it. Within walking distance to every restaurant and bar you can imagine.  Less then two miles from Universal Studios, and minutes away from the rest of the parks.  I  Highly recommend this Hotel

title: A great place to stay
review: The staff was welcoming from the start.  The facility was clean, and bright  and our suite was spacious and comfortable.  The included breakfast was both delicious and bountiful.  Whenever we had a request, the answer was always, "Yes, we can do that."  Special thanks to Mohammed,who checked us in, Elizabeth, and Jose, also at the front desk.  The breakfast room host, Donovan, was especially friendly and helpful.  He welcomed us each morning with a genuine smile and an offer to help in any way.  We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Attended the St. Barbary
review: It was our first time staying at this hotel. Our stay was very pleasant. The staff were very friendly. There is a lot to see and do. The Convention center was very closed by. Breakfast was very good and staff very nice.

title: Will Stay Again!!!
review: The Facility was being upgraded during our stay; however we didn't notice anything that distracted from our stay in Orlando!  We experienced an exceptional stay. The room, facility and the staff were beyond expectation!!! We highly recommend Embassy Suites and will be staying there again! They are our preferred hotel!!!

title: Good, not great stay.............
review: I always try to stay at an Embassy Suites when I travel. However, this hotel is still under renovation and when I booked, it was supposed to be completed. The staff is nice and the rooms are new, spotless and very roomy. The big problem is the construction crew is everywhere and utilizes 2 of the 4 elevators, making for a very frustrating stay. One glitch was, when we returned from our Disney day the room was made up nicely, but there wasn't any toilet tissue at all, any where. Unacceptable. My family includes 4 females, so you can imagine what that meant. I had to wait for the elevators and personally visit the front desk to request them. A little embarrassing to say the least. I'm sure it will be up to Hilton standards soon, but until then, I would stay at another E. Suites…

title: Great place to stay!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your stay.  It was great to hear that the staff was friendly and the hotel clean.  However, I truly apologize for the shortfall with the cleaning service and that you had to go to the Front Desk to ask for toilet paper.  That is a basic item that should always be in the suites and I will follow up with the team.  There are still a few items to complete with the renovation over the next 2 weeks but I am happy to say that all elevators are back in service for guest use.  With that said, if you have an opportunity, please reach out to me to discuss the stay at (407) 581-4301 or email me at william.friedrich@Hilton.com.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Hotel review!
review: Had a Great breakfast and evening reception time.  Great outside Pool.  Was clean and great beds.  Would stay again for the value!  Very friendly staff and helpful!! Was very kid and family friendly.  Great place to stay!

title: Embassy is sweet
review: I enjoyed my stay and will be returning back again next year. It has several restaurants to choose from and it was a great group of staff member always willing make your stay be a pleasant one. The made to order breakfast was great the staff kept the counters and table clean, there was not food laying around, and the rooms were comfortable and neat.

title: Trip to Clemson University's ACC football championship  game.
review: This was the most updated Embassy Suites that I ever stay in.  The location was wonderful.  It was within walking distance to restaurants, entertainment and other types of stores. We didn't have to more our car.

title: Booked through travel agent
review: Overall, great experience! Great location...walking distance to tons of entertainment on Int Dr. And had a trolley atop at the hotel. loved the outdoor pool and hot tub...indoor pool was closed, great breakfast selection, wonderful suite with separate bedroom. Rooms and lobby are sleek and modern. several large TVs in lobby for meeting friends or just getting out of room. Hotel is finishing up a major renovation but not much noise or disruption. Had a horrible experience checking in but all was corrected and an apology fruit tray was delivered to our room. Would definitely recommend to a friend and would stay here again!

title: Business Trip
review: This hotel is situated in a very convenient location, near several restaurants in waling distance.  Additionally, free Happy Hour is provided daily and serves as a great relaxed environment. The hotel staff was very accommodating as well.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
review: Went on a fun business trip.  Surprised at the extras, complimentary cocktails for 2 hours.  Free breakfast with made to order omelets.  WOuld definitely recommend., but I did not know the rate.  Assume they are competitive with all of the properties on International Drive.  Also a ton of restaurants within walking distance.

title: Excellent experience
review: Stayed several days with very favorable memories.  Clean hotel, respectful staff, beautiful architecture, and close to the convention center.  Would definitely recommend.  Close to the parks too so I was able to go to the convention and the rest of the family could play.

title: not up to Hilton standards-needs lots of improvement and reno
review: This hotel needs extreme help with the extreme renovation fumes, loud construction, slow elevators and slack attitude at the front desk.  as a weekly business traveler, i can overlook some issues but this hotel is in major disarray.  I had no airconditioning in the bedroom and no one came by to repair it.   Wi-fi non existent-to super slow hairs in shower on check in

title: Wait Until the Remodel is Finished
review: Thank you for writing a review of the hotel.  Luckily, the renovation will be complete within the next couple of weeks.  The guest rooms were completed in mid December but we are still working on the indoor pool and some meeting space.  While the renovation process can be tough on the guests and our team, the experiences you described with the attitude of the Front Desk Team and the cleanliness of your suite upon arrival are completely unacceptable.  I can honestly say that this is not typical of our hotel.  I would love to speak to you more about your stay and work to make it right.  If you have an opportunity, please reach out to me at (407) 581-4301 or via email at William.Friedrich@Hilton.com.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: The renovations are nice but still under construction.
review: Overall, this Embassy Suites is as to be expected. Clean, (mostly) friendly staff, decent breakfast.  However, the remodel/renovations happening are beyond inconvenient. Half of the elevators are shut down/reserved for construction making it beyond difficult to navigate the hotel, the WiFi doesn't consistently work, the noise levels are unbearable, and many amenities are unavailable.   Once the renovations are complete the hotel will be quite nice I'm sure, but I would highly recommend waiting until then to stay at this hotel.

title: Enjoyed my stay
review: From I arrived at the hotel I was bombarded with smiles.  Beautiful hotel and lovely staff. I enjoyed the evening reception and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Clean rooms and a great location.

title: Will be great when construction is done
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando International Drive Convention Center hotel.  I was excited to see your comment about our smiling team and that you enjoyed your visit.  We hope that when your travels bring you back to Orlando, we will have the opportunity to serve you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Under renovation nightmare!
review: We had a room on the 8th floor, and we arrived after the manager's reception, so I can't comment on that.  The room was very clean.  No mold in the bathroom, and the shower curtain was spotless as well.    The breakfast was hot, though not up to the level I expect from embassy suites, and the fire alarm went off during breakfast and the fire department showed up and had to walk all over the place to make sure it was a false alarm.  The location is in the middle of everything, there are food venues of all price levels available within a couple minutes walk, which was fantastic.  I have to say that the ongoing construction was still pretty heavy, and I think once it is done, I think this place will look great.

title: The hotel staff very helpful.
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit.  It was great to hear that your room was very clean and that you enjoyed our location.  We apologize for the fire alarm scare and the ongoing renovations.  While we are behind schedule with the work, we anticipate all suites to be complete within the next 2 weeks with limited public space upgrades occurring beyond that date.  The entire project for the public areas will be done before the end of December and we could not be more excited to be nearing completion.  We hope that when your travels bring you back to Orlando, we will have the opportunity to host you again and show off all of the upgrades.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Construction Zone
review: Hotel far below expectations due to renovation. Horrible breakfast service. Manager's reception was ok. Hotel should not open during renovation. A/C in rooms should be checked. The mini refrigerator was very noisy.

title: Good experience on second stay
review: This was my second stay at this property and it didn't disappoint. The staff recognized that I was a repeat guest with a small welcome gift that included a few bottles of water (nice touch when you HATE Florida's water). The room was spacious and the bedding was comfortable. The hotel is pretty close to different shops and restaurants - many within walking distance. There is only an indoor pool, which was kind of disappointing, but it was great for a few laps. It wasn't too hot or too cold in the pool or in the room - just right. The evening reception bartender was courteous and quick at making drinks. I wish there was a little more food available. It seems when it runs out it is never restocked. The breakfast was extremely busy but food stayed well stocked. I requested a lower…

title: Ipaid full price to stay on a building site.
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate your experience and for being a repeat guest of ours.  I will review the process for the evening reception snacks and ensure we are not running out of food.  We look forward to welcoming you back when your travels bring you back to Orlando.  Please reach out to me when you are planning travel so I can assist and ensure you get a suite in your desired location.  My email address is William.Friedrich@Hilton.com.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Veterans Day get away
review: I brought my  whole family from Ireland 9 people booked two rooms for a twelve night stay  in this so called hotel .we have stayed there three time previous to this stay and loved it.i dont even know were to start.from the dirt then the staff arguing amongst them selves in the middle of breakfast then the construction workers looking up our cloths while we were going up in the lift.the smell of glue that burnt our eyes and gave us sore throat's, the dust while your trying to eat the cold breakfast just wasn't worth it . for the 12 days we were there our rooms were never hovered ,Mr Hilton needs to send someone  in to look at this cesspit he calls a hotel i wonder would he let his family stay there .

title: Under reno but great hospitality
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I apologize for the impact of the renovations during your visit and would love the opportunity to speak with you about your stay.  The comments regarding the construction crew and our breakfast team were alarming and unacceptable.  Please email me at William.friedrich@Hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301 to discuss your visit.  I would love to have the opportunity to make it right and work to ensure you stay with us for a 5th time when your travels bring you back to Orlando.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Will be nice when construction complete - staff is great
review: The hotel staff was friendly and so helpful. The new renovations are looking amazing. The new suites are comfortable and an absolute joy to stay in. I recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the Orlando area.

title: Great location and hotel accommodations
review: Embassy Suites is the way to go for hotel accommodations. Rooms are spacious, well-kept and nicely decorated. Breakfast buffet is great! Free shuttle services to the main attraction parks is a plus! Will definitely book with Embassy Suites again!

title: under renovation
review: This hotel going to be a nice hotel once renovations are completed - good selection of places to eat within walking distance. I have stayed here numerous times - always a good experience. Current breakfast not the best but once good to order comes back it will be a good breakfast for sure.

title: Don't stay at this hotel!
review: This hotel is under construction - take your ear & nose plugs if you stay at the Embassy. On top of that , the pool area is dirty and the whole place is lacking. It is dirty, noisy and smelly. Stay someplace else!

title: Hotel condition.
review: Because of the renovations, the hotel was not up to standard.  I was very disappointed that they did not mention the renovation. My choice of hotel would have been changed.  We were very dissappointed with this stay.

title: Pretry good but beware construction
review: Nice. Lovely. Once construction done will be amazing. Good location to shuttle service. Can't beat breakfast and happy hour. Nice renovations. Room service good and quicj. Would recommend. Dont know if they have free shuttle like other Embassys. Wad never offered. Accommodated late check out.

title: Stay away
review: The hotel was going through a major renovation. The smell of paint, glue, and the noise from the contractors working made my stay unbearable.  This is the 4th time staying there, and will be my last.  You charged me $200 a night for that.

title: Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando
review: Yes, there is contruction going on, but they don't start until 8:30 AM and stop early evening.  We had our breakfast right beside the curtain blocking the eating area from the construction and was not bothered at all.  Once we got in our room we heard nothing!  The room was great.  We had a comfortable couch in the front room and a comfortable bed in the bedroom.  We had no regrets staying here!  Yes, there is dust on the rails - it's part of "construction" to make the palace even better...

title: Last Minute Reservations
review: I had a last minute change in departure date and was unable to extend my stay in my original hotel.  The online booking process was quick and easy and also provided me a great deal.  This was my first stay at this particular hotel but I will definitely be back!  The entire staff in all areas were super friendly and extremely helpful.  The accommodations were clean and comfortable as well.  I had dinner delivered by room service and was amazed by the quality of the food and the piping hot temperature was a pleasant surprise!  Thanks for a great stay.

title: Terrible construction
review: "Under renovation" doesn't cover it.  They are doing a total gut job.  It was noisy and dirty beyond any expectation.  The breakfast/evening lounge room was dark, had no windows, and smelled horrid - they said they had a construction-related flood.  Why on earth didn't they replace the carpet or whatever smelled so bad?  Only one restaurant, a quick seafood lunch joint.  Even without the construction, my room faced the interstate and was noisy at night (I asked for as quiet a room as they could give me).  I made my reservation far in advance and there was nothing on the web site about renovation.  When I complained, they knocked 30% off the rate, which made the room cost twice what it was worth.  I'd have been better off at Motel 6.  They offered to give me a break on a return…

title: Too much construction
review: A book to stay here a couple months ago and nobody let me know that there was a lot of construction going on the rooms were great but the paint smell and all the noise definitely would not have been my first choice if I would have known ahead of time

title: average hotel
review: This hotel was not special. As a rewards member, I was not greeted as a loyal member and had to ask for membership rewards welcome bag after i checked in. Needed to check room first, but there was nothing there. When you are traveling on the weekend for business, you expect more.

title: stay at embassy suites
review: Nice spot and great location, less then 6 dollars using Uber one way to Universal Studios. The suite was a great setup. Breakfast had several egg and meat options, cereals, oatmeal and toasts. The evening reception is a nice way to bridge the time to your dinner. The best thing was that the entire staff at this hotel was very helpful and friendly! The remodeling was happening while I stayed there. Kind of noisy and dusty but it will look great when completed by end of 2016.

title: construction site
review: Start with the positives...good location. very friendly staff...........negatives....filthy, dusty, noisy , construction site no cooked to order breakfast indoor pool closed outdoor pool dirty, floors dirty cleaning products left around workman using an angle grinder on the balconies out of the 8 floors only 3 were habitable..... never experienced anything like it...avoid at all costs until the work is completed

title: Weekend Getaway
review: Regardless of the renovations going on within the hotel, the individual room we stayed in was not cleaned well. The egress through the front entrance is very inconvenient. The hotel is well insulated making it a great quiet night sleep.

title: Great hotel
review: I felt obligated to write a review after seeing all the complaints about the construction.  I stayed here week of October 31st and saw no signs of construction... so... come on back, it's safe.  Just a beautiful interior with cathedral ceiling atrium.  Below is a split level grotto of chairs and a large bar.  There's happy hour(s) and free breakfast - they didn't bother to hand out coupons or vouchers; just show up.  Maybe because of the off season?  Three open glass elevators responded quickly and I never had to wait more than a minute.  There are fountains spilling over everywhere - as if you are inside a huge water fountain with waterfalls spilling out everywhere.  The roar of the rushing water hits you as you open your room door.  The service was spot on.  My room was long…

title: Better When Remodel is Complete
review: We had a decent stay at this location even though it is currently undergoing a complete remodel.  The staff was courteous and our room was nice.  Rooms on the outside facing freeway are very noisy.  Breakfast options limited due to remodel - not what we've come to expect from Embassy Suites.

title: Very comfortable!
review: I was down in Orlando on business and had the pleasure of staying here.   I have to say that the rooms are very nice!  I found the bed to be very comfortable!  I usually wake up sore when I stay at a lot of places, but not here.  The staff is very friendly and helped point me to the right direction when it comes to food.  I recommend this place and can't wait to see the hotel after it is fully renovated!   The lobby is already looking awesome!

title: Excellent place but watch out for noise
review: The staff and rooms were quite good, as expected.  But if you are sensitive to noise, watch out for rooms facing the highway (deafening) or the fourth floor ice maker (out in the hallway doing a fair imitation of a 747 accelerating for takeoff, 24/7).

title: Staff & room excellent
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We strive to provide an unforgettable experience for each and every guest and I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed the staff and rooms during your stay.  While we are happy that you like our hotel, I would like to sincerely apologize for the noise coming from nearby highway. I will also ensure that the ice maker noise has been addressed by our Engineering Department and has been corrected . When your travels bring you back to Orlando, please reach out to me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com so I may assist with your plans.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Amazing
review: The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The new mattress was very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel. Remodeling is still taking place so don't plan on sleeping late. The manager reception food selection is pretty scaled down for an Embassy.

title: Wonderful Hotel!!!
review: Stayed here during our time at Universal Studios and Sea World.  Service was EXCELLENT!  Loved that there was shuttle service to and from the parks, on site restaurant and complimentary parking.    The suites have a great layout and very spacious!  Very clean and had all the amenities needed. There was some construction going on; however, it was during the day while we were at the parks and was not a problem at all.

title: Great Stay for Location and Price
review: I would recommend this location for many reasons. The staff is very kind, friendly, accommodating and truly want to help you. Although there is remodeling being completed, it does not inconvenience you other than being kept away from these areas. They room was clean and comfortable and the location to the various local areas of attraction is great. Great cost as well for a great stay. I would definitely stay again with my family.

title: Bring your own pillow
review: The pillows go flat as soon as you lay down!  Let the water run - hot water takes a long time to get to the room!  The hotel is currently being renovated.  Breakfast was held in a banquet room and below normal quality.

title: Construction
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. While we are striving to provide great experiences, we realize that the made-to-order breakfast being temporarily unavailable at its usual location has been a disappointment to our guests. We have now officially re-opened the breakfast area and have gone back to our cooked to order breakfast.  With that said, I would like to know what suite you stayed in so I can research the cause of your disappointment with the pillows as we take great pride in our newly renovated rooms and high quality Hilton bedding. When your travels bring you back to Orlando, please reach out to me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com so I may assist with your plans.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Resort
review: The hotel was under construction which was fine if they had stated it right on the web site.   Said there was construction being done in parts of the Atrium and parts would not be available.  No atrium at all Breakfast was advertised on the web site and even on the bulletin boards they had set up as cook to order - NOT!!!!   Pool was dirty.

title: Nice hotel / great location
review: Great hotel in a great location. Close to shopping and restaurants. Was in town for business and the hotel was not overrun with kids. Friendly staff, clean, renovated room.  The hotel was under construction-the end results will improve the property

title: Great Hotel
review: Very clean and comfortable and close to shops, restaurants, and entertainment. The hotel sits on an active strip where you can walk and have lots to do. The rooms are very large and comfortable to accommodate a  family. If your room is on the side of I-10 you can watch the fireworks from Disney and or Magic Kingdom  late at night right from your stateroom.

title: Renovation nightmare
review: What a farce....hotel should not have been open. All but two floors were undergoing major renovations, which I was not told about during booking or even when I checked in. Terrible experience. The entire hotel was covered in a layer of dust from the renovations and the entire bottom floor (apart from check in) was closed.

title: Embassy Suites International Drive Orlando
review: Thank you for your valued feedback. Our goal is to exceed your expectations by delivering outstanding service and accommodations. I am disappointed that due to the ongoing renovation we fell short of your expectations on this stay and please be assured this was temporary. I am looking forward to renovation being completed very soon and I hope that you can return again to experience our amazing transformation.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Undergoing Renovation
review: A very nice hotel and will be even better once the lobby renovations are completed. I wish we would have known prior to our arrival that the hotel was under renovation. We were given a newly renovated room which was absolutely beautiful.

title: Don't stay during renovation
review: AC didn't work, sheets smelled, room smelled, cold breakfast, indoor pool wasn't open.  Construction started very early in the morning.  Our reservation was for a King but we were given a double and when asked to move were told that it was too late to transfer us (we had a late check-in)  The room was also on the street with a lot of noise.  We wanted the location and have stayed at this hotel before with a good experience.  Learned our lesson - Don't stay at the hotel during renovation.  Very disappointed especially since they did not have a reduced rate for the renovation period.

title: Fantastic stay and service
review: Thank you for your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear you enjoyed your previous stay with us and I appreciate your feedback in regards to the details of your most recent one.  We truly regret not meeting your expectations this time as our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for every guest. Please accept my sincerest apologies for your disappointment and the inconvenience. I can understand the frustration experienced with Front Desk and can assure you this certainly is not indicative of our Hotel service. We were due for an update and we are looking forward to the completion of the project very soon.  There are multiple enhancements being made to our property, including a redesign of our guest rooms and atrium that will improve the look and feel of the hotel. I hope that you’ll return soon to experience the amazing results of our transformation.  When your travels are bringing you back to Orlando, please reach out to me directly at William.Friedrich@hilton.com so I may assist with reservations.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Currently under some renovation.
review: We stayed from 24 Sept thru to 10 Oct 2016. We were aware of the refurbishment and had been in contact with the hotel via email. Check in was quick and we were allocated a re-furbished room on the 8th floor. Nice selection for breakfast and we enjoyed the Manager's special on a couple of occasions. We used the shuttles for Disney which were reliable and on time. The staff were very helpful and courteous. We have already decided to stay here next year to see the finished work. Great place convenient to Pointe Orlando and I Drive 360.

title: Older style hotel
review: Overall, just ok for the money paid. New atrium to be finished by late October. Other areas late this year.   Breakfast is in a conference room. The "Omelettes" are not custom made as usual but the pre frozen ones. Hmmm?  Room overall fine. Bed comfortable. Nice work area.    Though " renovated " my room still had issues with electric plugs, and finish work around the tub.   Staff was good and friendly.    I'd wait Til November.

title: Nice time had by all
review: Thank you for your recent stay with us. We are so pleased to hear that you have enjoyed the staff and the comfort of our beds and convenience of the work area. Please accept my apologies for the issues you have experienced. I would like to know what suite you stayed in so I can research the electric plugs and tub issues. Also, I am looking forward to the renovations being completed very soon so we can offer much improved breakfast experience in a completely re-imagined space!  I hope that you can return again to experience our amazing transformation.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Hurricane Matthew
review: Great customer service. No quick service check out. Checking in was kind of slow. I was a Hilton gold member and did not get the normal welcome bag I usual get. Elevators slow. Catered dinner was fabulous with university of Chicago.

title: Under construction nightmare!
review: No what were acustomed by Embassy suites. We are not staying  Never again in a hotel under construction. Same fee as usual but hotel was horrible. Lot of dust, paint smells, a/c not working properly, room was not ready as promised. Amenities were just ok.

title: Fabulous staff. Remodel in progress...will be beautiful.
review: Thank you for sharing your review. We truly regret not meeting your expectations as our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for our guests. Your feedback is very important to us as it is through the lens of our guests that we are able to critique and further improve the overall operation of the hotel. We would like to regain your trust and hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to the area. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further about your experience. Should you have the time, please contact me directly at william.friedrich@Hilton.com.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellent
review: Stayed at Embassy Suites International Drive for a conference I was attending.....just in time for hurricane Matthew to become an issue! Let's back up a bit.....the hotel is undergoing extensive renovations. The central interior courtyard looks a bit like Pompei! Many rooms have completed renovations and some are done except for some finish work or in some cases, bathtub refinishing. Workers start around 7am and it can be noisy if you're on a lower floor overlooking the construction. I was initially on the third floor and really wasn't bothered by the noise as the bedroom was in the back. The re-done room was tasteful. I had a problem with off-gassing from the new carpeting, paint, and other materials and my window did not open. When I spoke with the front desk staff they very…

title: Don't do it
review: Wasn't aware of construction.  Staff was awesome. Room was very nice. Extended stay due to hurricane and the staff was very comforting. Love the breakfast and reception. Love the suites. I highly recommend embassy suites

title: First Class Embassy Suites
review: This was our 3rd visit to this hotel and again it was a wonderful stay even with renovations being carried out. We were in one of the newly updated rooms which had been renovated to a very high standard. All staff were first class, very polite and helpful, nothing was a problem for them to help us with. The hotel is in a fantastic location on International Drive, with fantastic restaurants and shopping on the door step and close to all major theme parks. Full breakfast facilities are provided at this hotel, with cooked breakfast as well as continental. Both of which are first class and well presented. Complimentary drinks and snacks are also available at night from 5.30pm - 7.30pm, after a day at the parks it allows you some time to relax and is very much appreciated. We can't…

title: Embassy Suites by Hilton
review: The Embassy Suites was good. Construction and remodeling was in progress. Delays with the elevators was to be expected. The staff was very accommodating under the circumstances. The remodel rooms are nice. It looks like the overall make over of the Embassy will be amazing.

title: Under renovation
review: Thank you so much for your review and kind words in regards to our staff. While we strive each day to provide our guests with the very best service experience possible, we acknowledge the inconvenience being caused by the ongoing renovation and would like to sincerely apologize about it. I am certain our guests will be pleased with the amazing transformation of the property and look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Orlando Embassy Suites
review: The property was under renovation so it's tough to give a solid recommendation until the renovations are done.  The staff is friendly but you have to deal with the paint smell, construction activities, some area's clean and some not.

title: A work stay...
review: While staff is very nice, the hotel is under a major renovation. Noise level, disengaged elevators, solvent smell, and ease of movement around hotel affect the stay. Best to come back after all renovations are finalized

title: Cunstruction Nightmare
review: The website says under construction, fishing by the end of September, they forgot to tell you what year, I am not sure when it will be done but no way it will be competed in 2016. I am a Hilton honors member and I was not impressed, the fumes were enough for me to wake up with a headache every morning, sawing , grinding, welding, sheet rocking, you name they were doing it and all times of the day and night No compensation offered, everyone else I spoke to was beside themselves too, would have stayed somewhere else for sure.

title: Good stay, but missing a few things.
review: The remodeled rooms in the hotel were very nice with a second sink area in the bedroom and a bar in the living area with a large refrigerator and microwave.  There are only 3 real chairs to use to gather around the table - if you need a 4th, you'll have to use the ottoman.  The bed was comfortable for me, and it was nice to have a door to close off the living area from the bedroom.  The indoor pool is closed with their construction - something I didn't see listed on the disclaimer at the top of the website.  (For me, this would ordinarily be no big deal, but we could have used it this time to entertain a toddler.)    The complimentary buffet breakfast had quite a few choices, though the one morning I had a pancake, it was more like a hockey puck than a "cake"!  Also, most of the…

title: Rare Opportunity: Stay on the Death Star during reconstruction!
review: As of late Sept. 2016, the hotel is still undergoing construction on its interior. The rooms that are open are up to Embassy Suites standards but overall, it was disappointing because of the commotion. Give it a few weeks, call to see where they are at, and then definitely give this hotel a try.

title: Embassy...not a good look
review: The staff was friendly. The hotel was barely habitable given the state of the lobby. The construction noise was unbearable. I'd suggest the hotel cut losses and just CLOSE temporarily until renovations are completely done or near done. I suppose the hotel didn't want to lose money and rather sacrifice the look and ambience and perhaps safety to keep the doors open to continue to make money. Workers were in arms length wheeling out wheelbarrows with dirt and debris. Workers were wearing masks, which made me raise an eyebrow,  wondering if I should do the same!!! NOT a good look at all!!  The breakfast was barely edible and the food was bland and not fresh.  The food was just downright awful. The temporary dining area had an old, musty smell to it upon entry, making the dining…

title: Dissatisfied
review: The hotel HVAC was poor in my room, there was no ESPN, the lobby was noisy and dirty from construction, the hotel breakfast was subpar, the restaurant forgot to put my food order in. The only reason we selected this hotel was because of the location and proximity to our business needs.

title: Under construction
review: This hotel is currently under major construction. It is dusty, and noisy. Definitely needs improvement. Old rooms are dated and worn. Water sprayed from the pipes in my bathroom.  Posters showing new rooms look nice.  Staff were pleasant and helpful.

title: Exceptional customer service!
review: I recently stayed here for a business trip.  The hotel is under construction but the staff is doing everything they can to help with any issues.  On my first day I lost the pendant from my necklace down the bathroom sink.  I stopped at the front desk on my way out to ask them if there was any way that someone could try and locate the pendant in the sink.  The wonderful girl at the front desk assured me they would look for it and offered to contact housekeeping immediately as well to ensure that no one used the sink before maintenance could get there - I hadn't thought of that and appreciated her extra effort!  I arrived back in my room late that night to find my necklace with pendant nicely laid out on a towel to ensure that I saw it.  What a wonderful example of exceptional…

title: So much renovation. Without notice.
review: I wouldn't choose this hotel until Oct 2016, when the renovations are supposed to be complete. As of right now there is not an atrium in the middle. Because of that they are not doing made to order breakfast and the drink reception is in a room that makes you feel like your in an aa meeting with terrible snacks.

title: Very, very noisy visit
review: Good location but if you want a good nights sleep without constant noise Do Not Stay Here! Every night it sounded as if the traffic was right in your room with you. Couple that with the doors consistently slamming shut in the hall way led to the worst week of sleep I think I have ever had.

title: Besides the construction and lousy pillows, everything was fine
review: Dear Robert S, Thank you for sharing your review. We truly regret not meeting your expectations as our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for our guests. Please accept our deepest apologies about the noise during your recent stay. We would like to regain your trust and hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional experience when your travels bring you back to the area. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further. Should you have the time, please contact me directly at william.friedrich@Hilton.com.    Sincerely,   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great location! Under construction though
review: A bunch of my friends and I decided to hit up Orlando and use our first responders passes to go to SeaWorld. The hotel is in a perfect location, it was right at the center of every restaurant and bar on International Drive. We didn't have to drive anywhere, we were within walking distance.  We booked the newly renovated Presidential Suite. We were the first ones in there. It was great! Beautiful furniture, perfect layout, 2 bedrooms, 1 king bed, 2 queen beds. The bathrooms were beautiful.   Just a couple of minor flaws, one of the bathrooms door won't close completely, it wasn't leveled very well. We never had hot water to shower with, we all had to take cold showers but there was hot water in the sinks. We did notify management of the issue but the hot showers never came. They…

title: Good location but ....
review: My family and I stayed at this hotel many years ago and enjoyed it. However, this time around our stay was ruined by the renovation work being carried out at the hotel. Yes, renovations and updates need to be carried out but this ruined the feel of the hotel. We were first given an old suite which was so outdated, we felt it was overpriced for the accommodation. Fortunately, we were moved to one of the newly renovated suites but this still has the old small bath which is just big enough for a small person. The new suites also do not have safes which in this day and age is a basic feature in all hotels!! This is a complete let down for a Hilton hotel!!

title: Business / Pleasure
review: Dear _cathycandco,  Thank you for your valued feedback. Our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for our guests and I am disappointed that due to the ongoing renovation we fell short of your expectations on this stay. Please be assured this is temporary. While we are working hard to limit the impact of the renovations, we still have about a month left until completion. The suites did not have safes historically, which was a known source of dissatisfaction for our guests.  However, the newly renovated suites are equipped with a safe; it is located in the living area just below the TV, within the stand.  I hope that you can return soon to experience our amazing transformation. When your travels bring you back to Orlando, please reach out to me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com so I may assist with your plans.   Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Not worth the price
review: In town for a trade show and the entire family [8] joined me. The hotel was under a renovation so some amenities were not available but the construction did not pose a big problem.  The staff was excellent.

title: Anniversary stay
review: Hotel was absolutely destroyed by construction, and our room had a foul odor. I didn't get any HHonors benefits, nor was told about any managers reception or breakfast.  Really disappointed considering the room was almost $300 even with the construction.

title: lesson learned
review: It would have been nice to know that this location was under heavy construction, The noise was unbearable and actually had to stay out of the hotel untill 8pm when the construction workers went home .

title: Not Bad!
review: Dear Greg L, Thank you for your valued feedback. Our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for our guests and I am disappointed that due to the ongoing renovation we fell short of your expectations on this stay. I certainly apologize about the noise and while we are working hard to limit the impact of the renovation, we still have about a month left. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further about your experience. Should you have the time, please contact me directly at william.friedrich@Hilton.com.    Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Under renovation - might be ok for some.
review: I read all of the reviews before I arrived at the Hotel! Let's just say the reviews had me scared and nervous all at the same time. I pictured terrible things about the Hotel at Embassy Suites. My stay was from Sept.3-7th! Construction is going on. But, it's not that bad the Hotel is still in good condition and the staff made sure our stay was comfortable and relaxing. I'm sure once construction is finished with all of the updates the hotel will be super nice! I can't wait to come back and visit to see the upgrades.

title: Disappointing
review: Dear Danielle B, Thank you for sharing comments of your recent stay with us. We are happy to hear that you had many positive interactions with our team, as we strive each day to provide our guests with the very best service experience possible.  While we are glad to hear you enjoyed our hotel, I would like to sincerely apologize for the ongoing construction during your stay. There are multiple enhancements being made to the guest rooms and atrium and we know our guests will be pleased with our amazing transformation. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Good stay at Embassy Suites
review: So it said under renovation on the site. So I knew going in was under construction. That said there were still a few surprises.  Staff was friendly and accommodating. After getting a 90% renovated room to start - with tub and sink lacking renovation but balance of room done, they moved us to a different room (only a big deal because little ones needed tub). The new room had workers most all day every day - and that was surprising / disappointing, as I thought the work was done on top 3 floors.  Breakfast lacked the omelet station that is usually part of the breakfast, good otherwise.  The place is just noisy at night. The I drive side has bars across the street that quite down at about midnight, and the balance of sides are subject to I-4 noise. The windows are just thin and…

title: Under Construction
review: We booked the hotel understanding that there were "some areas of the atrium were unavailable due to renovations" as indicated on the website when we made the reservation.  Unfortunately, that was not an accurate description of the conditions at the property.  As we found out, the entire atrium was blocked off due to the entire hotel be remodeled.  There was enormous construction equipment within the atrium, as well as work being done to remodel the guest rooms on multiple floors.  The construction noise was incredible. We were assigned a guest room that had recently been remodeled.  It reeked of adhesive and fresh paint and was totally uninhabitable.  As an airline pilot, I spend well over 100 nights a year in hotels and I am used to "remodeling inconveniences", however, in my…

title: Rocky start soon changed to a great stay
review: Dear Steve C,  Thank you for sharing your review. We truly regret not meeting your expectations due to the ongoing renovation and we are looking forward to the completion of the project very soon. There are multiple enhancements being made that will improve the look and feel of the hotel. Please accept my deepest apologies. We would like to regain your trust and hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to the area. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further about your experience. Should you have the time, please contact me directly at william.friedrich@Hilton.com.    Sincerely,   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Don't stay here until renovations complete!
review: We started off rocky due to miscommunication on the phone about Universal tickets, but the hotel easily overcame that.  This is a very nice property.  The rooms were very nice and roomy.  The pool and hot tub were both very nice, as the pool is both indoor/outdoor.  The breakfast every morning was very tasty with good variety.  Staff overall did a great job.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good stay
review: Entire atrium closed due to renovations... Pay half the price for this hotel and stay somewhere else. However, once renovations are complete this will be a beautiful hotel to stay in. And it is located in an awesome location.

title: Excellent location and fantastic breakfast
review: Dear michellesC6166CT,  Thank you for your valued feedback. I would like to sincerely apologize for the experience you had during your recent stay with us. While we are working hard to limit the impact of the renovations, we still have just over a month left until completion of the atrium. I can certainly understand the frustration you’ve experienced and would really like to speak with you regarding your visit.  Please contact me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich  General Manager

title: Good
review: The hotel was great but couldn't use the gym like I wanted to. Staff was very professional though and the hotel since they remodel was amazing. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay at a nice and clean hotel.

title: sleeping on the hell
review: Dear Kyle G,  Thank you for your recent stay with us. We are so pleased to hear that you have enjoyed the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. We appreciate you sharing your experience with others and hope you are able to return very soon!  Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich  General Manager

title: Managers special
review: too noisy on night and morning cannot sleep well unclear towels bad ac good place friendly staff good price free wifi and there is free breakfast but the food wasn't good every day the same food but friendly staff at breakfast

title: Don't lodge here until renovation is complete
review: Dear hamadalkhateeb,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review on TripAdvisor. I value and appreciate your candid feedback. Please accept my apologies for the issues you have experienced. I would like to know what suite you stayed in so I can research the towels and AC issues. Due to the ongoing renovation, the breakfast items are currently prepared in advance rather than cooked to order. I am looking forward to the public space renovations being complete in October so we can offer a much improved breakfast experience in a completely re-imagined space!  I hope that you can return again to experience our amazing transformation.    Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Disneyworld hotel
review: We have stayed at embassy suits I drive and lake buena vista they are excellent hotels and perfect location . The hotel offers breakfast and managers specials this includes free drinks and snacks . Great hotels for families and the pool is normally quiet

title: The worst
review: The hotel is very dirty The furniture is old and only half the elevators work the hotel is a pass don't stay here your wasting your money They have let it go completely even the staff  Said the place is really bad

title: Under renovation but looking good
review: Granted, I stayed here while they were going through renovation, so some of the services were not fully operational, however the service and courtesy were extremely good, the complimentary breakfast - served in one of the conference rooms - was very well done, with a variety of hot and cold plates, and friendly staff. Stayed in one of the renovated rooms (3 floors are completed) and they look great!!! What made the stay memorable, though, was the service.  From the Manager to Front Desk to Servers, they all went out of their way to make the stay an enjoyable one. The location of the property is very convenient, not only to the International Drive points of interest: Convention Center, The Eye, shopping, etc., but also to the area attractions, as it has very easy access to…

title: Excellent
review: Will surely visit soon  great time at your hotel location service cleanness were better than we margined wonderful hotel  see you soon. Business or pleasure  we will be there great fir family and friends

title: Great hotel stay
review: Even under difficult circumstances due to major renovation, the service levels were above expectations and the room was clean and comfortable.  Kudos to the staff and management for making my stay very comfortable.  I will stay here again as necessary for business or pleasure.

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: Dear D6097ERdand,  Thank you so much for your fantastic review and kind words in regards to the staff and management. I am so happy to hear that you had many positive interactions with our team, as we strive each day to provide our guests with the very best service experience possible. There are multiple enhancements being made to the guest rooms and atrium and we know our guests will be pleased with our amazing transformation. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellent Family Vacation
review: The haters need to take a rest and butt out!! Bill, Erica and all of the team at this hotel are superstars and a credit to their organisation! Yes there was construction, yes there was noise and yes some aspects were different BUT if myself, my wife and three small children can travel 4000 miles, rise above this and have a comfortable relaxed vacation then so can all the haters!   Some of the remarks I have read are so funny and I'm sorry but some people need to get a firmer grip on reality!  Bill, Erica - THANK YOU SO SO MUCH!!!  The Sykes Family

title: Sons Graduation
review: Love Love This hotel for everything, staff rooms beds, evening reception, pools, atrium, except this survey is so long and getting on my nerves. The construction there was bad, but I can not wait to see the final results to the hotel and look forward to visiting them again.

title: Dated hotel
review: Dear Teresa H,  Thank you for taking your time to write such a wonderful review. We strive to provide an unforgettable experience for each and every guest and I am so pleased to hear that we were successful during your stay.  While we are happy that you love our hotel, I would like to sincerely apologize for the renovation work being completed during your stay. I am looking forward to completion of the renovation process and I hope that you can return soon to experience our amazing transformation.    Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Staycation
review: Though they have renovations underway, this hotel is dated.  I had to stay in one of the old room that hadn't been remodeled yet and it just had a drab feel to it.  I won't stay here again until the remodeling is complete

title: NEVER EVER - RENOVATION
review: Dear 165melanien,  Thank you for sharing your review. We truly regret not meeting your expectations as our goal is to ensure a great hotel experience for every guest. Please accept my sincerest apologies for the condition of your room. We were indeed due for an update as you saw and we are looking forward to the completion of the project later this year.  There are multiple enhancements being made to our property, including a redesign of our guest rooms and atrium that will improve the look and feel of the hotel. I hope that you’ll return soon to experience the amazing results of our transformation.   Sincerely,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Poor Quality for an Embassy Suites Hotel
review: This hotel is under renovation and offers poor services at this time.  The atrium is covered by a tent and completely inaccessible. There were workers and sand-blasting of the railing on several floors.  The breakfast was of very poor quality and evening reception consisted of popcorn or nachos with wine - not what you would expect at an Embassy Suites Hotel.

title: Friendly staff
review: Dear Gayla S, Thank you for your valued feedback. Our goal is to exceed your expectations by delivering outstanding service. I am disappointed that due to the ongoing renovation we fell short of your expectations on this stay and please be assured this is temporary. While we are working hard to limit the impact of the renovation, the atrium will continue to be closed off until late September.   Sincerely, Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Not the best.
review: Friendly staff greeted us and we're very helpful at reception.  The pool area was nice and relaxed.  The bar was good it was free between 5-7 for anything you wanted.  The rooms were massive and clean, had everything we needed.  Breakfast was very good. Loads to choose from and as much as you like!

title: Could have been better
review: When I was booking this hotel the customer service didn't say anything to me about construction going on.  I found out about the construction when I received my confirmation email.  They said minor construction but the place smelled heavily of paint or glue.  Construction resumed early in the morning.  No one answered the phones when we tried to call the front desk and no one was there went we went downstairs either.

title: Place is a Wreck!
review: Dear sundbergk,  Thank you for your recent stay with us. I appreciate your feedback in regards to the details of your stay and certainly apologize about the smell of paint. The work is going on daily from 8:30am to 6pm and while we still have a couple of months left, the major noise has subsided already. I can understand the frustration experienced with front desk and can assure you this certainly is not indicative of our hotel service.   Sincerely, Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Experience!
review: My family and I stayed here on both ends of our vacation. Price was very reasonable and a Good location to all of the Parks in Orlando. They also have a awesome  complementary Happy Hour and Breakfast everyday!! A Great place to stay for the entire family

title: Jackhammer at 7:30 a.m.
review: Dear Marc S, Thank you so much for the great review of our property! We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed our close proximity to the parks and complimentary happy hour and breakfast. We appreciate you sharing your experiences with others and hope you are able to return this fall to experience our transformed property!  Regards, Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Avoid at all cost
review: Went for my anniversary. Wanted peace and quiet. Was awakened at 7:30 a.m. by loud jackhammers, electric saws, all kinds of construction noise. They are renovating the hotel. Yuck! My family is cranky and tired! This should be closed until renovations are done! I thought some prisoners were tunneling into my room!

title: Huuuuge Renovation going on ....
review: Dear Lisa C,  Thank you for your valued feedback. I would like to sincerely apologize for the experience you had during your recent stay with us. While we are working hard to limit the impact of the renovations, we still have a couple of months left until completion. However, the jackhammering and use of heavy machinery is complete at this point. I can certainly understand the frustration you’ve experienced and would really like to speak with you regarding your visit.  Please contact me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Sincerely, Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Renovation
review: I reserved one one night for my son and his family for a transition night out of a timeshare. We knew they hd construction but the noise went on well past 5pm so the kids could not nap. smell was bad and room was old and worn. bathroom was "gross" not clean. Room door would not self close. They also charge for self parking. glad it was only one night.

title: Nice Rooms
review: Stayed in this hotel about two years ago. The location was good on international drive, close to lots of restaurants and bars. Close enough to universal studios also. The staff were very nice, bar man was very friendly. The rooms are the big attraction in this hotel, they are huge and very comfortable. The swimming pool was a major disappointment though-very very small! Happy hour with free drinks for two hours every evening was brilliant. Its a nice hotel but I'd doubt id stay here again.

title: Great hotel with a great location!
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience from two years ago.  I would love to have the opportunity to host you again.  Please reach out to me directly for assistance in making reservations the next time your travels bring you to Orlando.  We are currently renovating the hotel and I would love for you to come see the upgrades.  My email address is william.friedrich@Hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great value in the middle of things
review: I visited in August 2015 (I put September 2015 as it would not allow me to go further back and I am late with my reply). The hotel provided leaflets on all the parks and other things to do in Orlando, which was helpful as we could plan our day ahead before getting to the parks. Breakfast was delicious, I don't eat meat and found great alternatives to a cooked breakfast such as pancakes, waffles, doughnuts, muffins, cereals and fruits. Our room was a great size and the beds were so comfy; after a long, exhausting day at the parks I slept amazingly! The room was kept very clean. The pool was relaxing too and also had a jacuzzi! In the middle of international drive there were great restaurants eg. Señor frogs which we loved as it was great Mexican food and lively! There was also a…

title: A nightmare of a building site!
review: Thank you so much for the review.  It has already been a year since your visit, so hopefully we will have an opportunity to welcome you back again real soon.  Feel free to reach out to me directly for assistance in reserving your next holiday.  My email address is william.friedrich@hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Under construction
review: Embassy Suites was a sudden decision. Literally.  We drove in after a disappointing arrival at a condo that we had rented and paid for but turned out to be a horror story.  We walked away, I pulled out my smartphone and 15 minutes later were in our room at Embassy Suites, which was in the midst of remodeling the entire property, and  enjoying a cold drink. There is construction going on in various parts of the building. I remember it being here thirty years ago but our room, while small by today's standards for a suite, is first class.  They basically gut the rooms, replace the walls and everything behind them, and totally do over the room. Great job. And $120 a night for International Drive is even better. The free (complete) hot breakfast was too much. After two days I find I…

title: Disappointing... at best!
review: The experience at this hotel was disappointing at best. The people in the restaurant/breakfast/and bar were GREAT. The people booking the rooms made error after error, even giving me the wrong type of key. So after I waited for excessively long elevators to come and finally getting to my room, I needed to do the process again because the key was wrong.

title: Under Construction With An Excellent Staff
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I was happy to read that the Food and Beverage team provided great service.  However, I truly apologize for the lack of service by the Front Desk team and the errors that were made.  I would love to talk to you about your stay and try to make it right.  Please contact me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Extremely disappointed in THIS Embassy Suites!
review: Yes, it's an active construction site with lots of daytime noise (8-6) no matter where your room is located. That being said, the staff is outstanding and goes out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The location is very good for convention attendees. Avoid staying on the side of the hotel that faces I-4 unless you don't mind endless highway noise. The breakfast and manager's reception is fine.

title: Under Construction Beware
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience.  It was great to hear that the team provided great service!  The renovations will continue for the next few months but the major noise is behind us for the most part as the crew is done using the jackhammers and heavy machinery.  There will be some sawing and hammering here and there but we expect the experience to much better now.  With that said, I would love to have the opportunity to welcome you back when your travels bring you back to Orlando.  Please reach out to me directly at william.friedrich@hilton.com for assistance in reserving your next suite.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Hotel should consider closing to complete renovations.
review: Dirty pool, musty room, stained sheets.  Too expensive for below standard hotel and room. You don't get what you get expect after looking at their website.  The only two GOOD things about it was Jose-Check in Clerk and Osama-Food Manager.

title: Not Embassy Suites Quality
review: We love the Hilton brand specifically Embassy Suites however this hotel is not the quality we are used to.  While we were aware when booking that they were remodeling, we were truly disappointed in the cleanliness and overall shabbiness of the rooms and common areas.  Clearly they are working on the atrium and pool areas but the elevators, hallways and rooms were less than appealing and frankly dirty.  Orlando has to many options to offer in terms of where to stay I won't make this mistake again.

title: Wait until Construction is Complete
review: The staff at this hotel were very friendly and doing the best they could with what they have. The hotel is under construction so the complimentary hot breakfast is anything but good. The food is disgusting. The reception hour was disappointing as well. Foods included pretzels and stale popcorn. Not up to Embassy Suites standards. The rooms currently reek of paint, even if your room isn't being painted. Stay higher up, if you do stay. Rooms on floor 4 and down can hear all the construction and party noise.

title: Very Noisy at Night
review: We stayed at the Embassy suite post cruise in Orlando.   The hotel was extremely noisy at night to the point they agreed to refund our money.  They had a big family reunion and they took no control over loudness and kids running all over each floor.  In addition, the Internet was horrible and they also agreed to return our charge for that.  Over one week later we have yet to receive any credits to our credit card.

title: 3 year anniversary
review: This was a great stay. It was my girlfriend and I's 3 year anniversary we were lucky enough to get a brand new renovated room the new furniture and layout is amazing not only was the room amazing but the service was out standing from check in to check out. Chelsea from the front desk made our stay great. When I got into my room it had a small leak I called Chelsea before I stepped out and when I came back the floor was dry and the leak was solved. I will definitely be back once the renovation is fully complete. A must stay!!!

title: Wet Towel
review: This stay was only good compared to the other Embassy Suites I have stayed at, which were excellent! Rational for only a good rating:  The second day not so clean and inviting. I left for work, returned at 2:56 PM and my room was not cleaned. So I stepped out to get a bite to eat. I returned at 4:45 PM and my bed was made, clean towels and new toiletries, however, there was a wet towel in my shower (the one I used to place on the floor of the tub so that I would not slip) and hairs on the tub. While they were probably mine, it still was gross. I informed the front desk, however, I was tired and did not want anyone to come to my room and clean; that time past.

title: Under construction
review: Stayed here for a conference. They were under construction which I was not informed of until it was too late to make a different reservation. The construction was loud during the day but ended around 4. The desk staff was nice and helpful. The rooms were clean but dated.

title: Orlando Family Reunion
review: This hotel is in a great spot for dinning and great scenery. There’s plenty of things in the area for all family members to go to. Several restaurants, gift shops and miniature golf on International Drive..

title: Personal Touches exceed expectations!
review: Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando International Drive Convention Center was being renovated when I stayed in July 2016 yet it was still fully operational and was accepting guests on newly appointed floors (I did receive messages to inform me of the ongoing renovation and apologies for the inconvenience prior to check in)  ~Self Parking is free during my stay and I just needed to display a guest pass on the dashboard ~the concierge is located quite far away from the reception, next to the Budget rent a car counter right in front of the lifts on the left side of the building ~there’s a business center and next to it a little convenience shop  ~the pair of indoor glass lifts were facing the atrium opposite an identical set on the other side, these were single sliding door lifts…

title: Ask if renovation is complete
review: Visiting Orlando for a business trip. Wanted to stay at a Hilton property on International Drive.  Rooms are old, dated. Facility is old and dated. Lots of renovations in progress but as of July 2016 not somewhere I would stay again. Highly disappointed.

title: Run Through Hotel
review: Did not meet the Hilton Brand expectations.  Old run-through rooms!  Only stay here if you can't find a nicer room.  Read the comments.  The location is ideal but the rooms are old and uncomfortable.  You can hear all the highway noises and its extremely busy day and night.

title: Vacation Stay at Embassy Suites I-drive
review: The check in clerk was awesome, and extremely accommodating.  Also, the cleaning lady did an excellent job, and left a note of greeting every day.  I was disappointed in the quality of service at this Embassy Suites.  I purposely selected the hotel because I had had positive experiences with the brand before.  Granted the hotel is under renovation, it may be good if management would communicate with guest to let them know what is happening on the property. There was no cooked to order breakfast as advertised.  I am a breakfast person, so this was a REAL disappointment for me.  The afternoon reception consisted of popcorn, crackers and pretzel with dips, or popcorn, party mix and dips. Of course there was always the open bar.  But, as a non drinker, that did not excite me.  I…

title: Construction Nightmare
review: This hotel is like being in a war zone.  There's hammering and sledge hammering and drilling all day and all night, more construction workers than guests, inconsistent elevators and inconsistent hot water and nowhere to relax.  It should be closed.

title: Hotel in process of updating
review: Hotel in process of updating causing delays (one elevator was for repair personnel and one other was taken out of service for repair, leaving one elevator in use. Hot tub had one jet working , but was Repaired.

title: HORRIBLE
review: This property is under construction, we were not aware of that. we booked a 8 night stay. we originally booked a suite with TWO 2 rooms being that we have a big family and 2 more adults accompanied us on this trip last minute. it turns out the room we receive was a one bedroom with 2 very small "full" size beds in it and a living room that has a pull out bed in the couch which bruised our ribs because of how old and worn out it is. we actually had to get 3 blankets and layer them on top of it to be able to sleep on it. and that was because when we asked the front desk about the original room that we booked we were told that it was under renovation and not available hence it was the ONLY suite that had that feature of TWO bedrooms. The CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST consisted of the same…

title: Nice experience
review: The hotel is undergoing construction, but it wasn't bad. The indoor pool was closed for upgrades, and the lower level rooms as well. The construction couldnt be heard in our room so it wasn't a problem at all.

title: Tear it down and start again
review: The staff messed up the billing, the room was musty, foggy and humid. Took 15 min for hot water. Do not stay here till they finish the renovation. There is another Embassy up the road should have stayed there.

title: Nice Hotel!
review: Me and my son stayed for two nights. The rooms are spacious for only 2 people, it is near the convention center, and it has different amenities across the street. The morning buffet is great! Staff is very friendly ...  The only thing is weird is that they don't have safe in the rooms So if you want to leave your valuable items secure you must go to the front desk and they will put it in their safe...

title: Under repair is not enough
review: If HH thing that telling the customer  when you reserve the hotel "under repair" is enough, is not you need to clarify the extension of the notice, I will never will make a reservation again with this "under repair"

title: Make sure you know what you are reserving
review: We thought we reserved a suite with 2 different bedrooms. However, the reservation was for a 2 room suite (double beds in a room and then front room pullout couch) and should have been a 2 bedroom suite with 2 different rooms with beds in it. The hotel is going through remodeling and it is going to be nice when finished but they are doing everything to make sure it is not an inconvenience for the guests.

title: Good times
review: This is my family's second time staying at the Embassy Suites. We love this hotel and the location is a tourist dream! You don't need a car if you stay at this hotel because there are TONS of restaurants and attractions that you and your family can enjoy. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to/from Magic Kingdom and Universal. This July the hotel was under renovation, which limited our ability to enjoy some, not all, of their amenities, such as the indoor pool (but they have an outdoor pool) and we missed the fresh made to order omelettes which were also unavailable due to renovations. We plan to return Summer 17 and we can't wait to see all of the upgrades! Trust me, this is a great hotel and a huge thank you to Chelsea, receptionist, who was very friendly, welcoming, and…

title: Nice hotel and friendly staff.
review: We had booked the hotel for 5 nights. When we first arrived our room was near the lift and it was noisy. Every time the lift was used it mad a rumbling noise in the room. I raised my concerns with reception and they changed rooms the next night as they were fully booked. The new room was perfect as it was at the front of the hotel and very quiet. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, especially the 2 young ladies at reception, they could not have been more helpful. We could not fault the hotel, it was very clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast was excellent and very filling. I would recommend this hotel and would return again.

title: STAY AWAY, until renovations are complete.
review: This hotel is currently under construction. The noise is ridiculous, and extremely annoying. Even after we tried to put the TV volume high it was impossible to mask the echo of drills and hammers. They had hair all over the hotel chairs which ended up on my clothes and in my food. The hotel manager listened to our complaint and was able to give us a slight discount. The breakfast is mediocre with pre-made omelets (I have never seen that before).  The evening reception is horrible. I was so shocked at the lack of standards.  This hotel was such a bad idea.  I am glad that they are making changes because it is EXTREME need of a makeover.  This is the worst embassy I have ever been in.  I expected so much more.

title: Extensive renovations being done.
review: When we booked the website indicated some renovations were being done but it would not be an inconvenience. Sorry but the sound heavy equipment being operated inside the hotel all day long, the sound of rooms being torn apart with saws and drills and the heavy chemical smells of paint, varnish and concrete sealer are a major issue. The staff does it best to operate but this renovation is large enough that the hotel should just close until it's done.

title: Roaches and outdated
review: There were roaches in the bathroom when we checked in. We asked for another room and the said there were none available.  We were able to check in at 230 and when we noticed the roach they said they would send someone up. We had to call 4 times and they finally sent someone at 930pm. This is unacceptable! NO ONE WANTS TO TAKE CRITTERS HOME with them. The complimentary drinks were in a moldy smelling meeting room, and the snacks were popcorn, cold cheese and tortilla chips. We definitely paid for location. The hotel room did smell nice,  however. The fridge did not cool and the pillows had quite a few hairs that were not ours.  I have stayed in better hotels than this.  If you want to risk roaches and an unresponsive staff, by all means stay here!

title: All over the Place
review: Good day reviewer, first and foremost, allow me to sincerely apologize for the challenges you faced during your stay with us. This is not the typical level of service that we aim to provide our guests. If you find the time, could you please contact me or another manager so we can discuss your stay with you? We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. Thank you again for your feedback. I look forward to speaking with you. Have a great day!

title: Very central
review: We landed late at 10 at night and got checked in the lobby area was a little bit old and there were allot of plants around the place , the breakfast was alright everything u needed , there was a hot tub and an outdoor pool our kids loved it was not the biggest pool but we got hours of fun , a very short walk to Walgreens we went there in the mornings and got a couple of things , the rooms we good as we weren't in the hotel much but were quite small and old , a short walk to some nice restaurants such as TGIFRIDAYS and Millers steak house , a short taxi ride to universal studios and we walked to wet n wild there is a little shopping area down the street with a couple of little stores such as Victoria's Secret , Tharoo & Co , Hollister and Bath and Body works 😝 It was a very…

title: Comfortable stay despite renovations
review: In town for a conference, I stayed here because of the extra space, the complimentary breakfast, and convenience to both the convention center and other attractions in the area. Although some guests were disturbed by the renovations being done during our stay, I had no issues with noise or inconvenience, as I was off at meetings during the daytime hours. I like having the extra room, the fridge and microwave, the extra sink, etc., and having complimentary breakfast on site is a time-saver for me. Self-parking is very reasonable, and the trolley stop is right next to the hotel's property. Altogether, and especially after the renovations are completed, this is an excellent choice for either a business or vacation stay.

title: under construction
review: Great location but room price should be lowered during construction.  The property smelled of toxic fumes and we had no access to the atrium as it was being redone.  Elevators being used by workmen which left only a couple of very slow ones to use.  Don't stay here until the construction is over.  The breakfast foods were or poor quality, not the typical good food and reception snacks at most embassy properties.

title: Great staff, but don't visit until renovations have been completed.
review: Was informed by Virgin Holidays two weeks before our holiday that massive renovations were being done at the hotel. They wouldn't move us without additional cost to our holiday, but was assured that the work was only going to be between 9am and 5pm. During our stay work commenced at 7am with loud banging from the floor above, where the 7th and 8th floor rooms were being renovated. Also the smell from painting these rooms was terrible when we returned from long days at the Disney parks. On the ground floor massive renovation was taking place with pneumatic drills going all the time, and vehicles delivering materials early in the morning. When we spoke to a manager concerning the noise he replied " How do you think we feel, we have to put up with it all the time." Unbelievable…

title: Although in renovation we had a good stay
