review: Good day Mr. John L, I am very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Renovation can cause inconvenience and I sincerely apologize that this was the case for you. Regarding your detailed comments, we have communicated to the appropriate departments so that we can ensure none are repeat occurrences. With that said, we are very excited for our completion and hope that should your travels bring you back to the area that you visit us once again so we can show you our new property and also our true colors for guest service. Thank you again!

title: Great hotel
review: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel is being remodeled. I stayed in a newly remodeled room. It is beautiful. Great location. Complimentary breakfast and afternoon reception - both are very nice.

title: heavy construction
review: This hotel is under a lot of construction and I caution staying here until the bottom floor is completed. Don't be fooled by the low price. The noise and air quality is poor and the wifi is less than acceptable. The staff was friendly but they clearly don't  have the tools needed to do their job. Our recent trip was disappointing and a waste of our money.

title: sleeping in i-4 median
review: This hotel is along the side of i-4 it sounds like you are sleeping in the median. The room wasn't clean. During the construction the noise and fumes have been awful and we had to relocate hotels in the middle of the night due to the fumes in our room.  The staff are super great, I feel sorry that they work there because it is by far the worst hotel experience I have had.  It was very overpriced. It is a $59 hotel  for $159 per night.  I do not recommend.

title: Great location, staff, room, and parking!
review: Good day reviewer, thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay with us. I sincerely apologize for the noise and construction. It's our goal to try and limit the inconvenience as much as we can. I did appreciate the comment about the team. That is one thing we pride ourselves on is the quality of service that we aim to provide. The renovation should be completed mid to end of December. I hope you visit us again soon so we can once again show you our true colors with a beautiful new hotel. Thanks again!

title: Super friendly staff!
review: Hotel is being remodeled and it is going to be 1st Class when completed.  The staff are very professional, considerate and attentive to their customers.  My room was as requested and was able to park my car in a  perfect parking space on the hotel's property (safe & secure).   The hotel is a 6 minute walk to the Convention Center (you are able to walk from the hotel to the convention center on a wide & tree shaded sidewalk).  You are only a  3 minute walk to a Walgreen's and to some great restaurants (expensive & inexpensive) ... Cuba LiBre is one of the great restaurants for you to try for dinner and for a fun & price friendly lunch try Johnny Rockets (great hamburgers & shakes).  John (one of the managers) is most kind and extremely knowledgeable & helpful.  All of the staff…

title: Still under construction, but the service is still first class
review: I spent three nights at the Embassy Suites while attending a convention.  While it is still under construction, the room was as comfortable as always, and the staff here exceeded expectation. Always friendly and courteous, and I have to single out Elizabeth and Alejandra for service that will have me staying there whenever I have business in the area.  Both were always bright, engaging and made you feel like you were the most important guest in the hotel.  I ran into one issue, which happened off premises, and they were on it and it was resolved in less than an hour!  I can't say enough about the two of them.  Thanks again for making it a wonderful stay.

title: Well needed Remodel in progress
review: Thank you John B for your kind words. We know that there is never a convenient time for renovation, however, its sure convenient to have quality service. We strive daily to impact our guests during their stay and I was pleased to hear about Elizabeth and Alejandra. It's truly no surprise though. We look forward to welcoming you back soon! Thanks for staying and for your feedback. Have a great day!

title: WARNING!!! Terrible do not stay here!!!!!!!
review: The rooms were very outdated and the beds uncomfortable. The hotel is being remodeled and I'm sure will be very nice once complete.  The atrium was blocked off and indoor pool under construction. We were warned about the remodel but not told the indoor pool was unavailable. The traffic was kind of loud, we were on the highway side but didn't really hear it while sleeping. The pictures made it look much nicer than it was.

title: Loved it!
review: Thank you for your reply and for choosing to stay with us. We are very excited for the renovation and its completion. It will surely be a sight to see. I sincerely apologize for the indoor pool as well as your comfort with our current beds. We do hope to see you return should your travels bring you back to the area so that you may take advantage of our new product. Have a great day!

title: Another lovely stay
review: Hotel under MAJOR reconstruction- dust clouds no hot water jackhammers at 7am--- horribleDONOTBOOK-- were told renovations were occurring-- lies!!! Total mess - this is a major reconstruction-- do not stay here until reconstruction is complete- horrible and no discount for our horrible stay- there are so many other places to stay- DO NOT STAY HERE- you will not be rested relaxed or enjoy your stay-

title: Dirty Hotel
review: Gnats in drinks, side entry doors are unlocked & do not require room key allowing strangers to enter. Rooms not cleaned daily. Trash in construction are. Cooked to order breakfast is actually premade. Nothing was cooked to order. Pancakes & waffles were hard, dry & old.

title: Need to get it together
review: Good day reviewer, my sincerest apologies for not meeting your expectations during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical of our hotel. We try to limit inconvenience as much as possible during renovation. Regarding access doors other than the main lobby, those do lock after 7:30pm and can only be accessed by a room key. Regarding the rest of your stay, it is customary to service every occupied room unless there is a "Do Not Disturb" on the door. Our Housekeeping team is expected to revisit a room just in case this was removed at a later time. I hope that should you visit the area you provide us an opportunity to show you our true colors. Thank you again for your feedback. Have a great day.

title: Most awful Hilton experience of my life
review: Don't stay here until the construction is complete. Drilling rattled through the walls. Inconsistent hot water. WiFi not working. Dropped the rate to compensate, but only after I asked.  But location is great.  Visit when they get it together.

title: NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!
review: Good day to you LaraK, I am very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and we know that renovation can be frustrating. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon once again!

title: OMG, run away from this place as fast as possible
review: Moldy smelling hallways and rooms Carpet wrinkling  Trash in hallways and parking lot still there for the whole four days of our stay AC unit made banging noises so couldn't sleep and engineer couldn't fix Construction going on in hotel during day so no nap time possible  Pool area very unappealing  Gym very minimal  A horrible experience  Hilton should be ashamed and close this down until remodel is complete

title: GREAT HOTEL
review: We stayed here for two nights prior to our Caribbean cruise with Royal Caribbean.  It was a great hotel, which served breakfast every day, which is free to all guests.  Food was great and there was plenty to choose from at breakfast time.    It was a busy hotel as there was a conference on nearby (superheroes) each morning I never knew who was eating breakfast next to me (Spider-man, batman etc)    We never went to the restaurant at night, but when passing on route to our room, the food looked good.  Rooms  The rooms are very spacious, two king size beds in bedroom and a pull down sofa bed in the living room area.  There is a small kitchen area with coffee machine and a microwave as well as a fridge to keep your drinks cool.  A dining table to sit at also. There are ice machines…

title: Be advised
review: Great location. My family has stayed here before and were very happy but property is under MAJOR renovation. Lobby is GONE.. Indoor pool CLOSED .. Breakfast is buffet (NO MADE TO ORDER) breakfast was cold.. Drilling and hammering starts 7am ends 6pm !!! Can't wait till work is done but right now .. It's a MESS ! Beside construction .. Staff and property EXTREMELY nice and clean ! Unfortunately they did not offer any type of amends for incomvenience and it is NOT posted on the website as they tried to suggest

title: This is more like a quality inn than an embassy suites. I am a Hilton gold member and am so disappointed
review: Their eveninf reception was chips and salsa and breakfast is a pre cooked and pre packaged meals. No home cooked omletes. They couldn't accommodate food allergies and this was not typical of an embassy.

title: Vacation Family
review: There was no hot water and me and my wife likes too take hot showers but we had to settle for a looke warm showers there was a lot of remodel going on an in the morning we had to wake up to dust an a lot of it. I paid premium price so we deserve a next stay.

title: Not a hotel we would recommend
review: We stayed here in March and are glad to hear this hotel is getting a makeover as décor was old, worn, tired and room had a bad musty smell.  A good selection of food was available at the hot food counter for breakfast but poor choice of fruits and breads.  More staff needed over holiday periods as long queues and it was not worth waiting for.  We went to the hotel restaurant and had a tasty meal, the service was slow but staff where polite and friendly.  Pullout bed was old and uncomfortable and from shortly after 5.30 am you couldn't get much sleep as it was noisy with staff setting up for breakfast.  The bedroom looked out onto the highway and was very noisy.  Staff helpful and polite in booking tickets and giving directions.  We would not recommend this hotel.

title: business travel lodging
review: This is an Embassy Suites, so I was not disappointed for the offering. However, the reservation service can use some improvement - first the young man did not know what he was doing (need good training), then he could not fine my HHonors account information. The ride to airport for my departure, the driver was cranky (have "diversity" issues - bad for our shrinking world) - can use a lot of improvement. This applied to my stay during the first week of May, 2015. The breakfast was good, but offerings were not many, during my business stays at other Embassy Suites.

title: Great Hotel on a Great Location
review: The location is great for business people and travelers as well. It is very close to convention center. The 2 room suit is suitable for 4 people. The room has all the facility needed, except an electronic safe which is now available in all hotels. The Wi-Fi is free but slow at times. The breakfast and evening free drink are excellent. The hotel is fully air-conditioned and has a beautiful lobby/breakfast area with fountain. Highly recommended.

title: All you need for work and relaxation
review: With a microwave, hot water kettle, a bedroom (rest) and a separate living room  (work), the hotel offered an ideal work/life balance. With complimentary breakfast and evening drinks, what more could you ask for.  Despite renovation going on directly below my room during my stay, the noise was at a whisper level.  Conveniently located close to the restaurants and the Pointe.

title: The Greatest Asset of this Hotel is the Staff! Dedicated & Hard-Working!
review: We enjoyed our time at this hotel in spite of several small difficulties with bookings and mix-ups with regard to the 2 different rooms our family booked; the stay was saved mostly because of the superb staff! They obviously love their job, are valued by their employers, and work very hard to serve both the customers and their employers. They stood out in an obvious way, and not just one or two here or there - on many, many different occasions our family was impressed with their hard work and dedication (way to go, staff)!!  The hotel really is trying to minimize the distraction and inconvenience due to the atrium reconstruction, and, for the most part, they DO succeed in this effort. However, I have to say that I was extremely disappointed in the breakfast during the renovation…

title: ACTIVE Construction and Loud Noise all day long
review: For a family vacation with toddlers, nap times are crucial.  The loud active construction did not allow for ANY naps, which was disruptive to this vacation.  Handing out plastic construction hats were cute, but did little to remedy the disruption.  It would have been nice if I had been notified of the construction prior to booking the hotel.

title: Pleasant Stay EVEN with Renovations
review: Just recently stayed at this hotel and although they are renovating we still enjoyed our stay.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean, but in need of updating which is what they are working on.  Very conveniently located on International Drive.  We would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here again!

title: Another satisfied customer
review: I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was very courteous and professional. The room was nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable. The cost was very reasonable. The hotel atrium area is currently under construction but it is not a hindrance during the stay. My only suggestion would be to serve better snacks during the evening social.

title: Worst experience with Hilton
review: The place is under construction and we could not sleep in after 7am. The bathtub had a slow leak and there was paint peeling off the bathtub. This is the worst hotel stay I've ever had with a Hilton hotel. I felt like the price was to high for the quality of hotel.

title: Disgusting
review: Good day to you. I am very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical and we are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations during your stay. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. We are excited for the completion of the renovation but we are trying to limit any inconvenience as much as possible. Thank you again for your feedback.   If you find the time, please contact us so that we may address the bathtub and speak further about your experience. 407-352-1400.

title: Old Hotel
review: couldn't get any sleep, noisy, sliding doors could not be securely closed to keep noise outside.  curtaining didn't close good enough.  hotel under construction which was not listed on Hilton website.  Internet not working consistenlly.l

title: Construction blues
review: Hotel under construction, uncomfortable old bed and pillows, indoor pool under construction.Did not receive value for my money. Thank you for great employees. Wonderful staff, very professional and helpful.

title: Always a pleasure
review: I think this is the fourth time we have stayed at this Embassy Suites (while attending Megacon).  The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and ultra-clean.  The staff is an added joy, within this facility.  Their hard work is reflected in the quality and consistence of this hotel.  The complimentary breakfast and evening reception are a value within themselves.

title: I usually love the Embassy hotel
review: Although I usually love  the Embassy Suites, this one wasn't the best. I understand that prior to booking, the website indicated they are going thru construction. This made the lobby area extremely small, the breakfast area wasn't able to handle the beverage power making it inoperable for a period of time and seems like a lack of circulation so the paint fumes hit me hard on the 4th floor, causing me to try and cover my mouth until I was able to get downstairs. The room was nice, I hope the reconstruction consist of adding/changing the balcony. Even the evening reception was hot causing the snack dips to look unappealing. I will say the valet staff was extremely helpful with information. and housekeeping was nice as well.

title: Loved loved the location and staff
review: The valet staff and check in staff was amazing.  They were so friendly. We stayed there during memorial day weekend. You would think they would be too  to provide individual attention... Nothing further from the truth.  My only was the breakfast, it that great. I felt very rushed.

title: Stayed for MegaCon
review: Stayed here in 2015 and 2016 for closeness to convention center with supplied bussing. Also the breakfast and managers reception are usually pretty good. The bathrooms are showing wear and tear but for the most part it's a good hotel, clean and friendly. The beds were good too.

title: Staff responses
review: Very friendly staff..ALL. Enjoyed my stay and super breakfast. Also enjoyed evening reception when I was there during the period. Very conveniently situated for taking in clubs, restaurant and shopping areas.

title: Home away from Home
review: My family and I had the most wonderful stay at the hotel we will come back again because the staff was great made you feel at home. Also the room was so comfortable and cozy I wish there was a way to take the room home with me, thanks again for the wonderful STAY.

title: Great Hotel and Good Location
review: My wife and I stayed here while I was playing in a volleyball tournament at the Orange County Convention Center.  The hotel is located a little over a mile away from the OCC, but it is walkable.  You just need to be careful when using the crosswalks to cross the streets since many people ignore the law requiring them to stop for people in the marked crosswalk.  Our requested room was not available upon arrival (before the official checkin time), but we were quickly assigned another room in the same relative location in the hotel.  The checkin staff noted my request for no feather bedding and immediately sent housekeeping to our room with foam pillows.  The two room suite was quite comfortable.  The bedroom had a wardrobe and a dresser providing plenty of room to put away your…

title: A perfect hotel after a long flight
review: Easy to park the car immediately in front of the hotel entrance, so it started well. As easy to check in, my room was prepared and in a few minutes I was inside the room. I came to a very clean room, good decor and my preordered mineral water, lay on cooling and waited.  After a shower, I went down to the hotel restaurant and ate a simple but very tasty burgers. The waitress always had an eye on my table so it was easy to order more, she was always there.  The breakfast today, which was included in the room price, was very good. Clean and tidy, well-prepared food, perfect.  A hotel that I would return to.

title: Weekend stay for Megacon Orlando
review: Everything about our 3 day 2 night stay was fantastic. Staff was courteous, professional, prompt and helpful. Access and speed from parking lot to room, 4th floor, was convenient and fast. Two minutes from car to room from any side of building. Complimentary breakfast and evening drinks and snacks were great and off set the room price greatly. Saved us at least $50 and a great deal of time/day. Free wi-fi, indoor and outdoor pools, great room service. Spacious comfy rooms with great ammenities. Balcony is only about a foot long. If you are considering staying here you won't be disappointed. Our stay here made the rest of our vacation so much more convenient and stress free. It is on International drive which can be very congested, but you have to use that road no matter where…

title: Orlando orangy
review: the entire staff is wonderful and very cooperative. More particularly Sandy Sales person provided excellent sevices. We hosted reception in the hotel and guests were more then expected, but Hotel staff done excellent job

title: Friendly
review: Everyone that I came in contact with at this Embassy Suites was very nice, very professional. I particularly liked the people who worked at breakfast... very helpful.  Would happily stay there again.  Only negative was ongoing construction--noisy during the day.

title: Great location and hot breakfast too!
review: This is a beautiful hotel with large rooms. Most appreciated was the evening reception and the morning breakfast. The hotel was very quiet and in great condition. I would return any time I needed a hotel in Orlando.

title: Disney World 2016
review: Hotel was adequate but I noticed that they had plans out in the lobby to update this hotel.  However I have to tell you that everyone was extremely helpful, courteous, friendly and always will to help you out regardless of what you were doing.  Separate living room from the bedroom.  There was a sofa, small dining table and what could pass for a kitchenette with refrigerator and bar.  Our bedroom had two beds with a vanity area, sitting table and chair.  There shuttle was on time and very accommodating regarding getting the number of people to the attractions.  If the bus is full they go out of their way and have private vehicle, drivers take you.  Only note I have is read their card and pay attention to the times for the shuttles.  We did not and on our last day realized that…

title: Hilton Honors disappointment.
review: Not a hotel I'd recommend for couples or business. This hotel is way past due for an upgrade. The requirements of paying for handicap parking is dispicable. There are better hotels on International drive than this hotel for the same rate. The breakfast is rationed by the staff from behind the severing line.

title: Great service
review: Ongoing renovation did not cause any problem. All services continued. Staff went out of their way.  Arrived early - Front desk brought me my key in restaurant where  had"set up shop." Breakfast and Happy Hour staff were great hosts/hostesses.

title: Far to middling
review: Overall friendly, helpful staff. The hotel could definitey use some updating of less late 80s/90s looking decor, consistent checking of the fitness room and ability to even enter it; however, the staff, the service, and sleep quality was on cue.

title: Beware - under construction
review: No hot water due to construction. Slow elevator service due to construction. Construction starts early and ends late - don't anticipate environment that is quiet and easy to work in during day. Given premium price charged to other hotels in area, I'd hold off on this one until construction is done.

title: RW
review: I stayed at this hotel May 12th-May 16th. The breakfast was very good. Did not partake of the evening snacks because we were out doing things at that time. The staff was good very courteous. This is a great location for food and attractions. The whirlpool was very relaxing. The beg was very comfortable but furniture needs upgrading. Do to some construction work going on. My wife and I Conor enjoy our staff. It was too noisy with all the drilling banging and hammering going.

title: Disappointed Hilton honors member
review: I paid to much money to stay at this hotel it was under construction and the room had and old musty smell. The carpet and decor is really in bad need of remodel. I had to pay for self parking and the location was not as convenient as I had originally thought.

title: Staycation
review: The tub would not drain properly.  The cooling system only cooled the front living quarters and did not cool the bedroom.  Outside of these problems, we enjoyed our stay.  The amenities are good (free parking, free breakfast, free evening reception) and the location is great.

title: Short Orlando Trip
review: Great location, very friendly staff, rooms very nice but room floors need cleaning. Evening reception only had chips and ranch dip as a snack.  Hotel was above average and I would stay again. Not much on the property for kids but was perfect for a couple of might get away for my wife and I.

title: Embassy suites international dr
review: The hotel is beautiful so we're the rooms. I'm sure we can find things to knit pick but I'm not. Staff was excellent and attentive, and 5:30 happy hour was awesome!!! The breakfast with omelet staton priceless 👍

title: Sigh.  Should have stuck with Hampton Inn
review: The hotel appears nice but I believe this hotel is not family friendly.  The rooms do not have a "deadbolt".  My 2-year-old kept opening the door.  You could see through the front windows because of the sheer curtains.  We had to rig the curtains with our suitcases to cover the windows.  The bathtub was dirty and stopped up when we arrived.  Lastly, my husband accidently found a condom on top of one of the lights.  Oh yeah, the cleaning person left their cleaning towel in the room.  I got so tired of bringing things to management that I just stopped caring....On a high note, breakfast and room service was AWESOME!!!

title: Nice and Pleasant
review: Stayed at this hotel based on a recommendation of a friend who already had stayed here.  The hotel was very nice and clean.  The staff was very helpful with all questions or issues.  Restaurants and a WalGreens are within walking distance which was nice.  Getting to the theme parks was a bit lengthy but well worth the wait as you don't have pay extra for cabs.

title: So so experience
review: Luke warm water in the showers for the week. More often than not, just cold water.  Breakfast was standard fare. Location was excellent.  Guest services were adequate. Doubt that I would stay at this hotel again as there is a large variety close by.

title: Overnight Stay
review: The staff was very nice. Being a Hilton honors member, they gave me the only renovated room in the hotel. The renovated room is so beautiful. Very contemporary. The design of the atrium and the lobby were still dated though. I cannot wait for the whole hotel to be renovated.  Pool is ok but extra points for also having an indoor pool.  Location of the hotel is very convenient. It's in I-drive and very close to a lot of restaurants especially from pointe orlando.  As always, there were free "happy hour" and breakfast during my stay, however, the line was so long for the drinks during the happy hour.  I want to come back and stay again when the hotel is fully renovated to see the difference. Maybe I will give it a 5/5 then.

title: Good Place to stay, slowly coming of age
review: Its a good spot to stay on International Drive, lots to do in walking distance, shopping IMAX cinema, Restaurants etc. Also close to Universal. Staff is very friendly and hard working, bit can't keep up with cleaning sometimes. We only seen one lonely good soul trying to keep up but needs more staff to my humble opinion. I experienced Sticky floors and tables in Breakfast area. All has traces of use but maintained. All in all a good choice to venture out to all the attractions. Also no free direct WiFi, only for chain members. We choose same place again next time.

title: Awesome breakfast
review: They really do a great breakfast and its included in your room rate. There is a chef that cooks whatever eggs and omelets you want! Staff very friendly and helpful. Location was perfect and easy to walk around to local attractions and dining options.

title: The staff are wonderful but wait for the hotel renovation.
review: Robert and Ram were both wonderful and did their best to help when we had an issue. The hotel is being renovated which is causing issues. We stayed for 3 nights. We had issues with the hot water the first 2 nights and had them move us to a different room on the third night, as cold showers were not very enjoyable. We had hot water that night but then it was cold again the next morning! They did their best to make it right and we are thankful. The pools were nice and we had the option of indoor our outside areas. The breakfast was good, not all the choices that other Embassy suites offer but we love the omlet station. Even with the issues we will stay here again but not until the renovations are completed. They are hoping to be done by December.

title: Great breakfast!
review: This place was great! Our favorite part was the breakfast...we just expected a typical hotel continental breakfast. However, this was much better than expected. There was a cook ready to make omelets! There were many items to choose from to add to your omelet. The room was nice. My only complaint is that the water wasn't always very warm. I showered at around 10:00 each night and my water was just lukewarm 2 out of the 3 nights.

title: We always come back!
review: Love this hotel. Family friendly, great food and my son loves the indoor and outdoor pool options! I love the two room suite room layout. This is our second stay here and we will return. I do wish, however, the hotel would reconsider the $9.00/day parking fee. Seems a bit ridiculous to have to pay to park your own vehicle.

title: Stay anywhere else if possibl;e
review: Dirty, decrepit, noisy, smelly.  The staff were friendly but I would not return for that alone. The mattress was probably manufactured in 1960 and every lump was felt. They are scheduled for a complete makeover in May 2016 which is sorely needed

title: Excellence
review: Had an amazing stay at this location! Valet service was awesome! Reception people were great! Location was awesome! rooms were great! Free internet! Nice pool! Amazing Staff Excellent Property! Would definitely book again!

title: Quiet, Clean Room - Convenient Location
review: I stayed at the Embassy Suites on I-Drive recently while traveling for work. My commute to my work location near UCF was not bad, about 30 minutes without much traffic.   The property is laid on like most Embassy Suites - several floors of rooms surrounding an atrium. The room was spacious with a separate living area, microwave, mini-fridge, and an extra lavatory in the bedroom so multiple people can get ready at the same time.  Several outstanding restaurants are within walking distance of this hotel.    Accommodations include an evening manager's reception with beer, wine, and cocktails and a full breakfast. Each staff member I encountered was professional and courteous. This is a good choice for families as well as business travelers. I will definitely return.

title: Happy Stay
review: Speaking of happy...the happy hour is extremely generous and served with pleasant efficiency. It is offered near the pool...a delightful free evening activity. The morning buffet is also generous and tasty; Talk about selection! Comfortable, spacious, clean rooms harbor comfy beds. Best of all...the beautiful lobby/courtyard is full of foliage. Overall great atmosphere.

title: Awesome beautiful
review: Comfortable nice awesome and near everything you would want to be by in Orlando right on I Drive!! They where nice and we where pleased with our stay there and will definitely be back I wouldn't pick any where els!

title: Disney marathon
review: Great hotel and worth paying extra for corner room.   Easy shuttle to Universal and quick drive to Disney.  Magnificent breakfast with superb service.   Walking distance to many restaurants.  The beds were like sleeping on clouds.

title: Tired & noisy
review: Stayed here (again) for a convention, as it's on the list from the show-runners.  On the top floor, not facing the highway, but it still sounded like the road was running right past my window.  Tired rooms (I hear they're renovating soon).  Coffee maker didn't work (it was replaced). Hot water took forever to warm up. Also - for a suites hotel that provides refrigerators and microwaves, why not also provide easily-accessible disposable plates & cutlery?  I couldn't find a spoon to eat lunch I picked up at the market.  On the plus side, all staff was courteous and helpful.

title: Great Place to Stay
review: We both liked the hotel a lot, rooms weren't "modern" in decoration but were clean and cleaned every day. Lots of space, large bed, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Bathroom was large, great shower. Would stay again! Breakfast was great, lots of choice and was free which is always great too!  We were there as part of our honeymoon and the staff had left towels modelled into swans with a lovely note in our room and also bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries. All of the staff were lovely and very helpful! We already had some tickets to places that came with our holiday but the ones we did have to buy we got from the hotel and they were cheaper than paying at the places themselves, and we got a free I-ride day ticket each for transport (saved us $8 for the day).…

title: Dated but worth it
review: The hotel will be undergoing a complete rehab beginning in May. This will make a very god,hotel,great. The staff is outstanding, rooms are dated but well maintained, pool was inside and great. Breakfast was typical Embassy thus exceptional. Parking was good. Can not say enough good things about this hotel..  Ask for a room that does not backup on to I4 as it was a little noisy.

title: Awesome Anniversary Trip
review: We loved our weekend visit. The front desk texted us after arrival with a nice welcome message. The housekeeper was very friendly and decorated our room in beautiful swans! The rooms were clean. Breakfast was nice, especially the omelette station. We also loved the atrium elevator.

title: Embassy or Motel 6?
review: Hotel is dated and very dirty. Not up to par with other Embassy Suites. Carpets were stained in multiple rooms, the bed covers had a horrible smell. Lobby and breakfast were fairly decent, if only rooms were as nice.

title: Everything about this place is great.
review: This hotel is located in the heart of International Drive--convenient to everything.  The building, staff and amenities are excellent.  The suites are roomy and well-designed, and what you get for what you pay is exceptional.

title: Stay here often always good
review: I like this embassy. It is in a good location. The breakfast is always great. Rooms are comfy but dated. There is a cook at omelet station that is rude. Otherwise the staff is great. Managers reception is a nice thing to have for an evening snack/drink. Overall I like this hotel quite a bit and will return. I wish their internet was a bit better. Staff is super friendly.

title: Loved it!
review: We stayed for 9 days, the suites were very roomy. Had a mini frig, a microwave, and a coffee maker, and a wet bar. The bathroom was very large. A sink in the bathroom, as well as in the bedroom. The front desk people were very accommadating. I asked for a little fan(for noise) and they found one for me.  The only complaint I have, is the rooms didn't get cleaned very early. It was after noon almost every day.  We would absolutely stay there again.

title: So Old and run down
review: I would never come back or stay at this hotel.  It was so run down and old.  Carpets look original and dirty.  The rooms are scary to stay in as the doors don't even feel like they shut they are so loose from being worn out.  The staff at the front desk is nice but unfortunately that is the only positive I can give this hotel.  Even the internet service is spotty at best.

title: Avoid
review: Old and in need of renovation.  Don't take a room facing to the motorway, it's very noisy as the windows are not closing properly. Shower are sometimes hot and sometimes cold, stay there for 5 nights and didn't managed to had a 5 mn long hot shower The Wifi is appalling, I was told on Monday that something was broken and there were fixing it ..I left on Thursday and it was still not working. Breakfast very basic and coffee was terrible, restaurant was good. Don't go there, there are plenty places around much better. It;s pity because it could be a great place if renovated. The staff was nice and the idea of a free drink at 5h30 is a great idea but it's not enough to be a great place.

title: Bugs in the room
review: This was the usual Embassy Suites experience except that the room was in desperate need of a remodel and there were bugs on the table tops and counters   I normally don't complain, but it was just not a very good experience in the room.  The cocktail hour is fun and the complimentary breakfast is nice.

title: Shower was horrible!
review: Just returned from a 6-night stay and was very disappointed in the shower!  Water pressure and temperature were not good for most of the mornings.  Our room was on the 8th floor, so I do believe that was the issue.  We did ask to switch rooms but they were unable to accommodate that request.  The reviews were good so we thought it would be a better hotel.  The staff are friendly, but not having a good shower each morning really ruined the experience.

title: contest winner
review: i won a contest for a 2 night stay at this Embassy.  we upgraded to a premium suite.  everything was excellent.  service, rooms, drinks, food, staff, etc.  if Embassy's were pet friendly and a little less expensive, we'd stay here all the time.  happy hour for 2 hours every night is exceptional.

title: Don't go premium rooms
review: Premium suite benefits are not worth the extra money. Stay in normal suites. Otherwise it is a great property. Staff very friendly. Great location. Just avoid the premium suite, no added value at all.

title: Amazing stay!
review: We got to the hotel and were immediatly impressed by the efficiency of check in, when we got to our room it was very clean. The staff really made us feel welcome over the 3 weeks we spent there they decorated our room when they found out we were there to get married and also on our wedding day. The bed was very comfortable and it had a great view of the Orlando Eye to the left and the Convention Center to the right. Breakfast could get busy however there was no major queues in 3 weeks! Part of our time there was during Spring Break. We used the pool area which was clean and plenty of tools provided. The restaurant food was very good and also very efficient. The staff at this hotel are genuine diamonds, they treated us so well. Thank you and we will be back!

title: Really Impressed!
review: I've stayed at this location before during various business trips, so I knew it was a nice hotel. However, I was really impressed to see the Light It Up Blue puzzle and lights in honor of Autism Awareness Month throughout the lobby. As the parent of an autistic child, I was highly impressed by the sensitivity and genuine care that was shown to us during our stay! Additionally, I love the upgrade to the rooms since my last visit!

title: Great stay for Universal
review: We stayed with friends ( family of 6 ) for a short visit to Universal Orlando. This property offers great value large accommodation with an extra room/suite.  Plenty of room!  Great deal you can work on. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Run Down
review: Stayed two nights and place is stuck in the 80s. Staff nice but overall property is worn and very outdated. Room had a musty smell and not really clean. Furniture broken or badly scratched or fabric stained. Had to use a sheet to sit on sofa. Carpet at elevator loose and ripped. I saw the posters showing renovations but that does not do any good unless the work is done. Can't understand how a hotel that earns a descent revenue lets their property get so run down. Tells me it's only about the profit and not the customers.

title: Great Location
review: The hotel location is great.Very close to lots of restaurants and Disney. The rooms were spotless and spacious.  The bed mattress was a little worn out but still comfortable. They offer free daily made to order breakfast that we enjoyed every morning.  They also offer free happy hour with free items and light appetizers.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Needs renovation
review: Service is excellent, was in a bit of a pickle, and the employees were fantastic, went above and beyond, got toys for my kids and snacks and juice. Helped me in a time of need.  The room, on the other hand, needs a renovation, teamed of cigarettes, cigarette burns in the couch cushions, gum on the floor, not what I know of embassy suites. Would have asked for a different room, but with the kids, just sucked it up.

title: Great Hotel!
review: Another vacation was fantastic because our stay here was beyond wonderful! We will be back again as always! The staff take pride in their work and are extremely helpful and informative!  Thanks as always for treating us great! :)

title: Good for the most part
review: Everything about the hotel stay was good, from the breakfast, to the evening reception, to the friendliness of the staff. My only issue was the linen and blanket was dirty for the fold out sofa bed. They sent up clean linen, but not a clean blanket. What we got instead was a thick mattress cover.

title: Go elsewhere!!
review: There are much nicer establishments in the area. The Embassy Suites right down the street on Jamaican Court is much nicer and you will be treated better.   This location is run down and the rooms have a musty smell. Of course people think free breakfast and free beer makes the hotel great...it doesn't. Go down the street.

title: Run Down
review: Hotel rooms need maintaining! Bottom of bathroom door was rotted. Bathtub paint was chipping. Mold was high up on the wall above where the coffee machine was. Probably caused by the moisture coming off of the coffee machine. Made tea with it but couldn't drink it because there was things floating in it from the machine. Shower water changed temp on it's own. Pulled the plug out of the wall and the outlet came with it!

title: Clean and luxurious for reasonable price
review: Loved our stay. Room was clean, bed was comfy, and breakfast was delicious.  Especially the omelet station. Staffers were attentive and friendly.  The electrical plug ins were loose and we had trouble keeping our devices charging but overall, not a big issue.

title: Good hotel, good breakfast.
review: Hotel was good, rooms were clean, and it was conveniently located.  It was farther to Hollywood Studios than I had anticipated, but very close to Universal.  The breakfast was good, and the staff was very friendly.

title: Good people but the room just slightly dated
review: I attended a big convention and stayed here. Pros: efficient breakfast and the suite layout. Quick checkin and checkout as well.  Cons: aged room and furniture style. Electrical outlets etc for my gadgets hard to find. The bathroom was extremely basic and I cannot give a 4 star rating. However all of the people from housekeeping front desk and breakfast were great. I got an email from Mgmt after checkout based on my survey.  Thx for touching base with me.

title: Dissapointed
review: Having stayed here many times before, this time truly disappointed us.  Guests were coming down to breakfast in their Pyjamas. There were no bowls, for cereal the Que. for breakfast was way too long.  Guests walked around the hotel in wet swimsuits, causing huge pools of slippy puddles,  the pool area was untidy and again guests left all kinds of rubbish.  Children ran the corridors of the hotel, shrieking and at the free 2 hr drinks spilled coke, popcorn all overThe indoor pool was full of inflatables, this meant no room to swim.    The bar  staff where pleasant, especially Charlene and Kathy.  These  problems need sorting out.

title: Old Rooms
review: The hotel rooms were so old and stuffy. There was a musty smell in the room and it was so dark and gloomy. The breakfast was not enjoyable. Staff was very friendly but the hotel was not worth the price.

title: Overnight
review: This hotel is definitely in need of an update, very much in need but it is clean and comfortable for our needs. Check in was quick, I checked in through the HHonors app and arrived at about 230 pm. Our room 8th floor wasn't ready so we were given a 3rd floor suite.   We are here now so we will update after we check out.

title: Nice hotel with great price
review: Reserved during flash sale for $100, hotel was very clean and nice staff. The Fish Eye restaurant was average, it was 9pm so maybe that's why? The pool area was average and could use some new furniture.

title: A Great Hotel
review: We stay at the Embassy Suites whenever we visit Orlando and are never disappointed.  Everyone from Robert at the front desk to breakfast, bar and door staff are always welcoming and attentive. Our suite was on a Premium floor which was an added bonus, and was a lovely suite, perfectly clean and very comfortable. The hotel has its own facilities by way of indoor and outdoor pools and hot tubs, and a restaurant which is very good.  The breakfasts are excellent, freshly cooked and taken in the lovely atrium.  The cocktail hour (or 2) is great if youre back in time from your days activities, with choices of wine, beer and cocktails with simple nibbles. I cant praise the hotel and staff enough and will certainly be staying with them again next year.

title: Stayed twice, both times were very good
review: We really like this Embassy Suites, enough that we've stayed there twice (last Christmas and now Spring Break).  The hotel is in a great location, the staff is very nice (especially the bartender at the evening reception), and we've not experienced any significant issues.  The Saturday before Easter the manager even put on an egg dash for the kids which was a nice gesture.  My biggest complaint is when they combine the cooked-to-order breakfast line with the "express" line and it backs up really long.  That seems to be how it works during the week as on the weekend they had a separate express setup.  We've been told the entire hotel will be undergoing a renovation, which is somewhat good because as other reviews have said the rooms are a bit dated and could use a refurb. …

title: Embassy Suites - Orlando, International Drive
review: This hotel was fantastic! The two bedroom suite had more than enough room for my family of 8. Breakfast could get a bit crazy with all of the guests, but the staff were efficient and pleasant. The kids loved the pool, and the proximity to the major attractions and dining options was great.

title: Orlando
review: I was disappointed with the quality of this hotel. It was not up to the standard I expect from a Hilton hotel. The beds are horrible. I had issues with my key getting into my room. The internet did not work most of the time. The hot tub indoor was not hot at all.

title: Great Experience.
review: I booked this room at the last minute, on the date of my arrival, for an early business meeting the next day. I arrived about 8:00 pm and received a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool. I was working, and was anticipating some loud and unruly guests, since it was Spring Break. I was pleasantly surprised. It was quiet, the staff was amazing, and room service was prompt, hot and exactly as ordered despite my requested changes.

title: Not too good
review: I'm used to better condition furnishings, cleanliness and breakfast with Embassy than I experienced at this location. The man cooking at the omelette station was downright snippy and rude. I asked for very little and tipped very well. The furnishings are tired. Still feel safe on premises. I would stay again but only at a deep discount. Great location however. Housekeeping was very nice. They really are slipping in quality.

title: Gross
review: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at and Hilton should be embarrassed to have it under it's brand. Rooms were musty and mildewy. Breakfast consisted of watery eggs and slivers of bacon. The wifi only worked in the bathroom.

title: Disappointed family of 4
review: Normally we have great things to say about Embassy Suites, but not this one in particular. We were met with a less then enthusiastic person at the front desk. Room had a faulty key assembly which made it a nightmare to enter the room. Breakfast was bland and lacked variety. We did take out from the Fisheye Grill one night. The staff there were very rude and the food was less than appealing. The hotel is located in a great location. More than likely will not stay at this particular hotel again.

title: Hotel overall was okay
review: The clerk at front desk was very professional,  The property is older and the curtains and furniture is a bit worn . The evening reception and breakfast could be better. Not organized. Spoke with front desk

title: Great stay
review: This was our second stay at this location. We were Very pleased with everything. The hotel was clean the room was clean. The breakfast was great. The staff was friendly. Everyone was so nice. I will definitely stay here again

title: Needs to be updated
review: The staff were great.  The breakfast was good.  The rooms could use some upgrading and spring cleaning.  It was difficult to adjust the heat/cooling of the living and bedroom areas. Overall not a wonderful experience, would choose another hotel next time around.

title: Property needs to be de-flagged from the HILTON BADGE
review: We have probably had the worst stay at an Embassy Suites property. Not only is the property very shabby and run down but the price we are paying per night is definitely worth the stay. The property is in serious need of PIP which needs to be implemented urgently. Right from the attitude of the valet person when we parked to check in to the type of the room given and the interaction with the front desk staff - this property needs to be de-flagged from the HILTON BRAND. The room which we have # 508 is supposed to be 492 sq.ft but in no way feels a LARGE SUITE. When we asked for a room change/upgrade; we were told that the next room available is the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE which is $1000/night. Great attitude from the front desk staff!! Our package has a PREMIUM WI-FI included(primary…

title: DESPITE needing some renovation, it was a good experience
review: There was a lot of good things about our stay here at Embassy Suites.  The rooms were spacious and a good value overall and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful.  While the included breakfast was not the best we have ever had it was pretty good and the omelets were delicious!  We found the breakfast to be better than what we have received at many of the other Embassy Suites we have stayed at.  The hotel is located near numerous restaurants so walking some place for dinner is not a problem.    The biggest problem with the stay is that our room felt rather tired and in need of some refurbishing,  The bathroom in particular had deteriorated caulking, a cracker tiles, and the tower hanger on the back of the door was halfway hanging out.  I was torn as to whether or not to…

title: Vacation
review: Overall it was a good experience,  the location was excellent.  Hotel charges for parking. Be careful if you use electronic check in as we picked a room that was located next to the highway and it smelled like it they should consider opening the windows to get some fresh air circulating.

title: Quick Family Getaway
review: Staff was very nice.  Hotel is clean, but dated.  Everything looks worn and chipped.  My sons slept horribly on the sofa bed with springs literally underneath them coming out of the mattress.  Food selection for evening reception were not very appetizing.  I spoke to the front desk and was told renovations were going to begin in May.

title: GETTY OLDER AS THE YEARS GO BY!
review: We have gone to this Embassy because of various cruises out of Ft Lauderdale. This one is really in need of a makeover. The lobby, bar and pool area is very nice but the rooms are really dated. We may have to look for another hotel next time unless something is done. Very sad to have to say this.

title: Family Stayl
review: The hotel location was great and close by many attractions, which suited my family needs. The daily breakfast was great and many food items to choose from. Our only complaint with the hospital is the full size beds, they were comfortable but too small. But overall a decent hotel and stay.

title: Older Embassy suites Hotel
review: The good:  The hotel was clean good location with in walking distance on I drive so you have options. Staff was pleasant and very helpful when we needed something. Rooms were clean and looked maintained for the age.   The not so good: Older hotel.. Needs an update. ( I believe they have one planned) there were displays at check in of drawings of renovations. But no timetable or idea when it will happen. The bathroom seemed really small and the shower head was really low.. (I'm 5'10) I had to hunch down to get my head wet. I would guess the shower head was probably at 5'9.. Not big deal just was odd never have had that problem. We only did the evening reception on Sunday .. Was not up to par with what I have had at other stays at embassy. Chips and pita chips and 3 types of ranch…

title: Probably the worst hotel I've stayed in, but the staff is friendly
review: I'll start by saying the staff has been extremely friendly and have been pleasant every time we've seen them. To say the hotel is dated is an understatement, the hotel has boards up for new finishes so my guess is they'll be getting a refurbishment soon; too little too late for our stay. However it's impossible to close the curtains that look out in to the hallway - someone can always see in, our shower curtain is actually ripped and hanging off the rod and in the shower there's this awkward pipe hanging from the ceiling. Upon check in (room was only ready 15 mins before the 4pm check in time) only one of our keys worked so had to head down to get a second one again. We then quickly went up to shower and quickly discovered we had no hot water. Called downstairs to have it…

title: Great Location
review: This hotel is in a great location and in walking distance to lots of great bars and restaurants. Fairly close to the convention center and offers a shuttle to Disney. Hotel is well maintained and staff here are very friendly. Enjoyed the free cocktail hour. The valet guys can hook you up with passes to neighboring bars. The hotel has a nice pool.

title: Awsome!
review: This is the 2nd time I have stayed there and it was awesome. The hotel is clean and the staff is wonderful. I especially want to thank everyone for their wonderful hospitality. Everything is so close by and so many things to do at a walking distance. I just went to relax and didn't want to go any where and it was great!

title: Business trip
review: I have found The  Embassy Suites in Orlando, Fla to be a location to return to.Travelling on Florida highways has been a bad experience. The road signs are confusing, are not well placed not well marked. I wanted to travel form Orlando th Titusville ,55 miles , I had to backtrack a number of times , the trip .took 4 hours

title: Typically Good Embassy, A Little Noisy
review: Nice hotel, great location. You can walk to numerous restaurants and shopping. The one drawback is that many of the rooms face International Drive, which is very noisy. Ask for a room that doesn't face the front of the hotel. The breakfast setup is strange - instead of the usual buffet with scrambled eggs, sausage, etc it is behind the omelette station and you have to line up in the Express Breakfast line to get those items. The hotel is about to undergo a renovation and that is helpful but it's not bad now. All in all, a typically nice Embassy Suites.

title: dated and tiresome
review: This hotel was rather old and dated.  Good location on international drive so it was a plus. Breakfast omelette was delicious but the table and silverware could get some attention and sanitation.  All amenities were somewhat clean but dated.  For location, I gave it three starts

title: Hotel really needs a renovation
review: The staff in this hotel is excellent and the made to order breakfast was great.  My complaint is that the rooms are really old and needing to be renovated.  Especially the bathroom.  Another issue is that my room backed up to I -4 so I heard traffic all night and I am typically a very sound sleeper.  Also this is the only hotel I have stayed in lately that charges to self park.

title: Upcoming Renovations
review: Stayed in this hotel last month and was told it will be going through renovations beginning in May.  Went back this past weekend and got to stay in the model room for the renovations.  The room was very nice and modern.  The hotel already has all the extras, but after renovations it will be one of the best around.

title: Great International Drive Hotel
review: Embassy Suites on International Drive was a perfect location to visit Disney, Universal, SeaWorld or the Orlando Eye.  They have free shuttles to these parks.  The Orlando Eye is a quick walk.  There are dozens of great restaurants also within walking distance.  Also Orlando Pointe is a quick walk.  The suite room gives plenty of room and privacy. The pool area is quite nice.  The complimentary breakfast is very nice with a nice assortment of quality food.  Each evening is a complimentary reception with free beverages and snacks. the front desk staff was helpful and professional. I would definitely return to this hotel again when visiting the area.

title: Not up to par with other Embassy Suites
review: My family and I stayed at this hotel last week.  I was upset to find out that our travel agent had  inadvertently booked us at this location instead of the Embassy Suites on Jamaican Court .  The rooms are very dated and the breakfast buffet is not equal to other Embassy Suites we have stayed at.  The fruit choices are limited to 2 types of melon only.  Also the indoor and outdoor pools are not heated.  However the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are polite and very helpful.

title: Picked the Jamaican Court location, bumped to this one...
review: We booked through Flight Centre in Canada, intending to go to the newer/nicer Embassy Suites just up international drive. Were notified last minute that we had been bumped to this hotel (we had asked them several times prior to confirm we were going to the Jamaican Court location... and yet, here we are)   The Good:   Building's architecture is gorgeous imo. Elevators use hydraulic pistons vs cables. They are slow, but fun to watch. Building is old and needs renovation, but larger and more spacious than the newer location.   Really liked the two-room suite. Was clean and well-equipped for 3 people.   Staff were friendly and helpful. i.e.: Most of their keycards are old and scratched, had a lot of problems getting around the building. They replaced my keys and gave me a $30…

title: A Pleasure
review: I recommend Embassy Suites to anyone I know of searching for a hotel.  The quality of the hotel itself, the staff and the amenities are wealth worth the money.  The rooms are very spacious and have a living room environment where you can sit and socialize with your travel companions versus sitting on a bed and trying to talk like in other hotels.  The rooms are always very clean as well.  The complimentary breakfast is way more than a donut or muffin offered at many other hotels that advertise complimentary "breakfast".  The evening reception is also  a very nice added touch that is not offered at any other hotel I am aware of. I have stayed at Embassy for pleasure and business and highly recommend for either.

title: Not Embassy Suites quality
review: This hotel was more like a Motel 6 which probably would have been cheaper. I would defiantly not stay at this hotel again. May the Jamaican Way Embassy is nicer. Don't know it was old and showed it's age in a bad way. I would find another hotel to stay in.

title: Second rate hotel
review: Fine if all you need is a bed and a shower. Motel 6 would serve the same purpose. Staff and service are ok. The people are good but the hotel was too bare bones for the price they charge. Next time in Orlando I will stay somewhere else.

title: Older well-maintained hotel, great location
review: Stayed here with husband, daughter and 13-month-old granddaughter at end of Feb. Picked for three reasons: indoor heated pool, separate bedroom, cooked breakfast. All three delivered.  The hotel is older, furnishings a little tired but very clean, everything works and the location is quite good for what Orlando offers. We needed a heated indoor pool so my granddaughter could swim, even if it rained. Since we were meeting our east-coast based daughter and granddaughter after visiting with other family in Florida, we picked Orlando for its ease of finding flights from the Washington DC area and back to our home in California. Daughter able to fly in, meet all my granddaughter's needs for entertainment, food and getting to sleep by 7pm. We found the hotel restaurant to have…

title: OUT DATED
review: Hotel is OK,to much money for what you get.lot of noise from Interstate 4. Breakfast is very good. Happy hour /reception at 5.30 is terrible ,drinks are OK, food my dog will not eat it!!!! It is an old hotel that shows everywwhere!!

title: Terrible experience!!
review: From the check in staff, to the room, to the cleaning staff, this experience was one of the worst hotel experiences ever. Front desk checked me in but gave me keys that did not work. Went up to the room and had to go back down to get them changed. The room was musty. I had ordered a birthday surprise for my gf and it ended up being there after we got back to the hotel that night. The balloons were deflated and the cake was too dry to eat. Upon leaving the next day, the cleaning lady pushed her large cart into the tiny elevator with us, handed me her vacuum and told me to push the next floor down...did not ask but told. I tried to talk to someone before leaving but no one was available. I did speak to someone after and they gave me 20k points on my Honors account and invited me…

title: a little disappointed
review: was told we were upgraded to a room unique in all the rooms.only diff was no curtains on the living room part of room.this was actually smaller than what we were used to being that we've stayed in a lot of Embassy hotels.

title: Embassy review
review: Everything was great from the easy checkin to the happy hour to breakfast. The room was wonderful and immaculate. The service was even better!!!  I would definitely stay there again. I can honestly say I was very impressed. I thought it would be average but was pleasantly surprised.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando International Drive
review: While the staff are very courteous and genuinely caring, our experience at this hotel was poor. We had to switch rooms after the first night due to no hot water, plugs not working in room and the water reservoir on the coffee pot appeared corroded. We were promptly moved and had the night refunded. Our next room was to hot at night and we were moved to the noisy side of the hotel with bar music playing until 3 am. This did not allow us to get much sleep with a 15 month old in tow.

title: Worth your time and money
review: Definitely worth the money.  The staff are extremely friendly, the evening reception was great. Convenient, walk-able to tons of entertainment with super restaurants close by. The free breakfast in the morning wasn't spectacular but it was nice to grab something quick before heading out for the day.

title: BEST Place to stay in Orlando
review: What a great hotel. Service and cleanliness were impeccable. Large suites offered everything you need as a family and location is convenient to everything! The staff go out of their way to take care of you.

title: The worst experience ever!!!!!!!!!!!
review: On my arrival when I was check in the door didn't even work to get in to my suite. The maintenance person had to be contacted to change the whole door lock, So that meant no sleep until then ,the tub didn't work ,the internet didn't work properly either. When I notified the front desk they act like they didn't care and stayed well this is a franchise so they are not the same. then at breakfast the cook was so rude and u couldn't even get  your own food and when I ask for more than one item he states oh big breakfast huh ! really I didn't eat the food because it was nasty and the bacon wasn't done at all , so I left to find me a real breakfast. When I got back to my room it was open then they tried to give me strawberry which I am allergic to.

title: Supreme Services
review: Everything was excellent the Manager Ram was awesome, Supreme provide me and my wife with stellar costumer services.  he gets a A++ in my book thank you.  I would come back again like i have for the last 8 years

title: Service was bad
review: I was here on a convention, first thing was that I ordered 3wine glasses. Which never arrived. The  desk called to see if they arrive (half hour later) . I replied no don't worry about it. Suddenly a fruit plate,a bottle of wine arrive( with glasses) complimentary. So nice thankful you.  But then we were at the conference all day, comeback to room to relax for future dinner date to find room still not made up.  Went to front desk to complain and was told that housekeeping doesn't finish until 5. So I think hmmm. So I assume we must be the last room to be cleaned.  Really don't like to complain but this was unacceptable.  Front desk was no helps so sat In lobby fo 30 minutes until done. Rooms were old and dirty

title: Great location
review: Great staff and location. only one problem staff forgot to tell me they were working on water at check i Room was a little dated and some rust on the ceiling but the room was very clean.Most employees i encounter was nice.

title: Great place to stay
review: Clean - great service - within walking distance to so many restaurants.  Staff is gracious and accomodating - rooms are large and very comfortable - I highly recommend. Cook to order breakfast was Very good.

title: MUST STAY!!!
review: Wonderful hotel, super clean, great price and unbelievable services. Breakfast was great and large selection. I couldnt believe that they offered and evening snack and drinks, never expected this from a hotel. My children loved this hotel. We will be staying again at this hotel and this chain of hotels in the future.

title: Worst Breakfast Service Ever Experienced at a Embassy Suites!
review: I have never experienced a slower breakfast service at any other Embassy Suite. I have stayed in Embassy Suites all over the US. Why they have elected to service your breakfast buffet one plate at a time versus serving yourself puzzles me? You want a great breakfast and get out promptly to see the attractions in Orlando. One other of many issues too was the insistence of a bellhop to unload our luggage even though we always do it ourselves. We practically had to threaten him to give the luggage cart to us to move luggage at our pace. I had family accompanying us and this was their first Embassy Suites experience. Needless to say, they were not impressed and likely will not come back at least to this location.

title: Great Staff
review: The staff was all very friendly and helpful.  Hotel location is conveniently located along the I train which goes along the main drag for dinning and Sea World.  The hotel gives vouchers for free travel on the train.  This Embassy Suite property shows its age a little and it caters to heavy wear and tear of vacationing families, but it is still clean.

title: Run down
review: I booked this Embassy based on good reviews from Mousesavers and decent luck with previous stays at Embassy Suites.  This hotel (lobby and rooms) is extremely dated (not sure if it has ever been renovated since opening) and felt dirty.  Price of rooms was not cheap so I expected a little more.  Only reason I didn't choose terrible is due to the great breakfast included.  Lastly, request room away from highway side unless you enjoy the roar of Interstate traffic.

title: Good place to stay for a convention
review: Good: - bed was comfortable - room was clean - staff was polite - they have free snacks and drinks in the late afternoon/early evening,  I did not partake, but coworkers did and said the snacks were tasty and the drinks were good. - people responsible for room cleaning were very polite and did a great job  Neutral: - shower head height; I'm short (5'2) so it wasn't a problem for me but if you were any taller, it was a challenge to rinse your hair (per taller coworkers). - my room faced the expressway and boy was it loud at night.  Coworkers stayed on other sides of the building and did not have a problem with sound. - the room my company used for a sales meeting was cold on one half and hot on the other - the cooler than usual weather probably played havoc with the HVAC system. …

title: Not up to Embassy Suites or Hilton standards
review: Not enough characters to describe our experience. About 10 years overdue for a reno. A friend had to move rooms due to bugs, only to be put in a room not serviced from previous guest. Breakfast items were poor quality compared to others in chain. Attendant serving buffet had a tip jar to put cold pancakes and sausage on our plates. Balloon performer approaches table with a large button that says "I work for tips." So much for "complimentary" breakfast. Restaurant service was terrible -- we sat ourselves, had to ask for flatware, napkins and even the check only to receive an empty folder with no bill! Such a bad experience all around that it was laughable. We've stayed at many Hiltons and Embassy Suites and this was, by far, the worst.

title: Very disappointing stay
review: We stayed at this motel several years ago and it was fine. This trip, not so much. We had no hot water in the shower. We were there three nights and had no hot water at any time in the shower. We had five family members and we all took cool showers every day. Don't bother eating at the "Fisheye Grill". We were charged 18% gratuity for a large party. We had only five people in our group and we ate only sandwiches. This was with the female employee. We ate there one night and had a male server. He was great. She was AWFUL! It takes a long time to get food because they have to carry it over from the kitchen. The elevators are very slow and several times they were full of staff with large bins for the dirty laundry and trash. The breakfast has an express line; however, it was not…

title: good location
review: International drive is the perfect location to access all the theme parks.  restaurants are close by too,  Would've rated excellent if the parking is free.  $9 daily is a bit high when u the room rate is approx $150

title: Nice overnight option - odd pay for parking option
review: Good price, great location, nice options.    You can't get much close to the airport, beyond STAYING there.   Price was lower than a lot of other options. Happy hour (free drinks and snacks) was a nice touch.  We had a solid experience here.  Staff was professional and helpful.  Room, while as other have noted, was a little dated, it was clean, the bed comfortable and plenty of space.  Can't ask for much on a quick end of trip stop.  What I don't understand, why charge for parking in an open parking lot?  Thought that was odd.  Haven't had to pay for parking when it wasn't in a garage or valet.  Brought my rating down a star.  AVOID the gas station right near the hotel!  Go up another 500 yards to the WAWA.  Price gouging at the gas station!

title: love this hotel :)))!!!!
review: this is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed at in orlando and most other cities as well! the staff is amazing and the location is perfect. walking distance to restaurants, shopping and entertainment! easy access to disney and universal!! they helped my fiance with the perfect birthday surprise :))) will be back!

title: Fantastic
review: Quite simply, this hotel was amazing. The rooms are clean, the decor is pleasing and the services are great too. There is a shuttle service which goes to all the universal studios parks and the location as a whole is right in the centre of Orlando. The nearby restaurant, Uno, is definitely worth a try as well. We ate there everyday!

title: Great Price for a 4 star hotel
review: An absolutely wonderful stay.  I felt really secure travelling alone in a foreign city.  The staff made me feel safe and welcomed.  Breakfast needs a little bit of a make over, there was not time to try the "made to order breakfast" though, that might have been good. The wait staff at the Fish Eye Grill was very gracious and helpful, the front desk lady was extremely helpful.  Wish parking is free for Hilton Rewards Members.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Friendly Staff and Great Location
review: The Hotels is very Nice.  The Breakfast was out standing,  The Hotel is located near many restaurants, & stores but is quiet.  Everyone was friendly and service was great.  Not far from Outlets, nor the parks.

title: Survey
review: That specific Embassy Suites is centrally located in Orlando. The staff is quite courteous and the services impeccable. I would go back there anytime, business or pleasure.  I did not agree to pay $6.95/day for internet services.

title: Embassy Suites Conference Center, Orlando FL
review: The hotel staff were professional, friendly, and accommodating.  The hotel itself, though slightly worn or 'dated' was overall clean and in a great location near the conference center, food, and the Orlando Eye.  Needs some attention to maintenance to bring it to the higher level "Embassy" standards, but for a normal hotel, I'd still recommend it if attending conference in the area.

title: Great Location
review: Kinda dated but clean. Perfect for family with kids. We have 5 total in our family and it was the right size for us. Perfect location to walk to all sorts of restaurants and attractions. 10 mins from Universal Studios. 20 mins to Disney Springs. 10 mins to outlet mall.

title: Old and Tired
review: Poor value for the state of this hotel. Staff were pleasant and helpful, but couldn't provide directs.??? Rooms are old and in need of a full reno. Water hammer in pipes all night long. Elevators are slow. This hotel needs more than a face lift to get it back to the level it should be.

title: This Place Impresses Me All Around
review: First of all, this place is reviewed from a one-night stay where lots happened.   My family was coming off a 5-day stay at Disney where we stayed here because of the proximity of the property to the Orange County Convention Center.  I attended a trade show for one day so this made the perfect venue.  Truly, this is one of the nicer Embassy Suites I have stayed at.  Nice amenities such as a small gift shop, a restaurant, indoor and outdoor pools, a fancier than typical atrium area...just a very comfortable place to stay.  In comparison, earlier in the week I stayed at the other Embassy Suite a short distance away (on Jamaican Ct.) and was not impressed, to say the least.  You can also read that review.  Perhaps what made this property so special was the people who worked here. …

title: Great location, great stay.  Would stay again.
review: Got this for 1 night on a fantastic rate on Hotwire. The location is perfect on international drive. Close to wet n wild, ifly, wonder works, and so many restaurants I could not count them. Some reviews say it is run down but I didn't think so.   Since we got it via Hotwire we were booked in a king suite but really needed an extra bed. Doubles weren't available so I asked for a rollaway at check in. Within 10 minutes they had it set up in our room.  Staff was excellent.  We also were upgraded to a premium suite which included access to free snacks and beverages on the 7th floor.

title: Dave B
review: Yet again Embassy Suites International Drive (Convention Centre South) provided me with a great central location on International Drive, Rooms are spacious and comfortable and the  friendliness and delivery of service was excellent from all levels of management and staff for the whole of my 13 day duration  These days good, consistent customer service is hard to find however the management and delivery of service during my stay at this hotel was excellent from beginning to end and for my entire stay I genuinely felt that my custom was truly valued and that if I needed anything else it would be organised willingly.Great stay at customer focussed hotel with friendly staff and more than adequate facilities for my stay  Please see comprehensive review in earlier section  Dave B

title: Embassy Suites on I-Drive in Orlando
review: Stay away untill they update the property, staff is nice enough but the property is old and worn.  The location is good, with plenty of dining choices close by as well as several attractions that would be good for families traveling with children.  The food in the Fish Eye restaurant was sub-par and the bar will be considered limited to anyone who like upper shelf drinks (limited scotch and bourbon selection)

title: Old, tired & smelly
review: Stayed here because of a conference. First room had been wet and smelled like a pool locker room. They upgraded me to a Premium room. Same type of room; a Kurig coffee maker & free snack machine were the only upgrades.   Old thread bare linen, noisy HVAC system, long black hair on rim of tub for the whole week (I left it there to see if it would ever move - didn't). This is an old tired property that may be OK for eco travel and Disney trips but very substandard for business/conference use.

title: Hotel Needs Renovation
review: Hotel needs renovation. Stayed in the sixth floor and couldn't sleep because of the highway/street noise. Furniture is in bad condition as well as bathroom. Compared to other Hilton properties Hotel is in bad shape, although location is perfect.

title: Had an amazing time!
review: Friendly staff, great rooms, and more amenities than you can dream of! The price is right and location can't be beat! Breakfast is serve to order and every night starts with an open bar, all inclusive!  It was a magnificent stay, and the staff made it all the more better! We will definitely be returning.

title: Skip this one
review: Embassy Suites are usually decent and often amazing, but not this one.  Average at times, poor at others.  I also should say that for advertising queen size beds, they were the smallest queens I'd ever seen.  More like doubles.  With plenty of other hotel options in the area, I'd skip this one.

title: Very Disappointed
review: The hotel service was awesome but the rooms were horrible! I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and always expect a certain level of quality. This property was desperately in need of an update!  The room carpet was worn and the bathrooms had seen better days.  They did tell me that they were renovating but unfortunately I won't be returning to this location.

title: My review
