review: The location of the hotel was great.  The hotel is surrounded with various places to eat.  The place is nice.  The decor was is a little out dated.  It needs a slight make over.  Do not stay in room 508.  You will be able to sleep due to the noise outside.  It was very bad.  Aside from the noise overall experience was good.

title: Too noisy to sleep
review: Sits adjacent to interstate highway - which is very loud all night long. Had to use TV or earphones to counter the noise to be able to sleep. Room needs minor repairs (towel hook fell off door and shower head extremely loose, also almost fell out of wall).  Staff friendly and room layout matches other Embassy Suites. Great location - right across the street from several restaurants, near convention center.

title: Embassy Suites - International Drive
review: Absolutely lovely hotel.  It's walking distance to many great restaurants and attractions.  It's also very close to the convention center.  The room was very spacious.  The staff was very friendly and will do everything they can to make your stay comfortable.  I can't wait for another opportunity to stay here!

title: Above and Beyond the Call of Duty to accommodate.
review: Excellent overall experience. Helpful friendly and accommodating staff on the entire property, from front door to check-in to housekeeping all going above and beyond the call of duty. The Trolly that travels on Internatinal Drive is a fun and great way to get around the area. Restaurants in abundance close by. Great Experience. Thank you Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando International Drive Convention Center.

title: Weekend
review: Ended up getting a Suite on the 7th floor. Pretty nice comes with complimentary drinks and snacks out of the vending machine. The room was clean but it's the Embassy so that's expected. The staff were very accommodating.

title: Amazing Hotel
review: The room was immaculate. Staff was friendly and helpful. All of our questions were answered in a friendly and timely manner. Accommodated my son's food allergies without issue or complaint. Definitely will stay again next year.

title: Love this Embassy Suites!
review: Love the gigantic, delicious breakfast, love the huge rooms, love the big waterfall in the lobby, especially love the free return shuttle from Epcot in the evening.  I hope to keep coming back here for years to come.

title: great stay
review: very clean, quiet, and excellent rooms. (now I am typing extra words because the review must have a minimum of 200 characters.) Wow, even that wasn't enough, so here are some additional words. I must be getting close to 200 now. Nope, not quite yet.

title: EMBASSY SUITES STAY
review: good location, liked having two room suite. hotel is clean and well maintained.  best part is the fully cooked to order breakfast which is included in the room rate. i have stayed here before and will stay here again

title: great time great location
review: Take it from me it's a great place to stay if you're interested in being treated like you matter from a helpful staff that cares, the rooms are nice and clean , the location is great and the Staff is amazing . I would recommand this hotel to anyone looking for a little R&R

title: Fantastic Food
review: full breakfast, they had an omelet bar, cereal bar, pancakes, seasoned baked? potato's, french toast, muffins, bacon,sausage, bagels, extras like heated surp, great coffee, juice, fruit, etc food was hot, fast, tasted good, and included in room price cant get any better then that!   ordered room service for dinner, again, really surprised, like to treat on a trip so ordered the stake at 24 bulks ouch, but that was an amazing stake it was huge and so tasty and got the garlic red mashed potatoes ow wow (ate there both nights different things all very tasty)  the rooms were needing a lil updating but wasn't dirty, I think they got a lil excited with the cleaning stuff, had to leave sliding door open for a bit to air out, the staff was friendly, helpful, and we did have a lil…

title: Needs updates!
review: The entire suite needed updated and upgraded.  This Embassy Suites location was by far the worst room conditions I have experienced with the Embassy brand.  I have always had enjoyable experiences with the Embassy brand.  I even bragged about the great hotel stay we were going to have to other family members traveling with me.  I was embarassed at the condition of the rooms.  The hot tub was lukewarm and felt very dirty.  The pool area also needed major renovations and updates.  The breakfast was everything I have come to expect with the Embassy Brand-great job, efficient service, great food!  The lobby and atrium are well maintained and appealing.

title: The good and the OK
review: The good: Staff is very accommodating, friendly and helpful.  The daily breakfast has many choices.  Antoinette who took care of us one night for dinner at the Fish Grill was great as 2 in our party have serious food allergies.  Location is excellent, right in the middle of I Drive.  The OK: it's not that the place is dirty, it just needs a refresher.  Rooms need new paint and carpet. If you are taller than 4 feet the showerhead will be inconvenient as the one in our too  was very low.

title: Needs updated but great staff!
review: I wouldn't recommend the shuttle services.  It took us from 9:15PM until 10:30 PM to get to our hotel.  The man drove all the way out to Kissimmee and I was basically in a panic thinking he was going to be taking us to the wrong hotel.  Should have told us before hand and we would have hired a cab to get back in minutes.  It was especially frustrating after an all day trip to the park in which everyone is tired.

title: Embassy Suite
review: Pros: 1. Lobby and eating area decorated very nicely for the holidays. 2. Staff was courteous and helpful. 3. Price was not bad when I received a discount thru my employer.  Cons: 1. All buffet breakfast food was lukewarmor cold-pancakes, eggs, sausage.   2.Thermostat in room did not function. A/C ran all night and did not shut down when set room temp was reached. 3. Couch in room had filthy arm rests. 4. Repairs to bathroom were sloppy.

title: Not the usual Embassy Suites we expect
review: This is not the level of hotel we have come to expect from Embassy Suites.  We regularly choose Embassy Suites based on good locations, nice rooms and full service breakfast.  In this hotel the room was clean, but pretty beat up.  The sleeper sofa was in bad shape and missing springs.  Son fell through after the first night.  This sofa had been in this condition for a while.  The staff couldn't replace it, so gave us a rollaway.  The breakfast food was also below average.  That said, the location on International Drive is excellent. Easy access to transpiration, restaurants and night spots, shopping and entertainment.  Almost made up for the hotel itself.  We would not stay in this hotel again.

title: Disappointed
review: We are Hilton Honors members and this hotel is just not up to par. It's not clean and needs some work. As we entered room 703 the musty damp smell hit us.  Very unpleasant. The bathroom was not clean as the photos show.  Dirt and hair on the floor next to and on the edge of the tub. The handles for the sink are loaded with crud. Yucky!!  When we hung a towel on the bathroom door hook it pulled out of the door and fell to the floor showing that there were 2 sets of holes for the hook. They need to use anchors for the screws to prevent the screws from pulling out. There was no extra roll of toilet paper.    Furniture is very outdated!  They have not upgraded to the new Hilton look. At breakfast,  the floor was so sticky by the omelet station as if it has never been cleaned. The…

title: New Years eve
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I was disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy the visit.  While some of the concerns you mentioned will be addressed during the full renovations this summer, there is no excuse for a lack of cleanliness or a musty odor in the guest suite.  I appreciate you mentioning the room number so that I may walk it today to check for any concerns.  I will also walk the breakfast area today to ensure that the area is being cleaned appropriately.  The team does mop the entire area daily, so it may have been a timing issue in the breakfast area.  However, we may also need to update the chemicals we utilize or schedule a deep clean.  With that said, I would love to speak with you about the visit and ask that you please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  In the meantime, I will review stay records for the suite in question and see if I may be able to track down your contact information as well.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: I've Seen Better
review: Excellent hotel.   Clean, big ,very friendly excellent breakfast.  Pre requested extra towels.   Personalized note in room welcoming us.   Center of a lot activities and restaurants   Pricey but worth it walking distance to food and stores about 15 min from Disney

title: Room Needs Renovated, Bad Breakfast
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay.  All of us here at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando International Drive Convention Center were delighted to read your review and hear that you enjoyed the holiday stay.  We hope to welcome you back when your travels bring you to Orlando again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Christmass Holiday stay
review: We had a great stay at this hotel, very good location on international drive, close to restaurants, bars, shopping, attractions,our room was comfortable and clean the breakfast was good, also the fish eye grill and the complimentary drinks at PM time. the staff was very attentive and nice, front desk aknowelege you every time you came in, also the Concierge Jose Miguel he was great, he actually did all the planning for our vacation, told us where to go and what parks to do, also gave us good discounts for restaurants, and malls and tips around the area, he does a magnificent job on what he does, they need more people like him, we were so thankful for everything he did for us we even gave him a little Christmas gift, he sure tried make a great vacation for us and he did, overall…

title: Ok for a room  that we needed for one night. Otherwise, no thanks!
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We were delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and I will ensure that Jose Miguel is recognized for his efforts.  We hope you have a Happy New Year and look forward to welcoming you back.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Save your money and your sanity - find another place
review: We needed a hotel for one night after staying at Disney for 5 nights. What a step down! Room smelled like bleach, AC hardly worked...it was set on 61 and still not cool. Carpet and drapes were very dated. Forget the managers reception! lines lines lines! I had my clothes for the next day on the vanity by the sink in the bedroom. Not a pleasant surprise when I saw ants all over the counter. We were on the 7th floor, and the traffic noise was pretty loud from I 4. The wi fi kept dropping and I finally gave up.  Will not be back.

title: Worst Embassy Suites I ever visited
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I was disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay and would love to speak with you to find out which room you stayed in so I may follow up with our pest control company on the ants you saw.  I also want to check the A/C as we do not typically have any concerns with the heating / cooling in the suites.  The bleach comment has come up a couple of times in the past week and we have not heard that previously so I have some research to do on that front.  The carpet and drapes are due for replacement this coming year, along with the overall décor.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and ask that you please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301 to discuss your stay.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Christmas Vacation
review: Hotel looks ok from the outside, but is a total dump inside.  Our room smelled of chlorine, the towels were paper thin, the carpet was old in worn, the walls were dirty with scuffs and marks, the bathroom door had multiple holes and patches on it, there was a light on the exterior of the building shining directly in our room, and the AC system made a whistling noise.  The location is OK if you want to be on International Drive.  There are a lot of restaurants and it is close to Universal.  However, the traffic around the hotel is CRAZY and it took us almost 10 min to drive  less than a mile off the highway to the hotel.

title: Christmas Trip to Universal
review: Embassy Suites is a very old hotel.   Our room was not clean prior to arrival but the hotel did provide a 50 dollar credit to account.   The breakfast bar was great and the plenty of seating for everyone.   The hotel also had 2 cars windows broken in during our stay.   I would check other hotels in the area before staying here.

title: sGreat room and service- fair price
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate your stay.  I apologize again for the mix-up with your room not being clean upon arrival.  The hotel is due for a renovation in 2016 and we look forward to showing off the great new design and upgrades and would love to have you come stay with us again to check it out.  In regards to the two broken windows, we have increased our security patrols on property and I have been in touch with local law enforcement.  They have added more deputies in the tourist corridor as there were more than 30 car burglaries the weekend before Christmas in the various resort areas of Orlando.  Criminals broke into vehicles at budget motels, 4 diamond resorts, shopping centers and various restaurants throughout Orlando's tourist areas.  In nearly every case, the officer said the victims left expensive electronics, purses and other valuables in plain sight within the vehicle.  We will continue to be diligent but I urge all travelers to ensure you take valuables with you or lock them in the trunk to avoid theft, regardless of how long you will be in a business or how nice the location appears to be.     Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Terrific Stay
review: a very clean and fresh room. Two large screen TV's for our 11 yr. old. Very comfortable beds. Clean room with lots of extras. Inclu ded was a very nice helpful staff. It provided a van to take us to a restaurant we enjoyed. Breakfast was a feast in the morning with all you could eat included in the price. We got to swim in the pool. It was a great stay and parking was free.

title: Christmas Family Get Together
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a nice review of your visit.  We look forward to welcoming you back!  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Just returned from a week long stay at this terrific property.  Spacious 2 room suites with plenty of space.  The made to order breakfast were well prepared with lots of variety.  The service from the staff was great, especially Elsa who took particular care at breakfast to make us feel like we were in her home.  The daily manager reception was also very well handled, with snacks and complimentary adult beverages.  I would highly recommend this property for both business and family stays.  Near the attractions, restaurants  and convention center.  I will stay there next time I am in Orlando.

title: So many things make this uncomfortable
review: The public areas are nice enough,and location is good for many things.  But overall I will not stay here again for business.  This is the old style Embassy with full windows across the front of the room to the interior of the hotel.  Unfortunately the curtains do not fully cover the windows, so anyone walking down the hall will see you sitting on the couch.  The curtains on the exterior windows don't close at all, and there is no sheer curtain there either.  The noise level from central courtyard is unbelievable.  Possibly for families who are part of the noise and are never in their rooms the value of breakfast and the extra space would overcome these issues.  Also was not asked which Hhonors Gold amenity I wanted at check in, and was not given the usual bottles of water which…

title: Loved this property !
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your visit.  I truly apologize that we failed to deliver the amenities you should have received for being a Hilton HHonors Gold member.  They are typically confirmed and given to our HHonors guests upon arrival at the Front Desk.  Please contact me via email at William.Friedrich@Hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301 so I may check your reservation and ensure we had your HHonors account on file.  I feel terrible that we did not give you the amenities and would feel even worse if you did not receive the points earned for this stay.  With that said, I would also like to know which suite you stayed in as there should be a sheer in every suite both at the rear of the suite and in the front.  Furthermore, the curtains on the rear typically close very well and I need to check those out.  It sounds as if someone removed the sheer and a full panel and failed to replace them.  The front curtains have been a source of concern from our guests.  We have magnets at the Front Desk that we hand out upon request but we have also been moving the tracks closer together to help ensure the windows are covered completely so nobody can see in.  When we renovate in 2016 we are actually putting shutter style blinds on the front windows which will look and work great.  We currently have them installed in suite 402 at the hotel which is our model room for the renovations next year.  Again, I would love to speak with you about your stay and appreciate the feedback.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: I would return
review: From arrival to departure the experience we had was outstanding! Clean rooms, helpful staff and fantastic cooked to order breakfasts. Cannot wait to stay in this hotel again I highly recommend it to singles or families. The suite space was just what we needed for the extra space.

title: Comfortable hotel with great location
review: A really nice hotel.  It was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The morning breakfast made it so nice to start the day and not have to drive through traffic first thing in the morning.  I have been here before and keep coming back.

title: Dog Show Weekend With Friends
review: This hotel was perfect for my husband and I during our trip to Orlando. We chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced, a quick cab ride from the airport, offered a free breakfast buffet each morning and happy hour each evening, is conveniently located within walking distance to several restaurants and stores, and has a complimentary shuttle service to Universal Studios and Disney World. While the rooms were a bit dated, the beds were comfortable and clean, the breakfast was good, and the shuttle service was always on time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting the parks. It is a hassle free location.

title: Avoid at all costs
review: The overpriced rooms, moldy smell, horrible restaurant, horrible bar and awful service coupled with poor access to ground transportation make this one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed at and I was supposedly in a "premium" room. Recommend all stay away until they bulldoze and rebuild.

title: Great location.....OK rooms
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I was disappointed to read that it went so badly and would like to speak with you about it if you have the time.  Please contact me via email at William.friedrich@Hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great place
review: If the inside of your hotel room is not overly important to you then this is a great hotel to stay at. The location cannot be beat as this is close to everything that you could possibly need on I-Drive. I found the bed comfortable however the room itself was a bit dingy and smelled musty. Additionally when I arrived I could hear dogs barking on the next floor. Fortunately I knew it wouldn't be an issue once their owners returned later in the evening. If you are sensitive to noise definitely ask for a room at the front of the building as the back is directly on I4 and that traffic never stops.  Once you reach the hotel and park you can walk to just about anything: restaurants, bars, etc.

title: No attention to detail
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  We pride ourselves on providing top notch service and a clean hotel.  Admittedly, we are due for a renovation as the décor is showing it's age.  We are excited to share that the renovation will occur in 2016 and I certainly hope we will have the opportunity to host you again once it is complete.  With that said, thank you for your patience with the barking dogs.  We do not typically accept pets at our hotel but made an exception for the American Kennel Club Show at the Orange County Convention Center earlier this month.  The show dogs were very well behaved overall but we did receive a call or two while owners were away.  If I can be of any further assistance, please reach out to me via email at William.friedrich@Hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Clean, spacious, and would recommend!
review: This is in a really good location. The beds are ok. Rooms a bit tired but you're not in Orlando to stay in your room. Breakfast is great. Everything you'd want. Eggs to order. Good value. Helpful friendly staff.  Nice wee touch in the snacks and drinks from 5-7pm. The pool is small and quiet but grand for the kids to cool down for an hour or so in the evening-open til 11pm. Complimentary iride tickets to take you down to sea world. Great variety of restaurants in the vicinity, although avoid the Olive Garden right next door- air con much too cool and stinks of fried cheese. Would recommend Millers Ale house just down the street for a good beer/burger. Adequate free parking. I'd stay here again.

title: I would stay again.
review: My family and friends stayed at the Embassy Suites Orlando Intl Drive Convention Center for the Thanksgiving weekend.  If you are considering booking this hotel, this is what you need to know: self-parking is not free as some websites indicate.  The cost is $9.00/day which half the cost of similar class hotels in the area plus their resort daily fee is $20.00.  Breakfast: it is included in your nightly rate.  I found it to be one of the best FREE breakfast buffet spread I have seen in the Orlando area.  The choices include made to order omelets, juices, soft drinks and above average coffee.  During this holiday weekend, there were two additional serving stations offering scramble eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash brown and sausage links.  There was a wait for the omelet station but no…

title: Marsha (Jamaican) our housekeeper made our trip FANTASTIC!!!!!
review: The facility on the outside and the lobby seemed nice, modern and inviting but once I got upstairs to the room, it was aged, outdated and somewhat of a "decorator's nightmare" but good overall since the initial reason for the trip was business, a conference my wife was attending. To me, it seems as though someone purchased some used furniture from a "hotel closing sale" and asked the landscapers to arrange the furniture in the rooms before knocking off for the day. For a business trip, that is okay as long as the bed is clean and comfortable because at the end of the day, to get a good night's rest is what really matters.  It so happened that Friday the 20th was our 30th wedding anniversary so my wife and I agreed that I would fly down closer to the 20th and join her in order…

title: Great Hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  After reading your review a couple of weeks ago, we recognized Marsha publicly for her efforts in an all team meeting.  I am blessed to work with a great team overall and especially Marsha.  While the furniture was new when it was purchased nearly 7 years ago, it is definitely showing some age.  We are excited to share that the property is due for a full renovation in 2016 that will include updated décor and furnishings.  In the meantime, we pride ourselves on providing a clean hotel and top notch service.  Therefore, while I was disappointed to see a 3 star rating, I was happy to hear that the team members exceeded your expectations.  We hope to have the opportunity to celebrate many more special occasions with you down the road.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Breakfast cooks were great
review: Really enjoyed our 5 day stay at this property! Always like to stay at Embassy Suites. Great location! Right near the Convention Center where we were on business. Looking forward to staying here next time we are in town!

title: Would Stay Here Again
review: The staff at this hotel are all very nice.  I do have to give a thumbs up to the two cooks.  They were on it.  Fast, friendly perfect.  They pumped the food out quickly, an it was good.  The social people were nice as well but the cooks were awesome.  The hotel is showing its age pretty badly.  The staff makes up for it the best they can but it has to hurt repeat business.

title: Good value/ smelly rooms
review: The overall value for a family of 5 or more is a good deal. Their price includes breakfast if you don't mind dealing with long lines and pushy tourist.   The rooms are outdated and have a really noticeable smell when you first walk in. It smells like a mix of dog, smoke , and deodorizer.   Its hard to beat based on the price/value. I would recommend this property to those on a tight budget.

title: Needs TLC, but Outstanding Staff and Location!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I was disappointed to read that you felt the room smelled so horribly.  While we are due for a full renovation in 2016 that will address the "outdated" comments we do hear at times, we are an upscale hotel and cannot be placing guests in rooms with an odor.  If you have the time, please contact me via email at William.friedrich@Hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301 so I may follow up on the suite in question and check to see if the problem has been resolved.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Mini vaca
review: We love Embassy Suites.  This is mostly a typical Embassy.  Loved the additional sink in the bedroom that few Embassy Suites offer.  The beds were ok.  The room was mostly clean, however was in disrepair from the lights not all working, to the shower faucet constantly leaking to the alarm clock not working.  The pool area was dirty, two humidifiers were in the hallway near our door for a couple days, the fitness room door was often difficult to open with the key.   The breakfast offered slightly fewer options than other Embassy Suites, but there were 3 dips, crackers and chips at the Manager's reception which are more than typical Embassy Suites offer.   The front desk staff were probably the best that we've experienced at an Embassy.  They were on par with a 5 star hotel.   The…

title: Alittle worn...good location
review: Lovely hotel, stayed here before and it still is a very nice place to stay, clean, spacious, 2 pools with a great breakfast. The only downfall is the parking situation, guests have to pay to park at this hotel but many others in the area parking is free. I would still recommend staying here though

title: Very Good
review: In need of some TLC...if you are claustrophobic the bathrooms may scare you...the ceiling is no more than 7ft and the shower head is so low that I had to duck in order to get water on my head;-D .My breakfast omelette(meat lovers)was awful..Great staff...great location....decent TV selection..decent size rooms..good WIFI speed...fairly quiet.

title: Beautiful Restful Hotel in the heart of International Drive
review: This is a beautiful hotel.  The evening reception was wonderful after a long day of conferences.  Drinks and snacks by the pool.  I have never had a better breakfast at a hotel as this one.  Omelettes cooked to your choice.  The restaurant food is very good and the staff is exceptional.  Budget rental car is located right in the lobby.  The trolley stops right outside that can be used to go to the two outlets and shops.

title: Derek was amazing!!!
review: The concierge gentleman took care of our luggage even though our room was ready to check-in to an me we appreciated his hospitality because we are able to explore Orlando international drive carefree without extra baggage! Thanks a million Derek. We appreciate your kindness!

title: Aging
review: I travel for work often and usually spend a few nights a month at several embassy suites.  This one is average in comparison at best.   I was greeted by a strong whiff of a very strong chemical air fresher they doused the place with as I walked into the lobby. Not a good sign.   The entire staff was very friendly and pleasant throughout my stay. The lobby area was clean and seemed to have some updates done. No complaints here.   Our room though was musty with the same over whelming air freshener. It was supposed to be a smoking free room but someone must have been smoking up a storm in there. The room furniture is outdated as is the decor. The bed was comfortable and clean.   The bathroom was in disrepair with the ceiling stained from an air conditioner leak. There was a 1 inch…

title: Hotel stay for job conference
review: Excellant service by staff, rooms extremely clean, and air quality good, enjoyed the amenities and loved my entire stay!  Staff was extra special to me and I really appreciate the careful attention to guests and room service!

title: Suite Surprise
review: This Hotel was a tranquil luxury on International Drive. Room was spotless, staff warm and friendly and the breakfast and evening reception were exceptional(No waiting). Parking was ample and Foyer was beautiful. We are returning for another stay soon.

title: Excellent location, spacious and clean suites, wonderful staff
review: We felt lucky to chose this hotel when I attended a convention in Orlando. IT was only 20-minute walk from the convention centre which works very well for exercise lovers. It is very close to restaurants of all kinds and local amusements for children and adults. The reception staff especially Alejandra were very helpful and understanding. The design of the hotel was amazing. The suites were spacious and clean. The WiFi was a bonus. Breakfast was delicious.There is a coffee-making machine in the room. The rooms were very well furnished. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to go to Orlando for a holiday or business

title: Great choice
review: The hotel is very pretty inside.  The rooms are super spacious.  I had 2 double beds in one room and then the living room had a sofa bed and a table.  Customer service great.  Convenient to Orlando attractions and lots of places to eat all around the hotel, walking distance.  The Orlando Eye is a 5 minute walk away.  The gym needs to be updated with some machines broken. The indoor pool had too much chlorine.  Comp. Breakfast was decent with a choice of homemade omelets station. Overall great place to stay.

title: A good Embassy
review: If you are looking for a good hotel in the middle of plenty to do, then this may the place for you to stay.  It has both an indoor and outdoor pools and hot tubs.  The rooms were large and typical for an Embassy.  It is in the middle of International Drive about a five minute walk from the Convention Center.  Plenty of restaurants next door, across the street and within walking distance.  About a twenty minute drive to Disney.

title: Best Hotel Ever!
review: I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites in Orlando for anyone visiting Florida.    Everyone was so up beat that worked there.  They would always ask me if I needed anything.  I didn't have a car so they explained what things I could do within walking distance and how to use the local bus/shuttle service.  The rooms were clean and comfortable (the bed was like sleeping at home).  Internet access was reliable and easy to use.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious (the chef made anything I wanted).  I can't find that at a restaurant let alone a hotel for free!  Happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 is also complimentary.  What a wonderful way to unwind after sitting in a conference all day.  Plus it gave me a chance to socialize with other offices attending the conference.  I would…

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
review: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for our 2 week holiday in Orlando, the room was spacious with a huge comfy bed. The shower was powerful which was lovely after a long day in the park. When we first arrived we found some sugar ants in our room but the hotel apologised and sorted this for us as quickly as possible. Breakfast was good if you went early there was not much of a queue too. The hotel is in a great position on I drive and we would stay here again.

title: Great Location
review: On entering our room we found it a bit musty, however, once we settled in all was good.  We couldn't open the windows as they were locked but we were near fire escapes.  The breakfast was absolutely gorgeous and the service was brilliant, staff very friendly and nothing was a hassle.  Rooms cleaned everyday and felt very safe.  Free bar every night was a huge bonus with popcorn or chips to snack on.  Reception staff and front door staff extremely friendly and efficient.

title: Strange place for business
review: Visited Orlando for one night for business.  The location is great for family in vacation - close to all parks.  I didn't have time to check hotel facilities, but I'm sure that they can do better with the breakfast - which was very poor for the price of the room

title: Great place to stay near parks
review: We stayed here for 5 days while visiting Disney Parks and surrounding area. The rooms were big, clean and quiet. The staff were all super helpful and nice. The breakfast was always delicious and well stocked. We felt very safe and would stay here again. There are tons of good restaurants within walking distance.

title: Great place to stay.
review: We stayed here for just over a week. Location was perfect for what we needed. We used the free shuttle a couple of times to get to universal and Disney. We used uber to get back to the hotel - much cheaper then regular taxis, and gave us the freedom to come back anytime. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean, bed was very comfortable. Our favourite part was the breakfast, it was extremely good food. Freshly cooked omelettes and a big selection of other food and drinks. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing
review: This hotel has a great staff that treats you like family.  The breakfast was better than I-Hop and the scenery cannot be beat! The rooms were very clean and neat and the beds very comfortable.  I give this hotel a 5-star rating!!!

title: Excellent hotel!
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and were extremely impressed with the accommodations.  The rooms are very large, clean, and comfortable with a restaurant, full breakfast and hotel bar on site.  We will definitely stay at this location again when visiting Orlando!

title: Excellent Stay
review: Just recently arrived back from a 2 weeks stay at this hotel.The location on International driver is excellent with plenty within walking distance to keep you entertained. The breakfast is amazing at this place and the fact it's included in the cost is real money saver, I know there are people complaining about having to Q but for me it wasn't a problem, I'd much rather wait a few mins to have a freshly cooked breakfast. Free drinks and snacks reception every evening was also a great touch. The rooms are a bit dated and are in need of a "face lift" (which I believe is happening next year) but they were cleaned every day and are extremely comfortable. Over all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Orlando.

title: Great location, free breakfast, free drinks!
review: We've stayed here several times before - great place for couples.   The location on International Drive is within walking distance to a lot of restaurants and bars.   We walked north to the I-360 complex where there are several great restaurants and also the new Orlando Eye, Madame Tussauds, Sea Life Aquarium & Skeleton Museum - I recommend visiting all of them.   South of the hotel is WonderWorks which is also fun but more geared to kids.   Also south is The Pointe with many great restaurants and bars.   The hotel has great amenities - a shuttle in the morning to theme parks, free breakfast which had a huge assortment of items and free drinks late afternoon.   The pool was nice.   The suites give you a lot more space than a standard room at other hotels.   We would stay here…

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: We had a room on the top floor, beautiful view. We could see the fireworks in the evening. We attending the Epcot Food & Wine Festival and the hotel was only 6 miles away. I would certainly stay there again.

title: Rundown Desperately Needing Remodeling
review: Our room was described as a Premium Deluxe Suite, and it definitely was not.  For starters, there were only two standard size beds, we were expecting queen or king size beds.  The bathroom was in complete disrepair.  The toilet wobbled loudly when sat upon and flushed.  The metal doorframe was rusted and had a huge gaping hole in the bottom.  The bathtub had been repainted and had about a one foot section which had peeled away, and the shower head was loose and pulled away from the wall.  The complimentary breakfast was just okay.  Upon our check-in (at 7pm), we saw pancakes leftover from that morning, resting on the ledge in the hallway, they were still there the following morning when we checked out at 10am.  It appears cleanliness and attention to detail are disregarded at…

title: Poorly maintained property!
review: It is a decent size building but it is not well maintained.  Carpet was torn.  The bathroom sink was chipped  The most funny thing was the phone - no buttons at all ( picture enclosed).  Breakfast was not bad but the fruits and yogurt were bad all three days.

title: Poorly maintained property!
review: This is an old building with damaged carpets and cracked bathroom sink.  Basically the owner does not maintain this property.  My in home coffee maker was not working so I requested for another one.  The housekeeping staff brought another.  It was scary when a bunch of small spiders came out of coffee maker when it was turned on.

title: Great Place to stay
review: Love this place, excellent value for money with a breakfast buffet (full american, continental etc) and free drinks every 5pm to 6pm (Cocktails included!)  Hotel is clean modern and very plush, rooms are a good size and VERY QUIET we had a excellent view of disney and could see the fireworks show! stunning.  Room service was excellent and staff were top of the line.   There is a washing machine and drier ($2.00 each for a full wash)  Beds were very comfortable we had 2 queen bed suite. Bathroom was well kept and cleaned to a very high standard. Make sure you leave a tip for room service! We got free wifi thrown in so was happy with this. Living area was ok not large but sufficient with a sofa large tv Desk and chairs.   Also there is no charge for parking which was a surprise! …

title: Pretty Standard for the Area
review: I work in Orlando fairly often and I like the Embassy Suites brand. Until this past week I had stayed at the Embassy Suites at the airport and on Jamaican Court, but this past week was my first stay by the Convention Center location. This is definitely a nicer section of I-drive than Jamaican court and there seem to be better restaurants and activities nearby. The hotel itself seems to be an older building that has had something of a face lift. The rooms seem a touch larger than the other proprieties and are comparably appointed. The gym is pretty good by hotel standards although some cables and a chin up bar (as they have at the Jamaican Court location) would make it very functional. The pools also looked nice and I would consider staying here over the Jamaican court location…

title: Spacious suites, near most Orlando attractions
review: Large clean rooms. You can hear lots of noise from the hallways as it is a family friendly hotel with lots of kids. Free breakfast is decent but usually crowded.  Plan accordingly as seating can be limited.

title: Excellent Value
review: This hotel has the best service. I was at a the Renaissance Hotel in St. Augustine a couple of weeks ago, and spent more money. The facility in the resort was prettier but the Embassy Hotel service from all their service staff is just beyond words. They serve with a smile, and assist with all needs. They made me feel that they value my time and money.

title: Orlando Park Fortnight
review: Stayed in this hotel from the 3rd of October for two weeks, with several family members spread over three rooms.The Hotel is in a great location, and close to amenities.Some of our group found the hotel a bit dated and in need of refurbishment, but my wife and i thought it added to the charm. The rooms were clean and tidy, housemaid service daily.  The complimentary breakfast was very good with a wide choice and food cooked to order. The evening free drinks also welcome but the nibbles left a bit to be desired. The wifi was strange to log into and we all had problems with it. Once you got in it would last for 24hrs and then repeat. Over the course of the fortnight became a dab hand at connecting.  Overall i would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

title: Horrible Stay
review: When you first walk into this hotel, and when you see the price, you assume the rooms will be nice.  I showed up with 3 children under the age of 10; and I couldn't even let them use the bathroom after a long trip.  The bathroom has black things and pee all over them.  The tub was dirty.  There were NO towels.  The refrigerator didn't work.  The mirror looked like someone had spit toothpaste all over it.  And there were dirty underwear and socks in the drawer.  I called and they sent someone to clean it.  The two people who came to clean were fantastic and couldn't believe that I came to the room that way.  It was awful.  Never staying at this hotel again.  Sad thing is that we are in Orlando at least once a month and have Hilton Honor Rewards, but never to this hotel again,…

title: Potential, but....
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I truly apologize for the service failure you experienced.  It sounds as if the suite was inadvertently marked as clean and ready but had not actually been cleaned after the prior guest departed.  That is a big miss on our part and it does not sound as if the team did what they needed to do to make it right for you and your family.  I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you about this visit and get some more details so that I may follow up with the team.  Please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Beware of Parking Charges
review: The hotel is in a wonderful location. The staff is very kind. The hotel is in need of some serious updates. Furniture and rooms are a little dated. The ceiling was yellowing. The suites were a little smaller than I anticipated. The ability to look into the rooms was just a little unsettling, but not a deal breaker.

title: Wow this hotel needs to just go away
review: So i book the hotel 6 weeks ago a king suite then call the week we are to arrive to confirm and everything is set.  We show up to check in and advise room isn't ready no biggie we will call you when its ready. we wait 15 min. then they call your room is ready go up to room and its 2 queen beds ughhhhhh so go to front desk ask why we weren't told when we were waiting that the room we booked was what we were getting. So manager get involved and with in minutes we have our room awesome. We then go to take shower and the shower is literally poking me in the chin I'm only 6'2 come onnnnnnnn and then the kicker no HOT WATER AT ALL.  Now after we take a cold shower and go out we advise front desk of no hot water. they did give us a reduced rate for our stay but just beware when making…

title: Nickel and dime you to death
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during the visit.  The team should have confirmed the bed type upon arrival ensured that we had the details of your visit correct.  We obviously have some retraining to do with the person that handled your arrival.  We recently had a challenge with the hot water taking up to 5 minutes to reach a certain corner of the building and we have had a master plumber working with our Chief Engineer to discover the issue and replace some key components to the system.  In regards to the shower heads, we plan to have them moved as high as possible during our upcoming renovation in 2016.  With that said, I was glad to hear that the team reduced your rate in an attempt to make it right but I would still love to hear more details about your stay so I can double check the hot water and follow up on the check-in experience.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or give me a call at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great place to stay
review: Overall the hotel was average. We found long black hairs in one of the beds which did not belong to either of us. (Bald / redhead). The other bed had a terrible smell in the sheets. My wife booked last minute without realizing that the hotel charged $9 daily for parking which was in their surrounding parking lot. No garage or anything special just the normal parking you would find at any hotel that most hotels do not charge for. This hotel also charges $6 per day for the lowest tier of internet access and it's to slow to do much on. They do have a free cocktail hour which was ok if you like cheap wine, beer and watered down cocktails. They advertise a free cooked to order breakfast but other than the omlets it's cafeteria style with all the food in big pans cooked hours ago. My…

title: Hotel/Vicinity
review: Loved staying here. The complimentary reception and breakfast was good to have! Great place to go with family or for a staycation with friends. The front desk staff definitely helpful any time I had any questions.

title: Great location, friendly staff, room a bit tired
review: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, couples and families alike.  It has the best service I have had to date within a hotel and the staff goes above and beyond with their attentiveness and kindness which makes for a much more pleasant stay.  The locale is perfect in that it's so close to so many restaurants and places of interest.  I cannot express how wonderful Embassy Suites made our stay/vacation.

title: Great location
review: We stay in Embassy Suites quite often and love it because we have teenage children. This location was very clean and well maintained. The employees were helpful and friendly, especially the desk staff and servers during happy hour and breakfast. Lots of restaurants in the area to chose from.

title: Outdated rooms
review: Upon opening the door to our room, we were immediately hit with a stale, musty odor reminiscent of an old cellar that has been unopened for years.  There were several cob webs in the corners and along the walls, as well as bug carcasses.  The bathroom was fairly clean, though dirt/grime had accumulated around the baseboards and along the edges of the threshold.  Linens were clean and satisfactory; bed was comfortable. The interior atrium in the hotel was nice.  Had to wait a few minutes for a desk clerk upon check in, but understandable as it was 11:30p.  Complimentary breakfast was fair - mediocre selection and they shut everything down at 9:30a promptly.  Overall, not the usual experience I have had at previous Embassy Suites hotels...

title: WORST hotel experience I've ever had. FALSE ADVERTISING
review: Went to the bar during happy hour to pick up the supposedly complimentary drinks. The bartender was very rude and when I politely asked for two drinks, he said "One drink per customer", which was not the policy of the hotel. There were people sitting next to me with multiple free drinks who gave him strange looks when he said that.   When I left and went to the receptionist later that night to ask if that had been the policy . She asked what I needed and I explained what happened and she glared at me. Keep in mind I'm completely sober, I didn't even drink the one drink I was given. She told me happy hour was over and I repeated that I knew and was talking about an earlier incident. Then she rolled her eyes, shooed me away and said- you'll have to wait until I take care of…

title: Reasonable place to stay
review: I have stayed at numerous Embassy Suites around the country and this one is okay.  The suites were clean and well kept.  The carpet was snagged in several places in the hallway presenting a trip hazard.  We had a couple of cool showers.  The hot water was slow to come and inconsistent.  The rooms on the 8th floor were quiet.  We did go to a couple of the managers receptions which were pretty good.  The breakfast was very good.  Odd thing was they served you not self serve for the breakfast items.  The front desk staff were hit or miss with questions. When we checked in we could not get a cart and wound up lugging all of our belongings for a week long stay up by hand.  The front desk person was not helpful or apologetic.   So overall okay place to stay.  I would stay here again.

title: Our orlando vacation
review: The first impression was like wow but after our stay we had the following complaints  Rooms take too long to clean. Been in other hotels where the cleaning was faster.   The breakfast was not what I am accustomed with in other embassy suites. Also the internet connection was terrible.   But we were dissappointed as we stayed at other embassy suites that were better.

title: Great hotel
review: Fantastic hotel in an awesome location, right in the middle of everything.good size clean rooms. Friendly staff. Clean pools. Good shuttle service from hotel and public transport from outside the hotel.  Perfectly placed for all disney and universal studios. Walking distance from the I360.

title: ENA conference stay
review: very nice hotel with friendly helpful staff. i want to recognize your concierge Daniel. he was extremely helpful and innovative. i appreciate his attentiveness and ideas! we enjoyed our conference and our trip to the park

title: ENA Conference
review: Very nice hotel and great location.  Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and evening manager's reception.  The staff was very helpful especially Dereck the bell man.  Many great restaurants within walking distance, and outlet shopping using the bus #8 or the Itrolley to #1 stop red line south.  Had a great time.

title: Nice Stay
review: Very nice hotel - clean and guests are well attended to. Nice breakfast as well as evening social hour. Easy walking distance to all on International Drive. They do charge for parking but only $10.00.

title: ENA
review: Loved the pool! Great complimentary breakfast with eggs, bacon, made to order omelette, fruit! I stayed with two other people in the suite and it was very nice. I would suggest some clips to close the curtains with in the front room at night! Thank you.

title: Top notch hotel
review: We were in the area for a conference. The hotel was clean, the staff were wonderful and helpful, breakfast was great with a fantastic selection and the manager's reception in the evenings was a welcome time to relax and mix with colleagues. The hotel is well located with many restaurants within walking distance.

title: Absolutely fantastic hotel!!!!!!!
review: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel and coming back ftom 3 weeks at this hotel we just cannot get our head around some of them. Yes the rooms are a bit dated but we hardly spent any time in there as usually if your on holiday you go out!!! The rooms are being updated next year but they are extremely clean and house keeping came in everyday without fail.  The breakfast is great really filled us up for the day great selection, between 5.30pm and 7.30pm they put on free drinks,   i drink lots of white zinfendal rose and this was flowing and it was free. The nibbles were great.  There were pitta bread. Popcorn, crisps and dips really great.  People have moaned about having to drink beer out of a plastic glass in a review for goodness sake it is free!!! Go get a glass…

title: Tired Old Place - Old School Fees, Etc.
review: From the moment we arrived we were hassled with extra costs such as $9 per day for parking, valet parking, porter service, etc.  There is a newer Embassy within a quarter mile that looks much better.  (and parking is free).  Everything average; nothing great.  Mold on ceilings.

title: Disney vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I was disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay.  The comment regarding mold is very concerning and I ask that you please contact me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or at (407) 581-4301 so we can further investigate the suite in which you stayed and so I can attempt to make things right for you.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Room flooded
review: My family are just coming to the end of a two week stay here. I would struggle to find any major fault with this hotel which was a good value package with Virgin Holidays. We have stayed several times before. Each suite comprises of bedroom with either King bed (or super king as us Brits call it) or two queens. It has ample clothes hanging and drawer space with vanity unit and tv. Adjoining is a spacious lounge area with wet bar fridge and microwave. The bathroom with a good powerful over bath shower is off the lounge. Beds are incredibly comfortable with crisp white linen. An abundance of white fluffy towels are supplied daily. The rooms however do need an upgrade, they are looking tired and dated. I understand this is scheduled for 2016. Wifi also is a bit slow. All the staff…

title: Overall Good for the Price
review: I stayed here for one night to attend a conference at the convention center. Overall a good stay.  Pros: Rooms are huge: when you walk in there is a large sitting area with tv, desk/dining table, bar with mini fridge and coffee maker, then the bathroom through a door on the left and the bedroom (with a comfy bed)behind another closed door with another countertop sink and T.V.  Hotel is in a great location, plenty of bars/restaurants/things to do within walking distance  Good Staff: Check in was quick, I called down for a razor and it came in 5 minutes, the men that work out front doing valet are super helpful and friendly.  Large Atrium in center of Hotel: Plenty of places to sit with family, friends or co workers, Also where they have a COMPLIMENTARY happy hour daily and…

title: Mold
review: The room has a light mold smell, but better than other hotels in Florida. The room could also use some upgrades. The staff was very helpful and very kind. They provided lots of good amenities, the computer room was very much needed and appreciated.

title: Best Embassy Suites in Orlando
review: I must honestly admit this Embassy Suites in Orlando is the best one. Working for the Government, over the past 3 months, I've stayed at all Embassy in Orlando & Altma Springs. I want you to know that I have made it clear that I will NEVER and no one from my Office will stay at your embassy suites in Altma Springs. It is the worse and Customer service sucks. This is was the best experience I've encountered with your brand. The Internet and smell of the room were my only concerns.

title: Good hotel in a great location.
review: I stayed here with my wife for a grand total of 2 days/ 2 nights. In a nutshell this is a vintage hotel with some modern day twists. As usual, I will break it down as follows;  The Pros- * Great location with much to experience within walking distance. * Made to order Free Breakfast (One of the best you will find in the hotels in this area). * Free drinks offered in early evening at the bar. * Hotel convenience store is comfortable and very helpful. * Comfortable rooms that felt very welcoming. * Theme park tickets stand in the hotel at reasonable rates. * Hotel layout felt more organized considering the elevators are not near the main entrance of the hotel.  The Cons-  *The hotel felt a little worn in a few areas even with the renovation upgrades. *Rooms felt vintage as front…

title: Great Mini Vacation
review: We have stayed here before and always enjoy the bounty of foods that they have out for breakfast, especially the made to order omelets.  The hotel and the rooms are lovely.  The only thing we noticed is that in our bathroom - Room 828, the shower curtain rod was not attached well and it appears some of the bathroom could use a little updating; maybe some fresh paint around the door.

title: Embassy Suites, Orlando FL
review: Great hotel and staff.  Clean rooms, breakfast was great and afternoon complimentary drinks were good.  Parking Lot to sides and rear are dark and is a slight safety concern.  All the staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the area.  The concierge staff was outstanding!!  They helped me with dinner discounts tickets, nightly entertainment ideas and theme park tickets.

title: Definitely did not live up to Embassy Suites standards
review: Let me first say my wife and I are big fans of Embassy Suites and have stayed at various locations.  I must also say that the staff at this location were very polite and courteous.  However, this particular Embassy Suites property was a big disappointment.  I'll start with the bathroom in our room.  The shower had a constant drip so there was mold growing on the tile.  There were yellow stains on the walls and black scuff marks on the floor.  There was a strange, thick, clear gel like substance on the front of the sink cabinet.  The door jamb was rusty.  There was an open pipe protruding from the ceiling of the shower.  There was something green (lettuce?) dried on the floor.  The edge of the vanity had been sloppily repaired with what appeared to be Mighty Putty.  In the living…

title: Great Stay
review: The stay was great, the breakfast and the happy hour was great, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room were comfortable and clean.  Location was great, it was located near great restaurant and entertainment which helped for a great one night stay.

title: Great location, breakfast & complimentary drinks & snacks very nice,
review: Rooms a little dated but very clean, breakfast was very good express breakfast, and omelette cooked to order, plenty of drinks to choose from, evening complimentary snacks and drinks was excellent, both pools were nice and clean and never over packed, good shuttle service, would definitely stay there again - 1 tip don't rely on the washing machines had a few problems but definitely did not interfere with our stay

title: needs remodeling bad
review: this hotel is in desperate need of remodeling, definitely not worth the price. The worse embassy suites I have ever stayed at. I have stayed at this hotel several times, deteriorating fast. My family has a very large reunion planned for the Orlando area was considering this hotel but not anymore. Hopefully someone that has the power to change this hotel will read this review. It is a shame because it is such a great location.

title: Old Hotel, but Excellent Service
review: This hotel is due for a renovation, however the staff more than make up for it. All in all, the staff was very friendly, but Derek the Bellman was outstanding with his great attitude. The hotel was clean, though it needs some attention. They offer free breakfast, which includes omelets, pancakes, as well as continental options. Self parking was free, and they had a little gift store and an awesome restaurant which I'll rate in another review. Also they have a happy hour which includes free draft beer and well drinks. This hotel tries very hard to please.

title: Great hotel on International Drive
review: This hotel is very suitable for all amenities on International Drive.Hotel provides full  buffet breakfast for all tastes and happy hour drinks between 5:30-7:30 including wine and beers. Courtesy bus to Universal and Disney great for non drivers. Staff very friendly and helpful.Only complaint was rooms now a bit tired but still very clean.

title: Unbeatable value
review: Here for convention. Super fun location. A LOT of things within walking distance. Their rooms are very large and very comfortable. They are a bit worn but clean. The staff was friendly and on point. The hotel was very well run. The complimentary cooked to order breakfast was fast and good. Combine all this with the complimentary happy hour, and you have an unbeatable value. Well done guys! Keep up the good work!

title: Not Sure
review: In all reasonable value for money with buffet breakfast and happy hour drinks and snacks included. Staff were lovely and helpful, but the rooms are very basic and badly decorated.  The furniture is old, the décor depressing, the wardrobes are free standing and the bathrooms are too small to swing a cat.  Towels are small and amenities sparse.   In truth I was depressed to the point where we checked out a day early in search of more cheerful and brighter surroundings.  It’s hard to fault the concept but I would say that if you were going on vacation following a period of unhappiness – don’t stay here.

title: Family Friendly Hotel
review: The hotel is dated, but its location is brilliant – close to the theme parks and within walking distance of restaurants. Most staff are very friendly and courteous. Our family had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to families. The family room was spacious and clean but very dated, the breakfast in the morning has a good variety, setting you up for the day. This is a personal thank you to Ram King who, who went out of his way to make our stay fantastic, Dean who programmed our sat nav so we never got lost and Monique who made our kids very happy by providing off menu food.

title: Friendly staff Great location!
review: Read many reviews about this hotel before decided to stay. I will admit it definitely needs updating.Biggest issue is there are curtains by the door that don't close all the way so persons walking by can see into the room! Thankfully we didn't have much traffic by our room. However, the location is absolutely wonderful!! Olive Gardens is adjacent to the property, Hooters, Fridays,Dennys and Walgreens just to name a few are right across the street. I-ride trolley stop in front of the property. My kids loved the indoor pool and free happy hour with snacks and drinks even for them. The breakfast was good however,I would prefer individual yogurt containers rather than scooping a bowl of yogurt into cups. Also more variety of cereal and fruit or at least mixing it up some days.…

title: Great location to walk to restaurants and clubs on International Drive.
review: We have stayed at Embassy Suites in the past. Always a good experience and the rooms are large, comfy, and clean. The free happy hour for guest and the nice breakfast buffet are a plus. The only down side to that is this particular location is very busy because of the area. Happy hour starts at 5:30 and the line is very long. We gave up waiting and just went to dinner and had drinks there. Same with check-in. The clerk was great but there was just one guy and a line. These couple things are just a minor inconvenience at most. Honestly the biggest issue I have with this place are the drapes in your room! Don't laugh - they really are an issue. They don't wrap around at the end for privacy at the door. You have to put something against the curtain(s) to hold them shut or people…

title: Friendly staff and clean hotel
review: Always happy to stay at a Embassy with complimentary happy hour and cook to order breakfast. The room was comfortable and had everything we needed. The location was great very close to Dave and Busters.

title: Not your normal Embassy Suites
review: This hotel is old, room was musty smelling, took 20 minutes to get hot water in the shower. Furniture was old also. Very disappointed, Location is nice right in the middle of IDrive walking distance to everything. They need to update this hotel!

title: Great trip
review: The best trip was made with my family, there were 11 of us. We had three suites in Orlando. We stayed for 5 days and had a great time. The staff were friendly and more than willing to help anytime they say us walking down the hall. We take a family vacation every year, this is the first time we have stayed at embassy suites we will be back and will book our next trip were ever it may be with Embassy suites.

title: At the heart of the drive
review: Very convenient located, nice and clean, excellent customer service.  Excellent breakfast buffet. Embassy Suites provides you with an excellent facility at a fair price.  The personnel pay attention to details and was very friendly.  The location is at the heart of Orlando. International Drive.  You are close to all the attractions. I recommend this hotel for all family.  Its enclosed design provides you with a safe environment for your and your kids at all times.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando
review: Excellent accommodations! very clean and family oriented.  a variety of restaurants and Walgreen's within walking distances.  The Trolley and bus stops close to the hotel.  Rental car services provided inside the hotel with the cars on the grounds. The Staff very friendly and helpful.  I really like the way they greeted you every time you came through the lobby.

title: terrible
review: What can i say this hotel is the worst. first off i checked in and found a empty soda bottle in the couch when i pulled it out so my youngest daughter had somewhere to sleep. brought it to manager attention who refunded the first night of my stay. the second night of my stay was suppose to be a comp stay for the mishap. for a total of  a two night stay *simple right* so July goes by, august goes by, on September 1 2015 i see a charge on my debit card for $115.00 from Embassy Suites i called hotel where i spoke with John * Manager on Duty 9-1-2015 at 10 AM. he stated that the second night showed no record of comp but a $60.00 rate. so after a debate for 30 min i asked so if u show a rate of $60.00 how did my card end up with a charge of 120.00 he stated i was a guest in the hotel…

title: Fantastic hotel for families with great staff and leadership.
review: This is a personal thank you to the hotel Manager Bill, who went out of his way to make our stay fantastic. This is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel, the last being 2 years ago and I would recommend this hotel to families in a instant. Rooms are spacious and clean, the free breakfast in the morning is fantastic and sets you up for the day and the location on international drive could not be better.  This is the first time I have ever had the desire to write on Trip advisor, but the service from the hotel was so exceptional I needed to let you all know. I will be returning to Florida in the near future and will be saying at this hotel again, you may read comments on other reviews stating the rooms are dated, well they are a little but very clean and comfortable and we…

title: Needs Some Attention To Details
review: Generally nice suite room and excellent breakfast that you expect from the brand. On the other hand, there were nasty carpet stains, a cracked bowl on the toilet, insufficiently hot water in the shower, no receipt delivered to room on morning of checkout, lousy TV selection, escalating room temperature during the night, and a charge to self-park in a surface parking lot.

title: Great hotel in Orlando!
review: We had a great family vacation in Orlando. We stayed 6 nights at the Embassy Suites on International Drive - great hotel, great location, great service. Breakfast daily was a good perk, we did not have to worry about where to grab coffee and decent breakfast.  There is also managers reception at night 530-730pm - OPEN BAR with lots of snacks, I was only able to go one night as we were always out until after dinner.   Driving to and from the hotel is very convenient - shopping and Universal are 15-20 mins away

title: Good location, friendly staff
review: This hotel is located on the quieter end of I-drive very close to Universal and Sea World. It has an indoor and outdoor pool and whirlpool. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and all spoke excellent English (not always the case at some Hilton properties).

title: Embassy Suites
review: Love this hotel, very friendly staff, ideal location on International drive, complimentary breakfast and evening drinks and snack reception.  Have stayed here every time we have visited Orlando and would stay here again.

title: Good price, nice staff
review: Fairly clean, needs remodel. Ac unit loud but room decent size. Front desk nice, pool was clean. For price good deal. Needs better food choices. In a very busy part of town, not easy to walk with little kids.

title: Superb service
review: The physical facility shows a little age but was a minor concern.  All personnel were very friendly and accommodating. The bellman/valet and housekeeping employees went above and beyond. I would gladly return to this property.

title: Carmen from the Bronx 8/2015
review: Hotel is at an excellent location.  Walking distance to restaurants, bars and clubs. The breakfast and the two hour happy hour included was definitely a plus! I would definitely stay here again next time i'm in Orlando!

title: The hotel is in need of updating, but friendly staff makes up for this short coming
review: There is no doubt the hotel is in need of a face lift.  If you are placed on the International Dr. side of the hotel, with young children, sleep will be a problem for the lighter sleeper.  We were placed in one of those rooms and were fortunate enough to have our room moved to a quieter location.  The staff was so understanding, moved our belongings while at Disney, and made the remainder of the stay far more comfortable.  The bus to Disney runs at specific times.  One time, the bus was too crowded and our party of 4 and another couple were taken to the park by an SUV run by the same company as the bus.  The driver said if we each paid him $10.00 he would take us to the park we wanted to go to and not the one the bus dropped everyone off.  We declined and told the front desk. …

title: Friendly and Helpful Staff
review: Everyone who I came across working here were very friendly and accommodating. From the time of check-in(in which the front desk allowed an early check-in for me due to short time on a work trip) to when I ordered a pickup sandwich for lunch and the bartender assisting me was very nice. Not to mention the buffalo wrap was very good! As well as the valet gentleman, I wish I had gotten names but thank you for keeping smiles on your faces!

title: Great Stay
review: My wife and I had great stay at Embassy Suites. The staff there was excellent. We had a couple of problems that were handled right away. They worked to make sure that anything we needed was taken care of. Good breakfast every morning. Great suite.

title: Billing problems unresolved
review: Good location, you have to pay extra for parking.  Rooms average.  Problems with refrigerator and microwave, problems with WiFi.  Free breakfast but everything tasted stale.  I paid top price for a very average experience.  Front desk ignored us.  Acted like we were not there.

title: Elevator
review: even though I am a Hilton Honors member, I was placed outside of the elevator in the hotel filled with kids.  The elevator was very slow and it was noisy.   There were no stair options.   Additionally, being on the second floor, I was directly above the elevator mechanical room and it was very noisy day and night.  The bar closed at 10 pm and the breakfast options were not that good.

title: Great Anniversary Trip!
review: We love Embassy Suites.  With the free - full breakfast and the manager's reception it makes it a value even with the slightly higher price.  Located right across the street from Howl at the Moon- a fun sing-a-long piano bar.  This hotel offers everything.  The beds are ultra comfy and the rooms are clean.  We have stayed here from our last 4 anniversaries.  We loved the surprise bottle of wine from the hotel for our special event.

title: Worst Embassy suites EVER
review: If you are interested in a throw back to 1970 this is the pace for you.  I was not impressed from the moment I walked int he front door.  There was no one at the front desk - Keep in mind this was 3pm, maybe they were busy having lunch or watching movies.  Finally i was checked in.  Being a Hilton Diamond member I really had higher expectations at $200 a night.  So walking to the room it looks like it was built initially as an outside Motel in which they covered with a roof to make it inside as the interior looked like outside bricks - Very strange.  Entering the room - OH BOY, so not very nice, very OLD and DATED 1970ish and then I walked in the bedroom.....WOW a sink oddly placed right next to the bed.  I generally don't wake up in the middle of the night to wash my hands but…

title: Dirty smelly rooms pay extra and stay somewhere else
review: Our room was outdated and smelled musty and old like a retirement home. Our TV did not work and the extra blankets we received were mediocre to say the least. The kicker was when we pulled out the pull out bed from the couch we found crumpled sheets and an old recipe from a previous persons visit. I didn't even look at the date of the recipe I was so disgusted. I will not be staying here again. Also, the hotel should invest in locked on the bathroom doors, especially for families with young children who like to bardge in =(

title: Sadly, I won't be a return guest.
review: I gifted myself and 2 adult sons with an impromptu week away for the 3 of us. The hotel was highly rated by Mouse Savers. Embassy Suites is centrally located, very reasonably priced and seemed to be a great find. The hotel atrium lobby is beautifully done and having the guest rooms open to the atrium is a very nice set up. I enjoyed sitting by the fountain's waterfall while enjoying morning coffee.   Although the staff has been quick to act and unfailingly pleasant when I requested service, my point in writing this review is that I HAD TO REQUEST SERVICE and felt as if I were complaining. On vacation of all things.   The Hilton Honors Level room air conditioning unit had a broken valve and screeched when the fan came on, my room went unmade because 'do not disturb' was on the…

title: Do not book this hotel!
review: We arrived at this hotel last week. The room smelled stale and looked very dated. I tried to use the phone in the bedroom it was very dirty, didn't work and when I lifted it under the phone, clock and bedside cabinet was thick with dirt. I wiped it and took it to reception (see photo). The reception staff were understanding and helpful they offered an alternative room which I went to look at it was the same with bugs crawling on the phone. I agreed for my room to be re-cleaned. On returning from dinner I went back to the room, nothing had been moved or cleaned I wiped the area and surfaces and returned to reception. I spoke to the manager who was very helpful and understanding and was moved to the Hilton Orlando thankfully. I couldn't have allowed my family to stay at this hotel…

title: Old and needs remodel
review: Spent 5 nights during a conference. Internet (even premium) was extremely weak. Furniture and carpet stained. Valet parking is not worth it. No water for a few hours. Housekeeping missed one day. Some staff were responsive - others either were not trained or were not following their training.

title: Amazing time!
review: Spend 3 days in Orlando, first night the hotel was sold out and walked us to the Hampton down the road, although this was not ideal the front desk agent that took care of us and sent us there was even kind enough to call and check on us there once we checked in. Once arriving to Embassy the next morning way before check in the front desk offered to store our luggage, cover our parking for the remaining two days and assist us with the Disney shuttle! The remainder of the stay was amazing, the bellman were always giving us dinner suggestions and the front desk consistently was polite. Housekeeping was great, room was cleaned in the quick time between waking up and eating breakfast!  loved this stay, planning to go again in October!

title: Do not stay here ever!!!
review: So horrible don't know where to start.  Walked hotel appears worn and tired. Valet had a bad attitude.  Room smelled like a dirty locker room. WHY? The AC was broken. Maint tried to fix it at 1am worked a bit then it stopped working.  Kids walked onto the balcony..swarmed by Wasps, there was a next above the sliding door.  Chair was stained.  Found an old sock at the side of the bed.  Bathroom furniture chipped and leaning not sure if it was rented or something.  Bed linen was stained and had someones hair on the sheets.  AM breakfast was horrible.  Everyone we talked to complained about everything. Save your money So many other options.

title: many thanks
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  The list of failures you described is completely unacceptable and I can assure you it is not the typical experience of our guests.  While the hotel is due for a refresh in 2016, we pride ourselves on providing great service and a clean hotel.  It appears we dropped the ball during your visit and I would love to hear more about your stay.  If you have a moment, please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  I would like a chance to make it right and also use your experience as a training opportunity.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: International Drive Embassy Suites
review: This hotel is in a GREAT location, offers superior amenities, has plenty of very good restaurants and entertainment within walking distance, and is an ideal place to stay whether on a business trip in the area or on vacation.

title: Great stay!!! Will be back!
review: Stayed here for two weeks with my family and from the moment we arrived it was great, staff at reception were very polite and prompt with getting us to our room. Our room was on the 2nd floor (223) it was very spacious and very clean!! Don't believe the comments from business travellers, yes this hotel does have a convention centre but the rooms, staff and food are great.
