I didn't come across one single bug in the entire hotel, yes the rooms are dated and abit tired looking but who books a hotel for decor really?!  The pools where great my daughter had a swim every night, they are clean and fresh towels are available at both pools. The managers complimentary happy hour is ok but missable its selected drinks with crisps & popcorn. The breakfast was yummy the pancakes were awesome…

title: Very poorly maintained
review: Staff were inconsiderate on many levels and bathroom, room and window frames were all rusty but painted over. Looked gross. Had to use brut force to turn on and off the bath or shower. NEVER STAY HERE!

title: Poor Service
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I was disappointed to read that your stay did not go well.  I would love the opportunity to speak with you about the suite you stayed in and the challenges you faced with the team's level of service.  Please reach out to me via email to William.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: The way Guest are supposed to be treated
review: The room smelled musty. Door lock wouldn't work and had to wait until 2:30 am for it to be fixed (3 hours), was never offered another room, just required to sit there and wait. Son couldn't even lay down on sofa bed because there weren't any sheets or blankets and the front desk said due to limited staff it was the maintenance guy that had to get them for us and we would have to wait until he was finished fixing the door. There were only 2 people working at night for the entire hotel. Restaurant food was not good and the employee was not personable and had to ask each time for drink refills. Group of people roaming the parking lot after midnight walking around all of the cars. Overall not happy and will not recommend this location. The king size bed was very uncomfortable and…

title: Could have been better
review: Hot water not working -- no answer to report it at the front desk  Breakfast was good -- omelettes freshly made, pancakes met my son's approval  Felt that it was overpriced... compared to other hotels it should be about 50 bucks less...

title: Friendly staff
review: I stayed 4 nights and although the hotel has some age (and very low shower heads), the staff was excellent. The associates were all very friendly and ready to assist as needed. I love Embassy Suites breakfast, 2 room suites, and evening reception. I would have liked to serve myself for the hot items.

title: Business Trip with not so good hotel
review: A friends room was moldy smelling, another friends room had visible poor repairs to door facings.  Grout around tub was dirty looking.  The insulation in the mini fridge in my room had been cracked and part of it was missing.  Breakfast food choices were minimal.  The yogurt was emptied from a large container into a bowl, not individual containers as other locations have.  Scrambled eggs, pancakes and french toast was already made and not really warm. Looked worn and outdated throughout.  Wifi was not working about half the time. Elevators on one side were not working properly and a little jerky when coming to a stop.  I was attending a conference at the Convention Center and this hotel was convenient for that; only good think about it.

title: Really?
review: I'll make it simple.  Moldy smelly bathroom. The room smelled like mold, it stank and the air conditioning never worked.  For a brand that claims to take pride in their service, this time they fell short.

title: Spacious rooms
review: The suites we spacious and clean.  I stayed in a standard suite, and didn't care for the sofas in those rooms. They were quite awkward, very high arm rests that interferes with viewing the television.  This hotel is a tourist favorite, so if you are on business travel keep that in mind. It's crowded and with all the tours to Disney the parking lots will have buses lined up and breakfast is pretty much out of the question due to the crowds.  The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

title: Really fun Embassy!!
review: This Embassy Suite is right on International Dr. It's in the mix of everything. You have so many places to choose from to eat. Bars across the street. All in walking distance. The rooms are clean and the lobby is very pretty. They have reception in the lobby and serve complimentary cocktails for 2 hrs. It's amazing!! Embassy has an amazing complimentary breakfast!! Omelets made to order and the staff was great!! Indoor and outdoor pool.  The kids had a blast at Dave and Busters next door. Disney, Universal and Seaworld are all right there. Very convenient. The manager was a doll Bill Freidrich he made sure everything was great. Really a nice guy to everyone. Staff is everything!

title: Expensive but very good
review: Stayed here for three nights and it was good - everything worked as advertised. From the free Orlando airport pickup/drop off to the happy hour every evening, this hotel has its act together. The rooms and service were immaculate. I was able to set the temperature and actually have the a/c work promptly. In the Orlando summer heat/humidity this was awesome. The staff were professional and unfailingly polite. Breakfast every morning was included. This was not just a continental breakfast, it was a full feature breakfast: multiple hot dishes buffet style and egg dishes made to order.

Checked in late at night and requested a non-smoking room because the smell was absolutely terrible. The young girl at the front desk was very sweet and told me she could get me into a non-smoking if the smell was too bad. So when going back to the FD to get the other room, an older guy told us there are no more rooms and that it was an out of order room. He also continued to say that there are specific rooms on block and since I'm with the Hilton Family Travel there was nothing he could do for me. After spending the night in the smoking room my spouse starting throwing up the next morning from the headache... Breakfast was good. Called 3 times for a toothbrush. If you are looking for somewhere that would make you feel like you are welcomed and that you matter... DO NOT GO HERE!!

title: Dated rooms, horrible internet
review: I like Embassy suites because the rooms are big. This was no exception.  But as a business traveler, I was shocked when I found out that Internet was not included in thia Hotel, so I paid the 10 bucks for the "Premium" internet service, ended up being so crappy that I had to complain to have it removed from the bill.  Rooms where ok, but the bathrooms are dated. Other than that, the location is very good. I paid 265$ per night, which was pricey.  On good conditions, 4 stars, but with dated bathrooms and lame internet, 3 stars.

title: Amazing staff
review: We stayed here by default as we had to be moved from the Avaniti Resort next door due to our building going on fire.  The staff at this hotel went well above and beyond to help myself and family.  Chelesa at reception and Jon the duty manager both dealt with us not only professionally but with empathy given all our possessions were in a burning building the night we arrived.  The hotel itself is nice rooms a good size but as previously reported disappointing that there is no in room safe.  Small pool and good location.  Would book this hotel if any area

title: It needs a major upgrade!
review: This is being upgraded next year and it's long overdue. Tired rooms need a good sort out. We had a 'premium suite' and it promised unlimited snacks and drinks but they were from a vending machine which was rarely full. Had to input a code every drink, snack. Tedious! Premium suites didn't seem much bigger than any other rooms.  No valuables safe in rooms! Had to trek down to reception every time we wanted to put something in or out of storage.  Breakfast included but long lines and the tables were not cleared or cleaned often. As a result trash piled up.  Pool was small. Staff were friendly, though!

title: Average experience
review: I would have rated this higher but the elevators are very slow, the refreshment center was always empty, and you couldn't get the drink you wanted during the evening reception. I've stayed at the embassy suites in other places and these problems were never an issue. I actually called several times down to the front desk and they said they would fill the refreshment center but 4 hours later and it was still empty. Another words don't spend the $15 a day when you might not be able to even get a water!!!

title: Embassy Hotel
review: This hotel could use major upgrades. My room was very basic being that I paid $130 a night with no view whatsoever. The complimentary drinks coming from the rude bartender with blonde hair and glasses were not appreciated. But being that I paid I took full advantage. It would also help if staff members spoke english to help answer any of my questions instead of ignoring me and stating they did not work there.

title: Family Vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate your experience.  If you have a moment, I would love to hear more about your interactions with the team so that I may provide some feedback and coaching.  Please email me at William.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Best ever place to stay!
review: Our experience at the Embassy was an awesome. The hotel was very nice, clean and accommodating to our needs. The service was quality. The beds slept very comfortably. We loved the location. Restaurants and activities were in walking distance.

title: Friendly staff, great location.
review: We arrived early off a red eye flight from the west coast.  We thought that maybe the hotel could store our luggage and let us change before our day at Universal.  To our surprise, our room was ready (at 7am), and they let us check in and enjoy the breakfast.  This was a nice bonus we weren't expecting.  We stayed in a Premium suite for 3 nights, which allowed us unlimited access to the vending machine.  This was stocked with snacks (chips, chocolate bars, candy, granola bars etc, a mix of healthy and not!) and cold drinks.  This came in very handy for our trips to the parks. Our room was typical of Embassy Suites, we like the layout, with the extra room, and sofa bed.  This room also had an extra sink and vanity in the bedroom, great for the girls to 'get ready' while the…

title: Enjoyed the stay
review: We were in town for a few days and decided to stay here one night. From a previous stay, we had enjoyed this hotel.  Check in was great, staff very friendly, and valet was very friendly also even though we parked our own car, they greeted us every time we would walk by their podium! Hotel was very clean including the pool!  Breakfast and evening managers reception good too. Though everything was great, hotel did show some areas of aging, but did not interfere with the great stay! One note was bathroom did have a slight flaw in the cleaning, but otherwise the room was nice and clean.  Hotel is conveniently located to restaurants and shopping. Would stay here again!

title: Don't stay at this one. Find another Embassy Suite
review: Room sucked. Door not working, dripping faucets, lights coming on and off, ants in bathroom, room out of date, wait staff rude. Bellhops on the hustle. Hid all of the bell carts so they could carry luggage to rooms even though they had to leave their post of assisting guest with cabs and valet parking. Even observed bellhop having friends with SUVs parked and posing as limo services for the il-informed. Garbage left out in the hallways. Made serval calls but hotel made no corrections. Obvious management missing in action. This is a dump in need of major renovations. Please go somewhere else.

title: Hotel Needs Improvement
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your experience.  We clearly dropped the ball during your visit and I apologize for that.  There is no excuse for the lack of service you described and the condition of the suite with so many of the items being simple fixes that should have been caught prior to your arrival.  I would love to speak with you about your stay and hear which suite you stayed in so that I may personally ensure these items have been addressed. When you have the time, please email me at William.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301 if you just have a few moments.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: This hotel has a number of issues it needs to improve on, from front desk to quality of room, to improved food and beverages.  explained to stqaff some of our complaints, most not resolved during stay.  A very good location on I Drive in Orlando, near convention center but there are a number of other choices in this area that are better value.

title: it needs renovated
review: Trip Advisor is recommending this hotel, it looked good until I went to the "customer" photographs, and saw the photos of the bathroom and other areas.  I can only imagine walking into a room and seeing that.  As a courtesy I called the hotel today and spoke with an "on duty manager", she seemed concerned until I told her that I had not yet made a reservation.  I guess cancelling a reservation rings more bells than losing one.

title: Great Stay
review: I would recommend this hotel to all friends and family. It offers great services such as shuttle transportation to all Disney Park and surrounding attractions.  Located in the heart of all favorite brand restaurants like Bahama Breeze, Capital Grill, TGI Fridays, Subway and a local Walgreens to name a few.  I will definitely stay again.

title: The location rocks, but the rooms need updating
review: You can NOT beat the location of this hotel on I-Drive.  Near the Convention Center, a trolley stop out front, shutttles to all the parks and you can walk to many great restaurants!  The location is what shines here and is why we continue to choose this location when in the area (this was our fifth stay here!!!).   As an older property, you get a larger room with the old style sink in the bedroom (a welcome addition!).  We had a King bed, and the kids slept on the pullout couch.  AC worked well, wifi was strong and fast, tv was good, etc.   Sadly, the rooms are starting to show wear and tear.  I think it's time for a refresh.  Some new furniture, new carpet, and some paint would be nice.  We had some issues with housekeeping, they even forgot to empty the trash bin on our first…

title: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL EMBASSY SUITES
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  Overall, it seems like it was a good visit and I thank you for the kind comments.  We are indeed coming due for a refresh of the hotel, to include the carpet, paint, furniture and much more.  It is currently in the design phase and will occur next year.  We are all looking forward to the update.  Thank you for staying with us, we hope to welcome you back when your travels bring you back to Orlando.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Hotel with easy access to Disney and Universal
review: This time was just a short overnight stay for a convention, but they allowed my husband to check in quite early since I'm an Hhonors member and had an infant. As usual, the room was clean and the staff was very friendly. Unfortunately I wasn't able to take advantage of their full breakfast due to my scheduling (I had to be at the convention hall by 6am) but I was able to have access to cereal, OJ and coffee. My husband and kids DID get the made to order breakfast which they said was fantastic (as usual). The consistent great service, food and nice room are the reasons why we prefer to stay at Embassy Suites hotels. I liked this one so much I plan on returning in September for a full weekend.

title: Very bad experience
review: Bellman at the entrance with bad attitude  You can sell your room for 6 adult, no way!!!  Room specially bathroom in bad conditions  Not clean  This is the last time we use as a company this hotel, we have a very bad experience.

title: a disappointing stay to a previously enjoyable one.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. While we are due for a refresh of the guest suites, there is no excuse for you to experience any rude interactions with the team or to see any cleanliness issues.  I apologize for the lack of service you experienced and I would love to hear more about your stay.  Please reach out to me directly at William.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Orlando
review: This is our third stay at this particular Embassy Suites hotel and we have also stayed in another in California so we were excited to return. We also joined Hilton HHonors which enabled us to receive complimentary wifi and choose our room prior to our arrival which was very much appreciated. However, despite this, our stay this time around was less than satisfactory. Firstly, the bathroom door didn't lock and one of the lamps in the room wouldn't work and secondly, the house keeping service was a major disappointment. We haven't had trouble with this before but this time, it seems our room was ignored on several occasions meaning the bins were overflowing and there was no clean towels. Our first complaint to the front desk was dealt with by a very kind english woman who gave our…

title: Wonderful anniversary weekend.
review: Thank you for writing a review of your experience and thank you for being a loyal Hilton Hhonors member.  I truly apologize for the challenges you faced upon arrival with the door and lamp, everything should have been in working order upon arrival.  I also would like to apologize for the challenges with Housekeeping and for the misinformation you received regarding daily service.  The suitekeepers do service all of the suites on a daily basis unless a guest requests that we not enter the suite during their stay.  I am in shock that you were told otherwise.  I would love to hear more about your stay and have the opportunity to speak with you.  Please email me at William.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Good location
review: This is a fantastic hotel.  The staff were gracious and accommodating.  It was clean!!!  They have an amazing breakfast and cocktails at night! I do wish they offered more than just light appetizers during the cocktail hours.  It is close to some nice restaurants.

title: Convenient and Affordable for DisneyWorld
review: We just returned from a trip to DisneyWorld and enjoyed our stay at this hotel in room 235.  Our room was on the 2nd floor and an end unit.  We had two double beds which made it diificult for two adults to sleep on but my wife slept with my 4 year old daughter in the other bed.  Consider the king size room if you want some extra sleeping space.  The separate living room is nice and roomy.  It has a nice size fridge, microwave, sink, and dining table.  It also has a door to close so your little one can rest in the bedroom.  The bedroom has a vanity and sink and there is one in the bathroom which was nice extra space to get ready.  The bus has 2 morning departures (8:05a & 10:20a) and 3 evening returns (last one at 10 p.m.) to/from Epcot and is included with your reservation.  It…

title: OVER ALL VIEW
review: The hotel Brand is great.  Some locations are better than others.  This location suites are not as spacious as the other locations.  The rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly however the room service from house keeping was very slow during my stay.  The express breakfast is great but the buffet breakfast was cold which is not common but over all I will continue to stay at the Embassy Suites any time I can when Im out of town.

title: Could It Be Any Better?
review: Loved this hotel experience which is a lot since I spend at least 8 nights a month in a hotel somewhere in the country. The staff was pleasant and I never passed an employee who didn't not or wish me a Good Morning or Evening.  Because I was with a group, I had several unusual asks and was always met with a smile and quick service.  The room was great and everything wonderful down to the call after checkout from the desk who when my room was cleaned found a pair of sunglasses and asked if they should mail them.  WOW!    Again, I loved the hotel and will always try and stay at an Embassy Suites!

title: Old and outdated exterior
review: Not worth $150+ a night. Pool was small. Very out dated. Thin walls, noisy. Not up to par with other Embassy Suites hotels. Parking area small. Very small selection for drinks for evening reception compared to Ft Lauderdale Embassy Suites I stayed at in February. Staff was good but outside of hotel especially needs updating as well as pool area.

title: Privacy and Cleanliness Issues
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  If you have the time, I would love to hear more detail about your experience and your concerns with the outdoor areas.  While we are planning a full renovation for next year that may address the "outdated" comments, guest insights such as yours could help with the enhancements and I want to ensure we do not miss anything.  Please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Family friendly and great staff
review: from start to finish the experience we received was amazing, from reception to housekeeping the level of service surpassed our hopes. very clean and well run. breakfast included(food was well cooked and delicious) was a big plus and the managers evening reception was greatly appreciated each day. well placed for all major attractions and shuttle service and i ride was a bonus too. rooms are spacious and well appointed and the staff just amazingly friendly and made us all feel at home. pool is delightful with plenty of towels available. rooms are well sound proofed and bed extremely comfortable.

title: International Drive Oasis
review: I spent 6 nights here with my family while attending a conference at the Orange County Convention Center.  The hotel is perfectly located on international drive.  Close enough to walk to most every attraction between the conference center and the Orlando Eye (ferris wheel on steroids).  The hotel staff was very friendly.  The swimming pool had a good mix of sun and shade.  The evening reception with free drinks and snacks (typical at most any Embassy Suites), was very enjoyable.    The suite style rooms are great when traveling with a family.  The rooms were nice, but not flawless.  I could find issues at most any hotel. I love the open center atrium that Embassy Suite hotels have.  Breakfast was wonderful....repeat...wonderful.  And it's free...a.k.a. included with the cost of…

title: An amazing friendly Hotel
review: We checked in and after a long delay were grateful to find obliging staff on duty as it was late at night. He was fantastic. Hotel very clean. Breakfast was superb and a truly all you can eat with plenty of seating. Rooms were fairly large abd ab additional wash area seperate bathroom.The only thing I would say is the curtains to the corridors need more security as people walking pass could see inside. Restaurant was excellent good choice if food and drinks with friendly and helpful staff. Gorgeous cocktails and buffet all free which was a bonus. Location with tasty restaurants and bars close by. I - ride is stops right outside for the premium outlets shopping. We have stayed on I drive 7 times before but this hotel outshone all of them by far. Wish I'd if known it before.…

title: Summer trip
review: We visited Orlando for our summer trip and decided to stay at the Embassy Suites on International Dr. The location was excellent. The service at the hotel was exemplary. The managers reception and breakfast in the morning was great. We decided to stay an extra day and was told we had to move to another room. The manager Ram King organized everything and made the transition smooth. The entire staff from the bartenders to the waitstaff always had a smile on their face. I would definitely return.

title: Family Vacation! Great stay at this hotel...
review: I have never stayed at Embassy Suites before and when reading some negative travelers reviews it made me almost change my mind and book another hotel. I am so glad I followed my gut and kept my reservation at Embassy Suites. I can't say enough good things about our stay, the staff was excellent, the rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet every morning was outstanding. The hotel was in walking distance to many restaurants, areas of interest and attractions. The hotel also offers free park shuttle, one of the drivers kept us informed of pick- ups and drop-offs and we sang along with him the whole way. All in all a great time! We Can't wait to stay at Embassy Suites again!

title: The Place to stay
review: I like this Embassy Suites hotel for many reasons .....  It's location, the selection of restaurant's, bar's and attractions within a short walking distance is fantastic.  It's In House Facilities, it has indoor and outdoor swimming pools, restaurant and bar, shop, car rental desk, concierge desk with information and tickets on all the parks.  The Room's, all the rooms are suites with full bathroom / shower room and a washbasin area in the bedroom - handy when more than one person is getting ready to go out - sitting room and kitchen area's.  Best Of ALL, nice friendly staff, free breakfast and free evening bar 17.30pm to 19.30pm every evening.

title: Valet
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to review your experience.  All of us at the Embassy Suites Orlando - International Drive / Convention Center were excited to see that you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to welcoming you back when your travels bring you to Orlando again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Lovely stay
review: Hotel is ok. But we encountered a rude valet who we waited for 12 minutes to hand over our car keys and when we didn't see him, decided to remove our valet parking services and self park. The front desk accepted our switch over, but at 9:30 pm the valet called our room and was pretty rude in telling us that we could not opt out of valet services after signing and was not willing to listen to reason. He had to have the last word. Disappointed with housekeeping services as well as they did not replenish the daily necessities in the room when needed. This is our 9th Hilton group of hotels stay in a month, but will never come back to this hotel. The staff overall is also not friendly.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando-International Drive South/Convention
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience.  We appreciate your loyalty to Hilton and I apologize for putting the relationship at risk.  The situation you described with the valet is completely unacceptable and I can assure you that the service you encountered is not typical of the hotel.  I would like to know more about the experience and ask that you please call me at (407) 581-4301 or email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com so that I may have more details to share with the owner of the valet parking company.    Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Business Trip - Very Good Stay - 2nd Time and counting
review: We stayed here from 15th - 25th June from check in to check out we had. A Brilliant stay ALL the staff from check in who couldn't do enough for us regarding room requests suggestions and even helping with hotels near Boston airport as we had to stay there one night the cleaning staff always had an hello and the staff in the fish eye grill so friendly and funny Ronald and Monique HI ..everywhere spotlessly clean ...yes some of the furniture in the rooms getting a little dated but who's furniture at home is all brand new? Breakfast excellent and complimentary reception fantastic thankyou for a lovely stay and we wil see you next year Ignore negative reviews you will enjoy

title: Great Location and reasonable price
review: I like the Embassy Suites the service was great.  They offer great breakfast very convenient for a family of 5.  Thanks to all the staffs!!!Also, great location close to the parks.  Very convenient to TBN park.

title: Great location and stay for families
review: Offered a great free breakfast, the hotel is large, clean and offers two pools, Jacuzzi and a sauna.  The carpet is buckling in the halls and is a bit old and that's the worst I can say about the hotel.  Very nice place to stay and great location across from the Orlando Eye!

title: Great Location
review: Nice place right on I-Drive. Breakfast and Happy Hour is included. Rooms are nice, great place for a family. We always try to stay at Embassy Suites when traveling with the family. Having the free breakfast makes it an even better value for a family of four.

title: Business travel trade show woes.
review: friendly staff, nice grounds, lobby- tired old rooms circa 1994 , worn carpet stains, old bathroom, worn out card entry ( advised to bend the card to make it worK) ,extremely slow and sporadic internet access ( no file attachments would load fast enough- poor ac in the breakfast area.  comfortable bed, quiet room - slow elevators

title: Didn't meet expectations of an Embassy.  Rooms very dirty, needs renovation
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  While the suites have been renovated in the past 6 years, they are due to be done again.  We have a large project in the works for 2016 that will completely refresh the guest suites.  With that said, I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your visit, especially with the wifi while traveling on business.  We recently increased our bandwidth but we are also working with AT&T to test the signals throughout the building and see if there is anything we can do to further enhance the experience.  We did have an A/C challenge in the atrium within the past 2 weeks when one of the rooftop units failed and it has now been corrected.  With that said, I would love to know which suite you stayed in so that I may inspect the suite myself to see what we can do to improve that specific room.  While there are some things that may not be addressed until the large renovation, it sounds as if there are several things we need to update now in that suite.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: "Best Stay Ever"
review: This Hotel was the Cleanest I have seen in a long time. Guest Greeting was very Professional. The Breakfast was Excellent and so was the Managers Reception. The staff was helpful and checked on me often it felt like they had Pride in All the Services. The Assistant General Manager Sergio Bedrossian touched our table and introduced himself and offered us exceptional customer service. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff was very accomadating.  I felt like I was in Europe. The quality of food was amazing and I will definitely be back.

title: Wanda Adams
review: I didn't have a good experience and it was my birthday. The room smelled really bad and I was told that the carpet had been cleaned and was not dry, this being the case why was I put in this room, It smelled like mildew and  I had guest to come over how embarrassing is that! I had requested to be moved to another room the same day but that didn't happen instead a staff came and sprayed the room which didn't do any good. The next day a complained again and finally a Manger moved me to another room. I was comp for the first night but paid for the second night.

title: One night stay was enough
review: Thank you for writing a review of your stay.  I truly apologize for the experience during your birthday stay.  We had a company clean all of our carpets and I am working with them to determine what caused some of the carpets to remain damp after their treatments.  I was able to find your reservation details and just sent you an email to follow up further.  Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Needs major updating
review: First the good - the staff was wonderful, the hotel lobby was very nice, and they had a good free breakfast in the morning. However, we used the sleeper sofa and the mattress was terrible. Also the curtains by the sofa did not go all the way to the end of the window and did not keep out the light of the interior lobby area. And when we turned off the a/c as the room was freezing on arrival after a couple of hours the room smelled very musty and the bathroom even worse.

title: Don't stay here for work.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I truly apologize for the challenges you experienced and would like to know which suite you stayed in.  I would like to check the suite for an odor, which may be related to our recent carpet cleaning.  It also sounds as if we need to replace the mattress on the sleeper sofa.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Family Time
review: This hotel was an average Embassy Suites...The stay was nice, but I have stayed at better ones.  Maybe because it is so near to Disney and other places they have a hard time keeping up with the crowds. The outdoor hot tub was only about 85 degrees.  The indoor one was nice.  The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was kind of blah.

title: Wow factor in shed loads!
review: Right on Idrive, but not smack bang in the middle (so quieter), stands this Exceptional Hotel. The lobby was so plush,  the staff were so friendly, such a Great start to your Hols. The all you could eat breakfast was stunning, with everything you would expect on offer and more! Omelette's made to order, fruit, cereal, the whole nine yards! Lovely pool area inside and out, lots of towels always to hand.  Afternoon films, ice-cream and nachos for the kids and cocktails for the grown-ups. Ample parking for all guests, laundry facilities and all floors.  The rooms were very spacious and decor was tasteful.   Would stay here again in a flash and have recommended to friends and family x

title: Great Location and Great Service
review: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and found the location to be excellent, this hotel is close to the restaurants, shopping and most attractions. The rooms were large and very well maintained and very clean. The staff is very professional and friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is amazing! I found I was within walking distance of all the restaurants and shopping and the convention center. The bell staff here is amazing and they have much knowledge of the area, they make sure that you have a taxi that is honest and trustworthy and that is very important in Orlando.

title: Overnight stay before flight
review: Much improved since my last review. I have been coming here for a number of years, it's so nice when you walk in and see the same staff. I like it here, restaurants are across the road, shopping and evening entertainment within walking distance. I preferred a different suite to what I was given it was no problem to change and Chelsea  even gave me a voucher towards food/drinks. I missed the Managers Evening Reception but breakfast was very good. Always clean and comfortable.

title: If they would only fix the WiFi
review: Rooms =spacious and well-kept.  Location = close to Convention Center and easy to walk to some lovely restaurants and shopping.  Wi-Fi = inconsistent and problematic for the duration of my stay.  Staff= wonderful, helpful (except with the WiFi issues, no one had concrete answers) I really like this place, I just wish as a business traveler that they would've fixed the WiFi!

title: Great location on I-Drive
review: Very clean hotel.  Bathroom a bit small,  but not bad.  Good pool.  Great evening manager's reception. Walking distance to Dave and Busters.  Free parking.  Good staff and overall a good deal for the cost. Would stay again for sure.

title: excellent hotel
review: staff was attentive happy hour was great hotel lobby was clean and refreshing rooms had great views of international drive close to all theme parks lots of great food around hotel public trolley right outside

title: Outdated and overpriced
review: Of all Hilton properties, and Embassy Suites in particular, this was the worst stay ever. The rooms are very outdated-- the carpets, furniture, drapes, everything! The bathroom was small and rusty and in need of a good cleaning in the shower. The pool was dirty, although it was nice to have (tiny) towels supplied. I assume that there was not adequate staff for the hotel. I barely saw a member of the cleaning staff, and my room wasn't even cleaned the first day. The door to my room was so rickety that it wouldn't close properly and was left open by the cleaning staff on the second day. There was also a pretty big language barrier between most of the staff and guests. The complimentary WiFi is worthless. The TV channels are also worthless -- tons of news and ESPN channels and…

title: Rooms were nice, but.......
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I am ashamed of the experience you described and while our renovation in 2016 is going to take care of the "outdated" items, we strive to provide great service and a clean product at all times and it appears that we failed to do so during your trip. I would love to have an opportunity to speak with you about your stay.  If you have the time, please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or give me a call at (407) 581-4301.        Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Accommodations and Service that is a cut above the rest
review: The room was much bigger than I anticipated, very clean, but our bathroom fan wasn't working that was kind of annoying.  We didn't bother to call maintenance since we were in and out of the room a lot (going to activities in the area).  However, we did tell the front desk when we were departing.  The evening complimentary happy hours is nice, but the patrons were obnoxious.  People were just blatantly throwing popcorn around (on purpose) and making such a mess.  It happened everyday we were there.  I felt bad for the hotel workers having to clean up after rude people.  The staff was very friendly, but the clientele was just not what I was expecting.  The hotel is in a good location.  Very close to many restaurants and attractions.

title: Location Great, Staff Courteous
review: If you aren't staying on property for the theme parks in Orlando, this is a great area on International Drive.   For business it's walking distance to the convention center, lots of restaurants close by, and $25 cab ride to downtown Disney.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.    The rooms were okay and well maintained and the lobby was nice.    Odd observation - the elevators were really slow.      It also had a nice pool deck just outside the hotel.

title: Nice hotel but.....!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  While we wish we would have scored a little higher overall, it was great to see a 5 star rating for service.  It sounds as if you enjoyed your overall stay and we appreciate the kind comments.  We certainly hope to serve you again when your travels bring you back to Orlando and we will do everything we can to earn an even better review.     Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Glad to have chosen this hotel
review: Pros: Hotel lobby is very nice and the room size was good. They served made to order and express breakfast. Evening drinks was served as part of our stay also. My son loved the out-door pool and they do have a indoor pool as well. The hotel location is Great, close to food and attractions. Higher end hotels are also located on International Drive but at a higher rates. Parking is good and secure. Restaurant's: TGIF, Red Lobster, Fugo De Chou, UNO, Perkins, Ihop, Denneys, etc. All on internatonal Drive.  Cons: I did not like the noise level of our room. I heard the footsteps and the toilet flushing from the room above ours. I would suggest you stay on the top floor (8th). Bad Wi-Fi but they have a computer room with a printer for guest.

title: Disappointing - better hotels in the area
review: I found the staff all most helpful, the accommodation was spacious and clean although becoming  little tired. The location was great with plenty of good eating establishments of varying sorts in walking distance. Which became necessary after the free happy two hours at the hotel. The pool area was clean and usually fairly quiet . I would definitely stay there again.

title: Holiday
review: I chose to stay here as I had a good stay at another embassy suites property in downtown orlando. This hotel isn't anywhere close to that standard. Rooms in desperate need of modernisation. For the room rate I think it is reasonable to expect to get wifi included in the room which we did not. One thing that did annoy me was being given beer in a plastic cup. I know it sounds minor, but on international drive where you have a lot of completion, little things can go a long way. Wouldn't recommend.

title: OK if you know what to look for!
review: great location, rooms facing hwy are noisy.  internet service sucks.  good B'fast and near a lot of restaurants.  Pool area looks good and the lobby is fair.  the managers happy hour was OK, limited selection of adult beverages, but free with light selection of snacks.

title: One Night Stay
review: Good location close to Universal Studios and the convention center. Howl at the Moon, Senior Frogs and Bahama Breeze are across the street. This is good for nighttime entertainment but a nuisance since we could her the bass from the music til the wee hours.  The rooms are spacious. The bed and pillows are comfortable. At first I didn't think I'd like the second vanity in the bedroom but it turned out to be quite handy. The A/C didn't seem as powerful in the bedroom as the living room area. A ceiling fan would have been nice in the bedroom.  The atrium area can get loud even though it didn't seem busy during our stay. Breakfast is good. The layout of the breakfast area doesn't flow very well. The line for hot food can get long.  I would consider staying her again.

title: Great Value
review: I am giving this hotel 4 stars for customer service, location, and value. This hotel is in the middle of I-Drive, which means you can walk to several attractions and restaurants. It is right across the street from Pointe Orlando, which offers some limited shopping (Victoria's Secret, Bath And Body Works), as well as mostly upscale restaurants (Capital Grill and a Sushi joint). Wonderworks, Denny's, Walgreens, Friendly's, and even the IRide 360 entertainment venue are all close, and you can use the scheduled shuttle service to get to the Disney parks, or take the trolley that has several stops along I-Drive. There is also a Super Walmart less than 10 minutes away, and the Florida Mall is also pretty close, although you still have to drive. The Orange County Convention Center is…

title: A great stay, every time.
review: This Embassy Suites delivers what you would expect from this brand.  The rooms are spacious and clean; the bed is cool and comfortable.  The building is quiet and peaceful in the middle of the night.  Consider the full breakfast in the morning, the reception in the evening (free drinks), and the price you pay is a real steal!

title: Over and above
review: This hotel far exceeded my expectations and helped us feel like we were going "home" every day we left Disney or Universal.   All the staff was friendly, the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay better, and the concierge desk chatted with my 6 year old daughter and had stickers ready for her every day when she came back from Disney.   The amenities were great. The in-room soaps and shampoos were high quality, as were the coffees and teas available in the room. I got a cold at the end of our trip, and the front desk provided a variety of hot teas one night, well after 8 o'clock.   The shuttles to and from the parks were timely and convenient and the staff was very knowledgeable about the parks.   Breakfast was great every morning and there were a wide variety of…

title: Honeymoon Stay
review: My husband and I chose this hotel for our honeymoon as we just held our wedding reception at a local Embassy Suites and wanted to redeem our hilton honor points. The hotel lobby is beautiful. The front desk staff definitely accomodated us with an early check in however our room was located right next to the elevators. Thankfully it wasn't as loud as we anticipated. The room did have a strange smell whenever you walked in. I did like the view of the pool from our little fake balcony. Overall the stay was good.

title: USA HOLIDAY 2015
review: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of may, for a Two week holiday with my partner who has never been to America. The Hotel was amazing the staff couldn't be more helpful.(Daniel,robert,chelsea, april and Lee also the valet staff) The rooms were cleaned everydaySome people would say the décor needs an updating. the food was good, plenty on offer. my partner wanted to stay!!

title: dream land
review: Just had our second stay  at hotel.                                 Everyone from guys out front,( Boss Raymond, Derek, Maurice, Homer, Fitz ).All at reception,who were all very pleasant and helpful. A big thankyou to all the bar staff , Charllene, Kathy, and all.       Chefs were brilliant, food as well.great breakfasts.could not ask for more. Waiting staff very friendly and pleasant. Room service excellent.        All maintenance staff very polite.Thankyou to the congierge staff and a big thankyou to Florence, for booking our trip.                                     Miss You Already.                              Chris & Cheryl Oxley.

title: Second Stay, Great Time
review: This hotel is great for business or family travel (especially if you want to combine both). The hotel is centrally located on I-Drive and is within walking distance to several restaurants (e.g., Olive Garden, Capitol Grill, RA Sushi, Denny's, Friendly's and more), shopping (Pointe Orlando, gift shops, etc.), and I-Drive attractions (including Wonderworks, miniature golf, and I-Ride 360). There is a trolley stop just in front of the hotel that you can purchase a day pass for ($5.00), and the convention center is about a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel is also very close to Seaworld, Aquatica, and Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure, and no more than a 10-minute drive to Magic Kingdom and Epcot.  I first stayed here in September 2012 on the top floor (8th floor) and had a large…

title: Quick trip to Disney
review: Great hotel!  Beautiful!  Perfect location, walking distance to shops/restaurants/nightlife, etc.  And I'm talking about right across the street, walking distance.  The rooms are clean and nice (not great or fancy, but very nice).  Happy hour was great with Pitas and hummus and popcorn and of course free drinks.    The atrium of the hotel is so beautiful and relaxing with the trees, waterfalls, and vegetation.   We didn't try the restaurant as there are so many to choose from nearby.  The pool looks great as well and the staff here are all exceptionally friendly.  Free shuttle to the parks.  We would definitely return to this hotel. *Barter for your room price they are very negotiable.  We talked then down to $109 b/c of comps in the area

title: Perfect Location International Drive Orlando
review: Complete satisfaction with this hotel. Brilliant location to travel to all the theme parks. Excellent position for evening entertainment without travelling. The staff at this hotel are the best I have ever experienced, they will go the extra mile to ensure you have a brilliant time. The Fisheye Grill provides very well presented tasty meals at good prices. The breakfast service will please any taste and very much those that like cooked to order breakfast. Overall what a brilliant experience I would recommend to all couples and family's who want a hotel in a brilliant location and good value for money VERY WELL DONE

title: one weeks stay
review: Just back from another great week at this beautiful hotel. We have stayed here many times and it never fails to impress very central very relaxing lovely breakfast ,managers reception with very nice friendly staff. kept spotless our cleaning lady yolasta (not sure if I spelt that correctly)kept our room spotless and well serviced ,we had room 822 with great view of the eye. The receptionists were always pleasant and helpful ,I have stayed in quite a few hotels in this area over the years but this is the very best by a long shot didn't want to come home .It was a great place to come back to after a great weeks cruise . Sheelagh Dunne

title: Quiet nights sleep even when full
review: I enjoyed the stay here on business for a convention. Even though the place was sold out,the staff was very good, available for all issues and helpful. The breakfast area was never overcrowded and the selection was good. The location was great for walking around, even walking to the conference. I will definitely stay here again if I come for another conference nearby.

title: Nice place but needs updating
review: Liked the hotel but needs updating  nice down in lobby etc. but on floors and in rooms carpets are worn and new items in bathroom etc  need adding  also no safes in rooms and cheaper hotels have had them so why not. this one but saying that they did tell me they are updating next year and safes are going to be added

title: Great staff, hotel rooms need an update
review: Both Good and Bad -   The Bad - I stay here once  year for a conference and it is a reliable solid hotel.  I noticed last year that the rooms were starting to look a bit ragged, and this is the first year that I've felt "gross" walking into the room.  The paint is peeling, the carpet is threadbare and the room itself is very musty.  I found other people's shoes under my bed as well as food/candy that had been left behind.  Luckily I was only in the room a few hours per day.  If I had been there with family I would have considered leaving.  The Good - they have remodeled the lobby and elevator areas.  The atrium is, as always, very nice.  Although I didn't swim the pool are is also looking good.  The front desk staff are delightful to deal with and are the biggest reason I keep…

title: Good for the price.
review: Yes, the hotel is older. Yes, it could be better but for the $$$ I would not complain. It is a great place for a family. I would not hesitate staying again. The breakfast was outstanding. The made to order omletes were great. The variety one of the best that I have had and We regularly stay at hotels with breakfasts. They had a complimentary drink and snack time from 5:30-7:30 that I wish was a little better organized. I have been to others that had a few bottles of cheap wine and beer this was acutally mixed drinks. Unfortunately, the line was crazy long and we were not willing to stand in line when we could go across the street and start our amazing dinner. Maybe having more than one bartender and or having a section where you could actually pay for a drink. Though the people…

title: BEST HOTEL EVER!!!
review: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for one night (unfortunately) in may when we were starting our disney vacation(first time) and everything in this hotel make us think we really wanted to stay here forever. Mr Dean check us in at 1 am. HE WAS AMAZING SHOWING US WHERE EVERYTHING WAS, HELPING US WITH THE PARKING AND EVERYTHING ELSE. I really have to say, in fact, that all employees of this hotel were amazing, they all meet our expectations above and beyond. The room was REALLY good, bed was comfortable  and the pillow were really soft. Breakfast was awesome, a la carte. I want to thank he breakfast cookers because they really did a good job. We really loved yoir hotel. It is clean and nice and the staff makes you feel good. GOOD JOB GUYS WE ARE DEFINITELY COMING BACK!!!

title: Age really shows - Not recommended
review: The age of this place really shows.  The carpet in the hallways are worn out.  The expectations for an Embassy Suites were not met here.  I would recommend staying somewhere else if you had the option.  The pool is very small and disappointing to most kids.

title: I love this hotel!
review: This is my second stay at the Embassy Suites in Orlando on International Dr.  I booked the same hotel this year as last year because they offer the nicest staff, Happy hour EVERYDAY, a beautiful atrium, Free make to order breakfast every morning, and great beds! They have taken care of me my last two business trips and I always leave HAPPY! Five Stars!!

title: excellent hotel and service
review: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding reception. the hotel was great, clean, food was good and the reception was wonderful!! Everything was taken care of we had no issues with any part of the wedding. staff was wonderful.

title: Needs update
review: Room smelled like mold. Plumbing pipes making noise. Shower has low water pressure and low shower head. Old furniture. Door locks did not work correctly.  Good location close to restaurants and the parks.

title: spring trip to Orlando
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate your experience.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and while we are planning an update in 2016, there were a couple of things that you mentioned that we needed to take care of immediately.  We worked on the lock, odor and water pressure.  Thank you for bringing it to our attention.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: I4 Noise!!
review: had a beautiful stay at Embassy Suites. Room was not ready at check in was given an upgrade. Beautiful place , cooked to order breakfast great. Beautiful view from room.Pool and hot tub was great. Loved my stay. Would stay there again.

title: Great stay
review: I would go to different hotel next time. The noise from the interstate is to loud. the managers reception snakes are terrible. Morning breakfast was slow and the servers are unfriendly. only thing you could get fast was cereal and muffins.

title: Very nice rooms for a great price
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I apologize for the challenges you experienced with Food and Beverage and the noise from the interstate.  I would still love to discuss your trip if you have an opportunity.  I can be reached via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or directly at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Wonderful stay definitately a pleasant experiance
review: Did review other posts prior to staying.  Disagree with the negative ones.  Went to Orlando for our anniversary and thought that the Hotel was definitely worth staying.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast waitresses could use a little personality as with the maid staff.  Definitely would advise getting the suite.  The amenities are worth the extra.  Would go again without hesitation.  Breakfast was a home run and saved money in the long run.

title: Good hotel with the potential to be great ....
review: We stayed here on a family holiday for 10 nights in April 2015. The hotel is in a fantastic location on International Drive with an endless choice of restaurants within easy walking distance.  The hotel itself has a very welcoming and airy lobby area and although our room was not ready upon arrival we were dealt with well by the reception staff and the bell-boys. Our room (or suite as they are  known as), was very spacious with 2 double beds in the bed room and an adequate kitchen/lounge area. As many other reviews have said, the rooms are dated and are in need of a refresh but the general layout and space available could not be faulted. We did have a problem upon checking into our room which was that the toilet was not flushing properly. However upon calling the front desk,…

title: don`t believe all the negative reviews
review: After getting back last Wednesday after a two week stay at this hotel and reading the latest reviews i cant believe we were stopping in the same hotel.My wife my 21 year old daughter and i stayed in room 320 and yes it may need up dateing but it was clean and spacious.The air con worked fine we always had hot water and plenty of clean fresh towels daily when we commented at reception on the curtains across the door not closeing all the way we were given magnets to fix them back to the frame which worked perfectly.As for the breakfast this was more than ok  fresh cooked omellets were great.Cant say enough about the staff nothing was ever a problem always friendly and helpfull .Derek at the door needs a special mention.Hotel is in a excellent location with free shuttles to the…

title: Excellent Staff - Tired hotel rooms
review: The staff was excellent but the hotel is very tired. The room (the second one we received because the first one was smelled like smoke and musty odors) was very tired looking. Mold and mildew on the grout between the tiles in the bathtub, bubbling wall paper from being too wet in the bathroom, smell of mold when taking your shower. Window didn't have a screen and wouldn't lock when closed, AC didn't work properly. Old original furnishings. It smelled like mildew all of the time. Disappointed in this Embassy Suites as we have stayed at many of them around the country.

title: Clean, comfortable and excellent customer service
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your stay.  The team truly appreciates your comments regarding the staff being "excellent".  We are due for a refresh of the guest suites next year and look forward to updating the décor.  However, we pride ourselves on providing a clean and working suite to our guests, so the comments regarding a musty odor, mildew and the sliding door are alarming.  I would love to know which suite you stayed in so we can address the concerns and ensure that nobody has to deal with a subpar suite.  If you have a moment, please reach out to me via email at William.Friedrich@hilton.com or give me a call at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Just okay...
review: Usually don't leave bad reviews unless something happens.  I stay in hotels quite frequently for work.  Here for business frr 4 nights.  Hotel needs updating pretty bad.  Very dated.  Second day I was there, room was still not serviced at 5pm, even though I'd be out of the room since 8am.  Extremely disappointed as I wanted to sit in my room and catch up on work.  They gave me a voucher to the restaurant while they cleaned the room, and I hate to say I went back in a time warp in the restaurant.  No atmosphere and extremely dated as well.  I only went there because it was free and there were zero options.

title: Not worth the $$$
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I truly apologize that we did not clean your suite earlier in the day.  I was glad to hear the team made an effort to make it right and I certainly hope that they arranged for the suite to be cleaned earlier for the remainder of your visit.  We do clean guest suites up until 6pm on a daily basis.  However, we do accept requests for specific service times.  I am going to work with our leadership team to better communicate the times of service and the process for requests, which will help avoid these types of scenarios.  With that said, we are due for a refresh next year and hope we will have an opportunity to show you the updates should your travels bring you to Orlando again.  If I can be of any assistance, please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: One Night was just good enough for me.
review: I was very disappointed with the quality of the room. Bathroom was old and outdated. Location is the best quality of this facility. Breakfast was also decent. In my experience you can find much better value for your $$.

title: Wear a respirator!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your visit.  I would love to know more about the suite you stayed in and the specific quality concerns that you experienced.  Please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or give me call directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Horrible
review: first of all i thought for the fact that the hotel was on I-drive it would be very nice, clean and worth the money. I was so wrong. When i walked in the hotel it looked ok and i thought it was nice. its great walking distance to shops, restaurants and close to where i would be working for the week.I know that I would be working long hours so i needed someplace where i can get a good nights rest and i was wrong.  The agent that checked me in  was friendly and helpful. When i got my key  and started looking around then i saw the major need for upgrades.  The pool area was very dated, need lots of upgrades, fresh paint and work, the Jacuzzi didnt have any water in it. the gym area is very small and needed some cleaning because i walked in and immediately started sneezing. The pool…

title: Never again
review: The stay was horrible the only reason I put poor instead of terrible was because of the free breakfast and free drinks at the evening reception which were both pretty good first of all the pool sucks it's no bigger than someone's backyard pool would be and is always over crowded during the day also despite me telling the front desk I didn't want cleaning service the lady still came in when we weren't there the first day and the second morning walked in at 8am and woke us up then we put the do not disturb sign on the door and she still walked in 2 hours later they deactivated our keys after the first night so we got locked out of our room and had to go get a New key for the second day the room really wasn't that clean we took cold showers the entire stay and my mom slept on the…

title: Clean = yes.  Business friendly = no
review: I truly apologize for the lack of follow through from the suitekeeper and the challenges you faced with the hot water and keys.  I wish I would have had the opportunity to speak with you during the trip and try to make it right.  Furthermore, the medical concern you mentioned after sleeping on the sofa bed is alarming and I would like to speak with you or your mother to find our more and ensure that everything is okay.  Please reach out to me directly at (407) 581-4301 or email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Momi
review: Horrible internet service.  Supposed to choose "Comp internet option" on the HHonors welcome page and surf away...not so much.  That option does not work so you have to go to the front desk to get a promo code....

title: Extremely dissapointed
review: I truly apologize for the challenges you experienced with the internet.  We have corrected the issues associated with the new complimentary basic internet service offerings that we have rolled out in the last 30 days.  Up until recently, we were charging $9.95 for basic internet access in the guest suites.  When we changed the basic offerings to complimentary and rolled out the upgraded access for $9.95 we ran into a few glitches.  I hope that when your travels bring you back to Orlando, we will have the opportunity to serve you again and show you that we are a business friendly hotel.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: A really nice Embassy and conveniently located
review: No hot water at night or in the morning! Really 150.00 a night and no hot water. Also had to get new key four times as They would not work. Will never stay there again. They do have free drinks for happy hour which helped.

title: MegaCon 2015 Group
review: I was pleasantly surprised with our visit.  My only complaints are our GPS said the hotel was another quarter of a mile down the road and the elevators were slow when stair access only led outside.   The room was spacious and as advertised, a no smoking room that was true to its name. A delightful eating area for the continental breakfast and a free drinks happy hour with a great bartender - we felt spoiled! All staff was pleasant and areas including our room were clean. A free shuttle to the convention center and tons to do and see within walking distance made this very well worth it! We will definitely be back!

title: Mega Con Visit
review: Lobby and common areas okay but room was not as clean as I'd hoped. Bathroom is mismatched decor, weird updates and not up to par for brand. Old and dates furniture. AC was struggling so room felt humid. Weak wifi signal and cell service barely worked. Needs an overhaul. Won't be back.

title: Smoking Room only even though reserved Non-Smoking Room
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are due for a full renovation of the guest suites in 2016, which will be a more modern look.  In the meantime, we pride ourselves on providing great guest service and a clean suite.  Therefore, your comments regarding cleanliness were alarming.  I would love to know more about your cleanliness concerns and the suite that you stayed in.  Please reach out to me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or at (407) 581-4301.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Gift for my Brothers family to Disney World
review: My hotel confirmation clearly said non-smoking. I arrived and all they sent me to a smoking room. I lugged all of my luggage back downstairs to ask for a non-smoking room only to find out they didnt have a non-smoking room available that night, the night of my reservation. I think it was poor service to not communicate ahead of time that they were not going to have a non-smoking room available and also poor service to have sent me up to the room and not have mentioned it was going to be a smoking room. I ended up having to find another hotel with availability in the convention center area and ended up being late for my because of their lack of service.

title: Good location
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I truly apologize for the mix-up with your reservations.  I do not recall hearing of this service failure and I would like to research what caused it so we can avoid future situations such as this.  Ultimately, I cannot change what happened but I would like to try and Make It Right for you as well.  Please reach out to me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: One of the better hotels I have stayed in
review: Great hotel on the heart of International drive. Good sized rooms, cool interior common area, great rate, clean, and had FREE drinks and snacks from 5-7!!!! Hotel was a little older but it was clean and kept up. Website says you need to pay for parking but parking was free

title: needs updating
review: Check in was very easy.  The room was spacious but the temperature fluctuated between the bedroom and living room.  The veneer on the door to the bedroom was coming off and the bathroom door and vanity showed a lot of wear.  The beds were full size and a little tight especially for plus sized people. Other than that it was nice and the breakfast was very good (even though it was hard to find seating).

title: Nice location
review: It was a nice location love the made to order omelet bar and the happy hour in the evening.the hotel is nice could use some updates but overall nice.staff where nice and helpful the only problem we had was we called to tell the front desk that 2 of are outlets did not work but after a few trys to get ahold of them gave up

title: Surprised by poor condition
review: The carpet was literally threadbare, exposing the carpet backing, in several places throughout the room.  There was mildew in the corners in the bathroom.  The common areas were dirty with trash and food debris making the promise of a free breakfast entirely unappetizing and eliminating any interest in trying the on property restaurant.

title: Decent Property
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I would like to inspect the suite that you occupied to see the condition of the carpet and ensure that there is no mildew.  We were understaffed at breakfast in early April and will ensure that the staffing better reflects our occupancy at all times.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences and hope that you will reach out to me regarding your suite and stay.  My email address is william.friedrich@hilton.com and my direct line is (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Awesome lobby but awful rooms
review: For many years, our family has never been able to afford to stay at an Embassy Suites.  We knew many people who had but the rates were always alittle higher than we could afford.  We had always assumed that Embassy Suites was a luxury hotel but we couldn't afford anything beyond Hampton or Holiday Inn.  We decided this year's family trip was going to be extra special.  This would be our first time to Sea World and to Legoland and we wanted to splurge alittle on ourselves by staying in a "rich" hotel.  We were so very, very disappointed and will never stay here again.  In fact, we aren't sure if we'll ever stay at an Embassy Suites hotel again since we have no idea if they are all like this.  It is very obvious that this hotel charges the high rates not to make the guest…

title: In need of a major remodeling!
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience.  We are due for a guest room refresh in the next year as the furniture, fixtures, carpet and décor is approximately 5 - 6 years old.  With that said, Embassy Suites is an upscale brand and we pride ourselves on providing a fabulous experience with great service, clean suites, a delicious cooked to order breakfast and our daily evening reception.  Therefore, I was disappointed to read that you did not enjoy your stay and that we failed to deliver on our promises and internal goals.  I certainly wish you would have talked to someone at the Front Desk because while we could not change what occurred during your visit, we would have loved to do something to make it right or at least make you feel better about the trip.  I would still like the opportunity to speak with you if you have the time.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or give me a call at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellent Staff, Comfortable Rooms - in need of its 2016 Renovation
review: I travel extensively each year for my job.  I’ve been a Diamond member of the Hilton’s Honors program for the last 6 years.  This is by far the most poorly maintained Embassy Suites I’ve ever stayed in.  The facility is at least 40 years old and has had minimal maintenance provided to it over the years.  Flooring surfaces are in poor condition, there are many elevation changes as you walk through the public spaces, and lighting is poor throughout the facility.  I can’t pin the problems on the staff.  The people working there were trying to be helpful, it just seemed that they were working with a very run down property.  I’ll list some of my concerns below.  1.	Twice during my 6 night stay in my bathroom flooded.  The condensation line for the air-conditioning unit which was…

title: Great location, Staff friendliness not so great.
review: Thank you for your loyalty to Hilton.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and for the lack of follow up from the manager you spoke with.  There is no excuse for the issues that you experienced or the condition of the suite that you received.  I would love to speak with you to find out which room you stayed in, follow up with the team members that worked on the suite, follow up with the manager you spoke with and ultimately try to make it right for you.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Embassy Suites Hotel Florida
review: A big thank you to Mohammed on the front desk for all his help during our stay. Breakfast was tasty and portion size control was useful for ensuring not too much weight was piled on. Outdoor pool somewhat cramped and enjoyment somewhat inhibited by the inconsiderate nature of smokers discarding their used death sticks carelessly. Comfortable bed and room on the quieter side - although parties at "Howl at the Moon" could be heard late into the night.

title: Short trip with friends to attractions in the area
review: Nice hotel, but as soon as I opened the door of my room it smelled like cigarettes even though it said in the hotel description that rooms were Non smoking. I  did not like the fact that the window covers by the door does not have a complete coverage from some angles inside the room, for example the sofa bed. People walking by the door could see areas of the room inside. For the price I paid for a room I expected more privacy. The view from my window was the roof of another building. The elevators were a little slow. The furniture was a little outdated. 😒  In the other hand its centrally located closed to many attractions and the the breakfast was wonderful with a wide variety of choices.

title: Good location and nice service
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I apologize for the smoke odor in the suite upon arrival and for the lack of a view.  In regards to the furniture, we are coming due for a refresh next year.  I hope we get the opportunity to serve you again should your travels bring you back to Orlando.  I would be happy to assist with reservations and with choosing a suite in a better location for the next stay.  Please contact me at william.friedrich@hilton.com if I can be of assistance.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Good stay!
review: Well located on international drive with large rooms/suites and nice environment. Restaurants walking distances Happy hour Free shuttles to universal, disney and seaworld Parking not free anymore ...  Just a tip : i would choose a room on international drive to avoid the noise from the highway

title: 2 week getaway to Orlando
review: Good experience. Clean rooms and lobby. Nice people. Nice pool and two hot tubs. GREAT location right next to The Pointe where there are as many restaurants to choose from than you could ever want! Looks just like all the other Emnassey Suites we've stayed in before!

title: Staff/ location/ and friendly faces
review: Me and my partner stayed here for 2 weeks in May 2013 and I was pleasantly surprised.  I had read some reviews on here which were not very good, and that naturally made me weary.  However, we really enjoyed our stay here.  The furniture and furnishings were slightly outdated but this is not a problem and had no bearing on the standard of our holiday.  Staff were friendly, the room was always kept clean and tidy and there were lots of options to chose from for breakfast.  A great benefit of staying here was that they put on free transport to Disney and Universal.  Also, there was an i-ride stop not far from the hotels entrance which was great to use to get to seaworld or the malls.  There were also lots of places to eat out nearby (easily within walking distance) including;…

title: Was a great hotel, clean, and shuttle to disney free.
review: My husband brought us on a business trip and the kids and I went to Disney for the day.  Nice hotel, clean, big room, a great guest service there for Disney planning.  You can buy tickets there also while learning the "ins and outs" of Disney.  Free shuttle was really nice, too.  Breakfast was not your typical free breakfast - much better than average.  There was a happy hour with free drinks/snacks but we did not take advantage of it.  Hotel pool was also great with a small kiddy pool for the real youngsters if you wanted.  Nice lounge chairs and a big pool.  Oh, and also had to use the business center and needed technical help for printing something - guy came quick and was very helpful (nice clean, quiet, business center, too).

title: Comfortable hotel, friendly staff
review: Had  a very nice weeks stay here. Pull out bed certainly wasn't the  worst I've slept on and the room was clean and comfortable. Drinks/snacks in the evenings were also great as wa the breakfast. Would stay here again - great location on on Intenaional Drive.

title: Excellent service
review: Robert at front desk is extremely gracious.  He went above and beyond to make sure our stay started off on the right foot.  Derek is a wonderful Bellman and makes us feel at home the whole visit. Homer is another great Bellman.

title: A Great Visit
review: Having stayed in the Embassy Suites several times in the past, we had no qualms about booking again and as usual were not disappointed.  It was my birthday the day before we arrived, but the vacation is always classed as my birthday present and the Embassy Suites always go out of there way to make it special, this time it was a cake and balloons, I can never say a big enough thank you to them for they're efforts.  All the staff are helpful and its the little touches that keep us coming back, like the omlette chef remebering how I like it cooked and the Cocktail waitress remembering what we like to drink.  The facilities in the hotel are good and all the public areas clean and tidy, and the suite was spotless and kept that way by housekeeping throughout our 9 night stay.  The…

title: Family getaway
review: This was our 5th. visit to the International Drive location and we're looking forward to our 6th.  Staff as always was OUTSTANDING they always go over and beyond. Nice little purks such as free shuttle service to Disney and Universal. Free breakfast and comp. cocktail hour is very good and the staff bends over backwards for you it's a shame not too many people give them a tip for the service they provide. However, they provide the same service if they're given a tip or not.

title: Disappointed
review: This property does not live up to its name. It is dated and tired. Our room was below par. Housekeeping was almost nonexistent. 3 out of the 4 nights we stayed we had to call down to have our room made up by 6PM everyday! Garbage wasn't emptied, dirty towels left on the floor, and the worst...lipstick stained glasses under sanitary cover protection! He hotel is located near many great restaurants and is convenient to the Convention Center.

title: Great location but minor defects
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your visit.  While we are due for a renovation of the guest suites within the next year, we take pride in providing top notch service and a superbly clean hotel.  Therefore the experience you described is completely unacceptable and I assure you that it is not typical.  I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced and I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you regarding the visit.  Please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or you may call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  I would like to know which suite you stayed in so that I may inspect it and also research what caused the lapse in housekeeping service.    Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: The best chain of Hotels
