review: This hotel is on International Drive and is walking distance to several popular restaurants such as Olive Garden, TGI Fridays, Don Pablo's, Hooters, Bahama Breeze and many more.  After a long day at the amusement parks going to a nice eatery and being able to walk to and from the hotel is an inviting convenience.  The hotel has minor deficiencies with the housekeeping service such as failing to replace an empty tissue box, failing to provide new coffee pods and creamer and failing to empty a trash can.  All minor problems which were easily corrected.  It has an indoor and outdoor pools both with hot tubs and a nice fitness center.

title: great value, indoor pool, amazing breakfast to order
review: Never have Embassy Suites failed in delivering first class service to all of its guests. My trip was both business and family. When you find a hotel that can fit you every need then you tend to stick with it. I have with Embassy Suites and they have never let me down.

title: Good value hotel with pool
review: Positives = good value, omelets or any eggs to order, mixed drinks at happy hour, indoor and outdoor pool, microwave & fridge, comfortable bed, close to many restaurants and activities Negatives = rooms could use a little updating, and descriptions were not accurate.  n08-n15 were on the I-4 side but description said pool side (which must mean over the indoor pool or they changed room numbers.  I-4 traffice makes it too loud to open the balcony door. (also this is not a real balcony that you can step out on - but what is normally described as a Juliet balcony) TIP - choose room n01 - n07 to be over the outdoor pool and not on the expressway or road side (n=floor)

title: good hotel
review: the room was nice, some paint splatters in the bathroom from doing touch ups. the restaurant food was ok, soups very nice. conference room ok. I thought it was pretty expensive for an ok experience. the lobby area was pretty, the gift shop was open for a good amount of time. the complimentary breakfast was good. parking was good.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
review: First- I look aggressively for good deals in area or on trips where I can get significant discounted pricing- so decent pricing would be a given with any review that I give.  This location shines as to location- it is in the heart of International Blvd restaurant and shops area, and very fun place to walk around in the evening/night.  Breakfast was great as well as Manager's Special of drinks and light snacks. With the location, this hotel will stay booked- and with it being booked- heavy volume - meaning it will have a 'worn' and 'used' feel.  Staff and management do fantastic to minimize this factor and keep the location looking hospitable and inviting.

title: Nice people, poor hotel.
review: I am staying here for a work event and unfortunately my experiences at this hotel have not been the best.  I would like to start this out though with the fact that everyone I have meet has been fabulous, but where I see shortfalls is in the hotel/company itself.  Just a few issues: 1. Keys continue to not work so I have to go down to the front desk to get new keys each time. 2. Terrible service at the restuarant.  The waiter was awesome, but clearly understaffed. 3. There is a helicopter site next door with constant noise. 4. The last two nights I have had a barely warm shower.  Thankfully in the morning it was OK- not sure how that happens. 5. Phone broken in room. 6. Breakfast was pretty unimpressive.   I was compensated very well for the consistent key issues.  This was…

title: Better than Before
review: I am happy I was able to read your review and speak to you prior to your departure.  I certainly wish that we could have spoken much sooner to address the challenges you faced with the keys and ensure that your phone was switched in a more timely manner.  One thing I neglected to bring up during our talk was the helicopter noise.  While there is a helicopter touring business a few doors down, the noise was actually due to a large helicopter convention being held at the Orange County Convention Center.  There was far more air traffic and noise during the convention than we typically see.  Again, thank you for taking the time to chat with me and provide your feedback.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: A great location, comfortable rooms.
review: For business travelers, this hotel met my expectations for brand and price point. Clean and friendly. Much improved over previous stays. Tourist actually enhance the stay adding life and excitement in the public areas. Staff was helpful but respected the business class guest with privacy.

title: Great Experience
review: This hotel was way above our expectations. First of all the rate was very reasonable for a family of four. The room was very spacious with a King Size bed in one room and a pull out sofa bed in a separate living room. Aside from the bathroom, there were sinks in the sleeping area and kitchen. It also had a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room.  To top it off, the free breakfast was way better than any other free breakfast we've had in the past from any other hotel. They actually had an omelet station where they prepared the omelet per your request. You want ham and cheese with extra mushroom, you get ham and cheese with extra mushroom. Or you can choose from traditional hot breakfast items. Not to mention an assortment of cereals, bakery items, juices, and…

title: family travel
review: This is hotel is clean. But extremely OUTDATED rooms. There. Was a very bad musty smell in the hotel. The lobby is updated. Rooms over priced. We stay at many Hilton properties. This was well below par. Food was also below average. The pictures they use regarding the rooms are taken to look better than they are. Bathrooms were very small. My husband barely fit under the shower head.we traveled to Florida with a family of 5. I would never stay at this location again.

title: Very Disappointing- almost aweful
review: For 8 years I have been going to a trade show in Orlando and have stayed at the other Embassy suites ( Jamaican Court ), so I figured for a change of pace I switched to the International Dr location expecting to receive the same quality room. Was I wrong! The room was very musty and very dated. The bathroom was atrocious! Patched walls and ceiling( done poorly) painted trim that was painted over peeling paint. A shower head that was 5 feet high- I had to bend over to wet my head! The bed was old and mushy.   Complimentary drinks were in not served in the bar area ( weird) and the breakfast paled in comparison to the Jamaican Court location.  The only reason I did not give 1 star is the staff was very good. No fault of theirs that the location is horrible My recommendation is to…

title: Needs Revitalizing
review: This hotel is just tired. I've stayed in a lot of Hilton properties and have never written a poor review but this one has earned it. This hotel needs a serious remodel/revitalization. The location is great; located within walking distance to an abundance of restaurants and the convention center, however the rooms are old. It took 3 trips to the front desk to get the keys to work. My room had holes in the carpet and an old smell. The bathroom was not very clean upon check in with "body" hair around the tub and toilet. The staff was super friendly and as helpful as they could be. I was here on business so I toughed it out however had this been a family trip we would have checked out and went somewhere else.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando (International Road)
review: I have always liked Embassy Suites.  My stay was ok, but there was a bunch that the hotel could do to shape up the experience.  Hotel room was noisy when other rooms were showering.  It sounded like the main drain line for the showers and sinks was in the wall right behind drywall...and was not insolated.  Manager's reception was nice, and it is just an added benefit, but the selection of snack was horrible.  Breakfast on a monday morning was cold food only, I assume due to a holiday.  All sounds trivial...but you are paying for it.  I am sure that I will give Embassy another shot at some point.

title: This place needs a facelift
review: The hotel rooms needed a remodel, the room smelled and the beds uncomfortable.  The hot tube looked like it hadn't been cleaned in 6 weeks, full of trash and leaves. We requested a wake-up call that never came and the internet was very spotty.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando
review: It was a nice stay and I enjoyed sitting by the pool.  The hotel has a nice lobby area.  The rooms are spacious.  I really liked having the additional sink in the bedroom.  The front desk staff was very helpful.

title: Just okay
review: Our room was very clean but older furniture and needs refurbishing.  The bathroom door was warped and would not close.  Balcony door would not close and lock.  No wifi unless you are a Diamond or Gold Member but you can purchase internet, which we did not.  Nowadays, all hotels offer free wifi !!

title: It was average nothing  wowed me.
review: We were there  from 24-26. I would stay there again if i needed to. It was clean and served its purpose. Free breakfast get in line early but the guys works fast. The happy hour was great. SANTA being in the lobby was very cute and thoughtful. The rooms were clean and spacious. The pull out bed was super uncomfortable. Overall my stay was good.

title: Great Service good location
review: Friendly curteous staff good facilities staff very helpful and felt a valued client. Front desk extremely helpful day and night. Any requests or questions dealt with immediately. Rooms comfortable and cleaned thoroughly every day. Complimentary breakfast just perfect to start the day plenty of choice, good quality and service great.

title: Hotel needs updating
review: This hotel is great  for a location but does need some updating. Fast food is close buy and is very close to parks. There is a free shuttle to disney which helps out. There is a indoor pool which is very good if the weather is not warm

title: Perfect business travel place
review: Excellent arrangements. The atrium is like a forest and interesting place. Morning buffet breakfast is very good with lot of options. Conference rooms are well maintained. Very near to all theme parksl

title: Homeland Security Coordinator
review: Valet attendant not helpful,  made my wife move vehicle during check in process (room not ready at 4pm arrival) and on the rude side. No hot water on the first morning of stay. Also for the size of the hotel not enough parking,

title: Great Front Desk Staff and Leaders
review: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel.  The Front Desk service was excellent.  Every time i needed their assistance, Amanda and her Leaders went exceeded my expectation.  Great cooked to order breakfast and outdoor pool.  hotel is located near some great restaurants and attractions.    They are planning renovations which would make this hotel even more attractive.  Thanks for the service!

title: NOISEY Rooms facing I-4 !!!
review: I stayed here 2 nights (January 24 & 25). My room was #611, while the room was ok, it was a bit worn but clean. This is an older Embassy, but all in all was in decent/good condition.  The breakfast lines in the morning are not very quick and are congested.  They need to establish a self service line away from the cooked to order line to help improve on congestion.  My main complaint however is that my room looked out at Interstate 4 and EVERY car that drove on the interstate could be heard plain as day in my room and am assuming every other room on that side of the hotel all day and all night!!  So if you are a light sleeper, request a room other than those beginning with *08 thru *14.  Regards, Loyal Hilton Honors Diamond Member

title: Needs a renovation
review: Good service but the hotel needs to be renovated. Old FF&E and has a tired look. Within walking distance to the conference center which is great. I would stay here again but if you have a choice for the money I would recommend somewhere they are putting money back into upgrading rooms.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We booked a package holiday through virgin holidays staying from 1/1/2015 to 1/15/2015  Very helpfull staff clean room although a liitle noisey from main road at back of hotel Excellent breakfast will be staying again

title: This place stinks
review: Old worn out room furnishings. Beds are terrible. Sheets & pillows are terrible. Bathrooms are tiny - plan on bruised elbows & knees. You have to climb over the toilet to get to the tub. There are a lot better options on International Drive.

title: Excellent stay!
review: The staff is amazing and the rooms very clean and comfortable! The front desk staff made our stay a memorable one with champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, even a handwritten note congratulating us on our anniversary! Amazing! Perfect location on International Drive, you can walk to shopping, dining and entertainment.

title: Highly recommended!
review: The entire staff was extremely attentive and the experience was very personalized. Staff remembered my name after not even a 24 hour stay. When you check into the room, front desk calls immediately asking if the room is up to standard and to your liking. The complimentary two hour hors d'oeuvres and drinks is a great touch! Also, the complimentary cook to order breakfast is a fantastic way to wake up in the morning! Also, if you notify the valet of where you are going, he may have a coupon to give you to save a few extra bucks! Overall, great experience and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Location Location Location
review: This hotel is in walking distance to the Orange County Convention Center and many restaurants.  There is a Walgreens 2 blocks away.  Also there are lots of great restaurants within a couple of blocks.  The Manager's Reception offered a light snack and a small free drink/beer/wine.  The morning breakfast.  If you get the hashbrowns and scrambled eggs have them cover it with plastic and microwave it so that it is hot.

title: Rooms could use upgrading but overall stay was fine.
review: Booked room thru rewards program which has "non-smoking" room requested on profile. We were given a smoking room. Had to go back to front desk, get new room, keys didn't work in door. Back to front desk to try keys again, back up to room, still don't work. Back to front desk for the 4th time-not very happy as we have been traveling all day, haven't eaten dinner and it's getting late. Desk clerk is very friendly and apologizing the whole time, she gives us keys for another room (number 3). Finally we get in (sigh). Rooms are a bit outdated, could use new carpet (lots of stains) and bed comforters. We didn't use the pool area but it did look nice. The breakfast and evening reception (snacks -like popcorn) wasn't quite as good as some Embassy we've stayed at before but we have…

title: Great Location
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I truly apologize for the mix-up upon arrival and the challenges you faced with the keys.  I can understand how frustrating that can be and I assure you that it is not a typical challenge at the hotel.  After the first occurrence, we should have escorted you to the suite to ensure you would not have to return to the Front Desk.  While we are due for a full renovation, which will take place in 2016, stained carpet and worn duvets are not acceptable.  If you have a moment, please reach out and let me know which suite you stayed in.  You may send me an email to william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you,     Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: embassy suites orlando fla internal dr
review: This Hotel is ideally located with  great restaurants on your doorstep. The staff cannot be more helpful. Breakfast is very good wide a wide selection. Only downside is that decor of rooms is dated and needs refurbishment.

title: excellent stay for Orlando visit
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience.  The team was excited to see your comments regarding their helpfulness.  The team strives to ensure the property is one of the cleanest in town and that any wear and tear is addressed in a timely manner.  However, we are due for a renovation, which will take place in 2016.

title: This hotel did not disappoint us
review: We always stay at Embassy Suites hotels when they are available. This one met but did not exceed our expectations. The complimentary full breakfast and complimentary manager's reception was good at this location but not was good as some other Embassy Suites that we have stayed at. The main desk staff was outstanding and friendly The indoor pool area was extremely nice and welcoming. The hotel is very convenient to the International Drive trolley route and multiple restaurants are within walking distance. There is free WIFI for Hilton Honors members. Free parking. Onsite restaurant - we did not take advantage of it though.

title: Great Place!
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate your experience at our hotel.  I would love to hear more about your visit and specifically about your experiences with our Complimentary Cooked to Order Breakfast and our Evening Reception.  We are always looking for fresh feedback and ideas.  You may email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: your typical Embassy Suites
review: It's not the Ritz but the staff treat you like it is. They are attentive, friendly and do a fantastic job.  Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Our room had a separate room for the bed and a flat screen TV.  [703] had a 2nd vanity/sink in the bedroom so I could get ready while my husband got showered and ready in the bathroom. The front area (living room) had a sofa sleeper, another flat screen tv, desk and a kitchen area with small sink, fridge and a Keurig coffee maker with a select of coffee and tea. Room is quiet and dark for sleeping in.  We were right by the elevator, but never heard anyone coming and going down the hallways or in and in and out of the elevator.

title: Nice room but in 2015 I should NOT have to pay for internet in a business hotel
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review.  Everyone at the Embassy Suites Orlando - International Drive South was ecstatic to see such a positive review.  We strive to deliver top notch service and feedback such as yours is always great to hear!  We look forward to welcoming you back during your next trip to the Orlando area.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great location and friendly service
review: The hotel and room were very clean and breakfast was fine - just what you'd expect from your standard Embassy Suites hotel.  I had dinner in the hotel restaurant one night.  The food was excellent but the service wasn't so great.  I suspect they were understaffed and just had difficulty keeping up.  There were about 8 tables dining and 6 people at the bar.  While there for a convention, this hotel would also work well for leisure travel as there's lots to do in the area and Disney and Universal are close by.  Overall there was nothing remarkable about this hotel, but there was nothing terrible about it either.

title: Embassy Suites - Orlando
review: Housekeeping, front desk and bell hop service poor.  Room old and worn.  Shuttle service to parks poor.  Breakfast and Happy Hour were excellent. Pool and spa were OK but could have been cleaner.  Not the best ES experience.

title: VERY Late arrival with Immediate checkin
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I would love to get more detail regarding your stay and your interactions that led to your "poor" comments.  Please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great for families
review: We were much later arriving than planned however our room was ready, keys were immediately handed to us when we walked through the door.  Our first day was a short 6 hr nap in the morning - the room was quiet and clean.  Frequently we have issues with hair in the bathroom yet this hotel was spotless.  Service was impeccable, breakfast was well prepared and abundant.  We did experience an incident with an inebriated guest with 5 rowdy kids who was aggressive and rude - the security staff was quick to correct the situation and recheck with us and another couple to assure our safety.  A very nice evening social area, relaxing pool/sauna/jacuzzi indoor spa area.  Upon entry into the area we discovered a very untidy site due to uncontrolled, wild children without parents however…

title: Excellent! I had a wonderful stay.
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  The team at the Embassy Suites Orlando - International Drive South was excited to read such a great review.  I was also happy to hear that the team assisted with any concerns that arose.  We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in Orlando.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Below Par Embassy Suites
review: We chose this hotel knowing our 2 older teens were going to universal.  It is in a perfect location, Many great resturants  right across the street (walking distance easily).  The hotel has a gorgeous yet comfortable  lobby where they serve a great breakfast (included) and an evening snack and drink 2 hrs each night.  All drinks alchohol, and soft( with some specialty drinks) were totally free!!~!~  I was amazed, and found everything for a fun evening was right there.  They have 2 heated pools , one indoor the other out, both with hottubs.  This came in handy when the weather wasn't as great.  Pools clean and well kept, and not too small.  All staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. My daughter comented "this must be a great place to work because everyone is so happy!" Amanda…

title: Looks nice from outside at least...
review: I'm going the start this review with the positives. There is only one...and that is the staff. They are all so friendly and welcoming and TRIED to help with all our complaints and requests to the best they could. Derek was always smiling and all the staff seemed lovely.  However...When we first arrived, after a 10 hour flights, we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor, as we entered the smell of tobacco hit us hard. We are travelling with children and this was not the smell i wanted them or us adults to inhale. I asked to change our room, however, this room was even worse, the toilet was not working and the smell of tabacco was even stronger (as they had given us a smoking room). But there was nothing until they could do until the morning. After breakfast (and I'll come to that…

title: find another hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  It was great to hear that you found the staff to be friendly and welcoming.  We have ensured that Derek was recognized for his efforts during your stay, thanks to this review.  With that said, I feel horrible that your 10 night stay did not go well and I truly wish I would have had the opportunity to speak to you prior to departure.  I would still love to follow up with you and ask that you email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: OK for a night
review: This Embassy Suite hotel was awful.  It took 5 requests over two days to ask for two extra blankets.  The staff members at desk kept saying "we'll send someone right up".  Dirty hotel.  Old popcorn on hallway floors for days.  Finally, on about the third day, it was cleaned.  This hotel is old and in need of renovation.  Bathroom was not clean, old paint, hair on floor and dirty tile in bathroom.  Furniture appears to be old worn.  Definitely NOT worth the money.  This hotel was one of the worst we've ever stayed at. Embassy Suites is usually worth the stay.  This hotel is NOT a good representative of the brand name.  Coffee empty every time we took our cup to the machine at breakfast.  Food marginal.  No free internet in room.  Lobby internet slow.

title: Awesome place to stay for families!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  The experiences you described are not typical of the hotel and are completely unacceptable.  I would like to speak with you about your experience if you have a few moments.  Please reach out via email to william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Embassy Suites - International Drive Orlando
review: My family and I stayed for one night right after Christmas. We had eight people in our party so we needed two rooms. Both rooms could have used an update. The shower in one of our rooms had no water pressure. The entire hotel was a little run down. The lobby is beautiful though. The front desk and housekeeping staff were all very kind and accommodating. I wouldn't recommend for the current price when there is another embassy only minutes away that is nicer for the same price.

title: okay
review: good location but otherwise not worth the cost.  hotel lobby was pretty.  wish the rooms were updated as well.  weird mish mash of décor and layout in the room. room was dank. bathroom had pubic hair everywhere.  shower was dirty. tub was clogged with a bandaid that my husband had to pull out in order for us to take a shower.  food was pretty bad.

title: Great place to stay.
review: Thank you for reviewing your experience.  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.  The bathroom you described is completely unacceptable and far from "okay".  It sounds as if the bathroom was not cleaned after the previous guest departed and that we dropped the ball. Please reach out to me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301 so I may learn more about your experience and specifically which suite you stayed in.     Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Terrible breakfast
review: Hi My wife & I stayed here back in November/December 2014 for a holiday and we both had a great time we had read the reviews on this hotel after booking the hotel so we wondered if we may have made the wrong choice but on arrival we began to realise that the reviews should only be used as a guide. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay, the suite we were given was on a high floor on the east side of the building as requested the view was great the room we found to be very clean and was cleaned on a daily basis. The following morning we went down for breakfast in the large open area in the centre of the hotel we both found the breakfast to be very good on each of the days we were there a good meal to start the day. The hotel was in a great…

title: Key West
review: I stay at over 100 hotels a year and this breakfast rates as the worst I had in the past two years. I tried it two days and boths days I could not finish it. Poor quality and  cold. Even the coffee was bad. The rooms are ok but don't try the breakfast

title: Awesome hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I truly apologize for the poor quality of breakfast.  We recently replaced some of the equipment used for our daily breakfast, which has had an impact on the food temperatures and quality.  I certainly hope we will have the opportunity to serve you again and make up for the poor breakfast experience.  If I may be of assistance, please reach out via email to william.friedrich@hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: wonderful anniversary
review: My husband and I stayed here for our 15 year anniversary. Ram checked us in. He was so nice. Congratulated us and even sent chocolate covered strawberries and white wine to our room. The room was very nice, overlooking the pool.  They offer a complimentary breakfast buffet with cook to order omlets. They also have a managers reception in the evening with some snacks and drinks. The hotel was within walking distance to many restaurants and other fun activities. They even have an indoor pool which I want to check out next time. Thank you for making our anniversary one of the best celebrated.

title: Great Location!
review: This hotel was a great location on International Drive in Orlando. The closer you are to the convention center the better! The lobby was beautiful,rooms were really clean.The breakfast in the morning could have had a few more selections. The p.m. doorman was very friendly and helpful. We had dinner at Vito's Chophouse it was wonderful our waiter Quise was excellent. We also ate at Cafe Tu Tu Tango it was also great. The most important thing to remember when staying on International Drive is to stay on convention center side.

title: one of the best hotel
review: suite is in excellent condition,breakfast is good  ,transportation to and fro from the hotel need to be improved, like a shuttle service. Over all experience is good. I will recommend this friendly environment hotel

title: Treated Like Royalty
review: I have now visited this hotel twice and will not stay anywhere else in Orlando if I can help it! The rooms are always clean and fresh, and the staff treat you like royalty. If they can help you, they will!! I was staying at another Embassy Suites with a friend to celebrate my birthday and was given a smoking room instead of a nonsmoking room. The weekend was almost ruined when I called this Embassy Suites, and Amanda was kind enough to book us into a lovely 2 double, nonsmoking. She even made me laugh about the way the weekend had started, which really went a long way towards making me feel better! She truly did save the trip!! When we walked into this hotel, it was like coming home!! Like I said, I will never stay anywhere else!!!

title: Three day stay
review: Stayed for three days here will attending convention with family.  The room was standard one, and just a bit tired, but okay.  Service was great though.  Breakfasts here were not great, but happy hour was very good.  The best part was the location, lots of restaurants and close to the center.  Price was $150.

title: Amazing will defo be back again :)
review: Amazing hotel amazing food amazing staff, love happy hour every evening with free drinks and snacks. Jacuzzi was lovely. in a great spot on international drive with the i-trolley you can get to all off Orlando's hot attractions on one easy route and bus ride. Second time i have stayed on international drive and i recommend it for everyone who wants to visit Orlando and visit all those attractions especially if you have kids. Best times to go in early June. Traveled June 2013

title: Wow
review: What an outstanding hotel, staff is awesome, the rooms are fantastic, the breakfest is one of the best I've had in any hotel, highly recommended for any stay!!!! If you are in need of a hotl for any reason in Orlando this suhould be the one to go to.

title: Nice hotel
review: We had a very Floridian experience in this hotel, the food was good, and it was clean. The rooms were a bit outdated however, and we had some issues where our air conditioning stopped working, but they sorted it out straight away. They were very hospitable and we got tickets for various attractions in the hotel. The outdoor pool didn't look like they were up keeping it, but to be fair, we did go in the middle of winter, but the indoor pool was amazing, and warm. It has a hot tub too. The hotel is in an amazing location, just minutes drive from sea world, the disney parks, discovery cove e.t.c.

title: Great
review: Liked this hotel.  Rooms spacious, clean and a huge bed.  Pool looked lovely, both inside and out.  Happy hour good and a relaxed setting.  A really good stay in all honesty and I would def stay again if given the opportunity.

title: Oh What A Night!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites located at 8978 International Drive in Orlando Florida for two horrible nights last week.  Upon arrival they gave us a room that smelled like someone urinated in it.  After complaining they changed our room to one that had an air purifier in it, which wasn't much better so again we had them change the room hoping the third time to be the charm.  Boy were we wrong.  There wasn't a smell but the room next to us had a family of at least ten, with five or six children who ran up and down the halls yelling and screaming until 2 in the morning.  We called the front desk on two occasions and they said they would send security, which I do not think they ever did.  Oh what a nightmare.  Didn't get any sleep that night.  The next morning we…

title: Stay
review: This is a good hotel. It is starting to show it's age a bit, but was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and plentiful.  On the down side, there is no free Wifi button on the WiFi log in. We were asked to buy Wifi and they would take it off our bill, as we didn't trust this situation, we didn't get WiFi. The only bad mark on an otherwise good stay.

title: Great Comfortable stay
review: I stay here twice a year for a convention I work at and I am pleased every time. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. I look forward to the trip each year. The staff are always quick to help and kind.

title: All good --
review: This is off a busy street, but convenient to a lot of the attractions and the staff is very organized and helpful.  They pay attention to details and keep up the standards you expect with this brand.  With breakfast included, and a very good breakfast at that, it makes for a great value and great start on the day.  Very comfortable, safe and secure with great ambience for unwinding at the end of a hectic day of sightseeing or business.  Left feeling well rested and prepared for another day...

title: My Daughters Birthday
review: I plan this trip for a long time, my daughter myself and her best friend stayed at this embassy suites for  three nights on November 26th, I wasn't please or happy with my stay there, the hotel need  renovation, especially , the suites interior,  the bar  and breakfast area,  the limited quantity of beverage that was available for the evening reception, poor quality of drinks offered, cheap beer and cheap vodka, I expected better !  and the breakfast area, daily breakfast was poor, the food choices could be better. pancakes were cold, coffee was poor quality and taste terrible this hotel need major over haul, I would not return to this property again.

title: Ok but be careful which room you get!
review: After several nagging issues with our usual hotel on Int'l Drive during the Christmas/ New Year's season in 2013, we looked around for a reasonably priced property within the same area to spend Thanksgiving weekend. As we were late in deciding to travel we settled on Embassy Suites. The staff at check in were quite hospitable and  worked quickly. The hotel is outdated but kept clean.  Our room was 713. FYI: if you choose to stay here please do not take a room on the roadside as there is a busy highway which passes behind the property and the noise from the road can be heard throughout the night. We tried to change rooms but all the others were occupied; so we had 3 nights of noisy traffic although we tried to block it out. NB: be very careful when transacting business at the…

title: Great Stay - Disney Trip
review: My family and I stayed here during the Thanksgiving holiday on our trip to Disney.  My wife had originally mistakenly booked a smoking room type.  At check in Jon at the front desk was fantastic, and was able to change the room type, and even ensure that we had the two rooms booked close to one another.  Much appreciated!  The hotel was a bit dated, but in great condition, and it looked like the rooms had been renovated (at least furniture for sure).  We were quite pleased with our stay, and the kids loved the hotel as well.  The area was great with tons of stuff nearby.  It was basically a straight shot on I-4 to get to Disney as well (definitely an easy trip to and from if you are driving).  We had a great time!

title: Average Embassy
review: I love the Embassy brand when traveling with family.  The bedroom is separate with the bathroom in the common area (many Marriotts the bathroom is off the bedroom.)  They have free drinks and snacks in the evening.  The breakfast is free with made to order eggs.  This hotel you have to stand in line even if you want to get the premade eggs, bacon, etc.  That part is a big time suck and I have only experienced it at two hotels - most that stuff is self serve.  This hotel was having a bad week with flooding in the indoor pool and other broken stuff, but I assume that is not the norm.  My internet is free because I'm gold - it should be free for all.

title: Will Always Stay @ this Hotel When Visiting Orlando
review: Our room was clean. The breakfast & social hour was good. The location is excellent. Most of all the staff was kind, helpful & efficient. We highly recommend this hotel & will stay here again. Mohammed Mihoubi, front desk clerk, helped us over & over again with all of our questions/requests. He is manager material!  Manager,Wendy Aylesworth, helped us secure a room for our ASHA Convention. She is awesome!  Ram King, a very patient desk clerk, helped us upon arrival. Very dedicated! Rafael Calvo & Keisha Shelby, concierges, went above & beyond by recommending restaurants, giving us directions & finding us coupons. They are wonderful! Kathy & Christian mixed us excellent cocktails every afternoon, with a smile, at "Social Hour". Christian went out of his way to get us real…

title: Not up to Embassy Suites standards
review: Loud tired old and musty about sums it up. Very friendly staff does not compensate for the conditions of the room. There are several better places to stay in that area. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

title: Excellent!
review: This was our second stay at this hotel and once again, we had a fabulous stay! I contacted the hotel in advance to request a room away from the interstate and this was arranged and when I mentioned our holiday was a belated trip for my husband's 50th birthday, they arranged a lovely surprise of wine, fruit and balloons to be delivered to our room.     Our suite was spotless (and I am very fussy) and we were treated with courtesy from the minute we arrived until we checked out. The location on I Drive is perfect (and we have stayed at other hotels in the area) for the parks, restaurants and shopping. Getting around is easy with the park  transport provided from then hotel, the trolley buses (although they do get busy) and the Lynx bus service which is easy to use and runs on a…

title: Amazing service! Amazing Location!
review: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to the Orlando area. In addition to full breakfast and the manager's reception, the service was amazing!!!  This hotel is in a great location for local restaurants and shopping, as well as the "big" amusement parks throughout the Orlando area.  A must stay!!!!

title: 72 hour cancellation policy sucks!
review: Make sure you really want to stay here before being forced to! We really did not want to stay but the 72 hour cancellation policy made us stay! Highway robbery! Never again will I stay at a 72 hour cancellation hotel!

title: Meh
review: Staff was friendly, location fine, we like the size of Embassy Suites rooms, and having breakfast is a cost savings.  That being said, some minor maintenance issues, such as slow tub drainage.  Breakfast was not up to the standard of other Embassy Suites we've stayed at - limited fresh fruit, no waffles.  However, in fairness, still way above other hotel chains that provide a breakfast of cold cereal and stale pastries.  We got a great promo rate, so a decent value for the money.

title: Nice room, nice price!
review: We stayed here for a couple of nights when we visited Universal Studios.  We were definitely satisfied with our stay and the value.  The rooms are spacious and clean, and the hotel staff was courteous.  We enjoyed the indoor pool and the complimentary breakfast which included made to order omlettes...yum. The atrium/lobby area is full of lush scenery and fountains, lots of good photo ops. We'd gladly return.  The only negatives, were that it took over an hour for us to get some extra towels for our room, and that the curtiains near the front door do not fully close so people can easily see into the living room area from the hallway.  It also seems like their chefs are a little overwhelmed with the long lines at breakfast.  The could definitely use more staff to help out during…

title: Would come again!
review: Amazing staff and very nice accomodations. Ideal location within walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc... Rooms on the interstate side of the hotel were kind of noisy. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Everything we needed and more!!
review: First we choose this hotel because of its central location to all of our Florida activities. We've stayed at many Embassy suites (in fact we select only them) this location far exceeded my expectations the up to date decor and ease of use of facilities made it a favorite for our family. With the option of two large pools, fitness center and on site eating. As far as location it is within walking distance to many establishments, however if two blocks are still too far for ya, there are several biking rickshaws that are happy to give you a lift, not certain how much they charge our ride was free and very entertaining after we tipped him out driver gave us free drink tickets and these guys are the best resources for local fun!! We will be back in the area soon, as this is now an…

title: Orlando Experience
review: My only really poor experience would be checking in. Room wasn't ready but I needed to attend a Trade Show.  They were supposed to call me when the room was ready so I could communicate with my friend that was travelling with me.  They did not call and when I called I had extreme difficulties receiving the information that I needed.

title: Very Good - but not for everyone in our group
review: Our room was clean, well-appointed, and bug-free. A/C was fine. If you need more airflow, shut the vent in the bathroom. The shower heads are really low. We enjoyed the free hot breakfast - waiting in line for the hot foods to be served to you was a small inconvenience, but it also meant that there was no buffet and the accompanying ickyness when that many kids are running around handling things. Staff was friendly.  Yeah, the place needs an update, but overall we were satisfied with our stay.  Now the bad news: We were with a college marching band and had about 12 rooms. Of those 12, the one with bugs was the leader's room on the 8th (top) floor (he was also Hilton Honors club member - so it really really didn't go over well with him). He checked the room thoroughly before…

title: A great base
review: I stayed here earlier this year with my family. Really enjoyed my stay. The staff were among the friendliest in any hotel I've ever stayed in. The complementary breakfast was very nice, as was the happy hour.  Really liked the suite, was nice having the extra space. Despite what other reviews have said I found my suite to be in good condition and everything worked. There were a few scuff marks but nothing that would put me off.  The hotel is right in the middle of International drive so there are loads of places to eat and all the parks are easy to get to. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Below average for Embassy Suites
review: Was in town for IACP conference. Location is good with plenty to do within walking distance. Staff were welcoming and very friendly. Internet was decent - parking free which was nice. This being said, the place was noisy. I was on an upper floor yet had to listen to a semi truck parked outside with generator or cooler running every night. Rooms are very run down, drains in tub nor sink would drain. There are much better alternatives in this area, I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Exceptional Staff and great quality stay!
review: Had a fantastic weekend at this hotel. Made use of all of their facilities and found everything to be in great condition, and the staff to be very very helpful including the front desk staff, Mohammed, I think. Great Complimentary Breakfast offering!!!

title: Great convention, great experience
review: Was in town for a conference and stayed here while doing so. Great experience both at the convention center which is only a mile from the hotel and the hotel itself.  Also all kinds of food and after hour establishments within close proximity.  My wife went a along and loved the indoor and outdoor pools. She also commented and the great convenience of everything.  Great staff.  Close driving distance to the major theme parks too.

title: Great time
review: This hotel is located in a pretty good spot very close to Universal. Nightlife is pretty decent and the free parking is awesome. Being an Embassy Suite you expect the separate room, cooler, free breakfast and happy hour all pluses!!! However this place is in need of remodeling specially the bathrooms I've stayed at a few Embassy Suites before and was a bit surprised. Stay away if you are a very picky person.

title: excellent hotel
review: best staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in.  Extremely friendly and professional. Will definitely stay at this hotel again for all my Orlando visits. Close to many excellent restaurants and right next door to a Dave and Buster's if you have children.  Highly recommend this hotel. Excellent suites.

title: Interesting place, good-ish, a few rough edges
review: First time I've stayed in an Embassy Suites.  This one is about a half hour drive from the airport, seems to be well located on International Drive.  I was here for a conference, not Disney, sadly. Probably nothing new to our American friends but I rather liked the idea of getting a bedroom with a living room attached.  Lots of space.  Comfy beds.  Massively effective A/C.  Free beer in happy hour (!).  An iron and ironing board - and the iron did not leak rusty water on my shirts!  Good breakfast buffet and especially the omelettes.  Staff were very helpful throughout.  Ample parking.  Then the minuses:  good wifi but do I have to pay $9.95 a day for it?  The suite was past its prime.  Lighting, especially in the living room area was very dim, not much better in the bedroom. …

title: Adequate
review: I stayed here during a conference at the convention center.  The hotel was conveniently located about a mile away and there are ample opportunities for food in the area.  Upon entering the lobby is very nice and welcoming. I was excited to get to my room. upon entering it appeared nice, but once I started to turn on lights the true colors began to show.  The one light in the main sitting area barely lights up a square foot, the microwave rocks back and forth, there is mold in the tub area (yes black mold), there was water damage on the door, it takes 15-20 minutes to get any hot water in the shower, the outlets by the bed don't work.  Aside from all these problems, the bed was comfrotable and the desk met my needs to get work done.  Overall, I think the Hampton Inn may have been…

title: Loved it!
review: We have stayed here a few times and it gets better every time. Staff is wonderful. Cooked to order breakfast is excellent as always as is the complimentary drinks and snacks in the evening. Thank for very much for the Anniversary gift!

title: Very nice and comfortable hotel, great location.
review: Stayed for business here. Very comfortable beds, friendly staff, and the best isthat breakfast is included in the price. Cooked breakfast as well as usual continental. Close to the itrolley stop and great location overall

title: Works for me because of Loaction
review: I stay at alot of Embassy Suites properties and they vary greatly. This property is in serious need of updating. Carpets, furniture etc.. all looked worn. It took nearly 20 min fo the hot water to come up to temperature in the shower. The shower was so low I needed to do the limbo to get my head under it. Im not a tall person I would say average height 5"11" to 6"0". On the good side the breakfast was very good, the hotel service was excellent, and the hotel location is also excellent for my needs, 10 miles from airport good access to highways, lots of restaurants within walking distance.  Once they get around to doing some updates this will be an above average property.  But like I said because of location I'll probably be back.

title: Nice Hotel, good value.
review: This is a nice, clean hotel with good amenities close to major attractions, restaurants and shopping. Although this appears to be a slightly older Embassy Suites the amenities are good and the property is very clean.  Rooms on front side of hotel can be a little noisy at night due to proximity of bars/restaurants across the street.

title: nice, but the smell took away the experience.
review: The room was so moldy i through i was sleeping in mushroom farm. the room is huge, and clean, the lobby is also very nice.  I didn't pay for it as it was a business trip, so i cant say much about value per money.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: I chose to stay at the Embassy Suites because I was traveling with my teenage son and his friend.  The room offered a separate TV which allowed them to play video games and not disturb me and what I was watching.  The stay also included made-to-order breakfast buffet which comes in handy when feeding two teenaged boys.   Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and accommodating.  I will be returning.

title: Surprisingly Great Service for International Blvd
review: Hotel was overall very nice. Older suite, comfy bed, hotel a little aged, but was in process of major upgrades.  Staff In all areas, front desk, maintenance, breakfast and bar, as well as housekeeping, all super helpful and polite.  Parking very reasonable.  Indoor and outdoor pools also nice.

title: 2 Day Get away
review: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Embassy Suite Orlando on International Dr. The staff was wonderful and the resort was very clean. We love the free cocktails and breakfast!! The pool and hot tub were very nice as well. The resort is located right in the middle of great restaurants, bars and attractions. We will return soon!!

title: Run down dirty hotel
review: Air conditioning does not work in room, just keeps cooling. Remote controls did not work for either TV. Decour very dated, and curtains at entrance allow everyone to look in and light to enter room. Breakfast stale and poor selection.  Tables overflowing with previous diners and no staff to clean up.  Elevators had spilt food and drink and was not cleaned up all morning.

title: business trip
review: We stayed at the hotel for a week for business and 2 days of fun. It is conveniently located. The entire staff was friendly and helpful, including maintenance. The breakfast was great but I wish that it would start earlier on the weekends. We appreciate the bartenders  who served the complimentary drinks in the evening.

title: Goes beyond expectations
review: Great Location. Wonderful and Caring staff.  Nice facilities.  12:00 pm checkout and dark rooms if you want to sleep in.   Staff went beyond the call of duty and were all friendly and helpful.   Hotel close to Convention Center, Sea World and I -4 for trips to Disney and Universal.

title: Great Hotel - Easy distance to all parks and local restaurants and bars
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites recently and it was great, excellent service, staff were very helpful, the hotel also provided a complimentry breakfast and drinks in the evening which was great.  We new about the breakfast before we went, but thought it would be more "Continental", but it was that and much, the made cooked breakfast to order, excellent quality and very convenient when you had a busy day at the Parks ahead of you.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the housekeeping staff were also very helpful and friendly.  We read some reviews on this hotel before we booked it, and some said there was issues with noise and some noted that the bed sheets were not changed daily, we absolutely no complaints regards  this at all and would not expect sheets to be changed…

title: Five days in Orlando
review: Choose this Hotel due to location, price, and Hilton points. The staff is outstanding. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The hotel is standard Embassy Suite style, but it is probably older than most. Although it was clean, you could see the place was older, with dirt in hard to clean cracks and dings on the doors and walls.

title: Business trip
review: I was extremely happy with my room at the Embassy Suites. When we inquired at the front desk as to local eateries, the desk clerk was very helpful with suggestions, also gave us directions on how to navigate the local bus route.

title: Business Trip
review: Overall the hotel is good.  Room smelled musty, old, and of smoke.  Managers reception was very good.  Complimentary breakfast had many options and rate it very good.  Walking distance from many good restaurants and nightlife.

title: Ace trip
review: We always try to stay at this Embassy, on our business trips to Orlando , its in walking distance to a lot of places to eat, also the trolley comes right by. The breakfast is great , rooms are always clean, staff does a great and the bell men are always helpful.

title: Horrible ant infestation
review: First room we were given had THOUSANDS of small ants crawling over and underneath the bedding. Second room looked ok.  However after two days our legs have hundreds of small insect bites.  Ants are dropping from ceiling into beds.  This location is an insult to hilton brand.  Z c

title: Embassy suites in Orlando
review: I love there breakfast :):) so GOOOOOD ~ and also airport transportation service is GREAT as well !!!!  I always go there twice in a year and always choose this hotel ~!!!! Love there service and very polite staff ~!

title: Excellent Work
review: My review of this hotel is excellent place to stay The surrounding of the hotel is so beautiful. I took so many pictures of just the lobby. The service was excellent. The quietness of my room was okay accept for the people over my room they made a little to mush noise at night but over all everything was excellent.

title: Horrible
review: Water was cold after one shower. Cockroach in conference room, and staff not very nice about complaints. Breakfast wad cold and terrible with tables dirty even after they said they were clean. DO NOT RECOMMEND

title: GREAT STAY AT THE EMBASSY SUITES HOTEL
review: Excellent customer service at the Embassy Suites Hotel at Orlando's International Drive is always a great experience!  The staff always makes sure that I am accommodated during my stay! :-)  Keep up the great work! :-)

title: Comfortable stay
review: Located centrally on international drive great for eating out in evening. Friendly staff, good value for money,excellent complimentary breakfast and happy hour also transfers to parks, stayed twice now, will stay again.

title: Good Customer Service
review: This is a good hotel with an excellent staff.  They work to make your experience good.  Had a good time and staff made sure it stayed good. Facility is in good shape and well maintained.  The amenities are appropriate for type of hotel. Rooms were clean and internet service worked throughout the facility.

title: Great Family Hotel
review: Clean rooms with a nice breakfast and in a great location The price was reasonable for a hotel in that location.  The pool area was very nice and clean.  Will stay there again on our next trip to Orlando.

title: Embassy Suites, International Drive, Orlando, Florida
review: Great hotel, staff really friendly. Great location, really easy to get about from here on trolley buses, taxis and public transport. Not too far from Sea World either. Free transportation to Disney World and Universal too.

title: Great experience!
review: Great Location and a great staff. Super friendly and efficient. Would stay there again in a heartbeat !! Enjoyed both an indoor and outdoor pool as well! It is evident that this hotel staff take pride in their jobs. Thanks

title: Great stay
review: We stayed here for a week of our vacation and we had a great time. Our room was spotless and the maids did a great job. The free breakfast was better than some we had payed for and the managers reception in the evening with free drinks was a great touch. The staff were very helpful and polite. The showers could do with improvement, but that wouldn't stop us staying here again.

title: Embassy
review: Overall rooms are clean.  But shower heads are low and takes a long time for hot water.  Also, set air conditioner to 62 and never cooled the room.  Staff and breakfast are good  If you are not a Hilton Honor member, you have to pay for WiFi

title: Excellent hotel, location and staff
review: We stayed in the hotel this August for 2 weeks. The location is ideal to get to the Universal, Disney and SeaWorld resorts, as well as other locations such as the Malls, and all the dining and leisure facilities on International Drive.  More importantly, all the staff at the hotel from the front desk, the valet service, the catering staff and the cleaners etc  are very polite, helpful, and friendly.  We would highly recommend this hotel for any family visiting Orlando.....a very big thank you to Diandra, Giandro, Robert, Mohammed, Rich, Maurice, Raymond, Deryck and all the other staff....Cheers, the Kaur family, Bradford, UK.

title: Nice location and clean rooms but you have to buy Wifi
review: Beds comfortable (always important), Clean and good customer service.  Check in was fast, room facing International Dr. was pretty quite. Housekeeping very personable and actually room was cleaned before noon.  Location is great for all that Orlando offers, good restaurants nearby so will stay here again when we are in town. Dish towel or Paper towels would be nice to wipe up spills on counter in living area, I hate using bath towels for those issues. The only thing that is discouraging is wifi not free except for Gold and Diamond members, which is sad when you pay over $130+ a night...Cheap hotels offer it for free, what's up?

title: Not bad for the price
review: This was a short getaway so the price wasn't too bad for the hotel.  The exterior of the hotel doesn't match the interior of the hotel.  Exterior is very nice and so is the lobby, but some of the room furnishings are a little worn.  The room was comfortable and spacious though and the bathoom was very clean. The wait at some of the restaurants in the area can be long, so we ate at the hotel restaurant.  The food was good.

title: Old but Clean
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites while attending a Truck Show at the convention center on International drive.  The location was great, we were able to walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to go, as long as we could tolerate the FL heat.  Check in was easy, and the hotel staff was pretty friendly.  The hotel and our room was clean, however, it was incredibly dated and the rooms are by no means luxurious.  The bathroom in our one bedroom suite was small.  So small that you had to walk around the door to get to the toilet and then squeeze in the bathroom to get the door shut.  As had happened in other hotels, our shower was clogged and would not drain.  For instance, after I showered, my girlfriend was forced to wade into dirty shower water in order to bathe after me.  It took…

title: Great place to stay for Disney visitors
review: Our stay was wonderful.  The shuttle service was prompt and courteous.  The location is great.  There are many restaurants close by and shopping is close by.  Complimentary breakfast was delicious.  I would highly recommend.

title: Very Good
review: Excellent service. Complimentary drinks and snacks each evening, free high speed wifi, free use of computer room and printers, very clean, staff bent over backwards to help. Only negative was the breakfast was not too hot. In house restaurant very reasonably priced, good choice and quality of food. Superb location - 10 min drive to Universal and Seaworld / Disney. 20min from airport.

title: Nice Hotel Pro's and Con's
review: I brought myself and three little ones ages 2-13 with. We had a nice sized room.  There were a couple things negative.   The morning breakfast and evening "reception" was nice.   *The couch was torn on arm rests and stained and the curtains to the room that are located by front door wouldn't close all the way so we had to use the stroller and tape from people being able to look in room as they walked past.  *There is a charge for internet except in public areas which is lobby.  However on the 5 days there it would never work for me.  I went to front desk and asked for assistance and explained I couldn't log in except for the pay area and she went through the steps with me on my tablet and couldn't get it to work either. She just said to keep trying????    Thanks for your…

title: Not bad, but not as good as other Embassies
review: Check in was a breeze. Room was great as always at Embassy Suites, service was great at front desk. Happy hour started late and there were only a few drinks to choose from that were included for free. I have never encountered this before at any other embassy suites. I just drank the house white wine bc the liquor selection was so poor. The morning breakfast was a little lacking compared to the quality we are accustomed to at ES. The pool...omg. Don't even believe the pics online. It looked a bit small in the pics but not anywhere as small as it is when you see it in person. Poor considering all the competition in that area.  The next morning we moved to Coco Key right up the street and for  $20 less per night, we had a whole waterpark and a nice comfortable room! If you have…

title: fun hotel
review: We had a great time at this hotel.  Loved the open courtyard.  At night, we could see the Disney world fireworks from our balcony.  The made to order omelets in the morning were very tasty. Convenient location-minutes from all the big attractions and convention center. Great dining within walking distance.  Bummer to pay for internet access though.

title: Great for a weekend stay!
review: My fiance and I stayed with Embassy Suites a few weeks ago for a mini getaway! We booked through a third party from our bank and it was such an easy transaction! The hotel is centrally located to literally everything you need in Orlando. We didn't venture outside of the hotel much but the amenities were great! They do have two pools, hot tub and sauna which were not overly crowded! The room itself was very clean and spacious (I found the bed super comfy along with the pillows, I couldnt find a second blanket though, but it was okay); The bathroom was a bit small but that's okay. We were upgraded up to a premium suites which was fantastic. It's the small things that make us happy! The embassy staff was overall pleasant.  It's been a long time since I have been a guest at an…

title: Our night away stay
review: My lady and I needed a break from life's struggles and Mayhem, although we only live 35 minutes away from the hotel the hotel is located in a great place for a action filled break. The restaurant inside the hotel also staffed with great people will help you to unwind with a fantastic drink. The front desk area a little dated but to be honest still beautiful. The staff were and are exceptional quality of people who are very enjoyable. We will gladly stay here many more times on our own little stay cation. You won't find a better place for the money

title: In need of a facelift
review: This Embassy is in bad need of an update. Victorian wrought iron accents all around the atrium,  paint peeling, and decor that looks 70's style.   Room is okay but the whole place just feels very dated. Could not control the temperature.

title: Very pleasant and cost effective way to visit Disney and Orlando
review: I brought my son, his wife and my two grandsons for their first visit to Disney. I rented them a suite here with two beds so they could put the kids to bed and have adult time like I did when my son was little. I rented a Premium Suite for me so I had my own space.   Both rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable. The hotel provides free shuttles to and from Disney which is great saving me the cost of a car rental that just sits most of the time. A wonderful breakfast for five saves me even more money every day. At the end of the day we order in and the big folk visit and eat at the room table while the little ones eat in front of a favorite movie.  I can't  say enough for their restaurant Fisheye Grill. They have plenty of simple food for kids with a children's menu, pizza…

title: Nice place for a seminar
review: This weekend I went to Embassy Suites for a seminar. I was very impressed by the accommodations  for the seminar. During breaks the room was attended to very well, keeping it clean, refilling if the water. The food for lunch and snacks was very good.  We also stayed overnight 2 nights. The rooms were clean but my boss did day someone came to clean the room at 5:00 pm which seemed late. But the Buffett breakfast was very good with a vast selection. They also had a lady making really cool balloon animals for children which I thought was a nice touch.  The bartender in Fisheye, Vonda was excellent. Very friendly and informative when we asked her about nearby restaurants.  Great central location.

title: Wonderful, peaceful and accomodating!!
review: We spent a 5 days in Orlando... and loved this hotel!!  Location is central, easy on and off the freeway (traffic is horrible in and around the area, so this was a key thing!).  I chose this hotel because Embassy rooms are always spacious and I enjoy having a room with a door (and kids on the other side of the door!).  Our kids are now adults and the extra space is key to a successful trip!    The staff is friendly, and went above and beyond the make sure our stay was perfect.  Amber and Wendy at the front desk were sooooo accommodating in meeting every request .... from extra pillows and blankets for the pull out bed, to tips on Harry Potter World!  The best part of the hotel was the courtyard!  Airconditioned breakfast with a feeling that you were outside in a garden!!  Eggs /…

title: Amazing stay, amazing staff!
review: Just checked out and cried as am so sad to be leaving! We had 2 weeks at this hotel and every single member of staff is an absolute credit to the hotel .We upgraded to a premium room and had a fabulous coffee machine and unlimited use of the vending machine,a godsend with 2 teenagers .the location of the hotel is fabulous , we did not have a car but the lynx and I trolly are just outside the hotel. We used the free transportation to the parks which worked great. The breakfast every morning is great, loved the oatmeal,and omelettes pancakes and fruit kept us all going on our very busy days. The outdoor pool is great , plenty of towels and shade if the sun is too strong. Can honestly say this is a great hotel, the separate bedroom and the lounge area with fridge and microwave make…

title: Gross
review: We stayed here for 1 night. ...Checked in to the hotel.The gentlemen who checked us in was wonderul, and the hotel looked beautiful. We brought our bags to our room, and went to go get an early dinner ( we had been traveling all day). After getting back to the hotel we changed and to on a quick dip in the pool.  After swimming  we decided to get a few drink for the managers reception and enjoy the lobby area. Well that did not happen...There was a very large group at the hotel with what seemed to be 100 unruly kids. There were kids standing on the counter area where the snacks go, running all around throwing popcorn,  and knocking people's drinks over. We decided we would go for a drive to get away from the mess. When we return we just wanted to shower and get to bed...again we…

title: Very Nice Place to Stay...great staff!
review: Stayed here about week ago when I took my sister to Orlando to celebrate a big birthday!  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  Their treatment from the moment I pulled up to the front door made me feel like I was at a 5 star resort!   I ordered room service the first night from Fisheye Grill and it was deicious!  Room service is always more expensive but after a day of traveling a nice quite dinner alone in the room was just the ticket!  The steak was a little over cooked (but you take that chance when you order medium well.  Though a little over cooked it was still yummy!  The room was clean, which is important to me!  The only reason I took one star off is the wait times for the reception and breakfast.  Even for the simple scrambled eggs, bacon, saugage buffett type…

title: Centralized location for many attractions
review: Our Shore Life was busy traveling again...this time for a convention and stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive in Orlando. The hotel itself was nice...clean, yet lacked flair. They did have a "manager's reception" each evening...complimentary popcorn, pretzels, and chips as well as complimentary beer, wine and mixed drinks from 5:30 to 7 pm.  The property has both an indoor pool and jacuzzi as well as an outdoor pool and jacuzzi.  I really enjoyed the included cooked to order breakfast each morning...hot omellets, pancakes, and other favorites right off the griddle.  The highlight of this stay, however...location, location, location!  The hotel is smack in the middle of International Drive. There are more restaurants, pubs, souvenirs shops and attractions within…

title: Great staff
review: Staff is wonderful at this hotel.  If you need something, they will make sure you get it!  Beds are comfortable, room was pretty clean, but be sure to request a room with an allergen filter if you have allergies.  We stayed for 3 nights at the end of July and AC had difficulty cooling the room...maybe due to the large windows in the sleeping area of the one room suite.  Breakfast service was SLOW and seating for breakfast was very limited.  When the hotel didn't seem very busy, the breakfast area was packed and had long lines for omelet station, but the omelet was good.

title: Family holiday
review: Just recently back from a 10 day stay at Embassy Suites. I was travelling with my husband and 3 sons aged 16, 14 and 10. No complaints whatsoever about hotel, everything was fantastic. Check in was very quick and smooth and we were more than happy with our suite which slept 5 very comfortably. Breakfast and evening reception were an added bonus and on a couple of days we were able to bring breakfast up to the room as boys were having a lie in. Lobby and atrium were very nice and comfortable areas to sit in. Hotel has an indoor and outdoor pool area which is quite quiet, well kept and an ample supply of towels.  Hotel is in a perfect location, surrounded by great, very reasonably priced restaurants and a Walgreens just up the street. There is an I-ride stop right outside hotel…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Very satisfied with our experience.  This hotel is very clean.  They have a very friendly staff and it was in a very conveniently located to everything.  This was our third time staying at this specific hotel and we will definitely stay here again.  On check out day, since we were not in a hurry, it was really nice to have a noon checkout.

title: Perfect location and great price
review: Why pay crazy money to stay at Disney?  This hotel is perfect for families headed to universal or disney.  There are dozens of restaurants nearby and numerous attractions, and we saved enough on this stay alone to pay for multi-day entrance tix to competing parks.  Breakfast is included, what a steal!

title: embassey suites orlando
review: The hotel was excellent.The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and the food was good. It is in a good location being walking distance from a wide variety of restaurants and ha good transport links to all the theme parks

title: Good Value but ,..
review: I'd booked this room a couple months in advance for a special occasion as part of a trip with my wife. I thought Embassy Suites were really nice places, but the room we were giving was a little worn out and needed a better cleaning. They gave us another room after we complained (their only other available room) and it was not much better. It wasn't a big deal to me but there were a couple pubic hairs under the toilet seat and my wife was grossed out. We ended up leaving the hotel and found somewhere else. The hotel refunded the normally "non-refundable" hotel points I had used to book (they were good about that). I ended up using the "hotel tonight" app to find a really night hotel room for only slightly more money with their last minute rates and their HOTEL_TONIGHT promo code…

title: Just Ok.
review: This is a older hotel but nice. I was there on a Fri & Sat and it was so busy....evening reception had a longggggg line, but the bartenders were great and were serving with a smile. Breakfast was the same long lines and very crowded but there were employees everywhere and they were all very helpful, and breakfast was delish!. This hotel has an indoor pool,jacuzzi, and sauna and also an outdoor pool and jacuzzi and what appeared to be little kiddie pool which was very shallow.The deepest point was I think 4/5 ft or so? I expected a little bigger and deeper. The rooms were decent but I did not the bathrooms vanites were a little worn. < Not the usual at an Embassy. My room was on the side facing I-4 and it was noisy but i wasnt bothered by it but if your a light sleep ask for a…

title: Overall Good, but could have been better!
review: Let me start by saying this wasn’t the worst hotel experience I’ve had, but there was a lot that could have been improved upon that would have made it exceptional. I originally had booked a AAA rate of $170/night, but a few days before we left I happened upon an internet ad for a lower rate and called and got it for $125 instead. For this price, we think it was an good stay, if we had paid $170, not so much.  Overall Pros:  Location convenient on International Drive, easy/free parking, very nice staff, free food/drinks for breakfast and evening reception, large room (with door between the 2 areas).  Overall Cons:  They seem to be understaffed, in need of better organization for the breakfast and evening reception hours. The service/cleanliness of the room was inconsistent. …

title: great hotel
review: this hotel is in a great location. we were able to walk everywhere . the evening management happy hour was great. we went with 3 other couples and a the best time. this hotel was both indoor and outdoor pools and hot tubs.plus you get a cooked to order breakfast .  great place to stay.

title: Very Satisfied
review: First off, I would like to say I am extremely impressed with every staff member at this hotel! Every person I encountered (whether they were front desk, maintenance, housekeeping, waiters, cooks, or bar staff) were amazingly friendly. I always got a good morning or good night, have a great day, or how are you! I was honestly shocked with how friendly and courteous every single person was.  Customer service was an A+ rating.  Breakfast was delicious (omelets, bacon, donuts, apples, and oatmeal were my favorite). I was just very pleased with this place.  The bedding and living room areas were spacious and clean, but the only minor issues were that the couch was torn in a spot and our curtains didn't fully cover our window (which wouldn't have been an issue, but the little kids…

title: Great hotel in the middle of evrything
review: Had a great stay here at the hotel. Staff very polite and always greet you morning and night with a smile. Great the way you have complementary bar for 2 hours every evening after a long hard day in the parks. Yes the decor is a little bit dated but do you really care when your only in the room for a few hours a day. Lovely comfortable big bed fresh linen and towels every day,what more do you want, would recommend this hotel no probs,and we will definitely be back. Great place

title: Great location
review: Recently stayed here with my husband and 21 yo daughter very nice hotel, clean and spacious as it was a 2 room apartment. Complimentary breakfast every day as well as drinks and nibbles from 530 nightly. In a great location with many many restaurants to choose from as well as the bus situated right across the road for $2 per person it takes you to both the premium outlets. Staff very helpful behind the desk, although not over enthusiastic at the bookings counter for the parks and Disney etc.

title: Disappointed with quality
review: We stayed in this facility for two days.  Both days we had no hot water. Breakfast was minimal with all the bread items stale. The air conditioning sounded like a 747 taking off and we could hear noises from the street and all around the hotel.

title: ok embassy
review: stayed for 2 weeks. furniture as most hotels a bit dated.but more than made up for by great service, lovely & friendy staff,and a good breakfast, served by cheerfull and good chefs. we have already booked for next year. excellent location and travel to theme parks.

title: motel rat trap with bad food
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and felt that you received great service.  Your review will be shared with the entire team this week.  We look forward to welcoming you back next year.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Edwards family had a great time at this Embassy!
review: a camping tent would have been better, the food was just awful, the staff surly, the rooms smelled, they did not charge the agreed upon rate, carpets never vacuumed, breakfast featured old rubber eggs and warm sliced fruit

title: Typical but slightly subpar
review: We stayed at Embassy for 3 nights over 4th of July! International Dr is a hot spot and it's right in the center. Señor Frogs is right across the street and so many other great places. Dave and Busters is right next door and Olive Garden. We had a blast while there. The rooms are spacious and the interior is very pretty! Best part is the reception for 2 hrs! Wow they made some great drinks. Lenox was a great bartender and such a nice guy. Jose the maintenance guy swapped out a pool lift for my son. He has MD and can't get out of the pool without assistance. The battery was broke and Jose pulled in another lift to safely get our son out of the pool. He deserves a promotion in my book. He said he's been there 10 years. He was amazing! Bill Friedrich made all our accommodations for…

title: Very comfortable
review: I agree this hotel is showing its age to a degree, yet the lobby area has been just recently updated and does look great. Overall is it still a class place. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. It is really nice to have a fridge and micro available.
