On Sat & Sun am the complimentary breakfast was quite busy as you can imagine yet the 5 of us were able to secure a decent table and patiently wait through the omelet and express lines. You can grab typical continental stuff pretty quickly though. The hot food was very good and worth the lineup.  Several restaurants directly across the street give you many food options within a short walk. We didn’t try the Fisheye Grille but would like to next time.  The bonus for the whole stay was Amber at the front desk that made us…

title: Embassy Suites near Orlando Convention Center
review: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Disney parks. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. Our room had a musty smell that never went away, but the accommodations in the room were adequate. All the rooms open inside to an interior courtyard. There are glass windows on each side of the door. There are heavy drapes that can be drawn to cover the windows, but there is a bit of a gap between the edge of the window that cannot be fully covered by the drapes. This does not allow for full privacy of the room - and if you have someone sleeping on the sofabed....I used the two foot stools in the room to pin the curtains against the door frame. This helped close the gap. They should really have some kind of velcro or hook closure option here.  The complimentary breakfast…

title: Great Hotel for Family
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  It was great to read that you enjoyed the cooked to order breakfast we provide.  I was also happy to read that you felt the property was clean and that the team was friendly.  In regards to the curtains covering the front windows, we have heard this from other guests and we are working on solutions to alleviate the gap.  We are working out the details of a renovation next year and I have requested that we frost the windows on the front side of the suites.  In the meantime, I have ordered magnets to apply to the curtains that will allow our guests to secure the curtains tightly to our metal door frames, which will help greatly.  On another note, I would like to know which room you stayed in so that we may investigate the musty smell in the suite.  Please reach out to me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  We look forward to welcoming you back when your travels bring you to Orlando again. Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Lovely place to stay.
review: The hotel was clean and comfortable. It was very busy but I never felt crowded even when using the pool areas. The free breakfast was outrageous, quite a spread with plenty of options for everyone. The location is perfect, close to all the key attractions and plenty of restaurants, etc.

title: Tired old hotel
review: Quiet peaceful hotel with good facilities and pleasant staff. The free breakfast is of good standard and enjoyable. If you don't want wait for your breakfast head down earlier. The pools are lovely and the towels are provided. All in all not a bad hotel.

title: Would not come back!
review: I read the other reviews before I booked and should have paid closer attention to a few things that were mentioned. First, the breakfast line is 20-30 minutes long and if you're patient enough to wait in the line, you will likely not be able to find a table.  It's very unorganized and chaotic.  Rather than having stations of various food like a typical buffet, there's one massive line for all the hot food and it's crammed in a corner...I think they want to deter people from eating here.   It's a nightmare.  Second, at 9am this morning, we heard what sounded like someone screaming about disney promotions right outside of our room.  We finally figured out that there was a DJ in the parking lot, just below our room, who had speakers on his car and they were facing the hotel.  We…

title: Family Vacation
review: Thank you for sharing your experience.  Our goal is to provide a top notch experience and we clearly dropped the ball during your visit when it came to the pool towels and Food & Beverage.  I am working with our new Food and Beverage leadership on ways to improve the breakfast service during the busy summer months and it is feedback such as yours that helps us continuously improve.  We have also been monitoring the premium floor vending machine more closely to ensure that our guests have a seamless experience.  In regards to the Disney DJ, we are a partner and they send out a "Rock Your Disney Side" Team on Saturdays during the summer to entertain our guests.  I have spoken with our Front Desk about communicating this better to ensure that it is not an unwanted wakeup call.  With that said, I would love to speak with you about your stay.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Nice place for the money
review: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. the price is excellent for a full breakfast and evening reception each day. The kids loved having an indoor and outdoor pool. Being able to see fireworks from our room was an unexpected bonus.

title: Very Well maintained hotel for thirty years old
review: We just returned from our trip. We stayed at the embassy suites from 6/28/14 to 7/2/14. Yes the hotel is dated. They are however updating it. While we were their they were doing a lot of landscaping. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts which were very good. We found to get their a bit early between 7:30 am to 8:30 am worked well for us. The evening reception is good as well. Nice touch on their part. We also did the shuttles which worked out fine. It is within walking distance. We did go over to bahama breeze one night which is right across the street. Also Senor Frog's and many others five minute walk. Rooms are cleaned daily. Staff is very nice. Did not encounter anyone rude. A thanks to Derrick at the evening reception. Very polite. Only downside, out by the outdoor pool…

title: Great stay!
review: I was so impressed with the quality and the maintenance of this hotel that I had ask how old it was. I was told 30 years.  To think of how many people probably travel in and out of this hotel weekly. Great job of keeping up this property from the landscaping to the atrium to the rooms very well done. Also as usual great food and spacious rooms.

title: Business Trip
review: Your typical Embassy Suites which is above your average hotel. I always enjoy the breakfast cooked to your order and Manager's reception. Close to lots of restaurants and clubs, walking distance. Bus stop right out front. Free self parking.

title: Beautiful hotel with a perfect location
review: I loved staying at this Embassy suites.  I was there to attend a conference at the Orlando Conference Center.  The hotel was in walking distance to many restaurants and even to local attractions (WonderWorld and Ripley's).  I did also walk to the conference center twice.  It's about a 15 minute brisk walk.  The only issue I had was that there is not shuttle offered to and from the airport.  Obtaining a Taxi was suggested by the hotel and I felt unsafe and was not happy with the $46 Taxi fee.  If I were to stay again at this hotel, I would've arranged either a rental car or limo pickup.  If there was an airport shuttle I would have rated the hotel "Excellent" instead of "Very Good".

title: Excellent
review: We have been comming to this hotel for the past six years, and have just booked our seventh. The hotel maybe in need of some work, but it is clean, friendly caring staff, good food, great location, fantastic room size, great pools. I would and have recommended this hotel to several people. Like most things we all get older and need a bit of work now and then. Can't wait to come back. Thanks Ryan and Jose you guys are great.

title: Very good hotel
review: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  The lobby and food area are so beautiful and makes me feel happy.  It was clean and neat. The staff are very friendly and helpful.  The only thing I would say negative is the bathroom needed a little updating and the room felt a little dank.  But it was very clean and comfortable.  The bedroom furniture was great and beautiful. The TV screens were great!  the location where we stayed was perfect.  There are so many restaurants across the street and places to walk to.  The hotel is right on the but/trolley line.  Shuttle service to different entertainment spots is free and the times they offer were great!

title: Nice Hotel-But
review: The fire alarm went off at midnight.  Apparently there was an electrical fire out by the pool so they evacuated the hotel as a precaution.  The evening reception was nice and the complimentary breakfast was good.  Good location for sea world or universal.  Lots of restaurants around the area.  Nice hotel overall.

title: Fanstatic place to stay
review: We have just had a 2 week holiday here.  The room decor may seem a little dated but that is such a small thing when you consider how enormous the rooms are and the seperate sitting area was a real bonus.  The rooms were always clean and the beds really comfortable.  The free bar was great and most the staff really friendly which made the whole stay so much more enjoyable.  We did get a bit fed up though of queuing at breakfast some mornings and struggling to find anywhere to sit and eat.  The hotel is in an ideal location such a short drive to the popular tourist attractions and plenty of shops and resturants to walk to in the evening.  I would defientely recommned it and go back.

title: No luggage racks
review: I just arrived at the hotel to find out that they don't have enough luggage racks for the rooms. The front desk told me that they are thinking of buying more.  So if you are driving to this hotel stop and purchase your own luggage racks.  And also there isn't a safe in the rooms either.

title: Nice stay
review: Very comfortable beds. An extra sink in the bedroom which made the morning routine go faster for the 3 of us. We took advantage of the evening cocktail hour and the complimentary breakfast, both of which were a good value.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Awesome Hotel, Great Service, Nice Rooms with plenty of room.  Will definitely stay here on my next visit to Orlando.  I stayed in a Premium Suite and felt like I was in a Presidential Suite.  If you want a safe and friendly place to take your family, look no further.

title: Great location, that's it.
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  All of us here at the Embassy Suites Orlando – International Drive South / Convention Center were excited to read such a great review and we are truly delighted that you enjoyed your visit with us.  We look forward to welcoming you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Better than I expected!
review: I was nervous about staying here after reading many reviews ahead of our visit but I was pleasantly surprised! Here are my pros/cons:  Pros: -Beautiful lobby/atrium which was a great place to sit in between meals, etc. -We were allowed to check-in 2 hours early without any hassle -The suites are very spacious, comfortable, and VERY clean -Nice view from our room, which faced I-drive -Small amount of noise from bars that are way across a 4-lane street (I-drive); not bothersome at all and I'm a light sleeper -Wonderful, plush beds -Housekeeping cleaned our room early every day and did an excellent job -Nice having a separate living area from the bedroom for family members to spread out -Sink and vanity in every room -Fridge and microwave saved money on food (we were able to eat…

title: Being refurbished, but excellent anyway!
review: Although the hotel is currently being refurbished (the lobby was completed while we were there), the rooms, while obviously needing an overhaul, are spotlessly clean and comfortable. The staff are without exception friendly and helpful and the facilities such as the indoor and outdoor pools ensure kids can amuse themselves quite happily while taking a break from the theme parks. When not dining out, a perfectly good meal (and drink) can be had at the Fisheye Grill, in addition to the Manager's Reception when free drinks and nibbles are served each evening from 5:30 to 7:30. There are also free shuttles to all of the local theme parks, including Disney. Highly recommended!

title: Wonderful Staff but the hotel room has been around the block a few times.
review: The staff was very courteous and competent.  I was late for breakfast one morning and they re-opened the kitchen to serve me.  Any problems I had with the room were taken care of promptly.  Maid service was thorough.  Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful.  However- the room had definitely been around the block a few times.  There was a leak in the building, and the hot water kept being shut off (and then not turned back on).  My room smelled a bit stale.   The hotel is in walking distance of tons of great restaurants, bars, and shopping.  You can walk to the conference center, or take a short bus ride there.

title: Excellent location, nice size rooms
review: Stayed here recently for a convention and traveling with the family. I have stayed here before.  You can't beat the location on I Drive, many restaurants and attractions are walkable. Lobby renovation was completed during my visit, looked very nice.  This is the older style Embassy with the large interior courtyard in the center.  I love the look of it, very old Florida style,  Typical breakfast and managers reception, which was greatly appreciated.  The rooms are very spacious and slept my family of five easily.  Housekeeping was very friendly and accommodate my wife request to makeup the room early so the baby could nap.   The ticket/concierge desk is a great convenience and offered great recommendations and coupons.   A few negatives...  The AC doesn't push enough air to the…

title: Favorite Hotel Embassy Suites.
review: Love embassy suites. I prefer to stay at any embassy suites hotel, because of their free cooked to order breakfast, and evening reception.  Ive stayed in other hilton hotels and Embassy is far the best out of all of them.

title: Disappointing
review: This has always been my favourite hotel to stay over the years but this time it has gone down hill. The lobby entrance is undergoing a facelift, I don't why it was one thing I liked about it when you walked in. I booked a premier suite nothing special about it other than a better coffee maker  access to unlimited snacks and free wi fi. which I had to ask for the code as it was not given to me at the time of check in. Very noisy room by the road. One of the staff did advise me the rooms are going to be upgraded next year.   Breakfast was average. Its centrally located on International drive and convenient for restaurants, mini golf, shopping etc

title: Older hotel
review: Hotel was ok at best. Very outdated for an embassy suites. I have always been happy staying at the embassy, but this time it was just average. I recommend staying at the embassy down the street which seems much newer. Not worth the price we paid.

title: Good location
review: I recently stayed at this hotel for business. I attended a conference at the convention center. The hotel has clean, nice sized rooms. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The location was good for restaurants and bus stop. To me, it was just a little too far from the convention center to walk to it.  It's about 2 miles. I would definitely stay there again. Lastly, being a female traveling alone, I felt very safe.

title: Not really sure whats going on here
review: Stayed here for 5 nights. There was some construction going on in the lobby entrance shrouded by black curtains ; i guess there is not much we can do about that . The lobby is just weird ; all tiled like its outdoors with big old plants and everything in terra cotta. The tiniest frint desk ever (which may have because of the construction admittedly. Breakfast was poor. Positives ; the suite was very clean and had everything one could need. The door to each room is flanked by large windows looking onto the hallways which again is just weird. The gym was pretty good if small through ; actually had  few free weights and was clean and tidy.  The front desk staff were lovely as was the concierge. The breakfast staff looked less than pleased to be there. Overall ; this is one of those…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Thank you for sharing your experience.  I was happy to read your comments regarding the front desk team and concierge being "lovely".  I was also excited to read that you felt the suite was clean.  We performed a refresh of the lobby seating area and the front desk in May and June, which is why you saw the curtains upon entering the hotel.  The small front desk was indeed temporary.  We are currently working on renovation plans for the guest rooms, which will take place in late '15 or early '16.  With that in mind, the team works daily to perform maintenance on the suites and ensure our guests experience the best product possible.  We hope when your travels bring you back to Orlando, we will have the chance to serve you again.  Feel free to reach out to me directly for assistance in choosing a top notch suite.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Solid hotel
review: This Embassy Suites is what you'd expect -- except, it is under renovation! We enjoyed watching the progress (in only 4 days) and regretted not seeing the completion of the project. The staff is beyond helpful and professional. Every - single - person --- from housekeeping, to the pool attendant, to engineering, etc. was so helpful and genuinely seemed happy to see us / work there. We enjoyed our stay. Good location and fine hotel!

title: Needs some renovation
review: Stayed here for a conference last week - decent value. Manager's reception & breakfast are great! Mohammed at the front desk was also excellent. Internet service was spotty. The bathrooms also needed some work. I had to take a cold shower one morning because hot water was not available. Plus, the tub did not drain as you showered (gross). Our phone did not work either. Several phone calls to the front desk did not resolve this issue.   Pool area is great and workout facilities were adequate. Great location.  Probably won't stay there again, though, if it weren't for a conference.

title: needs remodeling and friendlier staff
review: lobby is being renovated but was not mentioned during reservation. hotel is in desperate need of remodeling, staff could be more friendly. Breakfast was good and is included. they overcharged me, so i had to go to the lobby (just one desk due to renovation). they corrected it but not even one word of being sorry about it. do not recommend this hotel for this rate. date rate was $ 184 and included strawberries and "champagne" which was one cheap sparkling white wine...

title: Hotel good but needs investment
review: Breakfast was always good, hotel staff always friendly and the location is ideal. The iTrolley is great for getting around. Only let down was the lack of lifts in the building, should of had 4, only had 1 working.

title: "Maket It Right Program" Really Helped
review: I have stayed at this hotel three times over the years. I had two minor glitches during my most recent stay. Hotel staff quickly apologized, corrected the problems, and issued me credits for dinner at the hotel restaurant. Nice recovery!

title: It's all about location...
review: Yes I-Drive is the place to be, the location is great.  The breakfast and manager's receiption are good too.  But if you are a light sleeper the Interstate traffic is 24/7 and will keep you from getting a good night's sleep.  Caution if you are sleeping on pull out couch...find something to push up again the curtains to stop people from seeing into your room!

title: "Graduation Trip to Orlando"
review: My mother and I recently visited Orlando, on Mememorial Day weekend, for my niece's high school graduation. Upon arrival to the hotel, I was greeted by Lee, the Bellsman, who helped us with our bags by taking them up to our room and provided us helpful tips regarding the hotel. Upon entrance to the assigned room, I did a walk through and noticed the room was very cleaned and organized with all amentities. didn't make it in time for the Evening Reception on the first day, I did get a chance to attend on the second day. The guy who was in charge of the complimentary drinks on Friday evening (5/23/14), was very nice and fast-paced, even though he had a long line waiting. Alma, who was my housekeeper was very nice and cleaned our room just as we specifically asked. However, I was…

title: Orlando trip
review: Stayed here with a school group for 6 days. Let me start with the negatives. This hotel is a bit dated and needs updating. All the kids (ages 9-12) agreed. This was the ONLY complaint and is the reason why I am not giving them an excellent rating. Every other aspect of this hotel is wonderful. The rooms are large with plenty of space. Housekeeping did a marvelous job of cleaning up everyday (our kids were messy). Everyone in the group enjoyed the hot complimentary breakfasts and the cocktails on the days we were able to make it. Usually out all day in the various parks. Staff in the dining area super friendly. Lines for cook to order omelettes could be a bit long depending on the time you get there. You can also come down and take your breakfast up to your room if you prefer.…

title: we loved this Hotel
review: We loved this hotel ... all the staff were so friendly .. the rooms were clean, the breakfast's were great with lots of choice .. we made the most of the Managers reception ..Location on I drive was good just outside the hotel was the i ride trolley stop .. over the road were some fab reseraunts and a walgreens pharmacy .. we will be going back here.

title: Tired hotel
review: This hotel was in need of renovations. The health club was small with limited equipment, and the on-site restaurant had a very limited selection. OK for the price, but not a place I would have chosen; the conference assigned the room.

title: Customer Service Oriented
review: We usually stay at an Embassy Suites hotel because of the great value the brand name offers its guests.  In addition to the spacious suite, exordinary made to order breakfast, the staff at the front desk were awesome.  One woman in particular really extended her services by locating a minister on short notice for us.  It was really a nice experience to see someone so eager to help without being prompted.  Thank you!

title: Below average Embassy Suites
review: I am a loyal Embassy Suites patron, when possible, I'll stay there when travelling for business or fun...but probably will not ever return to this location. Pros: The staff was very, friendly and helpful, and,  The location is convenient to convention center and dining/entertainment.  Cons: This place is the the least appealing ES I've ever stayed at: - run down, older.. security lock is dangling on door about to fall off, doors, walls and carpet is worn.  The front door has sen better days, I don't feel too secure, and probably would not want to stay there if I were a lady travelling alone.   - The remodeling (during stay) of lobby should have included the rest of the place.. they are updating fixtures, and I can see why.. I had a hard time finding an electrical outlet THAT…

title: Just ok
review: Location was great, check in was fast, but however no hot water in the shower, having to pack up everything and move to another room with 4 people was not good, after leaving one og the theme the parks. the breakfast was excellent.

title: Great Location, but aging facility
review: This is my second visit to this hotel and my group declines in many areas. The location is superb,and we all liked the Happy Hour , the pool and the well stocked gift shop for snacks etc. We found the rooms need updating, and the elevators were quite slow (possibly due to cleaning staff using same elevators). My room was noisy from highway noise, and hated that the internet required new log on each time. The hot water was inconsistent at all dayparts and many complained the shower was only usable for people under 5'2". Personally I did not like the bathroom being accessed from the living area rather than the bedroom, but that seems to be varied in this hotel. The hotel uses contracted taxi's that are more expensive than normal taxis so beware.

title: Better choices available
review: Poorly maintained and quite noisy rooms mean that there are better hotel choices available in the area. Although the communal areas (lobby and grounds etc) look nice, the rooms themselves are dated with very poor soundproofing from the atrium, adjacent rooms etc. The (two) pools are remarkably small (fine for kids splashing, but not for swimming) and compare unfavorably with other properties.

title: Embassey Suites, International Drive, Orlando
review: If your looking for somewhere in the heart of International Drive, Orlando then this hotel is it! Everything about the hotel is good. Hotel is friendly. Rooms are tidy and breakfast buffet is good. They even throw complimentary drinks and food every evening.  We will be staying there again.

title: Quite Poor
review: The room was not cleaned properly - toiletries were not replenished, Coffee was not replenished, used glasses were not cleaned. Dirty plates were left in front of the room for 2 days until the left over food was all dried up and smelly.   The indoor pool was not heated at all and was super cold

title: Best for your money
review: There are nicer hotels to stay at, and hotels far below this, but for your money this hotel is great. The rooms are very clean, service is great and free breakfast and drinks is a great touch. The room is very large with a separate work space and couch.

title: Just a good location.
review: Stay on Embassy Suite for a week on a Family Vacation April 2014.   Room The room needs  a major remodeling. Old furniture, stain carpets and musty odor. The sofa bed with the thinnest mattress I have ever seen. When the front desk was contacted regarding the mattress, they sent us a thin sheet to resolve the problem....what a joke!  Bathroom No hot water! Front desk was contacted. They said it was fixed and it was for few minutes, then the same problem again during the whole week. How they resolved it? With a $15 voucher on the restaurant. They offer to move us from our room the day before we were leaving.  Breakfast Breakfast was good. You need to wake up early to find a table.   Laundry Area Just one washer and dryer per story. It cost $2.25 per drying cycle and don't expect…

title: Expected More
review: Being a Hilton Honors members and staying at other Embassy Suites, I expected more from this hotel than what I got. The staff was very nice and helpful. My room however was smelly and the bathroom had mold around the tub. You could hear other people through the walls.

title: Woderfull Place to get Top Service
review: My Family had the Best stay and Service from the Staff. Very clean and easy to get to anywhere you need to go. Breakfast was very good and the Atrium is great, would like tohave seen some COI fish by the Water falls.

title: Family Gathering
review: My family had a total of five rooms for spring break vacation. This hotel was awesome. I spoke with the reservation manager Alison on several occasions prior to our arrival. She along with the other staff members were very friendly and courteous to my family. The location was awesome - there were several restaurants and a Dave and Buster nearby which provided other options of things to do. I would definitely recommend others to vacation here. GH

title: Great Location Horrible Staff
review: The location was great for us, the room was decent (except for the a/c which was broken), the staff was horrible!!! We informed them that we have a 1 year old baby and the a/c isn't working...we will be leaving for a few hours so they can send a technician to the room to fix it...4 hours after we got back the a/c was exactly as we left it! Upon returning I asked the lady at the front desk if it was fixed she said "the technician never contacted her back so she assumed it's fine now". When we returned to the room I called the front desk and Alan answered the phone he said the guy was up there...my response was I am sure he was up here but he did not fix it and I have a 1 year old who is fast asleep now.....Then he goes on blabbing "oh but we asked him to come and check it" …

title: Great hotel
review: This is a great hotel with a great location. The staff is excellent. The free breakfast is a real plus and the complimentary evening drinks are great too. The location on International Drive is great because it is right across the street from many restaurants. I like that it is a suite with a separate bedroom.

title: Would stay here again
review: Nice hotel, though the rooms could do with some updating. The breakfast was great with cooked to order omlettes and eggs and all the other usual fare. Friendly, helpful staff, although at time the wait staff and bar staff were very busy. It is located within easy reach of all the main theme parks and within walking distance of lots of places to eat and drink.

title: Embassy Suites, International Drive, South, Orlando
review: Rooms set on a number of floors around a central atrium. Rooms clean and perfectly adequate.   No free wireless internet access in rooms (free on computers in lobby, otherwise $10 per day) Staff very helpful and friendly. Complimentary birthday cake for daughter was very much appreciated.  Complimentary cocktails and snacks in evening. Cooked breakfasts great - cooked to order. Buffet breakfast extensive too. Outdoor pool basic but adequate

title: Expected more from the outfit based on location, price and asset
review: The hotel is nice, however, it shows its age. With the price of the rooms the wifi charge are like nickle and diming of the customer. Breakfast buffett needs lot more organization and quality improvements is much desired for both food, arrangements and the general service to the customer. Same thing applies when it comes to the happy hour. not many there to serve, so the line ups are long and one would get tired of standing in line to get served in a small plastic cups. The rooms are nice, however, the room service could be as late as 6pm (as we were told by the desk).  I would look for another property in future.

title: Decent, but needs some work
review: I recently stayed 4 nights in this hotel for a business trip and trade show.  The building really needs to be updated. They need to add staff at the bar restaurant, as there was only one person to act as bartender and waiter, and so people waited for long periods for service.  One of the people in my group said that his room was not very clean.  My room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Would Definitely Stay Here Again if in Orlando
review: Good location, just a couple minutes to the highway connecting Universal and Disney. Very close to Universal, 5 minute drive at most. Hotel is a very typical Embassy Suites, we have stayed in a dozen other locations and overall this location didn't disappoint.   Staff, great front desk ladies were very friendly and especially the breakfast staff, they were great. Keeping up with a few hundred rabid tourists is a chore and they did it near perfect.  Rooms were just fine, clean, ours wasn't worn down at all, may have been updated recently, we didn't notice any wear in room 204. Overlooked outdoor pool also. Didn't hear any highway noise from this room, which faces south.   Pool and public areas were clean and attended too often.   We would stay here again and recommend it to…

title: Great hotel for Family visits to Orlando!
review: Went on a two week holiday with my son to Orlando to do all the parks & the hotel is situated perfectly on International Drive - equidistant from Universal to Sea World etc. They do free shuttles to Disney / Universal every day, with multiple times for early risers & late lie in folks + also collect you to come home at a few time slots as well, which is just great. The staff are always helpful & big shout out to "Raymond", the best bellman on the planet - who was brilliant & made my son + me feel so welcome. The breakfast is cool & you can get omelette's made to your own spec + always great to have two TV's in the room & a fridge / microwave etc. All in all its a great place to stay & would recommend to anyone doing the Disney thing :)

title: Reasonable place to stay
review: Convenient to the convention center. Lots of eating places in close walking distance. trolley service to Sea World and Aquatica. Also trolley service to two large outlet malls. Clean and comfortable. Good breakfast.

title: Always a fantastic stay
review: We feel in love with your staff and hotel when we first came in February.  We just had our second stay and brought the in laws as well. I can't tell you enough how much we love it here. Our son lives in the pool, the parents enjoy some complimentary drinks and finish the night at the restaurant. We are planning on coming back in a few months...we are a military family and choose you over shades of green anyday! Thank you so much for the great times and amazing staff.

title: Pretty good
review: The rooms are nice but slightly outdated. Overall the staff was nice. The breakfast wasn't that good because there wasn't that much variety. I would give it five stars if they updated the rooms a little bit and improved the breakfast.

title: Nice Staff, Good Location, some improvements could improve overall stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  It was great to read that you felt the staff was nice.  We will be updating the decor in our lobby and at the front desk this year.  We are planning a full renovation of the atrium and guest floors for 2015, with dates still to be determined.  We hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Out of date and over priced.
review: The staff here was very nice, hats off to the bellman and also to the in room dining staff. Excellent location, easy to walk to restaurants and local attractions. Close proximity to convention centers. The rooms at this hotel should be a little cleaner and the noise factor and the pool exceeded pool hours.

title: No Hot Water & other issues
review: Staff is fine, location is great.  Major problems with hot water.  I was there for 7 nights and tolerated multiple luke-warm showers as did other guests.  Sometimes the water was reasonably hot but whenever it was time for a shower in the morning or evening after a run, nothing.  They gave me vouchers for the restaurant twice after I complained.  Even offered to take off a night's stay from the bill but I was not interested in harming their business.  I am a Hilton Gold Honors member and travel a lot.  This was far and away the worse experience overall.

title: Not so good
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  It was great to read your comments regarding the staff both on TripAdvisor and via the Hilton survey that you completed.  It was also good to hear that the team offered service recovery in the form of vouchers and a complimentary night in an effort to make it right.  However, I was disappointed to read that you experienced a lack of hot water on multiple days and that we ultimately failed to correct the underlying issue.  I understand how frustrating a lack of hot water can be, as it is one of the basic expectations when traveling to any hotel.  I have emailed you personally to follow up on the stay and hope we have an opportunity to chat further.     Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Stay! Small Unavoidable Issue Handled with Class
review: Smelly room and obviously needed some maintenance attention. Staff was very nice but room was above restaurant and when it was open smell rose and was very sewer like. Pillows were like rocks. Beds ok. A little dark and dingy atmosphere.

title: Great Experience
review: I was checking out of another hotel and into this hotel on the same day my wife was enjoying a spa treatment. Trying to juggle all of our luggage and our 1 y/o sone was tough, but made possible thanks to the great service of Derek, Raymond and Danielle. Derek and Raymond helped me get the car parked, luggage loaded and Danielle got us an early check in graciously. Dropped stuff quickly and thought I detected a mold odor but thought nothing of it. Opened the window and turned the A/C on high. Came back hours later to find the smell was worse. Front desk was very kind and offered to send help up. When help arrived we were told the room smelt fine. Ummm, no it didn't. After trying to convince us the room was fine, we insisted on a room change and she contacted the front desk to…

title: Great Hotel
review: We had a short stay in April 2014.  Appreciate the cook to order breakfast and comfortable mattress.  We would stay at this hotel again.  It is conveniently located near Disney, Sea World, and Universal Studio attractions.

title: March stay for daughters 21st Birthday
review: Despite emailing hotel manager 3 times before we travelled and our virgin rep contacting them prior to our arrival to ask for a quiet located room the hotel decided to put us in one of the worse rooms they had directly backing onto I4 with the washer and dryers next to wall and ice machine... When we went to ROBERT on reception he was unhelpful and suggested nothing could be done till the following day...... Wasting a further day of our holiday.... I informed him I was not happy with this and would contact the virgin rep to move us he was not interested however another gentleman came out of the office and offered us an immediate move to a quieter room.  We opted on this trip for a more expensive suite as we had our daughter for her 21st birthday and thought it would be really…

title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly
review: This is my second stay at the I-Drive/ Orange County Convention Center area in 3 months and my advice after this trip is that the hotels closest to the Center are the nicer ones, in particular, the Westin (fabulous suites, this Embassy Suites management should stay there and take some notes), the Hilton, the Hyatt Regency and the Rosen Center. Traveling about 25% of the year, I’ve discovered that Embassy Suites is a quirky brand with incredibly uneven experiences. There are terrific ones (downtown Chicago, Salt Lake City), okay one (Kansas City), and then this one.  Regarding my stay:  The good: Staff was absolutely terrific. Polite and helpful. Breakfast, as usual, was great. The bed. Seriously, the bed. Terrific mattress. Feather pillows. When the traffic noise outside wasn't…

title: Great Location & Spacious Rooms.
review: I stayed at this hotel for a little over a week during a work meeting.  The rooms are nice, spacious, and have been updated.  The downside is that the room has windows that look out into the hallway and atrium area...which is nice and bright but if you want any privacy from people walking by you keep the curtains closed and then the front part of the room is very dark.  The room had two sections though, a front living room area and a bedroom.  The bedroom is in the back and has a window to the outside so that section of the room is nice and bright.  My room faced the highway so it was a little noisy when I opened my window but so long as it was closed it was not too loud.  What is wonderful about this hotel is the outdoor pool and patio area and they offer a free happy hour…

title: Nice could do with an update
review: Loved it here the breakfast and the cocktail hour pool very nice just wish it had been updated as room carpets a little shabby and decor but apart from that its very nice oh and no safe in the room was a little disappointing

title: What a great place to stay as an alternative to Disney!
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for three nights (for business )after spending three nights on the Disney properties (for fun).  Can not say enough good things about this hotel!  We paid the same as Disney and the suite was three times the size. The price included breakfast, which had made to order omelets, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, etc.  We had originally planned on staying here for our entire stay but decided to stay on Disney grounds for convenience.  Big mistake - we should have stayed here.  The only advantage to staying on Disney was free parking at the parks and earlier fast pass selection.  Not worth it.

title: Spring break vacation
review: I was not at all impressed with this embassy suites. It is dated and in need of updating. The beds and furniture in the rooms need to be replaced. The traffic noise was louder than expected. The hotel staff were very helpful. The breakfast was good. Overall, for the price of the room and the fact that this is an embassy suites, I would expect a better hotel than this. I would not stay at this hotel in the future.

title: embassy suites international dr
review: hotel sold out during our one nite stay.  we got a w/c accessable room and could not change  the room was dark and not very clean looking.....i don not trust hotels with dark furnishings and low lighting in rooms.  the w/c  bathroom had mold in the shower caulking.  hotel was full so couls not change rooms..in morning we discovered that thye shower head would not stay up  so we tool turns holding the shower head for each other.

title: Convention nightmare
review: Hotel was very run down for the price. Needs to be renovated.  Room smells. No Internet access. Very poor to be able to do business in room. Glass windows in front of room and people can see right in your room from hallway.

title: Comfortable with room for improvement
review: The room was clean, comfortable, with enough to make it a pleasant stay.  Some minor areas needing attention.  The fee for wifi was a nuisance as the hotel should be able to provide this as a free service in this level of accomodation.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Have stayed at this hotel 5 times now, and have just returned from another lovely stay.  The staff are always friendly and attentive and the rooms and public areas very clean and welcoming.  Having 2 rooms per suite gives plenty of room to spread around,   The pool and hot tub are also very relaxing after a hectic day.  Breakfast was always well cooked with plenty of choice and never crowded unless you arrived in the last hour, and even then it wasn't too bad.  Evening cocktail hour (2 hours really) is always welcome if you have arrived back in time.  The fish eye grill does lovely meals at very reasonable prices, we didn't go the first couple of years as we thought the hotel restaurant would be pricey, but is just the same price as the local restaurants, so we now eat there a…

title: Walkability
review: Orlando has no end of lovely resort/hotel properties in the midst of high traffic areas. They are not walking convenient to restaurants, entertainment, convenience and drug stores. This hotel, though not perfect, is a mini-apartment amidst it all. There will be bustle into the early hours on the street. Whether you're a light sleeper or not, after a busy day you probably won't notice. You might even be sitting on the deck of the restaurant across the street with a Margarita or sweet tea in your hand. Up and down the street there are all kinds of restaurants. At the end of an evening a stroll to Friendly's for ice cream is fun. A mega-plex movie theater is nearby, a comedy club, and a mini-golf course too. You may park your own car or have valet service. Coming in late a couple…

title: Embassy Suites Hotel
review: Hotel was clean and comfortable , rooms maybe require an update. Hotel staff excellent, complimentary breakfast was a plus as was the drinks reception between 5.30 and 7.30. Daily cleaning of rooms did not take place until late afternoon, leisure facilities were good.

title: I 4 noise grrrrrrrrrr
review: Check in was a breeze and we were in our room in minutes. Like many hotels in the Orlando area this one is starting to show its age. Entire property is clean and well taken care of. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. The doors,woodwork,caulk etc are starting to look old and worn. With the use this place gets it is still a good deal.  With the free breakfast and evening cocktails it's a great deal. We have stayed at many Embassy suites and this one had the most organized and quickest breakfast service. Bartender was personable and eager to chat. Plenty of restaurants of all cuisine in close proximity to the hotel. Only problem we had was the noise from I-4. I got up several times thinking the window or outer door had come open but that was not the case. Hotel is just very…

title: Good hotel, great location
review: I've stayed here twice now. What this hotel has going for it is its location on I Drive: it's in easy walking distance to lots of restaurants, Walgreens, the Orlando visitor centre and the iRide trolley. It couldn't be more convenient.  The hotel itself is pretty dated and could probably do with a refurb, but it's very clean and the rooms are big. It's handy having a fridge and coffee maker, but I thought it a bit mean to just provide paper cups in the room: some proper cups would be appreciated. The beds are very big and comfortable. And the toiletries are very nice, and also include hair conditioner.   There are safety deposit boxes available at reception - no in-room safes. I find this quite tedious; having to wait at reception for access to a safety box most days.   The…

title: Great customer service and terrific stay
review: My family had stayed at this property on two other occasions and liked it very much. I booked a last minute spring break trip and we arrived around 8pm Friday. Although we checked out the view from the bedroom of the suite upon arrival and noticed the heavy traffic noise from I-4 highway, I didn't think much of it. Well, when we tried to settle in much later I realized how loud the sound was and it was clear I wouldn't be able to stand it. I called the front desk to politely ask if there was another room and was told there wasn't but the woman offered to transfer us the next day while we were out at a theme park. I said we would be back late and she said to just leave everything by the door when we left and they would transfer our stuff to the new room. Then she offered to give…

title: Nice Stay
review: I stayed at this Embassy Suites while visiting Sea World. The hotel is conveniently located to the park (approximately 3 miles). Given it's proximity to all of the theme parks and International Drive the property has obviously been used. However, the site is well maintained and the staff is great. I would definitely recommend it for a family visiting the area and looking for reasonably priced accommodations.

title: Great location for business
review: I stayed here on business for 5 days and it was perfectly adequate.  The breakfasts were as good as one would need when I didn't have early morning meetings.  It is close enough to the convention center that a walk isn't out of the question in the cooler early morning hours.    Those that like to swim (laps) there is a great pool just around the corner that is $5 to enter for a good early morning workout.    Tons of dining options nearby by walking or a very quick cab.   I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for business.

title: Lovely place to stay
review: We stayed here for two weeks in feb/march and really enjoyed the hotel and what it had to offer.All staff from the reception area right through to the room maids were cheerful and helpful. The breakfast was lovely and always plenty of things to choose from. The barman who served the managers complimentry drinks of an evening was a gem always wanting to talk and see what you had been doing that day and nothing was too much of a problem.The room itself was very spacious and it was nice cos in normal hotels you have just got the bedroom to relax in where here you have an entire suite.Perfectly located in the middle of international drive.Was very dubious beforehand about the hotel safety deposit boxes being in reception but dont worry because the security measures to access your…

title: Enjoyable stary
review: I really loved staying at this hotel, it is clean and serves a good breakfast Embassy style.  I arrived on the 27th March 2014 and the Manager on duty was particularly helpful, very warm, personable and friendly.  I would definitely visit this hotel again.

title: Nice, but choose your room wisely
review: I stayed here on business and enjoyed the breakfast and reasonable walk to the convention center (yes, it's closer to 1 mile but it's on the same side of the road as the Embassy and is not a bad walk).  I found my room to be just fine - no complaints.  My room did face "Howl at the Moon", which is right across the street, and I heard loud music up until it closed.  If you can't sleep with voices and a subwoofer filling the air, make sure you ask for a room not facing I-drive.

title: Breakfast was good
review: Late flight in, got to ground transportation and had to call the hotel for the shuttle. Once at the front desk we were greeted with a not so friendly clerk who offered us a smoking room. After some begging we got a non smoking room with a king bed and a sofa bed. Our son complained on how uncomfortable it was. Our bed was comfy but the walls are paper thin. The people in the room next to us were having a regular conversation and we could hear everything they were saying, Not the best feeling at 2am when you are trying to get some sleep. Breakfast was good with enough of selection. We had to take the shuttle back to the airport to get the rental car, driver was quite funny. Undecided if we would stay there again but only because there are a lot of hotels in the area we could try…

title: Great value
review: Made last minute reservations for a 3 day/2 night stay, room was fairly clean although dirty under bed.  King bed very comfortable, pillows are not, still you can easily fit a family of 4-5 without sacrificing the budget.  Breakfast was not stellar, just ok, great service from the folks doing the omelets.  Friendly front desk staff, within walking distances of great shopping and restaurants of all categories.  Overall bargain stay in centralized location!

title: Great Location and Value
review: Loved this hotel location - close to tons of activities and restaurants. Walking distance to Dave and Busters, mini golf, Walgreens, restaurants. Convenient shuttle to Universal.  Great breakfast, warm pool and friendly staff.

title: Stayed for a corporate event
review: It was alright. Not the finest place I've ever stayed but it did the job for a business trip. Had free happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 which was cool.  The restaurant in the hotel is not worth the dine in experience. Ate there once. It's just an older hotel and it is what it is.

title: What I expected..
review: Clean, comfortable, and what I expect from an embassy.  Free breakfast and cocktails with a clean stay.  I know people "nit-pik", and I am picky, but for the age of this hotel, it came through easily.  Will stay again..

title: Just OK, and very expensive
review: For what I paid for the room, I expected a 5 star hotel.  That was not what I experienced.  It was more like a 3 star.  It is in need of updating.  The restaurant was also very expensive with moderate quality.  A glass of wine was almost more than my entree.

title: Good value choice on International Drive
review: The whole International Drive scene is so far from my ideal vacation spot it is not funny. If you can name a chain restaurant you will find it on this road which tries to look and feel like the strip in Las Vegas but comes across closer to a Rt. 1 type strip areas of similar concentrated restaurants outside many east coast cities. That said, this hotel served it's purpose for me on what was mostly a business trip and needed to be at the convention center for a few days.  This hotel had a bus pickup each day for the convention along with a couple of others in the area.  I do have to complain about the noise from the Interstate highway in the backside. I would ask for a room that does not face the back. Even with the slider closed, the road noise made sleeping difficult, I sleep…

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel feels safe & friendly. I travelled as a single mother & I couldn't have been happier with my choice. The on-site restaurant, fish-eye grill is excellent (if a little cold)  the rooms are a little dark & tired but we'd expected that from reading reviews. Our room exceeded our expectations. We had a problem with hot water & were treated like royalty. There was no hesitation in offering to move us but we didn't want to as we liked being on the top floor away from busy highway. Instead we received a complimentary room service meal of our choice, $25 voucher for restaurant AND they sent up a popcorn bucket for my boys with a bag of microwave popcorn, a cuddly Mickey mouse plus a complimentary in-room movie voucher to compensate for us not being able to shower that evening…

title: Lovely Honeymoon spent at Embassy Suites
review: We chose Embassy Suites for our honeymoon and we were really impressed with the hotel throughout our stay. We let the hotel know in advance that we were staying there for our honeymoon, they gave us one of the HHHonors rooms on the 8th floor and surprised us with balloons, flower petals, a bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries!   During our stay we made good use of the free shuttle buses which took us to the parks and also the awesome breakfast buffet. I used the gym regularly during my stay as well and thought that the facilities supplied were also very good.   The staff were really friendly and I would recommend this hotel to family and friends :)

title: Management failure
review: I stayed three nights at this Hilton facility as a solo senior frequent traveler:   My experiences are as follows:  Advantage:   It is conveniently located to a host of local and fine restaurants; ample parking, close to Sea World. Disadvantages:  Reception area slow to attend to registrations; the noisiest loudest lobby of any hotel I ever experienced(staff agrees since they work adjacent to a five-story Niagara style Water Fall cascading down within feet of the registration desk and adjacent to the bar and total dinning area).  Add to that thundering loud noise level several hundred infants, kids, children, teens and parents lining up thirty deep for the included-the-the-price breakfast and will want to eat outside -- which is what I attempted to do, but found there was no…

title: Don't plan on sleeping.
review: Simply awful. Filthy, old, smelly, seedy, and vile. Not suitable for business travel.  The hotel is situated between a busy Interstate highway, a tittie bar ("Hooters"), and a heliport. Depending on which side of the hotel you're on, you will be kept awake. The highway (back of the hotel) is noisy all night, but at least it's continuous dull noise; the noise from the bar (front of the hotel, across the street) goes until 2 a.m., and it's booming base music and loud drunk men. The heliport (side of the hotel) isn't active at night, but the sides of the hotel also have the elevators and the misbehaved guests who fall out of them at all hours.  The place is old and dingy, and the smell of mold (or Fabrese, in an effort to cover it us) is profound. There was a tray of half-eaten…

title: Great Value and Location
review: We had a king room which included a refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave.  There was plenty of counter space to prepare a meal, if desired and the desk was large enough to be used as a table.  With a full breakfast and complimentary drinks and snacks in the evening, this was a terrific value.  The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant!  The lobby and pool areas are comfortable and clean and a very enjoyable place to sit at the end of a busy day hopping from site to site.  Overall, this was an excellent place to stay!

title: Wonderful stay
review: Our stay began being nicely greeted outside. Our room was lovely and well stocked. The bed is so comfortable and I had the best night sleep I have had in a long time. There are free drinks each night and a delicious breakfast the next morning. I will highly recommend this hotel to all my friends who visit Orlando.

title: No Hot Water
review: Had early morning flight home. Awoke to discover there was no hot water. Took tepid shower and shaved with cold steel.  At checkout, I informed the receptionist of the lack of hot water.  She replied, "Oh, that's not usually a problem on that side of the building."  Wiated for an acknowledgment that this was an inconvenience.  No "I'm sorry." No offer to do anything.  I guess Hilton doesn't empower their employees to correct obvious inconveniences.

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I truly apologize for the lack of hot water on the morning of your departure and understand how frustrating that would be.  I would love to hear more about your stay and find out exactly which suite you stayed in.  This way we can test the hot water and ensure that no future guests have that experience.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  Furthermore, I want to apologize for the lack of empathy, the lack of an apology and the lack of ownership from the front desk agent that checked you out.  I can assure you that our entire team, from the suite attendants that clean the suites to the valets that park the cars, have all been empowered to do whatever it takes to Make It Right for our guests.  Therefore, her response and lack of action goes against everything we have trained our team and I was truly disappointed to read about your experience.  It is feedback such as yours that helps ensure we continuously improve.  Again, thank you for sharing and I certainly hope we have the opportunity to speak soon.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: An ok place to stay in Orlando
review: The breakfast is a highlight of this hotel but that's about where it ends. The rooms could have been more modern-looking and the elevators were quite slow but the good thing is that the elevators were stationed at the four corners which made walking to your room a bit easier.

title: Great room and wonderful staff
review: One night stay in the area for my husband and I for Valentines day.  The staff were helpful arranging transportation to entertainment and our room was spacious and comfortable with 3 separate sink areas! The interior lobby is beautiful with walkways and lots of the outdoors feeling inside which just makes you want to just stay there all day.

title: Orlando Stay
review: The hotel was nice, rooms clean, staff friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was cooked to order each morning, we arrived early to avoid the rush.  Car rental on site was very convenient.  Lots of bars and restaurants nearby.

title: Spacious Room with view
review: Room was VERY large, towels fluffy, maid service was great.   Breakfast was convenient, didn't experience the social, and I loved that I could open the balcony to get some fresh air. Bedding was comfortable, and the extra sink in the bedroom made getting ready a breeze while my husband was in the shower.

title: Love the Reception!
review: With the hot breakfast and evening reception, this hotel is an excellent place to stay!  Well worth the value!   We enjoyed the relaxing hot tub, both indoors and outdoors every night after the fantastic reception of snacks and beverages.  I hope to stay at more Embassy Suites in the future if this is the norm across the country!

title: Motel with Breakfast
review: It is a Motel with Breakfast, when we walked in it smell and I saw a dead cockroach, but staff is very nice and for price they should do improvements in the rooms.. I don't want to write bad review but it is a fact.

title: Great location
review: Thank you for taking the team to write a review of your stay with us.  I was disappointed to read your comments and would truly like to know more about your experience.  I would like to know more about the insect you saw as well.  We take pest control seriously, as all hotels in Florida must, and have routine inspections and treatments to ensure that our guests have a comfortable and pest free stay.  If you saw something inside the hotel, I need to follow up with the company we have contracted to have that area inspected and / or treated.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me at (407) 581-4301.  I look forward to hearing from you.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Embassy Suites Hotel
review: We stayed at this location because it is directly across the street from where we were going to go for a fun night with friends.  Managers reception at night was great and breakfast the next morning great as well. And all complementary. We love staying at E.S. because of this. We stayed at one in Canada and it was different, only 1 drink during the reception and no cook to order breakfast. We had two couples stay here with us as well. Love it and will return.

title: It was OK....
review: Very clean and appealing.  Close to convention center and many restaurants.  Staff very accommodating.  Breakfast and evening reception an A+.  Very nice overall.  Elevators accessible for the handicapped.  Food quality very good.  Taxi service available and shuttle service also available everyday.  I would recommend to families also.  Although I did not use the pool or exercise room, they were a nice addition.

title: Experience Embassy Suites
review: For the price, the value did not serve the hotel justice. Other hotels provide about the same extras for a lesser price.  The eviroment is beautiful, but there are other cheaper hotels that provide the same quality and extras.

title: Favorite Place to Stay in Orlando
review: I have stayed here several times for business trips and refuse to stay anywhere else. The location is fabulous, the rooms are spacious and the service is great. I really enjoy the complimentary breakfasts and happy hours. You are in walking distance of a multitude of restaurants and only about one mile from the convention center. The gym is small, but there is usually no one else in there. The pool is great as well. The only thing I would recommend is requesting a room away from the highway. If you face the highway (backside of the hotel), it can be a bit noisy at night from the cars.  My company keeps trying to put me in a pricier hotel and I keep requesting the Embassy Suites!

title: "Birthday Stay"
review: First of all, my wife and I have been here several times in the past as this is somewhere her company used to take us for work weekends.  They have a lovely center court area where on numerous occasions they have had weddings performed.  It truly is very nice inside.  They keep the waterfall and plants looking well maintained.  The rooms are great as with all Embassy Suites.  You not only get a nice bed room, but you also get a living room of sorts as well.  It does make a difference to have a little bit more room than a normal hotel room.  Best of all every room is pretty much at least this type.  We did notice that this time they had placed a towel in the shape of an Elephant on the end of the bed.  That was really nice.  We have seen this when we are on a cruise or when we…

title: Indoor pool
review: Lovely hotel with an added bonus of having an indoor pool for the cooler weather.  Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast....good food and service.....location is very convenient to other restaurants and places of interest.

title: Great place to stay in Orlando!
review: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights on our honeymoon and had a great time! The staff are really friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, and the suites are lovely and big. Every night during our stay the hotel put on free drinks and snacks for a few hours which was a lovely treat, and the bartenders during this time were so lovely and chatty. The breakfast was pretty good. As we were on our honeymoon we got some sparkling wine and chocolate-covered strawberries in our room one night, which was a nice surprise! Bed was huge and really comfortable, but the pillows were a bit lumpy.  Only negatives: the housekeeping wasn't particularly great e.g. bins were insufficiently emptied (I found some trash from the bathroom bin on the floor in the lounge area when we…

title: great stay
review: place is great...great staff... hotel was close to seaworld with shuttles to all the Disney attractions.. place was pretty clean.. definitely the cleaner one on international drive.. stay away from the Avanti resort next door..pay the extra $30 and stay here!!

title: Perfect hotel !!! Excellent staff !!!
review: Just returned from our honeymoon with my wife from four day stays either side of a cruise and from the initial welcome to the final checkout I can honestly say that everything was perfect. The breakfasts were delicious especially the cooked to order omelettes, the reception of a night was also very nice, we were treated by the hotel on our arrival to some complementary wine and a cheese board which was a lovely touch as the staff new it was our honeymoon, the shuttle service to the theme parks was excellent and always on time, there were laundry rooms on every other floor which was handy as we had a 16 day holiday. The hotel is very well situated and is within walking distance of a large number of delicious restaurants. The hotel also does room service at reasonable prices and…

title: Interstate Noisy
review: The hotel is very clean considering the age.  Rooms could use some upgrades along with the extra blankets and pillows.  Don't get a pool view room, cause you will also get an interstate view which is very noisy.

title: Not what it used to be
review: I have stayed in this hotel before and the whole attitude seems to have changed. Everybody was warm and friendly and now they seem cold and business like. The rooms were never anything to brag about, the place is old and it shows that not mich money is being put to maintain it. Its proximity to the convention center is its salvation. The breakfast was ok and so was the reception. I was told by an employee that all of management is new and believe me it shows, I wonder if they will read this and get their act together!! The front desk was just meh, nobody seemed like they were enjoying their job, blame management I guess.

title: Outstanding Hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We work diligently to keep the property very clean but there is no denying the fact that we are coming due for a makeover.   The hotel is in the planning stages of a full renovation of the guest suites next year.  In the meantime, we are making improvements daily to ensure that our guests have a great stay.  We also have 3 major projects coming up in 2014 that will enhance the lobby, public space and the hotel grounds.  I certainly agree that we have a great location as we are within walking distance of the Convention Center as well as numerous local attractions, shopping venues and fabulous restaurants.  On top of our location though, I truly believe we have a great team that strives to deliver top notch service.  I get to thank the team almost daily for the numerous trip advisor reviews and other feedback forums that mention how great the staff is.  Therefore, I hope you can understand both the surprise and disappointment to hear that you felt that the team was not happy and that they did not deliver great service.  I would love to hear more about what made you feel that way.  Please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or feel free to call me at (407) 581-4301.    Thank you again for your feedback, I certainly hope we will have the opportunity to serve you again when your travels bring you to Orlando and I have no doubts that the team will show you the great service we are known for and that you deserve.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Experience
review: y Husband, myself and my 13 year old son stayed here for 12 nights Christmas and New Year 2014. This is our 4th holiday in Florida, always staying on International Drive in either 3, 4 and 5 star hotels.  By far, this hotel was the best hotel we have stayed in.  Very difficult to find fault.  Suites are not spectacular but are very nice and spacious. Beds wonderful.  Reception staff and housekeeping were exceedingly pleasant. Cooked breakfast was something to look forward to every morning, only slight niggle was occasionally seating could be a problem. Complimentary  Reception between 5.30 and 7.30 was an added bonus although we very rarely arrived back at the hotel in time for this.  Shuttles to and from the parks were very reliable and drivers very pleasant although it would…

title: Great stay (one suggestion)
review: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suite. We chose this hotel because of the indoor pool and the fact that it was January.   If you decide to stay here in the King Sized Suite with Bed and Sofa Bed, ask them to insure that there are adequate linens for the sofa bed prior to arrival if you intend on using it.

title: excellent location
review: Just stayed at the embassy suites staff are excellent breakfast good however house keeping didn't clean the room on 3 occasions and had to chase up also lack of safety deposit boxs took our room number and would get in touch when one was available never did over the 14 day visit visiting next year hope issues will have been resolved

title: Good Location but..........
review: Visited Orlando for 4 days with my wife and 14 year old son during Christmas. Location very good near restaurants, pharmacy etc. The room was okay, but the food services could have been much better. I have been at other Embassy Suites and this one was not quiet what I expected. The food service was not really up to par. The service and food at the restaurant on site was sub par.(very slow and quality of food, bad!!!!!) . The breakfast was a free for all with can you believe only 1 (one) toaster for a full hotel. Actually the breakfast was a very unpleasant event, I would suggest even going off site and the managers cocktails / snacks from 5:30 to 7:00 should really be avoided, really don't waste your vacation time for that, just plan your evening without a thought about going to…

title: Great location. Great staff. Needs upgrading
review: Stayed here over Xmas. Location is great with loads of restaurants on the doorstep. I-ride trolley outside hotel. Lovely hotel lobby and loads of seating. Concierge desk where one can book Park tickets in lobby. Hotel also offers free shuttle to various parks. Managers evening reception great. Free drinks and free snacks from 5.30-7.30pm. Yes free!!  The only down side is the hotel suites, which consist of a living room area with TV, small bathroom and bedroom with TV, all need upgrading to be brought into today expectations and standards.  They are clean and a great idea especially when with children as you can order in a takeaway, but needs redecorating. Breakfast is self service and consists of queuing for made-to-order omelettes but queue moves very quickly. Breakfast chefs…

title: Great Location
review: This hotels biggest asset is its location. Central to everywhere and walking distance to many restaurants. The suites are comfortable, but like the hotel could do with a facelift. However lets face it you are not going to spend too much time in them. The Atrium did get very cold in the evenings so was uncomfortable if you wanted to sit down there and have a drink. The hotel bar was very quiet, very boring and the food was not freshly cooked, there was nothing there to create an atmosphere that would entice one to go back a second time. Having said that the hotel is clean, comfortable and a great base for discovering Orlando.

title: Staying in Embassy Suites Hotel in Orlando
review: Our family experienced a pleasant and enjoyable stay at Embassy Suites at International Drive-Convention Center in Orlando during our visit from Dec21 to 31, 2013. We highly recommend this hotel for those who are looking for easy passage to shopping and attractions in Orlando.

title: Helpful
review: I had booked here and cancelled via the online system, but didn't get a cancellation confirmation e-mail. The hotel charged my credit card but reversed the charge upon being notified, and was helpful and friendly in the process.

title: Embassy Suites International Blvd Orlando
review: Though this property has been around awhile, it is very, very well maintained.  Location is excellent being near Disneyworld.  I attended a meeting/conference and believe it or not the conference rooms were a perfectly comfortable temperature.  During our stay outdoor temps ran from 40 - 80  degrees but hotel was very comfortable during entire stay.  The banquet service for our lunches provided excellent meals.

title: Good but wake up early
review: I have a good experience overall but there was no hot water on my room and if you want to get breakfast you must wake up early I was on the seventh floor and woke up about 9:40 am and the elevator stop in all the floors going down when I finally got to the breakfast it was close nothing at all left just cold coffee I call room service and for my surprise "no breakfast either" we ended in ihop eating breakfast.

title: Capitol One Bowl Trip
review: Great stay! Front desk, valet, bartenders, and housekeeping was very attentive. Breakfast and Managers Reception was great. Many good restaurants and entertainment within walking distance! Didn't have to move the car until checkout. Well worth the money. I try to stay here everytime I come to Orlando.

title: Better Hotels Elsewhere
review: We arrived at the hotel on December 27 and found the room to be old and shabby, particularly the bathroom.  We asked for an extra blanket and was told they ran out, so they gave us extra sheets instead.  The next morning we had breakfast and it was terrible.  The quality and variety of food was very poor compared to other Embassy Suites and the lines were long.  Given that there are hundreds of other hotels, we checked out and found another place to stay.  We would not recommend this Embassy Suites.

title: Needs updating
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.  December 26th to January 1st is the busiest week of the year in Orlando as I'm sure you noticed.  However, there is no excuse for us running out of supplies and failing to deliver a top notch experience.  With that said, I would like to talk to you about your stay, find out which suite you stayed in and would ultimately love to hear more about your experience.  Please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or directly via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Stay over christmas 2013
review: This hotel was acceptable but below the standard of other Embassy Suites I have stayed at.  The wood on the bottom of the bathroom door and the cabinet units needed replacing as it had cracks along the bottom.  Otherwise, the room was good.  The breakfast area appeared to be short staffed and there were many tables that were not cleaned up after the guests left.  The floor was sticky and the carpet did not look very  clean.  Like I said, acceptable but below what I expected.

title: Florida Vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I was disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your visit and I truly apologize for the inconveniences.  Your visit came during the busiest week of the year but there is no excuse for the breakfast area to be short staffed.  I am following up with our Food and Beverage Team to find out what went wrong, as we knew that the week would be very busy.  I have also asked our Engineering Team to follow up on the condition of the bathroom in your suite; I was able to determine the room number after seeing the hotel survey you filled out online.  With that said, I have sent you an email today to follow up further and hope to hear back from you soon.  I know we are better than this and I hope we will get an opportunity to serve you again when your travels bring you to Orlando.    Thank you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great location & Stay
review: We stayed 19 nights at this hotel over the Christmas period and had an excellent stay. We had certain recommendations about room position based on reading trip advisor. I forwarded these  via E-mail to the hotel manager 2 weeks before the holiday. I received a very detailed E-mail with his recommendations re room position, which proved to be excellent. Overall an excellent stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.  Positives. - Excellent staff- very friendly, polite, and very very helpful. - Accommodation met our requirements. Hotel and room clean and tidy. My wife has very high standards re cleanliness- and she was happy. - Managers reception every evening- free drinks and nibbles. - Free Shuttle bus to Disney/ Universal every day, and free I ride tickets to get to Sea…

title: Worse breakfast experience ever!
review: Beds were very poor quality and breakfast each morning was aweful.  Each morning, there were long lines to get food, more than 30 minutes.  Everything was missing, plates, cups, fruit, coffee, juice, milk, bread.  It took 10 minutes to get a spoon to eat my cereal from a plastic cup the first day.  The next day, I had to drink my cereal from a plastic cup.  The next four days, that cereal was missing. :(

title: Great Hotel Great Value
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I was disappointed to hear about your experience and I apologize for the Food and Beverage Team being ill prepared.  Your visit came during one of the busiest weeks of the year but there is no excuse for us to fail to deliver a fantastic breakfast.  The complimentary cooked to order breakfast is one of our brand pillars, and it is imperative that we deliver a top notch meal every day of the year.  I am following up with our Food and Beverage Team to find out what went wrong, as we knew the volume of guests that we should expect.  With that said, I noticed that you filled out a hotel survey as well and I have sent you an email today to follow up further.  I hope to hear back from you soon.  I know we are better than this and I hope we will get an opportunity to serve you again, when your travels bring you to Orlando.    Thank you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Family Vacation
review: My Family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Orlando for a holiday vacation this December. This is a great hotel, with great staff. Everyone was very accomodating, and friendly. The concierge was always helpful to provide tourist information on what to do, and where to go while in Orlando. Quick response from the housekeeping staff, and never once we saw an unfriendly face even when the place was so busy.
