Please note that this is a 3 star hotel, but the hotel staff and management will give you a 5 star treatment. Do not expect to pay 3 star price, and expect a 5 star room. This is what it is, but if you are looking for a good, clean, and friendly place where you are not charge for parking, or "resort" fees this is the place to stay. This place offers free breakfast, free…

title: Kind of a tired old hotel, but serviceable
review: From the beginning to the end, we truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. They had activities for kids for the Christmas holiday and much more. Everything we needed was right at this hotel. Great family vacation.

title: We do not recommend this hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel earlier this month for a meeting. We picked this hotel for its proximity to the convention center and the famous made to order breakfast that Embassy Suites is known for.   Check in was a challenge. We had reserved 2 beds but only a king was available. The evening manager was less than helpful in providing us with any hope of getting a suite with 2 beds any time during our 5 day stay. So, the first night I was on the sleeper sofa which was not comfortable.   The day manager was much more helpful and moved us into a double suite that served as our home for the next 4 nights. The room was being cleaned and would be available later in the day.  Both suites that we had were showing signs of age. Cabinet doors that didn't shut all the way, bathtubs that showed…

title: Dont stay here
review: The hotel atrium was pretty. The rooms are old. The a/c did not run well, made noise all night long. Had to put the temp down to 65 to cool room. The shower was very slippery. The breaksfast was awful. The cook literaly just threw bacon on a plate for me...The restaurant is very expensive. We would of gone outside of the hotel to eat but we were tired and wanted something quick. Forget about the elevators, they were slow. My husband asked if there were stairs and he was told no. Sounds like a hazzard if there was a fire, unless they have stairs that lead to the outside. Most of  the employees were nice except the cook in the morning. I think the free breakfast should last past  9:30 in the morning.. 9:30 is pretty early to end breakfast since check out time is a few hours later.…

title: smelly, poor service, terrible breakfast
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I was disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay and I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.  I was surprised to hear about the elevators being slow as we have recently finished a very extensive elevator modernization in which all of the mechanics of the elevators were upgraded.  It was a six month project that had seemed to eliminate speed and noise concerns that we had heard of prior to the project.  On another note, I do want to assure you that we do have four stair wells that lead out of the building and serve as emergency exits.  Three of the four lead to exterior guest areas and our guests are welcome to utilize them when going down.  They are never locked from the inside.  However, they are kept locked from the outside for safety and security reasons so if someone wishes to go upstairs via the stairs, a team member would need to assist.  In regards to breakfast, we are taking a look at the breakfast hours to ensure we are in line with what the rest of the brand is offering but also to ensure we are offering the best times for our guests.  With that said, I would love the opportunity to hear more about your stay.  I would also like to know what room you stayed in during the trip so that we may inspect the room and address any issues that may be present with the HVAC system and bath tub.  Please contact me directly at (407) 581-4301 or feel free to email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com. Thank you again for your feedback.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Amazing Christmas Stay!
review: smelly rooms, poor service, terrible breakfast, worst embassy suites i have ever stayed at.   don't stay here until they change management and clean up the place. asldkfjasdlfkjas dlfkjas dflkasjdflkajsdfl;kasjdflaksdjfl;askdjflaskdjfl;askdjfal;sdkjfa;lskdjfalsdkfjasl;dkjfal;skdjfalsdkjfal;sdkjfals;dkjfasl;dkfj

title: EXCELLANCE
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I would love the opportunity to hear more specifics about your stay.  I would also like to know what room you stayed in during the trip so that we may inspect the room and address any issues that may be present.  Please contact me directly at (407) 581-4301 or feel free to email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com. Thank you again for your feedback.    Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Best Place to stay if you want to visit Disney, Universal and Seaworld
review: My sister and I brought our families to the Embassy Suites on International Drive to celebrate Christmas together.  The hotel was decorated beautiful for the holidays and even had a surprise visit from Santa and a showing of Polar Express with cocoa and cookies.  Although away from their own families, each staff member went out of their way to make our Christmas memorable!

title: Good visit
review: This hotel is in a great area and the evening reception/morning breakfast are great. However, the hotel is starting to show its age in areas like styling and bathroom design. The hotel is still clean by any standard and I would stay again. I think it is a great value for a hotel with such a great location. I also felt very welcomed being a HHonors diamond member.

title: Great location, close to everything
review: We love staying at Embassy Suites because of their great breakfast and evening cocktail hours.  This property didn't let us down.  The reception desk was well staffed and check in was completed in a matter of minutes.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was facing the Interstate and we did hear the traffic but it wasn't enough to keep us awake.  Our room was showing it's age but was clean and comfortable.  The pull-out couch bed was one of the more comfortable pull-outs I've experienced and our twin eight year olds didn't seem to mind sleeping on it.  The indoor swimming pool was perfect for our twins to unwind in after a five hour drive and the hot tub water temperature was perfect; not lukewarm like many other hotel's hot tubs.  We really enjoyed the breakfast…

title: Spoiled by This Embassy Suites
review: We like Embassy Suites and since I got a good deal on this it was our "go to place". It was wonderful and also decorated so prettily for Christmas. I see where it is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel also. We got in at 3:00 and relaxed and waited for the evening reception in our two room suite. That is soo nice when one wants the TV on and the other wants to nap. It was very clean and well appointed.  The manager's reception was good and kept us from having to go out for dinner. There wasn't a lot to eat but we made it enough!!! Breakfast was cooked to order and delicious and then we were off to discover more of Florida.

title: Convenient to Resturants
review: We have stayed here on business 3 times. Breakfast is included and cocktail reception in evenings. All good but make sure you ask a for a room not backed the freeway. Last night was brutal to sleep. Thats why the 3 stars.

title: Brief stop in Orlando
review: Great breakfast with made to order eggs and fresh fruit. Stayed in this hotel and Embassy suites in Fort Myers. Both were excellent experiences worth the few extra dollars. Bed was comfortable and hotel withing walking distance of Orlando hot spot restaurants and activities.

title: Hotel Stay
review: Hotel very clean, quick check-in after greeted by the bellman. The breakfast and evening drinks was a plus. The location was just right if needed to walk for shopping or just grabbing a bite to eat.  The hotel pool and spa facility kept clean.

title: Great location and staff for Orlando trip
review: The hotel is a deal when there isn't a convention. From the free cook to order breakfast included with the room and the evening reception, this hotel provides a great deal for families. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

title: A great four weeks
review: We stayed here for four weeks in November booking as part of a Virgin Holidays package. We were a party of nine staying in two suites. Check in was a breeze,I just needed to show ID and the hotel were happy for us to pay for any charges to the rooms as we went along so we didn't need to leave card details tying up available funds on our debit card. We were checked in by Robert who also checked us in on our last visit four years ago. Robert is a pro and has worked here for years but we all thought he would be great working at the Tower of Terror in Disney.He made us laugh every night just by standing behind the desk looking emotionless,the kids think he sleeps in a coffin out back. The breakfast here is awesome and the people who cook the food are very efficient and friendly.…

title: The noise from the bars across the street on Thursday night is intolerable.
review: I stay in hotels at least 20 nights a year. This hotel was the loudest room late at night with booming bass from bars across the street. I stayed in Times Square in NYC within the last 2 weeks and experienced considerably less noise than this.  They either need to soundproof or alert patrons and deeply discount rooms that face international drive on what I assume is a weekend issue. I habitually stay at embassy suites for the amenities and this has been the most disappointing embassy suites of all of them. They previously had visible mold on the ceiling and sky lights in the atrium (which has been cleaned and was less concerning than the noise experienced).  Be aware that you may experience booming noise on at the very least a Thursday night well past midnight.

title: Wonderful hotel amazing amenities
review: Located on I-Drive this hotel is central to parks (Disney, Sea World, etc.) and has TONS of food options surrounding it.  This breakfast is AMAZING. You can have an omelet made with tons of options. They have pancakes, eggs (cooked to order), bacon, sausage, and potatoes. They also have bagels and toast, cereal, fresh fruit (cantaloupe, honeydew, apples, oranges) and fruit dip, muffins and donuts. The breakfast options alone make this hotel a winner.  Evening reception offers drinks and snacks which vary every evening.  The rooms are amazing with their layouts of separate bedroom and sitting areas. Two tvs cut out any fights over which program to watch. Wet bar with fridge and microwave are great to have. Central air in each unit cools the whole suite in no time. Great water…

title: street traffic noises kept me awake!
review: The location, breakfast, and nightly reception are all good reasons to choose this hotel.  The atmosphere is pleasant and clean a good fit for families.  The showers are tiny with the shower head set at about 5 feet 4 inches way below my husband's head!  The traffic noise kept me from sleeping.  Choose a room towards the front of the hotel and bring ear plugs.

title: Great place to stay
review: Other than the extremely slow elevators (which isn't much to complain about), this is a great place to stay.  Friendly, clean and great location.  Staff is helpful and breakfast and evening reception is excellent.

title: Great Family Stay
review: This is a great hotel especially for the price. We stayed in a double suite. It has a separate living area and bedroom area. And the breakfast is awesome. They have made to order omelets, bacon, eggs, hash browns, and all the other standards like fruit and danishes.  The hotel is also very conveniently located on international drive within walking distance of several great restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice Location and good staff
review: Very nice hotel in a great location; hotel staff was excellent.  Food quality and value in hotel restaurant was great, though it was a bit slow to get to you since the kitchen is on the opposite side of the hotel from the restaurant.

title: Business Stay
review: Excellent location, complimentary food and accomodations in the room. Great room set up for business if you need to work and family as you can close the door to the bedroom and continue to work. Very quiet, as well.

title: Embassy Suites
review: Everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and bed was soft.  It was close to everything you could possibly need and within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel if your in the area.

title: Work and Play
review: Had a great stay, like home away from home.....! Evening reception was a big bonus, Got to watch the Dallas game and enjoy free beer. The breakfast was good.............hey what do you expect for free? Overall stay was a winner.

title: This review should end your search of the right hotel
review: Although the Hotel was very nice & very very clean, it's because of the employees that will make us look for all Embassy Suites Especially Unique & Ken they made us feel comfortable and took very good care of us as well as the other employees.  Not to mention the free perfect real free breakfast and the free evening drinks. after looking weeks for the right place to stay after coming back from the a cruise and no car, the hotel had lots of things to do and see around it, in walking distance or you can get the Trolley super cheap. We loved this place.

title: Orlando Park Trip
review: It was the perfect stay, close to the parks, confortable, clean, and at good prices, it was only one night, we came 6 friends and had a blast. Good breakfast too. I will definitely come again if I ever get the chance. Thank you very much.

title: Nice for the Price
review: The hotel was nice.  The service was excellent.  The carpet and rooms could stand to be updated, but overall it was well worth the price.  It was very convenient to International Drive and the surrounding attractions.

title: Embassy Suites
review: Hotel needs to be update,  dirty old furniture in rooms, walls were dirty  bathroom has mold around tub and 20 coats of paint. Looking out my window was a wall could see nothing but the wall. Need more security lights in the back parking lot. need to pick up the trash on the ground around the building.  Hotel has a great location but needs some care and cleaning

title: Pretty nice hotel.
review: Nice hotel.  Not the best, but much nicer than the average hotel in the Orlando area.  The main difference I noted is the attentiveness of the staff.  They were great and quickly worked to resolve any problems encountered.

title: Great Stay
review: Great place to stay while in Orlando.  Relaxing hotel with many accomodations. We will definetly be back to stay there.  The location is perfect with so much to do around the hotel for kids and adults. Made it easy to buy tickets for attractions right in the lobby.

title: Loved this hotel!
review: I can't say enough positive things about this hotel.  Stayed here hoping for a good night's sleep before taking the auto train.  Room was extremely spacious and up to what we expect from Embassy Suites.  There was even a dressing-room area sink in the bedroom area, which was a nice touch (this in addition to the sink in the bathroom).  Room was spotless, bed was very comfortable.  Best part was we could walk to shops across the street - was nice not to have to get in the car and drive someplace, that we could go for a walk and relax.  I would HIGHLY recommend staying at this hotel!

title: excellent excellent excellent!
review: Like Maria R, we too had booked another hotel, but had to check out immediately and find another hotel. As it was very late on a Sunday night (with jet lag, children and tears!) we drove round I'Drive and chose this one to try. From the minute we walked in, the experience was flawless. The lady on reception let me view the room before deciding as she realised our previous hotel had upset us so much. The room was lovely - separate bedroom with King size bed, and lounge with sofa bed for our son. There was a useful fridge and microwave and a desk for working. There was also an extra sink/vanity area in the main bedroom. The whole place was spotlessly clean and well laid out, with a lovely atrium design in the centre which doubled as the restaurant, with lots of plants and water…

title: Eh?!
review: Nothing terribly wrong with this place, just nothing exceptional either.  Elevators are quite slow and granted, I'm not very patient!  Breakfast didn't include oatmeal the first day and no one seemed to find that a problem.  Toilet seat would barely stay on the toilet in my room.  The bathroom had only one switch that controlled the light and a very loud fan.  Luckily there was a sink in the sleeping room so I could shave and get ready without the annoying fan rolling all the time.  I was here on business but I don't think my family would have enjoyed the pool very much- mainly because its not very large and enclosed on the side of the building and didn't get Florida sun late in the day.  All in all there was just nothing remarkable to me about the accommodations.

title: Wonderful Time
review: My new husband and I were in Orlando for our honeymoon and we had booked a room at another hotel. The experience there was so horrible that we had to check out and find another place to stay. After driving International Drive for several hours we happened up on the Embassy Suites. We went in and we were greeted by Danielle at the front desk. I explained to her in tears the situation we were in and asked her if they had any rooms available. She told me there were several and we were given a king size room. She was very pleasant, very helpful and she made things much easier. When we checked in the room was amazing and the view, even though it was of I-4 was gorgoeus as there was a lake and trees and being that we were on the 8th floor it was stunning. We left to have some lunch…

title: Turning negative into positive experiences through costumer service
review: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We had previously stayed at the Embassy Suites on Jamaican court and had loved it so we decided to book it again this time. I made the reservation through Hotels.com and by mistake I booked the Embassy Suites located on International Drive South instead of the one on Jamaican Court. When we arrived at the one in Jamaican Court (thinking that we were at the right location), the front desk nicely told us that our reservation was actually for the other one but since the Manager's Reception was almost over (which is the hotel's complimentary daily open bar from 5:30-7:30pm), he invited us to come in for a few minutes and have a drink before heading to our hotel. Very nice touch after a few hours of driving! After our drink we…

title: Great place for a family reunion
review: We had approximately 40 people staying at this hotel including children of all ages. We were abe to take advantage of the spacious lobby, managers happy hour, breakfast and both pools.  The rooms were very comfortable, and the staff was very friendly.  We also took avantage of an excellen rate on the internet.

title: Good Location in Orlando
review: PROS: Location, Breakfast and friendly staff  CONS:  Hotel needs more maintenance and renewal. It is showing its age and does't meet the quality standards of other Embassy Suits.  Old and noisy AC unit, rusty in the bathroom, old carpet smell.

title: the stay was ok, good points and bad
review: the stay was ok, it was our 19th wedding anniversary, we have problem after problem with the door and keys, which started to become fraustrating going back and forward to the front desk for keys only to find out it was the door you have to hold and pulled it forward in place (too many steps to open a door), their was no hot water after a certain time, we were not informed of this was it was a shock when you go to take a shower and the water is cold as hell and takes 10 mins to get sorta warm, the TV was working when it felt like it, but on a good note, i left my camera there when we checked out and i called and they had the camera at the front desk, so that's a good point, honesty

title: Accommodating staff, nice hotel
review: Every staff person we encountered went above and beyond.  Hotel was very clean, beds were comfortable with good linens  and allergy free! Breakfast on Sunday offered a good variety.  Indoor and outdoor pool were decent.  My grandchildren loved it.  Managers reception was fun.    Love this place!  This was our second stay and we will be back!

title: DEMA convention
review: I loved having the extra space, the  separate living area with a little kitchette.  The hotel  bartenders were really nice and friendly.   It was convenient that the hotel was walking distance to lots of cool restaurants.  It is pretty far from the airport...a 45 dollar cab ride.

title: November 2013
review: Overall my experience at this Embassy Suites was excellent.   The hotel and rooms are very clean and up to date.  The bed and pillows..the best ever.  The breakfast was very good in quality,  I have just experienced a larger assortment at other locations.  Staff is great!!  Would most certainly stay here again.

title: Great weekend stay
review: We enjoyed everything during our stay to attend Festival of the Masters at Downtown Disney.   The evening drinks and snacks were good and varied from night to night.  The breakfast was great.  If you don't want an omelet with many fillings, you can get friend eggs too.  Yummy hash browns and crispy bacon was nice too.  Hector at the front was very helpful with our rooms.  Even though our room faced the interstate and was next to an elevator it was very quiet and well insulated.  We slept great on a comfortable bed with perfect pillows!  We will be back for sure.

title: Mixed bag, mostly good
review: This is a nice hotel. The guest suite I was in was large, clean, comfortable. The challenge for the hotel is that the building is old and it is tough to retrofit an old building with new stuff. For example, in my bathroom, the shower curtain rod was barely hanging on and that was due to someone having screwed a couple of unsightly TapCons into the wall.  There were a number of small issues like that, mostly cosmetic, but if I were staying in that room on vacation for several days or a week, I would not be too happy with those things.  On the other hand, the service was very good. During my check-in process a young man named Ryan was very friendly, very competent and willing to go out of his way to assist. It was much appreciated.  The evening reception was quite good. My…

title: `Great Value
review: We really had an awesome time at this hotel.  It was right next to everything and was a really nice hotel.  I will stay here every time I go to Orlando. The breakfast was really good, and was served very promptly.

title: Excellent place to eat
review: Recently had lunch at the Fisheye Grill and Lounge and it was excellent. Had the crab and shrimp quesadillas and the swordfish and both were amazing. also got a tour of the rooms and facilities and they are superb. I highly recommend this place if you are in Orlando and want to be near the convention center

title: Loved this place
review: I took my daughter's family to Disney and rented 2 rooms, as I am a smoker and there are very few places around Disney, that are upscale and allows smoking.  Rate was $500 per room for our 4 night stay....which I thought was very reasonable.  They have a FULL breakfast every morning and staff throughout the hotel were cheerful.  Room was clean, housekeeping was great... no complaints about anything.  Highly recommend.

title: Amazingly poor.  Also, a warning about cabs.
review: Normally, Embassy Suites is a great place to stay.  However, this particular location was exceptionally poor.  Where do I start?  The room smelled musty.  The carpet was worn out.  The furniture was old.  The bathroom fan was really loud.  The was a terrible noise of really loud vibrating pipes or something when we showered.  The shower curtain was too short and it was easy to flood the floor.  The toilet paper dispenser was coming out of the wall.  There were no towel racks.  The phone by the bed didn’t work.  The breakfast was poorly cooked and tasted bad.   This was by far the worst Embassy Suites I’ve ever seen.  Unless you get an incredibly cheap deal, I can’t recommend staying here.  There are probably many better options.  Also, beware of cab drivers.  We called a cab,…

title: Not up to snuff
review: This Embassy Suites was just okay not great. The room we had definitely needed some overdue TLC. We stayed two nights for a convention. Great location--close to Convention Center, shopping, dining and activities. Lobby/atrium were beautiful! The room was another story. As soon as we walked in the first thing to greet us was a spider on the ceiling and her web ran from the ceiling to the lamp. Not great but not a big deal. The room smelled a bit moldy and dank. Bathroom door was peeled and brown at the bottom and we had to play around with it to get it to close properly and lock. We finally figured out that you have to push it firmly in and upward to get the lock to engage. Also noticed there were no pillows provided for those sleeping on the sofa bed even though we registered…

title: Bottom of the Barrel
review: As far as Embassy Suites go this facility does not live us.  there is a MUCH nicer ES about a mile up the street. Stay there.  The rate they charged for this this facility is inline with the chain but not a value for this facility.

title: Not what I'd expect from Embassy Suites
review: I stay with Embassy Suites numerous times throughout the year. This property didn't meet my expectations. The biggest issue was waiting for hot water for 15 minutes. If you happen to get a room at the end of the waterline, be prepared.

title: Excellent Hotel Excellent Location
review: We were a three generation group, Grand parents, parents and children and we all loved this Embassy Suits.  We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, offering assistance without being asked.  Lovely outdoor pool and hot tub area with bar and food service. There is a small pool for todlers.   The breakfast is good with a good choice of food, and cheerful staff.  The location is excellent, close to a great selection of bars and resturants, mini golf etc and the Trolly stop is right out front.  Plenty of free parking spaces and taxi's if required.  The free bar in the evening is also very good with a good selection of drinks on offer, special drinks for the children and again served by friendly staff.

title: Excellent Embassy
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 14 nights in October. The customer service from this hotel is first class nothing is too much trouble. It's worth asking for a room facing I-drive as these are quieter, you still get some noise from the bars across the road but after a day at the parks will soon be fast asleep. Rooms are very large if a little dated but this is not a problem as most hotels in Orlando are well used. Beds are comfortable and plenty of pillows. 2 TV's in the room though not much on American TV even if you had the time. Breakfast is excellent with any combination of omelette you could think of along with eggs any way, sausage, bacon, waffles, fried potatoes and toast and a whole host of cold options. The guys serving the hot food are great. All served from…

title: Predictable Hospitality
review: Embassy Suites in Orlando continues the predictable hospitality of the entire chain.  Great rooms, service, and amenities for the business traveler or family. Wonderful time by the pool, great managers reception, and wonderful breakfast.  Concierge arranged transportation for us efficiently.  Thank you!

title: I miss the Koi fish
review: Hotel has seen better days. Carpet is frayed, our rooms smelled like cleaning chemicals and we ordered the allergy free "pure" rooms. We were told they were substitued , but still had to beg to get the usual room rate rather than the premium rate we were charged. Maybe the Koi fish swam away or were poisoned, we had thought the health department or maybe the amount of daily maintenance was the reason they left. Which embassy is the Hilton benchmark for the Embassy Suites , the Benghazi Embassy?

title: Comfortable and conveniently located
review: I was in Orlando for a legal seminar and stayed here one night.  I stayed in  a king suite.  The room was spacious, quiet and clean.  It offered a great view.   This room was what they called a " certified pure" room.  It had a commercial air purifier and was advertised as sanitized. I had no problems with my reservation or check in. The bed was extremely comfortable and included six pillows.  The bath was dated.  The shower head was mounted lower than my head.  The vanity was cracked and had been poorly repaired.  The common areas in the hotel were well maintained and offered plenty of seating.  The location was convenient to the convention center and was close to several restaurants.  They offered valet and free self parking.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Check…

title: Great Welcome
review: The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that I could settle in quickly. My flight in was delayed and I was running to an appointment. They efficiently and quickly checked me in, gave me directions and got me on my way. THANK YOU ALL!

title: Tricia44 - disappointed
review: The hotel is OK the managers drinks and nibbles at night were good also breakfast was excellant however as we were overseas visitors with valuables money passports ect  room we were given the safe did not work and after chasing up an repair man to look at it (4times) we were finally told it could not be repaired and needed a new part which means it was not checked before our arrival - the only option for us was to use the safes that were located behind the front desk not very suitable - also we were told that they could  not  accomodate us in another room. Very disappointed. Will not use again.

title: Good for a family staycation.
review: Rooms are nice. A/C is not great. Front room (living area) not very private from people walking in hallway (curtains don't close all the way).   Free breakfast is great. Very nice. Omelet bar - awesome.  Managers reception - very nice. Free drinks. Staff was super nice.  In-room dining (not good) food was bad. Customer service was not good with food & beverage area.

title: Awesome Stay
review: My stay at the Embassy Suites was an awesome one. Me and my family really enjoyed our stay there. The staff and presence of the Hotel was spectacular. The complimentary breakfast was amazing and the rooms were very clean and smelled nice. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again and will be returning there in the near future.

title: VERY GOOD VALUE
review: Managers reception had few beers and breakfast was great. Good location for my business trip.  very good bed.... I think when you add in extra's it bring cost way down... I was attending convention center event and shuttle picked me up at curb made life very easy.

title: The place to stay on International Drive
review: We will be heading back to the Embassy Suites in December for the third time in four years. We are a family of three with a teenager. The fact he has his own room to sleep in his fantastic and we actually stayed in the "Presidential suite" on our last stay. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is situated in great location beside Pointe Orlando. From front of house to house keeping the staff were professional , courteous and above all friendly. Cocktails at 5 were excellent and a nice touch. The breakfast are of a high standard and having it cooked to order is great . The atrium is bright airy and a great place to hang out. Looking forward to seeing everyone again. One outstanding memory was the warm greetings and farewells we got from got from the concierge staff.

title: Location Service Cleanliness equals a Comfort
review: I have to start by saying it is not the Waldorf. It's an older hotel but very we'll kept. It has an antique old school vintage look. The room is very comfortable because you have SPACE! There is a little table you can sit and have a snack or whatever. There is a sofa bed and the bedroom is separate (has a door). When you step out of your suite, you will see the entire hotel because of the all around balcony they have. The elevators have a glass so everyone can see you coming up or down. I love the fact that parking is free!!! There is an indoor pool which I didn't use as well as an outdoor one and fitness room. The breakfast is free! And wow the cook to order omelet was the highlight for the men in my family. The food is fresh and there are two lines for hot food (sausage bacon…

title: Good Hotel
review: I have to concur with another review here that I do not think my room was vacuumed upon arrival, but was after the next day cleaning. We got terribly sick on our trip which made it difficult to enjoy.  The staff had to be phoned a three or more times to clean our bathroom and replace the towels while I was laid up in the bed.  The front desk staff could have been more helpful to my husband who was looking for something engaging to do with my toddler while I was sick...it's international drive there are a ton of activities that they could have recommended.  They made the best of it and played around the hotel space and pool but my husband was looking for something "out" to do.    The breakfast is good - could be better, pancakes are hard at 8am seating but the made to order eggs…

title: Great family hotel near Universal Studios
review: Embassy Suites International Drive / Convention Center is a very convenient hotel for families visiting Universal Studios.  The I-Ride trolley stops in front of the hotel and the hotel provides scheduled shuttles to Universal Studios and Disney. Universal is only about 2-3 miles from the hotel.  The property is large and is staffed by very friendly employees that go out of their way to help you. There is also a concierge with info and tickets and discounts for area attractions as well as a Budget rental car in the hotel.  Breakfast is great with cooked to order omelets and eggs with bacon, sausage, pancakes, potatoes and grits.  The bakery area has muffins, donuts, bagels toast, etc.  Cereal and fruit are also provided as well as coffee, juice and soft drinks.  Lots of seating…

title: Large rooms, free cooked to order breakfast
review: This is a nice hotel near the convention center.  They have two room suites with a refrigerator and microwave in the room.  There is also a sink/vanity in the bathroom and in the bedroom.  There is also a television in each room.  The decor could use updating but it's not too bad.  Our room was on the interstate side of the hotel so it was somewhat noisy as you could hear the cars go by but it wasn't bad.  There are side windows by the door with curtains that can gap open so privacy in the living room area is somewhat compromised.  There is a chef who cooks your breakfast to order...from eggs to intricate omelets.  They also have bagels, doughnuts, fruit, yogurt, and cereal.  There is a beautiful garden lobby to eat in with plenty of chairs.  There is also an evening reception…

title: Worst Hotel Room EVER!!
review: The room was filthy, had not been vacuuumed and I am skeptical if the sheets had been changed after the last guest. The bathroom was mildewed all over and did not have the proper ventilation, as the fan barely worked and the condensation would build up and drop on your head from the dirty ceiling. The front desk person who greeted us was a joke. The breakfast was good but not good enough to outweight the issues we had. The front desk person in the morning did give me a discount but it was still too much to pay for this joke of a hotel. I would rather have stayed in ANY other hotel than this one. I will never stay here again, as the street gets cleaned once in a while and I would rather take my chances there.

title: A Great Birthday Get Away
review: My son asked to go to Sea World and stay in a hotel with a pool for his 8th birthday. We were going to stay at the hotel we used in August, but the pool was closed.  I found the Embassy Suites on line and the gentleman that helped me book the room was a delight.  We were able to get in our room early in the day and ride the trolley outside the hotel for free.  We saved on parking at Sea World for two days!  The pool, breakfast feast and evening drinks/snacks were awesome.  We were able to walk to many places on International Drive and we even found coupons in the hotel lobby.  We are all working in our family to save up for a weekend in November or December for my birthday.  Thank you again for such a lovely and relaxing weekend.  The McNews

title: Very enjoyable stay!
review: Returned from the embassy suites this morning, were meant to be staying at the NV, very nice hotel, kept very clean, our room was spacious, though the beds weren't really big enough for two, but no problem, my husband and I had a bed each, lovely comfy beds! Enjoyed the breakfast every morning, though the queue for a cooked breakfast could sometimes be very long, all staff were very nice and did every thing they could to help! Shuttles are available to the parks,though we did make our own way to Disney as noticed that bus was often quite late, the location wasn't quite right for us, as more often than not the I ride would be full, and often left standing at the stop when we wanted to go further up I Drive to eat or look round the shops, all in all a very enjoyable stay, but…

title: Visit to Disney
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We were excited to see the headline of "Very Enjoyable Stay" and are glad to hear you enjoyed your Orlando holiday.  With that said, I was disappointed to hear that the theme park shuttles were not timely during your visit.  Rest assured, we will follow up with our partners to ensure that this does not become a trend.  Again, thank you for sharing your experience, we hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellent stay for family with kids
review: Love the hotel.. clean. friendly staff. and lots of things to do nearby. It is also far enough from Disney/Universal, but close enough to be just a short drive.  ON site food is very good as is room service. For something non-Disney to do, being in the middle of I-drive makes things nice, as you have Ripley's Believe It Or Not, Many food places (TGI Fridays, Senior Frogs, many others) nearby.  Been here before and will stay there again!

title: Nice stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  All of us here at the Embassy Suites Orlando - International Drive South were excited to read such a great review and we are truly delighted that you enjoyed your visit with us.  We look forward to welcoming you back!  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Embassy Suites
review: We stayed rfo over 5 days last winter, and the room was spacious, with a kitchenette, which is perfect for preparing something wuick for the kids, a small fridge and microwave. Also, their breakfast is included in the rate, and they offer an afternoon snack with crackers and juice. The shuttle service is good but very tricky, because if you are late, even am inute, they WILL leave you at diseny. Other hotels in the area, even Days Inn, will offer you a free shuttle servie upon request to and from Disney, but not the Embassy Suites. Friendly staff and clean hotel. Highly recommended.

title: Great Stay
review: All the staff at the Embassy Suites works very hard together to make your stay  perfect.  I appreciate that and I would return anytime to this hotel.  The hotel is always clean and is in a great location.  Near Sea World, Discovery Cove and all the Disney Parks are just a few miles away.  They have a nice out door pool and patio area.  The breakfast offered is a full one with every breakfast item available to enjoy.  I like how the open Atrium is with the tropical feel of the waterfall.  The concierge desk is staffed and offers knowledgeable information about the area.     Kids would love this hotel.  My room was always made when I returned.  If I needed anything such as decaffeinated coffee for my room the front desk provided it right away.  It’s nice to stay somewhere where…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  All of us here at the Embassy Suites Orlando - International Drive South were excited to read your review and we are truly delighted that you enjoyed your visit with us.  We truly appreciate the kind words and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Orlando!  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Wonderful Holiday!
review: Such a lovely hotel. We had a wonderful 9 days here. Great location and really good facilities. We really enjoyed the breakfast and the free drinks reception every evening. Super friendly staff, we loved Mr Lee and Charles. Rooms are a little dated but very clean and comfortable. We will be back. Thank you Embassy Suites!

title: Good Location, rooms need a bit of TLC
review: My husband and I stayed here for 2 weeks as part of our 30th anniversary celebrations. We were really pleased with our choice of hotel and we found all members of the staff team  from the manager to the housekeeping staff to be friendly and efficient. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Lovely indoor and outside pool. The breakfasts were of good quality and the free happy hours were brilliant!! Rich on the concierge desk was very helpful with ideas of where we could visit as we are not interested in Disney. The hotel is in a good location with easy walking distance to a wide variety of restaurants or the bus stops right outside. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great Hotel
review: Good location as the area is really being nicely developed, good selection of restaurants in walking distance.  Very nice outdoor and indoor pools which are open very late so plenty of time for a dip in the late evening. Complimentary breakfast was excellent and the chefs could not do enough to ensure you enjoyed the experience. Similarly, the staff on the two hour Managers Special in the evening were fantastic, The young man ( I believe was a student), who worked only on weekends was absolutely tremendous. Down side was that the rooms ere very 'tired' and in need of a little refurb. However, the linen, bed and bath, was immaculate. Great business centre with full facilities - good bonus

title: Nice experience, mostly
review: What a breath of fresh air after departing from the other location! Beautiful courtyard, friendly people & felt very safe. A couple little glitches however, room service, ordered the wilted spinach salad with salmon, what was delivered you ask? Spinach dip & chips =) not the same! The staff happily corrected the problem & delivered the salad with salmon & it was perfect. Loved it! The other issue, lack of hot water. I talked with several people there who were experiencing the same issue. The front desk said they would get engineering to check on the problem but it was not fixed during my stay. While the room seemed a little out dated & the a/c was lacking a bit, the room was nice. Enjoyable stay & nice safe area.

title: Nice Place to Stay
review: This hotel is convenient to Sea World and Universal Studios, and there are many restaurants close by.  It is a bit of a drive to Walt Disney World so if you are planning a Disney vacation, you may want to consider a hotel closer to the parks.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  We enjoyed the free breakfast in the morning with made to order omelets.  One of the elevators was out of service when we were there, and the other three elevators were very slow.  The room set up was a little unusual since the living room area had windows opening to the atrium area/hallway.  If you plan to use the pullout couch, you may want to get dressed/undressed in a different room as the curtains did not close all the way.  Overall a nice place to stay for the price and location.

title: very enjoyable stay
review: I was very pleased with the hotel.  The location is great and the value is excellent for what you get.  Staff is wonderful and helpful.  Just felt very homey to me and not like a dirty old hotel.  I love the indoor features of the rooms and the happy hour!  the room was very nice and clean.  Bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on.

title: First impressions
review: On arrival at the Embassy Suites we were initially a little disappointed as although the exterior and lobby appeared to be 4 star standard the rooms were a little worn and dated.  We unpacked and there was plenty of hanging space for our clothes although only a few hangers supplied. We asked for more and they promptly arrived. Looking around the room there was plenty of space with two double beds in a large bedroom and a separate living area. The living are had a full size fridge and a microwave.  The bathroom was fairly spacious but the fittings were dated and the shower trim was loose and kept falling off.  Everything did work though.  Everything was clean and working.  The common areas were a little worn with the elevators currently under refurbishment. We were staying on a…

title: fantastic stay!!
review: This hotel is gorgeous, all the staff are so welcoming and friendly. Lovely spacious rooms, great breakfast with plenty choice, fab free drinks & nibbles every evening for 2 hours, free shuttles to the park, lovely pools and jacuzzi .Ideally situated, loads of restaurants/shops etc right outside the hotel and bus stop 2 mins away. It was  my birthday and they surprised me by decorating my room with banners/balloons, a lovely cake and good ie hamper :-) also we were on the 8th floor and the views were amazing and we never ever had any problem with the  elevators. This hotel has everything you could possibly want. We loved it!!

title: good stay
review: We stayed here in the busy month of August. We had a room on seventh floor overlooking International drive with views in the direction of NASA. We actually saw a rocket launch in the distance. The room was cleaned daily, coffee topped up and was even given a birthday cake as a surprise on arrival.  Breakfast every day was simple but adequate, we never had to queue as others have stated. The pool area was small but as its not used very much space was never a problem.  Managers evening reception was over rated. Too many fingers in the same dish but free drinks.  Staff were always very helpful, even letting us use desk phone to sort out a few things.  All in all I would use this hotel again as extra space was such a bonus. Having bedroom and lounge area both large, excellent for…

title: Quick Get-a-way
review: The appearance and ambiance of the hotel is very nice.  The staff was friendly and customer service oriented.  The complimentary breakfast was once of the best I've had.  An excellent value for the price.  We will definitely come back.

title: Great Stay
review: The hotel staff were warm and welcoming. Special thanks to Ryan as he was always helpful and courteous. Breakfast was always warm and plentiful, although when 10am arrived everything disappeared! Afternoon drinks were served by friendly staff who remembered what you were drinking, a few dollar tips helped. We had a few problems with rooms but they were all sorted without too much fuss. We stayed the last week in August when I understand it is relatively quiet, I dread to think what it would be like at the height of the season as the pool is quite small as is the breakfast area. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

title: Orlando business and pleasure !
review: Hotel was clean, quite, and not so busy. Breakfast was awesome and worth the extra cost of the room....it was right in the heart of great restaurants and entertainment and 10 minutes from everything from universal to Disney...busses came every 10 minutes to take you everywhere.

title: Comfortable but...
review: We stayed here for 5 night’s, over all it was quiet pleasant with 1 horrible bit which I will detail in a minute. The Hotel staff are all very nice and helpful, the rooms are quiet large with everything in them to give you a comfortable stay, TV, fridge, Microwave and a Games console as well just to name a few things, a soft bed for a change and ample soft towels which makes a change from the scratchy 1’s found in many hotels. everything was very clean and the maid did a great job every day on cleaning the room. Now the horrible bit! The breakfast service consisted of a long Q some 20/25 people long, waiting for/giving orders, the express breakfast was a guy behind the counter who asked you what you wanted then grabbed handfuls of food chucked it on a plate and more or less…

title: Most Excellent
review: Really a nice location on International Drive with lots of restaurants in walking distance. Close to the Orange County Convention Center. Staff was really super and hotel very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

title: excellent stay
review: I stayed here for 2 weeks aug 25th 2013. Hotel decor needs upgraded in bedrooms but thats all I can say if im being picky. We were overcharged in the fish eye grill but it was a genuine mistake, the head of house  was excellent at his job, very apologetic and we had a meal to apologise.  Lennox the bar man is a very friendly and bubbly person and should be promoted as he promotes a nice welcoming atmosphere. The reception staff very helpful and also the porters at front door. My wee boy loved charles. Rooms cleaned daily.  Excellent location for I-ride and lynx buses. Ii would definitely recommend and I will return.

title: Great stay
review: Love the location and the staff, everything was nice, Nice pool , great breakfast, very good breakfast, and located walking distance to great restaurants , bars and convention center. I am booking for there for my next trip to Orlando

title: Embassy Suites Orlando-Int'l Dr. South/Convention Center
review: Great hotel, great people, great location.  Been there 7 times, would not even consider staying anywhere else.  Two pools and fitness centre, nice and comfortable rooms, fresh and cooked breakfast to get the day off to a great start

title: Pleasant enough
review: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while we visited the theme parks.  It is very close to all theme parks and surrounded by restaurants, which was great after a long day walking around the parks. The rooms are huge and clean, the beds and pillows are comfy and the toiletries are nice. The breakfast was average, but hey, it's free! Get what you pay for, I say. It was certainly good enough that we ate there all three days. The doorman (Charles?) was a delight, and I think the water features in the lobby added a little something-something. What I would say as  'negatives' (and, to be honest, they're not even that negative) are that it is a bit dated - some of our dark wooden furniture would not look out of place in a Victorian-era hotel, and I thought the outdoor pool…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: This is a beautifully designed hotel with friendly staff. It has a very beautiful atrium and was very quiet. Great breakfast with many hot and cold options, including made to order omelets. We missed the happy hour as we only spent one night but it was an excellent choice at a great price. I do not see any reason that anyone would rate this hotel with anything but 5 stars.

title: Disney
review: We stayed a few nights for Disneyworld and this hotel was in a great locations. Plenty of shopping and places to eat. Staff was very nice and took good care of us. Enjoyed the free breakfast each morning and free drinks at night. I liked the fact the hotel had a indoor and outdoor pool.

title: Dated but cheap
review: This hotel has seen better days, but in perspective, for what it cost me, it was not too bad.  I don't think the Embassy model is really suited for short term business travel, but I see how it can appeal to families or long-term business travelers.   Breakfast can safely be skipped,as it's not particularly tasty at all..  Not particularly impressed with the check-in staff or with the cleanliness of the hotel.  Didn't need the bellhop but he looked very friendly.  Will try a different place next time.On the positive side, decent and free wireless.

title: Happy hour!
review: We stayed here a few years ago & so it was top of the list for us this time around. Lovely staff (especially Charles on the door), happy hour a real perk & great breakfast. Lots close-by & indoor/outdoor pool so whatever the weather you'll be entertained. Love this hotel!

title: A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!!!!
review: Stayed three nights (08/29/2013-09/01/2013). Loved it.Could not find a thing wrong with this hotel.The free breakfast (made to order omelets) was very good along with oatmeal,cold cereal,fruit,bread muffins,donuts,bagels,juices,milk,coffee,teas etc.... From the moment I checked in -I found the entire staff to be helpful and friendly (the valets,the front desk,the housekeeping staff, the cooks....). This hotel had more amenities than any I've stayed at (2 pools,jacuzzis,exercise room,a lovely atrium to relax in). The hotel in situated close to a number of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel has its own restaurant-ate there for lunch Friday/Saturday and enjoyed what was ordered-the food was very good on both occasions. Comfortable bed and also comfortable fold out bed.…

title: A Very Good Experience.
review: This is my second review of an Embassy Suites (1st in Miami) and I can't help point out the positives of an great hotel. I am commenting only on the aspects I've experienced first hand - so not having eaten at the in-hotel restaurant, I'm can't assume its more or less favorable.  Service - I truly believe that Embassy Suites has perfected the model for customer service.  The staff are genuine, responsive and compassionate about the needs of their guests. Whether midnight or midday, I found their disposition to be consistently positive - including housekeeping staff, busboys, front desk, valet and the concierge.   Value- Cost comparing with other hotels on I-drive, Embassy offers vey good value for money as far as accommodations go. I booked on Expedia, so I'm unsure what the…

title: Stay away from the gift shop!!
review: The hotel overall is good, the restaurant was ok, I placed an order to go, and they gave me a little portion of food and a small Styrofoam bowl for soup..   But the worst part was the gift shop.. PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN SODAS OR ICE CREAM.  The price for an ice cream cone was $4.99... And the price of a disani water was $4.75.... Very high prices for a gift shop.

title: Bad room service
review: For what I paid the food was terrible. The second night I was so tired after working all day that I just wanted to order food and stay in bed. The soup was really bad, not even hot and tasted like  the onions were burned or over cooked. The coconut shrimp was the worst coconut shrimp i ever had. I was uncooked the crust and the shrimp was not tasty at all, but i was starving and I ate as much as i could . The next morning I was feeling sick and I couldn't even had breakfast. I was very disappoint it with the room service.

title: Great location and great price
review: It is definitely an older hotel but very clean and friendly staff.  Right in the heart of I-drive, close to great restaurants and bars (walking distance), close to Universal and Wet n Wild.  Great free happy hour at night and breakfast in the morning.  The room was spacious, clean and quiet.  We couldn't have asked for more for our short trip to Orlando.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: excellent hotel ,
review: this was our 4th. time staying at embassy suites family of 4 staff excellent concierge rich very helpfull booked golf for our 2 children at shingle creek could not do enough hotel very central will stay again.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Excellent hotel, the only thing bad is the delay you have in elevators but the rest is perfect, i would come back again. I went with my boyfriend for 5 days, the breakfast is good and the space you have in the room.

title: Excellent
review: Could not have been more happy!! Hotel was awesome from staff to accommodations!! Walking distance to all the fun of downtown Orlando!!! Indoor and outdoor pool was awesome! Plenty of seating around to pools to be able to entertain!

title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME
review: Wonderful, Beautiful SUITE Hotel.  Great For Families AND Groups Of ALL Kinds.  STAFF Very PROFESSIONAL And PLEASANT.  FOOD Is EXCELLENT.  SERVICE IS EXCEPTIONAL.  The Pools Was An Extra Added BONUS.  The PRICE was GREAT.  I Will Stay Here Again And Again.  I Will Also Reccommend This HOTEL To Others.  This Hotel Should Be a  Top Taxi / Shuttle service choice hotel for travelers going to DISNEY WORLD, CRUISE PORTS and many other Florida attractions.  GREAT TO BE A HILTON HONORS MEMBER

title: Embassy in Orlando
review: Very nice. A little dated. Managers reception was nice, but limited snacks. Great bartender. One elevator, so it took a little time to go up and down. Breakfast omelet was good, with potatoes, sausage and bacon.

title: Embassy Suites International Drive Orlando
review: Really enjoyed our stay everything met our expectations and more. Hotel staff professional and friendly and very helpful  Evening reception was very nice server in the bar area awesome person.  We will go back in future

title: Do not stay here
review: I have life threatening reactions to fragrances.  This hotel assured me they do not use air fresheners and their pure rooms were fragrance free.  I paid extra for their pure room but it was highly fragranced.  Ended up there were two air fresheners in the air duct so the air conditioner was blowing fragrance.  The sheets and towels were washed in Tide and Downey, both of which are highly fragranced.  The bathroom had water damage on the ceiling.  I paid extra for a pure room yet it was filled with allergens that the hotel knew could cause a life threatening reaction.  I was lied to just so they could rent me the rooms and it could have killed me.

title: A Great Deal
review: If you don't stay at one of the Disney properties, this place is a good alternative.  Close to all parks and lots of restaurants (within walking distance) as well.  The property is very dated, needs a major overhaul, but if you overlook that, all else is good.  The pools are small and shallow (good for kids) and the breakfast is more than adequate.  The concierge was somewhat helpful, but plan on doing most of your own research.  We did better on tickets to other parks over the internet than we would have done with him.....  Overall, a positive experience!!!

title: great place to stay
review: Had a good time using the indoor pool being it was raining out and relaxed in the hot tub, very comfortable and regenerating.  The managers get together was open and inviting. The inside features very beautiful and sky light for the area made it natural

title: huge sweet, nice extras
review: We got a good deal directly through Hilton. The sweet was huge, like a studio apartment. Don't get a room near the ice maker- very loud. The manager's reception at night was almost a meal, and who doesn't like free drinks. However, the line can get long. The complimentary cooked breakfast was good too, but again , the lines could get long.

title: overnight stay
review: We stayed one night here. When we arrived the bell hop was every helpful. He must have come from a five star hotel because he had it down. Check in was good (smooth) Embassy suites has free managers special at night so get there before 5:00pm to have some free drinks. Breakfast is free in the morning and its a full breakfast with omelet station (not cont.) only problem I had with the room is that people walking down the hall could see in the 3 inch gap that you could not close in window. Being that I have teenage daughters we had to fix that. all in all good stay and I would stay again under $100 that's what it is worth to me.

title: Great location!
review: This hotel is right in the middle of the action in Orlando.  The I-drive Shuttle service has a stop in front of the hotel, so you can avoid driving for much of your stay.  The staff is one of the friendliest and most helpful group I've experienced.  Morning breakfast is a welcomed treat.

title: Great business trip!
review: I was in the area on business and the location could not be beat for servicing my clients, and still being in the heart of Orlando's I-Drive area. The hotel is a bit aged, but I had the best night's sleep in a long time. I tried a Pure Room for my two night stay. The room smelled fresh and clean 24/7 and I slept like a rock.  Breakfast offerings were that of what you expect from an Embassy, but the omelet team were awesome and energetic (even at 6:30am!). The front desk staff remembered me throughout my stay. Housekeeping was TOP NOTCH. I swear they clean with personality through the little touches left in my room. And I had no issues with water like some reported. It was a great stay and a great hotel.

title: lovely place to come back to.
review: We always enjoy Embassy Suites because we have a family of 6 and this place always accommodates us in one room comfortably.  The staff is always great and the location is superb.  Really enjoyed coming back to Embassy Suites International Drive in Orlando.

title: August 2013
review: We chose the Embassy Suites over other hotels on International Drive because of price and breakfast.  It is 9/10 of a mile from the convention center door and the trolley used to shuttle people back and forth is totally unreliable.  So if you do not like to walk this may not be for you.  We enjoyed the walk, which we made at least twice a day.  We got caught in the rain twice.  If we were visiting Disney attractions, none of that convention center stuff would matter.  The breakfast at Embassy Suites was very good.  The omelets cooks were amazingly quick.

title: recent Embassy stay
review: Embassy is a very good hotel and out side of the internet being charged for everything else has been good. the location in relationship with the orange county convention center was also good. The room price for the area was fair the complimentary breakfast was very good and the dervice was quicker than Mac Donalds

title: Not what it use to be, don't be fooled!
review: My family and I have been visiting the Orlando area for close to 11 years now, and we have stayed at this particular Embassy Suites on several occasions. Our visits would range in length from as little as 5 days, to as many as 30+. Let me begin by saying that this location "use" to be a phenomenal hotel that provided great service, and quality amenities!, This no longer is the case! First off, the elevator construction has been going on for weeks if not months, therefore there is only one functioning elevator on left side east side of the Hotel, and it smelled like a NYC subway  As if someone could not wait to return to their rest room to relieve themselves. In addition, the rooms as previously posted have NO garbage can liners/bags as when I questioned the front desk I was…

title: Great stay at the Embassy Suites!
review: We recently spent 8 nights at this hotel.  We found the entire staff to be friendly.  We recommend staying on the International Drive side of the hotel, as it is very quiet.  The 8th floor rooms also have a small balcony.  Our room was fine, bed quite comfortable.  We enjoyed the breakfasts, as well as the evening receptions, after a busy day.  We ate at the Fish Eye Grill several times, and Ron is a great public relations employee for the hotel, so friendly and personable.  Only cons were the slow elevators (one was out of service), and the fact that drapes in room by the door had to be secured with chairs, so people walking by could not see in.  Curtain rods need to be extended to avoid this. Thanks for an overall great stay!!!

title: Great Staff and Service
review: The service was excellent. The hotel was old and as other people have said "tired." I had to work very hard to obtain hot water in the shower. Thanks to another TripAdvisor review that I had read, I knew to jiggle the handle to the shower and I was able to have a hot shower after about 5 minutes.   Indoor pool, jacuzzi and sauna were great.   The breakfast omelets were below par for Embassy Suites. They need to cook the ingredients more and take the stems off of the spinach leaves. They also need to cook the omelets separately due to food allergies and the simple fact of not wanting other customer's meat (ham, bacon) in your vegetarian omelet. The staff was very accommodating due to food allergies in the family. Carlos went above and beyond to accommodate us at Happy Hour.…

title: Orlando 2013
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  It was great to read that you felt the service was excellent.  I know that Carlos, Freddie and Gaby truly appreciate being mentioned by name and we will ensure they are recognized for their efforts.  With that said, I would love to hear more about your stay and specifically the suite in which you stayed.  The "jiggling" of the shower handle as you mentioned is a product of a bad valve that needs to be replaced.  In order to improve this particular suite for future guests, I ask that you please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  On another note, I have shared your comments regarding breakfast with our Culinary Team as it was great feedback to help us improve the experience.  We hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.  With several enhancements planned over the next 24 months, I'm sure you will see the positive change.  Best Regards,   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great place to stay with your family
review: Hi, As basic hotels go I found this very good. Yes it could probably do with an refurbish but the place was very clean. We were given a free wifi code when we arrived which was good along with free access to the business room where they had computers to use including free use of he printer. Rooms were of an average standard but very clean. Restaurant was good and well priced with free kids meals. Breakfast was also good however did find it difficult at times to get a table and then when asking staff if they could kindly clean the table for our use they were very hrumphy and unwilling to do so and at times quite rude so definitely did not tip any of the serving staff. Apart from that I found the hotel good and the free bus to the parks was a godsend.

title: Disappointed
review: We had no issues with staff especially valets. The hotel is dark with no natural light in the atrium or the lounge part of the rooms, we had to have the light on at all times. The doors into the rooms were flanked by curtains which did not fit so you could see in which meant no privacy.  We asked for a safe and were offered a deposit box which was kept at the desk. they had a SHELF under the front desk for bulkier items. They would not cover cost  if anything happened to them. both pools  were at the deepest 4 1/2 foot deep. The Whole hotel needs a very urgent update. I was really disappointed as we were looking forward to our holiday.

title: Property Needs serious updating
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We have several exciting projects occurring over the next 24 months to enhance the aesthetics of the property.  One of the projects is to frost the glass surrounding the entry way of the suites.  We are going to test it on one floor within the next 60 days.  I believe that the process will result in greater privacy for the living room and will also allow more of the natural light from the atrium to enter the suite.  While the bedrooms are completely private, we understand that many guests would like greater privacy than what the curtains currently provide.  In regards to the safe deposit boxes, we clearly have a training or procedural challenge that needs to be addressed immediately.  You were given misinformation and for that I apologize.  We will get it fixed.  With that said, I would love to hear more about your stay and the specific suite you stayed in.  Please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Kind Regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great Value
review: This property from beginning to end needs updating.  Check In: efficient and quick - unfortunately valet and or bell man no where to be found.  Rooms: Dated is an understatement - signs of wear and tear all over the place but well equipped.  I am sure the lotion in our bathroom was left over and over again from prior guests.  Breakfast: very well done and actually tasty.  Elevators: Seriously this is a major issue - the amount of time you have to wait is unacceptable. There was clearly one elevator broken down on the 2nd floor that is now being used as a storage closet - Management guests don's want to see that! Cover the windows.  I personally would not stay here again and the property is very busy however they should be used to that based on their proximity and being a tourist…

title: Lovely hotel, very friendly and accommodating staff. Will recommend to others
review: Clean, plenty of room, great breakfast, free wifi, and pleasant staff. King sized bed, fridge, coffee pot, & microwave. Unlike other Embassy Suites I've stayed in, this hotel has two pools... one indoor and another outside. The rate was competitive relative to others in the area. In addition to the complimentary breakfast, they offer a happy hour with snacks.

title: Great stay
review: We have just returned back from an amazing 2 wks stay in this wonderful hotel. All the staff, from the bell man to the reservations manager were super friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We were emailing the reservation manager prior to our stay, who was extremely friendly and gave us all the information we needed. Right on International Drive, with the availability of a complimentary iride ticket supplied by hotel, making your options of food and entertainment endless. Free  shuttle bus service available from hotel to the main Disney Parks with free connecting Disney transport available from there. Plenty of choice for breakfast including pancakes, bacon, omelet, cereal, toast, muffins (gym time soon!) Nice size indoor and outdoor pool both with hot tub. Fish Eye Grill…

title: Great location, Great Price...
review: This Embassy Suites is located in a easy location on International Drive. Not too far off the highway. Gazillions of food options literally steps from your door. Lots of parking. Small gym but hey by the time I got up all the family's where having breakfast and heading to the parks. No capacity problem here. Staff was friendly.  Rooms were suite size. Mine had an extra sink in the bedroom. Great for large groups staying in a single room. Hotel breakfast was decent. Not a large selection but enough to fill you up. The elevator 1 out of 4 is a work in progress. But it looks like they are refurbishing all of them. You have 2 on each side of the building. So if its slow just walk to the other side of the lobby. The one thing I noted, it seems that each elevator has its own button.…

title: Very pretty but bathrooms are REALLY small
review: This was a nice hotel.  Check in was fine but the man that checked me in didn't offer any information. The crew I was traveling with had another man who after giving them their key explained what time breakfast was and other amenieties.  That is good customer service!!Clean sheets, nice room with microwave, frig and living room but the bathroom was SO small you HAD to shut the door to get into the tub or shower! However, the breakfast was fabulous!  It was quite a distance to the convention center where we were working and we only had one shuttle so there was no way to come back and take a break when we did get one.  Elevator on my floor was broken so there were only 3 working rather than 4 and on Friday night the alarms came on and the Fan for the elevators came on to cool them…

title: Chose this for proximity to Convention Center; Worked Out Well
review: What does it tell you that I wasn't sure if I had stayed in this hotel before until I checked in?  I recognized one of the doormen and then the hotel lobby layout, and then realized this was the same Embassy Suites I had stayed at around a year ago for another convention at the Orange County Convention Center.  Overall, the stay was fine for a three night business stay.  Check in was OK.  Room was not ready by 1, so I went on to my business meetings in the afternoon after parking my car in the lot.  Was able to walk to the convention center (about 15-20 minutes), though the I-drive trolley is an option as are taxis.  Thanks to previous reviews, I specifically asked for a room away from the interstate, which they were able to provide.  I see what other reviewers mean when they…

title: Great overnight stay!
review: We stay with the Hilton Brand when we travel if at all possible, and one of our favorites for an overnight or weekend visit is Embassy Suites.  This trip was no different.  It is important to note that this Embassy Suites is undergoing some minor renovations, but there was not any real inconvenience as a result except that one of the elevators was out.  Front desk staff were very friendly and immediately answered when I called regarding a roll away bed. The room was very comfortable and clean, breakfast was great, as always.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

title: Awesome vacation stay
review: This is a pretty decent hotel. Check in was a breeze even though we showed up a bit early. Our room wasn't ready so my family and I sat in the atrium which is very nice and took in our surroundings. Once our room was ready, we were escorted up with our bags and got situated. We were also celebrating my daughter's birthday and guess what, our travel agent arranged to have a birthday cake waiting for her in the room. She was completely surprised; we all were! And the cake was delicious :) This hotel is in the perfect location. You are surrounded by a number of different restaurants, so you'll never get bored with food choices. Breakfast here is wonderful with made-to-order omelets with a variety of fixings. All you can eat and its very good. There is plenty of seating. We never…

title: Will Be Back
review: Had a wonderful stay in Orlando! This is a great family hotel for people on a budget (and who isn't these days?!) The very best thing about this hotel is THE BREAKFAST IS INCLUDED! Made to order omelets with at least 10 choices of fixins! Bananas, oranges, coffee, various juices, tea, sausage, bacon, pancakes, french toast, cold cereal. All you can eat. So if you want to take a few Florida Oranges along in your backpack to Disney as a snack for the kids - feel free! The rooms were nice, service was good. Pool was not crowded. There is also a free happy hour with complimentary well drinks for a few hours in the evening. We shall return! : )

title: Not bad for a last minute reservation
review: My friends and I decided to go to Orlando for the weekend, so we booked the room very last minute. When we arrived, around 9:45am, the front desk agent was very friendly, great smile, but I just would have hoped if she would have informed me a bit more about the Hotel, about the wi-fi, pool hours. Our room was very comfortable, the only thing that we laughed about was the boardroom table in the entrance of the room, that was very unexpected lol. The air in the room was great, everything was very clean and very quiet in the night. We managed to go to the managers reception, the Bar served great drinks, but the food was just popcorn and chips with salsa. We never managed to use the pool, returning from Islands of Adventures we were exhausted!!So once again if you are planning to…

title: Disappointed
review: Very disappointed in this hotal. Room had a funny unpleasant smell. There were stains on the couch. Elevator was very slow. One was out if order for our whole stay. The carpet in the hallway was worn out and bubbled. There was mold in the bathroom. I have stayed at the Enbassy Suites before and expected more.

title: Bad start to a long awaited vacation...
review: What a disappointment his hotel was.  My family and I are frequent travelers and have stayed in Embassy Suites before with modest satisfaction.  This one was a real let down.  Where to begin...the four elevators are agonizingly slow, with one apparently permanently out of commission.  The hotel cleaning staff clogs up the elevators as they shuttle up and down floors with their large bins that squeeze out potential customer riders.  A second elevator got stuck twice with hotel guests on board while we were there, causing them to frantically hit the alarm button to no avail.  The hotel itself is sadly outdated.  We were on the seventh floor where the hallway carpet outside our room was worn out and bubbled up for about ten feet.  The room itself was tired and not particularly…

title: Very Nice Place
review: We had a great stay at this Embassy Suites during the 4th of July week. Breakfast was fantastic, mangers receptions each evening were also great we a full verity of mixed drinks beer and specialty drinks for children as well as great snacks. Unfortunately I believe I gained 3 or 4 pounds as well. Rooms were clean roomy and comfortable. Only improvement suggestion would be a music combo, piano player or some kind of light entertainment. We've stayed one other Embassy Suites in the are but didn't realize you have 6 in the Orlando area. Great place to stay at a reasonable price.

title: Great family Vacation
review: The amenities provided including shuttle service to Disney parks allowed us to enjoy the park experience and see the city. Great central location, near outlet malls, just a few minutes from downtown Disney and Kissimmee.

title: Service, Silence and Savory!
review: The hotel was clean, the staff was excellent, and the SERVICE was terrific.  The SILENCE at night was fantastic - you don't hear your neighbors or those above you.   The breakfast was SAVORY - cooked to order omelets, with all the fixings - free...and the staff is there to assist and move the hungry guests through timely.     A++  weekend.  Thanks Embassy Suites!

title: Poor Condition!
review: The staff was good and courteous.  The condition of this hotel is run down.  One elevator was out the entire time we were there.  Make sure your room doesn't face the interstate.  There was mold on the ceiling of the main atrium.  Our tub faucet ran and wouldn't shut off.  There was mold behind the toilet.  Very disappointed.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now, so that says it all...breakfasts are great, staff are very helpful, location is  fantastic, so central to get to all theme parks and shopping mall's, we love this hotel  Thank you.

title: Excellent Customer Services! Great Location!
