review: When you make a choice to stay at Embassy Suites you know for sure that each one of the employees/associates will deliver an Excellent customer services! From the moment you walk in till the last day you leave! Any issue you have to address they take care immediately.  We have to change room after the first night because the street noise (that was not a problem for my husband who sleep like a baby) LOL! Me other wise was a disaster! Front desk accommodate our request immediately . A/C was not working properly, the auto was not working but for me having an steady cool temperature is heaven! ;).  Our only complain was/is the curtains set up in the living area that compromise the private enjoyment when you want to relax at the sofa. We notice that any one can pick walking out at…

title: Embassy Orlando
review: The hotel is lovely hotel. I stay at this embassy every time I visit orlando. This weekend the elevators were extremely slow and there was an elevator out of service which was an incovenience this weekend being that it was a holiday weekend and the hotel was at capacity.

title: Great Location and Breakfast
review: Great weekend getaway with the hubby. Hotel is clean and in wonderful walking distance to numerous restaurants. Located on I-drive the end closest to convention center. 4 elevators in hotel which are very much needed. Great chef cooked omelettes and wide selection of other breakfast foods!! Rooms are spacious but bathrooms are small but mirror and sink located in room for others to use and get ready. Indoor pool and hot tub which we did not use but saw others enjoying. Worth 100.00 to max 130.00 a night!!

title: Nice time
review: Was a busy 4th of July weekend, but the hotel was nice, complimentary reception and breakfast was a really nice touch. Restaurant was excellent.  Room was very comfortable, just wish it didn't smell like cigarettes in a non-smoking room

title: A/C not working properly but overall ok
review: Room is clean and nice. The only problem we had was the A/C did not function properly and there was a lot of noise. There were people running down the halls after midnight. The food is good. Hotel has a nice breakfast and the location is nice.

title: Disappointing Experience
review: We spent a long weekend here and it was completely underwhelming.  The elevators didn't work, breakfast was poor and our room have was horrible.  The noise level from the HVAC was so loud that we couldn't sleep in the main bedroom.  The hotel was booked so there was no chance of changing rooms.  The staff was awesome because they helped me with planning events. I don't think we will be staying here on our next trip.

title: disappointed
review: very disappointed in this Embassy.  Room wasn't clean when we got back from SeaWorld. Took over a hour to get blanket, pull out bed horrible. TV didn't work took 45-1hr to get it working first night. Vanity fell apart in bathroom. Lobby was constantly wet from indoor pool

title: Unexceptional
review: Me and my family have always trust the Embassy name until we stayed here! First the elevators were so slow we would've been better off using the stairs! Oh and that broken elevator in the past reviews is still out of order! The first room that we were issued had a moldy musty smell that greeted us at the door was unbearable! The pillows on the bed were dirty along with the comforter. The friendly staff were nice enough the give us another room that still had the moldy smell. The air conditioning unit made a loud annoying nosie that we couldn't deal with! The location and staff were amazing but until they renovated this hotel I would not recommend staying here!

title: Nice for Overnight
review: This Embassy Suites is nice for a night or two but I wouldn't want to stay here longer.  The hotel was very full with two large groups and the elevator nearest our room was broken the while we were there.  Rooms are nice with very small bathrooms but there is not much they can do about the size of the bathrooms now.  Carpet in room looked new and furniture was in good shape.  It was hard to sleep at night because of the noise level.

title: Don't Stay Here
review: I picked Embassy Suites after scouring the reviews to find a reasonable priced hotel for me and my fiancé to stay on I-Drive. We decided to spend the weekend in Orlando and go to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. We settled on Embassy Suites because it is centrally located and close to the park. I was a little hesitant because of some of the reviews complaining about the moldy odor and the long wait for elevators, but I figured I couldn't go wrong with a Hilton hotel. And after telling my fiancé what I read in the reviews, he was convinced that people were just nit picking! So I went ahead and reserved us a King suite.  Once we got to the hotel, we realized much of what I had read in the reviews was accurate. This hotel is definitely not on the level of other Hilton…

title: Dated hotel
review: This Embassy Suites hotel is undergoing renovation, so maybe it will be a better facility when the work is completed.  For now, there are better options even within the Hilton brand nearby.  This hotel probably meets the interests of tourists better than someone on a business trip who is on an earlier schedule that some other guests.

title: nothing special
review: Just spent a week here.  This hotel was really not good for the price.  I read all the reviews and new the common areas were renevated and not the rooms. The rooms are ok.  AC didnt seem to have what it needed to keep it cool enough.  Also, the two front windows besides the front door are terrible.  The curtains dont pull far enough over so anyone walking down the hall can peek in.  We had to wrap the drape around the door knob and use a chair to hold the other side against the door.  There is quite a bit of road noise on the interstate side of the hotel.  Rooms were clean, but we never really got things replenished daily.  We had to call for toilet paper, coffee cups, coffee, washclothes, sheets for the pullout bed.  For close to $200 a night, I shouldn't have to ask for…

title: Nice spacious suites
review: We were moved here by Virgin as we were caught up in the NV fiasco, loved the spacious bedroom we did make a special request for a room with 2 double beds rather than the kingsize and they happily accommodated this. The breakfast was good however very busy and often difficult to get a table and there were long queues. My Daughter loved the pancakes. We did go over Easter period though and there was also a big cheerleading com on so hotel was fully booked.  The evening drinks reception was very good, though would have been nice to actually see management mingle an chat to customers. Staff were always friendly an accommodating an the indoor pool was particularly with Jacuzzi an sauna an only us using them. Fantastic location an the shuttle service was brilliant. Nice exclusive…

title: our fourth and best hotel in orlando
review: just returned after two weeks holiday  staying at embassy suites international drive what a fantastic hotel from all at room service to ryan on front desk and all the other staff making this the best place me and wife have ever stayed

title: Great value, great service, great location
review: The staff was fantastic, the accommodations were very good.  It is tough to finds better value for the money, especially in such a great location in Orlando.  We thoroughly enjoyed the wide variety of choices and the spacious breakfast area.

title: Some good, some bad.....
review: Stayed one week, Sat-Fri. First I'll give the good. Great staff! They go out of their way to help you! Good free breakfast, pretty nice room. Two good pools, one indoors, one outdoors. The bad, tiny little bathrooms with 24 inch doorways. Not enough elevators. Only 4 elevators (two banks of two) for eight floors of guests. And one of the four was broken the entire week and out of service. To add to the joy they were VERY slow and buttons were not sequenced. You were forced to push the button to both even though they were side by side. And last, no desk for business travelers to work at.

title: great hotel with best of staff
review: stayed here first two weeks of June, one of the best hotels i stayed in on international drive. breakfast was great , kids loved the pancakes. evening reception was a great treat. room we stayed in was great could'nt ask for more. staff one of the best i have come across so friendly and helpful. pool area lovely always kept clean, open till 11 at night , kids thought this was great for their night time swim. in walking distance to a lot of restaurants, i-ride trolley outside of door and transport to parks. this will be my choice of hotel when i come back to orlando, thanks to all that made our holiday wondeful.

title: Great Florida Experience
review: This was our first trip to Florida. My wife and I were accompanied by our children and grandchildren for our first "Disney experience". The hotel is in an excellent location within easy walking distance of many bars and restaurants and the "I Ride" stops right outside in each direction. Complimentary shuttles to the theme parks are provided but only go at certain times. Being an Embassy Suite the hotel scores well against others by including a free breakfast which consists of almost anything you could wish for. Another extra is the free bar between 5.30 and 7.30 each evening. These extras can make a real difference when budgeting for a two week stay. The only criticism was that two of the four lifts were out of order (and had been for some time according to one of the staff I…

title: Embassy Suites
review: It was well worth the money.  I loved the dining area in the center of the hotel.  Best continental breakfast that I have ever had. The location was very convenient to restaurants, movie theater, and botiques.

title: great hotel
review: rooms are always clean and spacious our choice of hotel when in the area staff are very nice we love the complimentary breakfast. My spouse and I both work at a hotel not Embassy and would not stay at any other brand we love it.

title: Embassy Suites Orlando Convention Center
review: This hotel is not as old as the Embassy Suites about a block away - but the state of maintenance and facilities in general seem to be a lot worse.  Staff are friendly and helpful, but room keys don't reliably open doors,  lifts take forever to arrive and the dining options are very limited. It's near the the Convention  Center, so depending on what's going on there, prices can be excruciating.

title: Acceptable but a bit tired
review: Stayed here on business. The hotel was OK but looked a bit tired and in need of a face lift.  Hotel was comfortable and the room was clean. I liked the bed and loved the extra space a suites hotel has to offer. Location is also a bonus. Close to a lot of restaurants and a Walgreens.   If you hate the sound of traffic, I suggest staying away from any room on any floor ending in 08 through 18. They face right onto a very busy highway. The rooms on the other side ending in 26 through 34 would be better. One note, 2 of the 4 elevators were out of service and being worked on. Not sure how long this is supposed to last but it is a bit of an inconvenience as the elevators are slow.   The hotel staff I met were friendly and helpful. Hope this hotel gets freshened up so that it can get…

title: Embassy Suites - International Drive, Orlando
review: Inside desk staff was great.  Hotel room very dated and moldy smell.  The hotel's recommended taxi service (not sure I would call a man driving his own SUV a taxi service) was terrible.  This person was parked in the parking lot by the front door and was called by valet when guests asked for a taxi. He charged twice as much as a regular taxi service to drive from the hotel to the OCCC.  When I complained to the driver, he was rude and said that is what it is.  The driver did not even take my luggage out of his car but left it up to me.  I took every opportunity to warn the other guests of the rip off.  Very disappointed in this property.

title: Slow Elevators
review: The elevators were very slow and my room had a wet spot and was being dried for 2 out of 3 days with a jumbo fan and dehumidifier. My boss also had her reservation canceled and had to re-locate to another hotel. This made early morning transportation more costly and complicated. The breakfast was great.

title: OMG!!!  My stay was amazing
review: I loved that my suite had a mini fridge, a microwave and complementary popcorn & water.   The towels were soft, the beds comfortable and I appreciated the quietness of my suite.  The breakfast is my favorite part.  Hot, made to order, omelets, pancakes, bacon, sausage.  My friend loved that the doughnuts tasted like they were made fresh and in house.  I have already told my friends and family how awesome the stay was.

title: Orlando
review: Decent location near restaurants and the convention center. However the hotel is out of date and needs work. My room backed up to the interstate, so it was a noisy room.  Thankfully they sell ear plugs in the hotel.

title: Comfortable but pricey
review: Hotel seemed a bit tired and old, our bathroom door was coming apart and wouldn't close right. Part of the sink base fell off. Bathroom was clean.The beds were very comfortable.Furniture felt old. It was nice having the kitchenette area. Air conditioning was freezing cold in front room and too warm in the sleeping area. 2 of the elevators in the lobby were broken. Breakfast was just ok for me as I don't eat eggs, but if you do, they make omlettes to order. Staff was very good, friendly and helpful. If you are coming to Orlando for a convention, this is a good hotel to stay in. Cocktail hour is nice. Don't think I would recommend it for families as the pool area was very small. Think I will try a different hotel next time as I think there are many other choices with higher…

title: Always the best!
review: We have stayed at this hotel several times now and we always feel like we are coming home.  We come for a cosmetology convention held the first weekend in June at the Orange County Convention Center but always stay a few days before and after to visit our favorite spot....Disney! While it is set in a most convenient spot near the Convention Center you can get to Disney or any of the other fun parks without any difficulty.  There is plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance if you don't want to drive.  There is also the trolley that goes around International Drive as a good alternative to walking or driving yourself.  While the hotel had two elevators shut down due to new ones being installed everyone took it in stride and the other two elevators served as…

title: Universal Getaway
review: This hotel definitely served my family's needs as we were looking for a hotel that had shuttles to the parks, complimentary breakfast and free wi fi. This hotel had all the perks for an exceptional rate. I will certainly stay here again. However, you may have to pry information from the front desk clerks for they are not forth coming with important facts about your stay.

title: Hotel Experience
review: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this Embassy Suites. The location was perfect for one that didn't have a car to transport around. Many attractions, restaurants, and shopping areas were in walking distance which was very nice! I can't wait til my next visit in the area!

title: The extras matter
review: We went for a week as a family from the UK with one 7 yr old child. Our visit was for the attraction parks before going onto Clearwater for another week. Having read other reviews on this site I can give my personal opinion and experience. From the start all the staff were excellent. The room was good and I have been to 5 star hotels that are more dated than other reviews have highlighted. The rooms were clean and adequately furnished. Free wifi, free breakfast, managers reception and great clean pool were all excellent. Location brilliant for all restaurants in safe, clean south area of international drive. Free shuttle to all major attractions another bonus. Atrium is clean and does not smell of damp and slight marking in one area of ceiling ( very high up) does not give any…

title: Family vacation
review: We stayed here for Memorial Day weekend for a trip to SeaWorld and had a great time.  The reason we stay at Embassy Suites is because of the free breakfast and manager's reception.  We love the atrium atmosphere and I believe it just gives a courtyard type of ambiance that I love.  A few minor things that are almost too petty to complain about-more variety of healthier options for breakfast.  Only melon.  I'm not a huge fan of melon and some cups of yogurt would have been nice.   The coffee mugs are really tiny too.  My coffee mug at home is 3 times the size.  The coffee machines in the room aren't worth the hassle.  The coffee isn't very good and the machine is not really that great.  It leaked all over the place and the coffee they give you in the room is weak.  But like I…

title: Nice Staff
review: Nice place to stay in the middle of activities and close to everything in Orlando. I would recommend the American Express Hilton Honors card to go along with your stay. Embassy being a member of the Hilton Hotel family is a great benefit.

title: Family Vacation
review: This hotel needs an overhaul.  It needs new furnishings and up to date facilities. There was quite a bit of maintennace going on during our stay which was very distracting.  Embassy Suites quality was not present at this location.  The breakfast was good as usual.  It's like you step back in time when you visit the guest suite.

title: Good location, ok place to stay
review: Older Embassy Suite hotel but well kept. Good location on I-drive but small pool. Breakfast lines for hot food and omlets run together, which is confusing and leads to a long wait time for breakfast. Also, long line for cocktails during evening "manager's reception." Also, slow elevators. However, it is a nice, clean room in a great location. Staff does a great job keeping the common areas and everything else clean too and were helpful when we had a question or concern (drapes don't completely close over windows to hallway so we got a binder clip from maintenance to keep them closed.)

title: Looks a little dated
review: The style of the hotel is nice, a change form the ordinary. The rooms are all situated around the main courtyard inside the hotel creating an outdoor look, indoors. The courtyard is nice and 'bistro' like. The breakfast selection is pretty good, about average and similar to many others, with cereals, fruit, breads and hot made to order eggs and accompaniments (bacon, has etc.). As mentioned, the courtyard is quite nice and it makes eating in it enjoyable. The rooms sadly are looking a little dated through out (bathrooms, main room, bedroom). It appears as though they have done some touch ups to try and make it look like updates have been done but unfortunately it did not work. Each room has small curtains covering the windows by the room's door (1 window on each side of the…

title: Disappointing Stay
review: Too many problems:  At check-in the front desk associated informed us the water was turn off at the hotel.  We received a written the power would be turned off in the lobby area and a generator would be used for the elevator.  Manager hours not good, very limited drink selection.  No frozen drinks without paying out of pocket.

title: Great location,excellent service with cooked breakfast and happy hour
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I truly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.  We scheduled the power outage on our slowest day of the year in order to replace our main public space electrical panel.  While it did not cause a power loss in the suites, I can understand the loss of two elevators during the outage was inconvenient.  The water outage was not planned but was necessary to fix a hot water leak that was causing substantial loss of water.  With that said, I would love to talk to you about your stay and would like to hear more about your experience at the evening reception.  Please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or directly via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Fantastic - See you next year
review: We stayed at Embassy Suites South, International Drive, Orlando with my daughter and 5 year old granddaughter between 4 and 18 May 2013 to 'do Disneyland'. The hotel met our needs for location and closeness to restaurants - we found the Olive Gardens next door excellent as well as Maxwells Ale Inn and others on our doorstep. One disappointment was the frequency of the shuttle buses to the Disney Parks. There were early and mid morning shuttles but the earliest return shuttle was not till 17.15. We found that 5 hours in the parks was enough for our 5 Year old (and ourselves!). However a taxi ride back cost around 40 dollars. Talking to other U.K. visitors we found that we could get a no.50 Lynx bus from the Magic kingdom to Seaworld and then a no.8 Lynx bus to the hotel. Total…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: Cant fault this hotel, especially the 2 hour free bar and breakfast bar!! The cleaner left us little toewl shaped gifts as well, so cute!! Love this place!! We're already booking for next year!! Honestly, I cannot praise this hotel enough!!

title: Mainly good expect for Fisheye grill service
review: Hotel was nice and clean... Location was very convenient ..  Only complaint was reception line at night was long and breakfast was gone by 10:20 --soda machine was even turned off  Beds were good, hotel was clean, good value and very good location for restaurants and not a long drive to Disney.

title: Still a bit tired,but good value!
review: We just stayed one night after flying from the uk and all we needed was a bed before we set out on our road trip the next morning. It's a clean place throughout,the suites are spacious,the beds are comfy,nothing wrong at all! Breakfast is ok,cooked to order omelettes are good.fruit etc. Away from the bustle of sand lake rd area and easy to get to eateries within a 5 min walk. Nice small pool indoors and out. It's a good base if you want to do the parks and free shuttle so no driving required. I recommend this place but I've just rated it average because the decor now needs updating.

title: Hotel Has Chosen Poor Taxi Company
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We're so glad our hotel provided a good base for you and your family to regroup and refresh before heading out on your road trip.  I was disappointed to hear that you felt the hotel was "tired" though and would love to hear more feedback.  If possible, please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or via phone at (407) 581-4301.  While a full renovation is still in the planning stages, we are making daily strides to improve the appearance and functionality of the hotel.  For example, we have resurfaced our outdoor pool in the past month, we are currently modernizing our elevators both mechanically and aesthetically, we are refinishing approximately 70 bath tubs, we just replaced approximately 50 AC Units and the list goes on.  It has been feedback from guests such as you that have helped identify and justify the big projects and the small ones.  Again, thank you for the recommending the property, we hope to see you for a longer stay during your next visit to Orlando.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Excellente
review: The Embassy Suites in Orlando partners with a taxi company whose drivers do not prefer to accept credit cards.  In advance of my two taxi trips I asked the drivers if they accept credit cards.  Upon completing my trips, I was told that the credit card readers in the taxis did not work.  They wanted to take a carbon copy imprint of my card, which I refused due to security concerns.  One taxi driver had an iPhone app that was able to take my card.    My second trip was much more troublesome.  I asked the hotel's concierge to arrange for a taxi to take me to the airport.  The taxi driver called me while on the way to the hotel and confirmed that he accepted credit cards.  Fine, I thought.  When he arrived I asked again if he accepted cards and he said the credit card reader wasn't…

title: Not a bad deal
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I appreciate you bringing this to our attention as I was not aware that our guests were running into challenges with paid transportation from our hotel.  I almost always pay for taxi service with a credit card whether traveling on business or leisure and I can understand your frustration.  I would love to talk to you more about the experience so that I may address it appropriately and follow up with our preferred company.  If possible, please contact me via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or directly via phone at (407) 581-4301.  Thank you again.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great hotel
review: great hotel to stay with the family. Big rooms, free breakfast, friendly stuff. every year, when we go on vacation, we stay in embassy suits. very good price and quality. I will recommend to stay there

title: A great place to stay
review: Every person that we met at the Embassy Suites was thoughtful, kind, and helpful.  when we were lost, the person at the from door (Young Man from Hong Kong) was so so nice and helpful to get us on our way.  He went out of his way to help us.  the Breakfast was wonderful and we enjoyed your friendly and caring staff.  We usually were getting up late, and one of our favorite kitchen staff always told us so we could get what we wanted before it closed.  These kind of little things make for a great place to stay.  We enjoyed "happy hour" after a long day of touring.  It was very nice and enjoyable.  When we return to Orlando, we will stay here again.  Kind regards to all of the great staff who cared for us.  I wish I had written down names.

title: Great Place!
review: Stayed here for 2 nights.  Does need upgrading for sure but were informed that is upcoming.  The happy hour was fantastic.  Great way to unwind and talk to other if you choose.  Lets face it the price of things these days, I thought it was fantastic.  Also, breakfast included!!  with made to order eggs!  Great way to start the day off!  Honestly dont know how they make any money, but I would definately stay here again for sure!!!!

title: Great hotel/great breakfast
review: Stayed here for two nights in a king-sized suite.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was very spacious.  It was an older model hotel but remodeled in a contemporary style.  The made-to-order breakfast was great.  The hotel was beautiful inside and out.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially the valet attendant, Hung.  Location was great as well.  The only thing I would recommend is to check for mold and/or mildew because my allergies & asthma started to flair up when I was in the room. But other than that, the room and bathroom was pretty clean. The pool and Jacuzzi was a bit small. I would more than likely stay again.

title: Very adequate hotel in a great area
review: If you need a central area hotel which gives good value for money and a great location then you need to seriously consider the Embassy Suites. We had six suites in this hotel for a two week period and the staff did all they could to ensure we had a good visit. The included "extras" of a cooked to order breakfast and free bar for 2 hours each day are a serious consideration if you are here to enjoy a family vacation. When using the hotel bars and restaurant there is no compulsory gratuity charge added to your cheque automatically, which means that you can reward good service when you feel you have received good service. It can be really annoying when restaurants hit you with an 18% or 20% gratuity charge when the service has been pathetic.

title: 3 weeks at a run down hotel
review: Decent but quite a bit run down. One of the lesser embassy suites I've stayed at.  Staff is nice.  Location is good.  Fridge & micro.  Hate curtains in front of room facing hallway which are hard to keep closed. Smelled of mold. wi-fi is $10/day. Good Breakfast. Good happy hour - better at other ES's though. Pool is ok.

title: Great place to stay
review: Stayed for two nights in April for business. It added a few minutes drive to my commute but it was worth it. The place is near the middle of I-Drive surrounded by plenty of places to eat and some entertainment. The traffic is not bad and the area is quite nice, I will return. The hotel itself was nice, clean and well kept. The staff was very good as well.

title: Would never go back
review: There are some pros and cons to this hotel.  The cons heavily outweigh the pros in my opinion.   The bathroom was so poorly taken care of - there was water damage on the ceiling, a hole in the wall, the soap holder in the bath tub had a nail sticking out that they caulked over.  The rest of the hotel was dated and needs updating.  The restaurant Fisheye was incredibely slow - 35 minutes for a hot dog is unacceptable.  My whole family got a rash from the sheets - they use a very strong detergant or bleach.  There were some staff members that were nice - the bellman, a bartender and the people making omlets.  However, I found the rest of them that I encountered were unhelpful and just rude.  Customer service isn't a priority at this hotel. If you want to go to Disney World this is…

title: nice place to stay
review: We stayed here for business. We were attending a conference. The room was large, beds comfortable. The FREE breakfast ans happy hour each day was a great bonus. The breakfast is a full service breakfast with made to order omlets, sausage, bacon, pancakes, waffles, fruit, toast, yogurt, pastries, milk, coffee and juice.  It made it really nice each morning before going to our conference to have a full hearty breakfast. We would return each day to a FREE happy 2 hour happy hour with cocktails and bar snacks like pretzels, humus and pita, chips and salsa. The bartenders were excellent. We used the indoor and out door pool, sauna and hot tubs. All were very nice. The hotel is located in a very central location to all of the theme parks and would be a nice location to bring tha…

title: Very big rooms
review: Had a suite with one bedroom and one sofabed in the 'living room'. 2 flatscreen tv's, full kitchen. The hotel is centrally located to all the attractions. Free shuttle bus to the parks, and public bus stop nearby. Restaurants nearby.  The breakfast was very basic and the breakfast area too small when we were there (Easter), resulting in long lines for waffles and people not being able to sit down.  Nice pool area.

title: Great Hotel
review: Just come back after two weeks at the embassy Suites, I drive. The hotel is in a perfect location for all to do In orlando. There is a courtesy bus every day which takes you too either universal or epcot. At epcot you catch the free buses to any of the Disney parks. To go to sea world and aquatic water park you can catch the I trolley from the bus stop near enough outside the hotel. The hotel offers a breakfast which includes cereals, fruit, breads, cakes and all soft drinks and coffee and tea. They also serve  any omelette you can think off including bacon, sausage, potato and pan cakes..Our room was cleaned every day and if you get back from the parks early enough there is a free bar which serves beers, wines, cocktails, spirits, soft drinks and sangria. There is also a…

title: Solid accomodations
review: The rooms show their age in places and could stand a refresh but are kept clean and orderly. Housekeeping was excellent, check-in staff friendly and the complimentary breakfast was very good. Avoid the rooms near the elevators - there's additional noise from the traffic - if you need quiet while working in the business (front door) area of the suite, but with the master bedroom in the rear the noise poses no problems for sleeping. The in-house restaurant food was good and the staff very friendly. The conference room was comfortable. Pools looked real nice but I didn't get a chance to use them. I'd stay here again if in the area.

title: Sad & Tired Rooms in Great Location
review: A total makeover is overdue.  Cosmetic needs include paint and carpeting.  I hope that will help the damp, musty smell.  The gout in the bathroom has mildew.  Fortunately we did not spend that much time in the room. Price was too high for what we got - $200+per night. The breakfast was just okay. It was nice to have that included but the quality was not up to Embassy Suite standards. Pros- Parking was free. Across the street were some great restaurant choices. Hotel conveniently located to attractions.

title: Pros better than the cons
review: Let's get this straight - this is not a 5* super deluxe property.  It is a reasonably comfortable hotel in Orlando that perhaps needs a little TLC in places.  You're not going to get 3* Michelin food for breakfast at the buffet, what is there is good enough.  The downsides have been mentioned - the drapes do not cover the windows fully/easily at the front and it's easy to peek around the edges.  I always travel with Duck tape and this solves the problem.  The room decor could do with an upgrade and the sofa-bed was not the best in the world for comfort.  Luckily my kids were worn out from the parks.  Food in the in-house restaurant is not that good.  The good - early start at breakfast is easy and gets you out for the Parks in good time.  Rent a car - do not rely on shuttle…

title: Embassy suites
review: Stayed there 5th April till 12th.i was in a room on freeway traffic very noisy.the staff were very helpful and moved us the next night to the front of the hotel which was quiet.Rooms a bit dated but very clean.Maid service excellent room cleaned and tidied daily very well.complimentary soap stuff very nice.BReakfast very plentiful and tasty.Didnt make it to manager reception but a nice idea.THe lifts were erratically working a different lift broken daily.and a wait for the ones that did work.

title: Not up to standard
review: My whole family stayed at this hotel over Easter. It was not of the standard one would expect for a busy period and hotel in international drive. Three out of the four lifts were actually working; the swimming pool needed a vacuum to clean it as you could see the dirt collected on the bottom. The sauna was never hot as the door didnt close properly, and no water to throw on the coals. Guests tended to form two lines at the breakfast grill which was not marked what you could obtain from each queue, also there was a long wait for cutlery and trays.. The staff are not motivated in collecting breakfast trays, so it was difficult every morning to find a place to sit, a self service disposal of trays area would suffice as there was not sufficient staff.  The room furniture was out of…

title: Very nice hotel
review: This is a good hotel on International Drive near many restaurants.  The service was Excellent especially the young man at the front desk, I'm sorry I did not get his name but he is there most of the day Saturday and Monday. The room was very quiet and clean.  Breakfast was very good.  We plan on returning.

title: This hotel is in a great location with plenty to do in walking distance.  The hotel offers a shuttle to the theme parks.
review: The hotel is in a great location on International Drive and walking distance to attractions such as Wonder Works, Pirate Cove miniature golf, and the Ice Bar.  This Embassy Suites also offers a free shuttle to them parks and a great breakfast each morning.  I enjoyed my visit and will certainly be back.  JC

title: sally
review: The last couple of reviews of this hotel are simply not true. This is an older hotel, but it is well kept, clean and the service is excellent. We did not hear a sound as we were trying to go to sleep Very good location. good food in the restaurant, as well as the wonderful  breakfast. Superb place to stay.

title: Not what you'd expect
review: This is an old an tired Embassy Suites.  The window coverings in the front do not cover the entire window so all walkers-by can look in on either side of your door.  Tub was old and cracked, ceiling was peeling.  The AC worked hard but the room stayed humid and stuffy.  One elevator was broken. The other is so slow I took the stairs down 8 flights and beat the family to the car by 4 minutes.  My wife had been a guest there the previous week and said the elevator was broken then.  On a bright note, I let my daughter sleep in the king bed with my wife, and the pull out sofa was the most comfortable I've ever been on.  I slept great

title: Clean Room, Complete lack of privacy in rooms
review: Pros Our room was clean, updated and in generally good shape. Good location, easy to get to with all dining/entertainment options nearby. We enjoyed Manager's reception, and breakfast was efficient and good. I thought overall hotel was nice and had enough amenities for this class. Pool area was nice, ample parking. I'll list the Cons, but overall we were very pleased with the choice of this hotel. Cons You can see into the rooms from hallway, we resorted to using a hanger to clip curtains together!! Seriously, FIX THIS Embassy! Breakfast was very good but didnt change from day to day.  Update shuttle options to theme parks, once a day doesnt cut it. One elevator was down, lengthy delays.

title: Not equipped for 100% occupancy
review: The basics are absolutely lacking, while the amenities are great. Weird! Overall I would say save your money and find a cheaper alternative. Anyways, I will try to organize my review by category -   Room - The front room of the suite lacks privacy. The drapes do not cover up the wall size windows on either side of the entry door, allowing any outsider to peak in the room. The bedroom area feels private enough though. The room size is good, and in room supplies are great - bed, sheets, soft towels, shampoo, soap all of great quality. Shower was good, except set pretty low in the wall. A tall person would have difficulty washing his or her head.  Breakfast - The seating area cannot handle a full crowd, forcing some to take breakfast trays all the way to their rooms and others to…

title: This property should have been condemned 10 years ago
review: Thank you for your review of your past stay with us. I always appreciate hearing from our guests – including areas for improvement. I apologize that the comfort of your stay was interrupted and I have taken your comments to our team to ensure that in the future we do a better job of serving our guests and also a better job with communication. We'll be sure to keep in mind your suggestions for a better overall experience. It is feedback such as yours that helps us continuously improve.  In fact, one elevator was out of service during your stay due to a planned elevator modernization project, which our guests have been requesting for some time.  This project did cause some delays during spring break in March but with three other elevators in service it has not been a concern of our guests most weeks. I hope that you will be our guest again the next time you have the opportunity to travel to the area – thank you for your review.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Um, you can see into the rooms from the hall! But the breakfast rocks.
review: This is one of the oldest and nastiest properties i have stayed at.  The rooms are musty, worn carpets, furniture from the 70's and only 1 of 4 elevators functioning during spring break.  The breakfast is most probably the best part of this property.  My suggestion is to stay elsewhere.

title: Not as Virgin describe it
review: Thank you for taking this opportunity to share your feedback with us. We apologize for the issues you experienced.  While one of the elevators was out of service as part of a planned modernization project, there was a day in which we had 2 more elevators out of service due to technical difficulties.  I am happy to say that the challenges were resolved and we have not had a reoccurrence. In regards to the condition of your guest room, I can assure you that the description and pictures you posted are not indicative of the majority of our rooms. I have asked the team to try and find your room based on the picture of the carpet with a small tear.  It is clear that we need to sand and stain the bathroom shelving and also replace the carpet in that room.  If you are willing, I would love to speak more to you about your stay and I may be reached via phone at (407) 581-4301 or via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Broken elevator, unclean room. Not good.
review: Ok, I'll make a compliment sandwich here.   The staff was really nice. The location was superb.  The rooms were seriously ghetto. There was a random pipe leaking cold water directly on my head my during my shower! I'm pretty sure it was clean, but...honestly.  Most importantly, the blinds in the room do not close all the way. Do you like to walk around in the buff while getting ready in the morning? Share that with everybody that walks by your room! My husband had the good sense to use some duct tape he brought to tape the blinds closed.  There were some stains on the furniture. When we left,2 out of the 4 elevators did not work. The only stairs took us out of the building. We waited quite long to go down 1 level.   Breakfast was seriously excellent, but keep in mind the rush is…

title: Awesome EVERYTHING hotel
review: Really nice property.  Great sized suites and it includes free parking and a great breakfast spread... not to mention they have a manager's happy hour  reception for 2 hours which includes free cocktails and snacks.. You can't beat it.. Plus it is SMACK in the middle of everything.. Howl at the Moon and Bahama Breeze are steps aawy.. cross the street and you are there.. or go right next door and Olive Garden is there.  They also have a REALLY nice indoor pool.  The staff was really friendly and accomodating.  A special thanks to William who helps during breakfast.. a gem of a person!

title: Wish we had stayed Embassy Suites Downtown
review: We decided to split our trip to Orlando between the Embassy Suites Downtown Orlando and the Embassy Suites International Drive/ Convention Center because we were going to SeaWorld. We arrived way too early to check-in, but we knew that going in. We decided on this hotel because of it's proximity to the parks, and complimentary i-Ride passes. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a nice young man with a smile, who asked for my last name. He then said "We have you in a King Non-Smoking room for one night, the room isn't ready yet, but I'll give you the key packet so you can get on the shuttle." The key packet had room 511 on it. We came back from a wonderful day at the park, to a grumpy, impolite man who informed us that they became oversold and we were moved to a smoking room. While I…

title: HORROR IN ORLANDO
review: Before you decide to book at this hotel, understand that the staff at the front desk will NOT take care of you.  The Complimentary breakfast is more like a bad scene from MASH.  Elevators dont always work, so be prepared to hike up the stairs.

title: not really worth the price
review: Its a beautiful hotel but when we got there the garbage cans had no liners and they smelled, we only had 2 washrags for a room that slept 6. The elevators are very slow, you wait 5 minutes at least, staff doesnt use a service elevator so that holds it up. Breakfast is great in the morning and the fisheye grill was very good.

title: good location, nice looking hotel
review: i stayed at embassy suites from 12th march 2013 for 14 nights.  the location of the hotel is really good. lots of restaurants. the breakfast was okay i went a couple days for breakfast over dennys as there wasn't any food left a hour before.

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for four nights, to attend Megacon.  Everything was so nice, and clean, comfortable and convenient. The breakfast is exceptional, as is the Manager's Reception each evening.

title: fab hotel
review: just back from Florida having stayed at the embassy suites for 10 days.The hotel is great the staff very friendly room kept very clean,the breakfast was a real bonus and overall food was good.the happy hour in the evening is a lovely touch nice to relax after a day at the parks .also ate at the fisheye grill the shrimps are amazing a must try appetiser .I will definitely be booking again.

title: Another great stay
review: Have just spent our 4th vacation at the Embassy Suites, as usual we had a great time. The hotel was perfectly clean and the staff very pleasant and more then helpful. Our suite was clean on arrival and kept that way right through our stay The breakfasts were good, and only a little crowded if you go down late. The Cocktail repections between 5.30 and 7.30 are welcome if youre back in time from busy days out The Fisheye Grill Restaurant in the Lobby was very reasonably priced and we had a lovely meal Lots of other restaurants within easy walking distance which puts the hotel in a very conventient location. Would certainly recommend the hotel and would stay again

title: Okay, but not more than that
review: My overall feeling for this Hotel is Ok, but not more than that. I was on Business trip and was chceking this Hotel, to see if my Family and I should stay there at an upcoming vacation.  I noticed the Hotel offered free Bus Service to nearby attractions, this could be handy at a vacation.  Things I liked: - Very Friendly staff. - Free Business Center (one day I had the need for a printer, then this was handy). - Coffe/Tea maker and a large fridge. - Complimentary Breakfast makes it easier in the morning. And the Breakfast was good. - Location, Hotel has a good location with several restaurants nearby.  Things I didn't like: - The Hotel looks old. - The rooms look even older - especially the bath room need a renovation. - Both the bathroom fan and the a/c were very noisy. - Very…

title: It worked
review: We stayed here after a couple days at DisneyWorld. Totally not fair, so I'll write this and try very hard not to compare. The parking area was ample. While they did offer valet parking, it wasn't needed. Front desk was very attentive and gave us a few great pointers. In addition, they also gave us all free passes for the trolly. The trolly dropped us off at SeaWorld to continue our journey and the people on the ride also added to the trip.  Is the hotel dated? Yes Are the rooms dated? Yes The view from our room was terrible, and I'm Hilton Diamond... however The breakfast was very good and it suited our needs very well for the price we paid.  Stay with confidence and enjoy all the excellent restaurants that surround you.. IF You get the change, stop at Howl at the Moon! The best…

title: Pools need some serious cleaning
review: This Embassy Suites is an older building that definitely needs renovation and not up to the standards we are accustomed to with this brand.  The room was clean and acceptable; however, both the indoor and outdoor pools had serious staining on the bottom and side walls that appear to be green algea.  I informed the front desk staff on two seperate occasions while staying here 4 nights...NO IMPROVEMENT!  I will not stay at this hotel again.  When I travel to a warmer climate, I EXPECT an inviting pool that is clean and well kept.

title: Okay Hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I was happy to hear that your room was clean but I truly apologize for the condition of the pool during your visit.  I can assure you that the pool's cleanliness is of the utmost importance to us and that the problem you noticed was not algae.  The "staining" you described is actually a worn down pool surface.  We will be resurfacing the outdoor pool prior to the summer and are working on finalizing the dates now.  I would love to speak with you about your stay.  If possible, please email me at william.friedrich@hilton.com or call me directly at (407) 581-4301.  We hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Location is amazing!
review: The hotel is in a good location. But the Hotel is very average. It needs to be updated. The breakfast is good and convienent. I don't care for the windows that are in the front of each room, even with the curtains closed people walking by can still see into your room. Valet parking is $12.00, ridiculous!. I probably would bot stay here again.

title: Musty Odor Spoils the Atmosphere
review: Directly across from Senor Frogs and Bahama Breeze.  You can walk a mile in either direction and have something to do.  Beautiful surroundings and a very safe area!  The hotel staff was so awesome from front desk employees, bar, cleaning staff- everyone made the experience perfect!  We weren't going to any parks on our visit, so the hotel WAS our vacation, I can tell you we were not disappointed!  I called at 5:30 am the day we were to arrive and Hugh assured us "our suite will be ready upon arrival" which was at noon!  He went out of his way to allow us an early check in.  We had a late departure and the friendly staff allowed us to check out at 4:00 instead of the normal time.  I'm sure they were able to do this since it was a week day and not so busy, but some places are so…

title: WOULD NOT STAY AGAIN!
review: Yes-the hotel has a beautiful atrium. Yes-the hotel has a great location. Yes-the breakfast is delicious.  BUT NOTHING CAN MAKE UP FOR THE MUSTY ODOR, MILDEWY BATHROOM AND WORN CARPET AND DATED FURNITURE. There are numerous newer hotels along I Drive. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! Don't stay here!

title: Classic Embasy Suites Styled Hotel - Great Location Next to Pointe Orlando
review: Stayed one night on business, I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member so I stayed on the top floor.  The hotel is an older Embassy styled with the classic open air central atrium type arrangement with 8 floors.  The hotel is well maintained and the rooms were not dated and everything functioned perfectly. I stayed in a typical king, 2-room suite that was quite roomy and comfortable.  I was travelling on business so the desk/table made a great desk for catching up on some work and e-mails.  It would be a great family room as well with a sofa sleeper in the exterior room.  The two rooms are separated by the bathroom and a wet bar type area with fridge, coffee maker and microwave.  Inside the bedroom area there is a second sink with a large counter area which would allow multiple…

title: supernice top suitehotel very very good.
review: this is a topper all open in the middle, indoor pool-sauna-hottub (i was in februari, that day way to cold) fitness room.  good restaurant, top breakfast. so nice , clean and really super rooms with nice tv s and furniture, i think one of the best on international drive, will book there again and in the future will search for embassy suites again. only minus point, paying for wifi, make the room 2 usd more expensive for all.

title: Great location
review: Stayed at Embassy suites in October for a girls trip with my 2 daughers.  The rooms- the beds were comfortable.  loved having the extra sink in the bedroom to allow for all of us to get ready at the same time.  We moved to a room with a balcony to allow for us to leave door open and allow for fresh air.  The balcony was small, not allowing for you to walk out on, but allowed you to open the door.  A nice touch- upon our arrival one night was a plate of cookies, strawberries and milk with a note from management aking about our room due to the room change.  Breakfast- standard embassy suites breakfast, with omelettes, cook to order eggs, bacon, potatoes, and many pastries and cereal.   transportation- we did not have a car to get around.  We used the I-RIDE for $1.25 per person,…

title: Brilliant location
review: Stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Dirve and it was superb.  Brilliant location, really central for all of the attractions.  Complimentary shuttle service to all of the parks was well organised and efficient so didn't need to hire a car.  Rooms could do with updating from a decoration point of view and had all of the facilites you could need.  The bed was extremely comfortable so had no problems sleeping.   The I4 runs along the back of the property so there was constant noise from the traffic although this didn't disturb us.  Fantastic, all you could eat, breakfast and the included Managers Happy 2 Hours was a welcome bonus.  It is worth eating in the hotel restaurant as the food was good and reasonably priced.  Also if you are travelling with Virgin you get a 25%…

title: Good location, nice ameninities, horrible beds.
review: We stayed for two nights in a one-bedroom, King suite.  We slept 5 in the room, comfortably.  Two kids on the sofa bed, one in a complimentary crib.  The hotel is in a good location, with convenient and free parking.  The breakfast is very nice - cooked to order eggs, omelettes, pancakes and other buffet items.  The manager's reception each day was nice to grab a drink and some snacks.  The hotel was mostly business people when we were there (during the week) but we saw a few other families.    The staff was great, the hotel was clean.  I love the two room set-up.  When traveling with 3 kids (12, 4, and 1), it's just not feasible to all be crammed into one room and expect to get any sleep.  This suite was a good option.  It's also always nice to have a fridge.  There are lots of…

title: Perfect Stay
review: We stayed and traveled all around Orlando & Tampa for 8 days.  This was our favorite stay.  We found this Embassy hotel really  lived up to all our expectations!!!  Made us feel like real Hilton Honors Guest. We also found it to be really central. The staff were all extremely nice and helpful. Robert really went out of his way, from getting us tech support with the computers, to making a recommendation , and reservation to FishBones, which was 5 min away and TERRIFIC!!!  The room was really clean and very comfortable!!!! The white gazebo in the atrium was beautiful.  It was nice to see a little different decor in a Embassy. The drinks reception in the evening was super!!! I enjoyed the express checkouts (I believe they were called) . Breakfast is the morning is not to be missed…

title: Needs Updating
review: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for a convention. Although the location is great, the Atrium inside is very nice, our room was dated. The furnisihings need updating, the carpets. The door frames had rust at the bottom in the bathroom and the cieling was kinda crumbly. It wasnt cheap so I am being hard on them. I went to Hilton Orlando up the street afterwards and had a 5 star resort hotel for $50 more per night. well worth it

title: WE WILL BE BACK
review: The rooms are large and the beds are soooooooooo comfortable! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is excellent and never seemed to be too busy.  The evening managers reception is very good. We had a wonderful time and wished we could have stayed longer.

title: Oh Orlando - the Embassy has let me down
review: The good news is that this was a business trip, so the horrible room and hotel didn’t ruin a vacation.  That being said, I advise you to take your vacation elsewhere. The room was horrible, see my photos.  There is what appears to be mold on the atrium which is directly above the breakfast area.  My bathroom had rust and mold poorly covered up with caulking. Even without these disgusting discoveries, the hotel looks like it hasn’t been updated since the 80’s.  The staff was non-caring for the most part. And, by-the-way.  They shut down 2 of the 4 elevators halfway through our stay.   Why?  They were being used by the hotel maintenance staff because they convert this hotel to a jewelry bazaar mid-week.  So we had to wait in a line for elevators.  Sometimes it took 2 cars before…

title: a very good hotel between universal and disney
review: I want to apologize for the unfortunate experience that you had at our hotel. The comfort, health, and safety of our guests are of the utmost importance and are always a focal point of our operations. I want to assure you that we take your feedback seriously.  In regards to the rust and mold concerns you mentioned in your guest room, I would love to know which room you stayed in so I can follow up appropriately.  I did see the painted rust on the bathroom door frame and A/C panel in your pictures and we clearly need to sand, prime and repaint those areas in that particular room.  If possible, please reach out to me directly at (407) 581-4301 or via email at william.friedrich@hitlon.com.  On another note, we are in the process of collecting proposals to have the debris on the atrium ceiling cleaned.  In regards to the jewelry show, the group has come and gone.  The show we hosted was an invitation only event that involved wholesalers meeting with the buyers from the major department stores and specialty shops who are looking to purchase jewelry to sell in retail outlets.  It was a very exciting event to host for the past week but did involve us having to move quite a bit of furniture and boxes.  At the beginning and end of the event it did require us to utilize two of our four guest elevators and I truly apologize for the delays it caused during your visit.  Thank you for your feedback, I certainly hope we have the opportunity to discuss your stay and the room in question.       Warm regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Nice hotel... Nice Location!!
review: We really liked the decor of the lobby where breakfast and the managers reception was enjoyed. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The area was great. It's a short walk to many good restaurants.  We enjoyed our stay and will return.... and have recommended this hotel to friends.

title: nice hotel
review: Only complaint we had was the pool was cold (but it makes sense not to have a heated pool) so that was no big deal. The staff was all friendly & rooms are a good size also. They have a hot/cook to order breakfast that was nice to have and then in the afternoon they put out snacks & drinks also. The "waterfall" by the elevators was a calm & relaxing to watch. It was nice to have a fridge in the room for drinks & snacks also.

title: Fabulous hotel - great value!
review: The entire end-to-end experience at this hotel was superior.  The staff are very helpful.  The breakfast buffet is excellent; the evening reception is very nice.  We had a wonderful experience and wished we could have stayed longer.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel and will defintely return.

title: very good value
review: Visited Orlando for a quick 4 day get-a-way to Disney/Universal and did not want to spend a lot of money for a resort. I figured we would be at the parks most of the time and the weather although very nice was not outdoor swimming weather. So I decided to book a three star moderate hotel. I ended up staying at the Embassy Suites International /South and was so pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful and friendly; the hotel offers complimentary made to order breakfast and free drinks during the Managers Reception. Pool areas were very nice and the bartender at the pool was fantastic. The rooms are suites with plenty of room and clean. The bathroom sink area needed a little updating as the sink had a big chip in it, but not a big deal. The atrium is beautiful, glass…

title: It depends upon the location of your room.
review: We stayed one night before our flight home. As Embassy Suites goes this one is typical, although it needs updating. The check in was fine, room clean and comfortable, evening reception and breakfast average. When we arrived in our room it looked right out on 12 lanes of interstate 4, it did not seem that loud at first. We spent most of the evening in the front room and I assumed the noise would die down once we got to bed.....wrong. I4 is just as loud at 3 am as it is at 3 pm.....constant roar of trucks whizzing by. If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room that faces International Drive.

title: Great Value
review: We just recently stayed at this hotel while visiting the Orlando area for 3 nights.  It was a girls weekend and we all commented what a great value the Embassy Suites was.  Our suite had a refrigerator and microwave and the bedroom area had an extra sink and mirror in it.  Given that there were 3 of us in the suite, it was nice to have the extra area to get ready in the morning. The breakfasts were fantastic--cook to order omlets which were great.  We found all the staff very pleasant and friendly.  Everyone spoke to you whether it was in the halls, at the breakfast area, lobby area or out front.  Very friendly staff.  We also enjoyed the free mixed drinks/beer and wine each night along with the appetizers.  This hotel is located right next door to an Olive Garden and there are…

title: Beautiful Hotel, will stay again
review: This was a last minute reservation, and the staff was very helpful in securing a room for me and my service animal. I will stay again when visiting Orlando. Excellent hotel. Hot and delicious breakfast, excellent happy hour. The decor is pleasant and peaceful to the eyes. The hotel itself is the best by far, especially the beds. I have a back problem and when I awoke the next day, my back was not hurting at all, and believe me, this is important to me to have a good night sleep without any pain. Will tell all my business friends. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Business Trip
review: The extras you get with Embassy are always great. Free breakfast, coctail reception. While not the most cutting edge of the Idrive hotels this one sure fits it nicely and is very well taken care of. This is my go to hotel about 6 times a year and will continue to do so.

title: Great hotel!
review: My family and I stayed here one night to visit with a family friend on our way through to Key West. The hotel lobby was so gorgeous I couldn't believe it when we walked in! It was by far the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The price was not bad for how nice the place was.  The continental was free and had quite a bit to choose from including omelet/egg station, oatmeal, fresh fruit and more! Although we did not use either pool (indoor and out), they looked very nice. We stayed in a double room with a sofabed and we were very comfortable. The only downfall was that the staff was not overly friendly. I am not saying that they were rude, but I just expected a little more from such a nice hotel.

title: Excellent stay
review: Recently visited Orlando and had a lovely stay here! Food and drink were lovely, service was great and we saved $10 on our Disney tickets buying them in the hotel. The shuttle was great too and took us straight to Epcot ready for park opening.

title: Good stay, great staff!
review: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a great stay! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a nice size, the extra bar area was great to have. The bathroom was a bit small, but not any smaller than other hotel bathrooms I've been in.   Breakfast was very good, the omelets delicious. I just wish breakfast ended at 10 during the week. (Ends at 9:30)  pool area was nice. The shuttles to Disney were great. They were there every day on time.   Other than the room being a bit musty this hotel was just what we needed. It was a very good stay! We would definitely stay here again!

title: Not Impressed
review: I stayed in room 604 and the room has a lot of things that show it needs some upkeep.  It takes a while for the water to get hot. At check in they checked me into a room that was still being cleaned waited outside the room with the bellman for about 10 minutes.  They had no info on a trade show that I was attending about shuttle service.  Every time I walked by the front desk they had there heads buried in the computer while no guest were there and never acknowledged me. I was very disappointed especially for the price I was paying. There was so much more but you get the idea.  I would stay somehere else too many other choices to pick from.

title: The best front desk staff I have ever experienced combined with an unfortunate experience = a less than excellent review
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I assure you that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are sorry we let the ball drop. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience and appreciate your comments so we can address each issue with our staff. We appreciate that you shared your room number so we could quickly inspect and remedy the hot water problem. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider giving us another chance.   Kind regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great stay!
review: My wife had a convention at this hotel in which she was a presenter. Let me begin with some positive info.....The front desk personnel at this hotel were, without doubt, the best I have experienced in years of hotel stays.   Ask them "Where can I.....?"  and the answer is "Let us do that for you"  The breakfast is excellent including eggs made to order...a really nice touch.  The accommodations are quite good, however the bathrooms seem a bit dated.   We had a bad experience at this hotel, and had it not happened, I would have given the hotel and "EXCELLENT" score.  The hotel offers free transportation to the theme parks.  We thought we would go to a theme park on one of our 3 days at the hotel, the other two days being focused on the conference agenda.  We did not realize that…

title: Nice Place
review: Rooms are clean and staff friendly.Near almost all the good sites with plenty of restaurants to choose from.I would stay here again!Grounds are clean and lots of parking .Easy access of main roads and Interstate.

title: Bad Hotel
review: Started off our two week honeymoon in this hotel. We were staying here for one night and then we were moving on to a cruise and then coming back to this hotel for the second week. We had to change hotels for the second week because this was not a good hotel.  Reception in the hotel is fine and the staff are friendly, but its when you get to the room that you are let down. Rooms look like they have not been done up since the 60's and the front door into the room would not close properly.   Found hair all in the bed when we got into it.   It is right beside the motoway and the windows do not keep out the sound of the cars and trucks travelling past all night and trust me its loud.  Bathroom was old and dirty. Mould around the shower was terrible, Bathroom door was rotten where the…

title: Tired
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience!  First and foremost, congratulations on your recent nuptials. We're glad you chose to stay with us for your pre and post cruise honeymoon. I'm terribly sorry for the cleanliness experience you encountered and deeply regret that we could not offer you the great hospitality we pride ourselves in. I can assure you that we do not take mold issues lightly and additional protocols will be implemented to ensure we're doing all we can while servicing guest rooms. I am sorry for the inconvenience and disappointment. Please contact me directly so I can personally apologize.  I can be reached via email at william.friedrich@hilton.com or feel free to call me at (407) 581-4301.  Kind regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: EXCEPTIONAL STAY
review: If I had not arrived as late in the evening as I did, and as tired as I was, I would have found another hotel instantly.  Instead, I struggled through one night in this old, tired, depressing, dark and gray hotel.  Air in the entire hotel is stale, furniture is circa 1950's, front desk is impersonal at best and uncaring at it's worst, and although not necessarily dirty, one sensed that it was not clean - mostly because hallways were dim, carpets were threadbare, walls were scuffed, furniture dinged and everything just was in urgent need of updating.  Checked out the next day and found another hotel which didn't make me feel like I had to avoid contact with as many surfaces as possible.

title: Not as good as usual
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I'm terribly sorry that you were disappointed with the look and feel of our hotel. We're always looking for new ideas to enhance our offerings. I'm also sorry to hear about your encounters with our staff. Great service is very important to us and I can assure you this is being addressed. We appreciate all of your feedback and hope you will come see us again soon. We'd love to hear what you think about our progress.  Kind regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Definitely worth coming back to
review: This hotel stands out from the rest. The high quality of decor, fixtures and fitting in the whole hotel and the suites are far superior to more contemporary competitors. The breakfast is exceptional and you could not think of anything for all tastes that is not available. The evening free cocktails are a benefit worth having too.The thing that makes the Embassy stand out above all is the quality of the staff. From front desk to the cleaners everyone is helpfull, friendly and genuinely want you to have a good stay. Nothing seemed too much trouble. When our two weeks was up we were sorry to leave. Perfectly positioned half way along International Drive transport links are more than adequate if you do not have a car. The indoor swimming pool is full size and properly maintained…

title: Christmas va-cay at the Embassy
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 2 days, Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. Our family of four had a great stay. I read reviews prior to booking and got a good sense of what to expect. Great location and is in the midst of everything. So much to do. Great staff, helpful. Great breakfast and manager's reception, although snacks were a little weak on Christmas Eve. We would have enjoyed some good music during the manager's reception. Great value.

title: Always an Excellent Stay at the Embassy
review: Stayed here for 2 weeks (Nov-12 / Dec-12) as a group of 6 staying in two suites.  This was our 5th stay here in the last 6 years, and for the rest of our party this was their 17th consecutive year at the hotel.  All the staff were great (Food & Beverage, Breakfast, Housekeeping etc).  Special mention to Charlene and Lennox at the Bar at night – always remembered our drinks orders, were very friendly and Charlene especially remembers us from our previous visits and was so nice and friendly to us all.  The Hotel is ideally located with I-Ride stop outside, and within walking distance there are plenty of restaurants and takeaways (TGI, Olive garden, Tony Roma, Miller Ale House, Ming Court, Pizza Hut, Dominos, Subway etc) , Pointe Orlando (shops and restaurant, cinema), Adventure…

title: still 1st class. staff are some of the best
review: hi.  i reviewed this hotel after our stay in 2011. i couldnt have praised it any higher. so we decided to stay again in december 2012. the hotel hasnt changed. its still a really good hotel. so much so, we have already reservations for 2013.  1 thing really stands out as being quite unusual. it was 14 months since our last visit. so how many people would pass through this hotel in that length of time? A LOT. but still we had numerous members of staff greeting us with enthusiastic ' Hi , welcome back, its good to see you again ' .  as i said in last years review. the staff arent being friendly because its their job. they are just friendly. the fact that so many staff are there year after year is a good sign.  its also nice to walk in on your arrival and notice so many people,…

title: It was Okay, but have seen better Embassy Suites
review: The hotel seems a bit dated.  The rooms are okay, but the bathroom doors do not have locks. The blankets we used had holes in them.  One of four elevators broken on Christmas and caused some major delays.  The breakfast was okay, nothing too fancy. The atmosphere of the hotel is laid back and not too much traffic in the atrium.  Perhaps that is because everyone is there for the theme parks.  They are no safes in the rooms, which is very common today.  Parking in and out is very easy and the kids enjoyed the indoor pool.  I did expect a bigger Embassy Suite with more going on.  The staff was very good and were always nice and helpful.

title: Excellent hotel-Nice Rooms w/ separate living room/kitchen area
review: Thank you for sharing your experience!  We truly apologize for the elevator challenges during visit and we're sorry that it was not rectified in a much quicker manner. Our housekeeping staff replaces items that do not meet our quality standards and we appreciate you notifying us about the holes in your blankets. Thanks again for sharing your comments. We hope you will come back and see our friendly staff again. They're anxious to show you our improvements.  Kind regards,  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great last minute change
review: The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating with our last minute need for a room. The room was clean.  The beds were comfortable.  No complaints at all.  We did not have a chance to hit the breakfast.  I felt bad for the valet, as some guest failed to read the clearance notice for the pull thru, lots of damage.  Hopefully they were able to get that fixed.

title: It was ok
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  All of us here at the Embassy Suites Orlando – International Drive South were excited to hear that you enjoyed your "last minute" visit with us.  We did indeed get our porte cochere repaired and the hotel looks much more welcoming than it did during your visit.  We hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: third time a charm........
review: It was ok not the best not the worse would use it again breakfast was good rooms where cleaned everyday very good location I reviewed a lot don't look into all you read as you will be pleasantly surprised everyone's tastes are different

title: The only hotel we will ever stay in!!
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We were happy to read that you enjoyed your overall stay and specifically the breakfast we provide.  We hope that when your travels bring you to Orlando again, we'll have the chance to welcome you back.   Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: great location, capable and helpful staff, very good hospitality with breakfast and happy hour
review: myself,husband and teenage daughter,3rd December/17December....Wow,what a welcome,it was like coming home,check in with Hugh was easy and Robert remembered us from last time,when we arrived in our room we had been left bottles of water in the fridge and plenty of tea and coffee at breakfast area,..room was spotless and fresh,a knock came to the door and a lovely lady handed us a platter compliments of front desk staff,...cheese,crackers,nuts and fruit..just lovely....as usual the hotels breakfast was topnotch,the staff super friendly and helpful,special thanks to Ryan,Robert(get to Cork Robert lol) and Lennox,our lovely housekeeper Julie who always made sure we had plenty of fresh towels and toiletries....Carmen is a knockout at the breakfast station!!!,iride passes are given…

title: lovely stay, friendly staff, excellent location
review: just got back from stay 6-20th november. we were going to the nv with virgin but because it wasnt finished we swapped to the embassy suites. so glad we did, the hotel is fantastic. shuttles were great 20 minutes to disney, 15 minutes to universal and free irides for seaworld and shopping malls either end. the iride takes approx 20 minutes to seaworld. they run every 20 minutes between 8 and 10.30. shuttles to disney at the time were 8.10 and 10.40 returning 5.15,8.30 and 9.45 and universal was 8.30 and 10.30 and back 7.15 and 9.15. prompt services and efficient staff. the concierge member huan was fantastic always stopped to talk to us and play with the children. Drinks reception was good for a freebie only used it properly once because we were so busy, served between 5.30 and…

title: Location, Service and Quality is Top Shelf
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel Nov 16th to the 23rd and couldn`t be any happier.  From the great staff and I mean ALL of them to the BEST cook to order breakfast in the morning to the managers reception each eve from 5:30 to 7:30 pm where the drinks flow like free money.  I mean if this place offered free lunch it would be considered all inclusive.  Two pools, two hot tubs,  hot tubs were hot and the pools were warm,  soft and clean towels,  great parking and if FREE I might add.  Honestly if you want to be close to everything and in the center of a ton of great restaurants then this is the place to stay...  It blew our expectations away.....Loved this hotel and will recommend this hotel to everyone. We are Canadians ages 51 and 49.......loved it, I should add that my wife…

title: Usual Embassy Suites
review: This is the first time I have stayed at this Embassy Suites.  It was pretty much what you expect. Room was generally clean with some wear in the carpet.  There were some minor stains on a pillowcase, the curtain in the window and the curtain in the window facing the atrium.  Everything in the room worked properly (phones, microwave, fridge, televisions, lights, etc.)  They had valet posted, but never saw one.  They had bell man, but they never offered to assist with luggage unless you specifically ask them, then they only have one luggage cart to share between two bell men.  The manager's breakfast was well staffed and the omelets well prepared.  They had three cooks-chef making and serving the egss and omelets.  Lots of staff cleaning tables and keeping things moving in the…

title: Great stay, good service, polite friendly staff
review: We stayed here from 6-20 nov in a family suite, hotel very well located and reception happy to give free I-ride tickets for transport up and Down international drive, shuttles to disney are good times and staff very friendly, on site business room to check email and send fax/print etc was a free added bonus.hong who is a chap from Hong Kong on concerige was so friendly and always making the effort with the kids making balloons etc he even sat with us one night during the managers special complimentary 2 hour free bar. Great location with being over the road from subway/dominoe pizza and a big Walgreens. Bahama breeze deff worth a trip but pre book as always busy, we did try to go in senior frogs(also over road) but Music was just to loud for small kids. Overall a strongly…

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Stayed here in a 1 bedroom suite over Halloween.  We were allocated a twin room but the front desk was happy to change to a king size for us.
