Sofa bed in living area was big enough for 2 and the king bed in the bedroom was huge and very comfortable.  Suite had all amenities you need, fridge, microwave etc and was perfect for a party of 4. Location on international drive was excellent a short distance from many bars and restaurants.  Suite was spotless with towels and toiletries changed every day.  Only negative was the lack of a room safe though we could utilise a safety deposit box at reception for most valuables but this was not big enough for laptop or iPad.  Self parking was free with plenty of space.  Would certainly stay here again.

title: Great Hotel to at if you are going to the convention centre.
review: Stayed at the Embassy suites Orlando Convention Center last year January and am booked in again. Rooms are similar to all Embassy suites (big and clean) but the lobby is different than the others. It has a tropical theme which fits Florida. Can't smoke in the rooms but can by their pool. Lots of resturants well within walking sistance from hotel. Free cocktails between 5:30-7:30 but the bar staff is surley. Nice breakfast included in the morning. Front desk very helpfull and knowledgeble.

title: Good for families, OK for business travel
review: I stayed recently at the Orlando International Drive Embassy Suites when I got to town the night before I was to check in at my convention hotel. It was adequate, but nothing special. First, the facility looks fairly old. It’s the atrium design that is so prominent in Embassy Suites. The rooms have large windows that face out onto the walkway, so you have to make sure the drapes are closed if you don’t want passers-by watching you watch TV. The room was clean and had the usual kitchenette. There was flat-screen TVs in the living room and bedroom. There was a charge for internet use, but since I was there for only one night, I went without. The manager’s reception wasn’t as nice as others I’ve experienced at Embassy Suites. The service at the bar was fine, but the snacks were…

title: Amenities Galore!!
review: Embassy Suites are the best hotels for big and small families. They have an amazing breakfast buffet with omelette station, fruits, cereal, pastries, eggs, bacon,sausage, and potatoes. We all know that going to a restaurant for breakfast is expensive!! Everyday from 5:30-7:30 pm they have a FREE managers happy hour. Beers, wine and some mixed drinks. Where else can you get that? Free shuttle bus to the theme parks. Free day pass on the iride bus. Rooms are all suites. Very spacious and clean. Overall, this is an excellent hotel.

title: Embassy Suites International Drive - Average
review: First night we arrived after 20 hours of traveling the guy at the front desk put myself + my family in a one bed room. After complaining he put is in a room on the left side of the hotel which is probably the nosiest room I have ever stayed in, (outside is some sort of generator which sounds like an airport terminal with a plane just landing). If you ever stay here ask to be located on the right side of the hotel. I complained again as I could not sleep and was told I'd have to wait until the morning to see if another room would be available. The next day I was like a walking zombie and this time there was a stoney faced girl at reception who put us in a room on the right side of the hotel which was much quieter (no apology offered). We put this behind us and decided to get on…

title: embassy suites accomadation
review: excellant location staff excellent free transportation to universal I ride outside the hotel free breakfast and 2 hours managers special every evening suites large with two tvs tiffany at receptition excellent golf arranged for children very good at shingle creek

title: Just average as Embassy Suites go.
review: The bed was really comfortable and the room was clean but that's about the best I can say. Rooms on the back side are very noisy because of the Interstate hwy. Bathroom was in need of a big makeover. Tub coating peeling off and grout stained. Alarm clock did not work. Also asked front desk to help me with shuttle reservation and leave message in my room. The lady forgot to do it. I stayed at Embassy Suites in Denver (you can read my review here on TA) and I gave them a 5 stars rating. This Orlando property has a long way to go. Rumor from the staff is that the entire hotel will get a complete makeover in 2014. Be advised.

title: Good location for events at the Orange Ct Convention Center
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your stay at our hotel. We’re sorry that we did not provide the exceptional service you expect from our brand. There is no excuse to for lack of service or poor conditions. We do not currently have a plan in place for a full renovation but we are taking on multiple improvement projects in 2013 including the resurfacing of our pool, the modernization of our elevators, the installation of new fan coil units in several rooms that have air flow trouble and more. While these projects will have a very postive impact on the guest experience at our hotel, I am happy to say that these are projects that will not disturb on normal day to day business or the guest experience while the work is being done.  We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.  Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Great service, not bad for the price
review: My husband and I stayed here in May, 2012 for his daughter's law school graduation at the nearby convention center.  The location was great and easy to find - navigation to downtown was simple.  AND if you have a blended family that needs to gather between graduation events it is terrific to have the living area that the Embassy Suites provides with every room.  Could use some sprucing up but considering the pre-purchase price, the size of the rooms and breakfast included I am not complaining!

title: Best Hotel on International Drive
review: I stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive (yes, there are a couple in the area...so make sure you know which one you are going to) from 8 to 11 October, 2012.  I have to say right off the bat that the service is GREAT!  I have traveled a fair bit, so the staff did a great job in the service department.  The property itself is a typical Embassy Suite setup - large rooms with the usual inner courtyard for the hotel.  Complimentary breakfest where you can have eggs to order or a pretty dang good omelete (beware the coffee!  Its pretty bad, and I've been in the Army for 20 years).  The biggest "con" I can say about the hotel is that its starting to show its age.  There are only so many layers of paint you can throw up to cover things....its really all minor though unless…

title: Needs a remodel
review: If you are looking for a hotel on International Drive, Orlando, the Embassy Suites is by far the best choice. I have stayed on I-Drive several occasions and this hotel is a class above all others. All the staff are so willing to help and make your stay plesant and comfortable. I dont want to name individuals as  I beleave it is a team effort and what a wonderfull team they have. The included cooked breakfast  was was simply superb and as much choice as many as the local diners-so saving to be made there. The beds are the most comfortable, I now have to buy a new one at home to match! All in all, an excellent hotel, great amenities inc free internet use and wi-fi, and super, super staff. Do not hessitate to stay at the Embassy Suites on I-Drive Orlando, (not to be confused with…

title: Average, could be cleaner....muggy....
review: This Embassy is not 'bad' but I left after my 1st night to stay at another property on my 2nd......the room felt muggy the whole time, regardless of the air being on.  Also, the towels felt wet even before use, when they were obviously clean.  I just think the building is old and needs a re-vamp to take care of the issue of keeping the air dry and clean (the muggy air trapped inside promotes mold....and you could see anything metal had rust growing as well).  I had this issue with the Embassy in Miami a while back, and I have since stuck to HGI or Hamptons, or Hilton proper.....just seems like some of the Embassy Suites lines are going downhill.  The bathroom was just OK, but there were occasional 'hairs' (NOT mine!) that were from multiple persons.....they had wiped the main…

title: Top of the class!
review: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay with us. I sincerely apologize that we were unable to meet your expectations.  Since your stay we have identified some rooms that have air flow challenges and we are replacing the fan coils / air conditioners in several suites.  Furthermore, after receiving multiple comments such as yours, we have increased our internet bandwith to provide an improved experience.  I hope that if your travels bring you back to the area that you will consider staying with us again for a better experience. Thank you again.      Bill Friedrich General Manager

title: Made you feel right at HOME...
review: Here's the straight goods: - Large size one bedroom suites were great - All the staff 'jumped' to help you every time - Made to order 'Hot Breakfast' was fantastic - Plenty of room to lounge in the atrium  - Manager's Happy Hour every night, started your evening off with a smile - Within walking distance of everything you could want in terms of Restaurants & nite-life - Hotel shuttle available 24/7, courtesy of a great concierge (Hung knew everything!) - Pools were great, for kickin' back during down-time  Recommend this hotel, 110%!

title: An Embassy Suites, just needs some touchup and beware the Expressway
review: What a super Hotel, it's got the lot and more. First let’s get the negatives out the way, a wee bit tatty in places, the rooms need new bathrooms, a coat of bright paint and new carpets(room 632 nice and quiet faced I-Drive and car park) other areas very clean and tidy(pity 1 of the lifts was OOO for the fortnight)4 lifts. Now the goodies, what a very friendly and welcoming staff there 2 days and you know them and they know you, the reception staff are very helpful(free I-ride tickets to SeaWorld and Shops) now the breakfasts, a brilliant start for the days out at the Parks. Check out big Lennox Lewis at the 17:30 -19:30 managers’ free cocktail bar he’s cool and makes a mean cocktail. All the maids are very friendly and nothings a problem. Watch out for FBI he’s one of the house…

title: Excellent position on I Drive
review: Overnighted here since I was attending an event at the Convention Center.  Checkin fast and fine.  Suite was typical Embassy Suites, though the furniture was a little bit worn (tattered arms on the sofa, water stains on upholstery of an easy chair).  My room, 602, faced the I-4 expressway, so was noisy throughout the night.  Exercise room was nice, and the bartender (a UCF student) was friendly while serving drinks.  Breakfast with the made-to-order omelettes was good, though there were no wafflemakers, and they seemed to only have styrofoam cups (with no lids) for hot beverages.  it is a LONG walk to the Convention Center especially in the heat, but convenient to typical chain restaurants along International Drive.

title: A good choice
review: This hotel is in I-Drive and within walking distance or short cab ride to alot of places to eat or shop.  The hotel lobby and center area are very nice.  It seems a bit dated in areas.  The rooms are all suites, separate bedroom and living area with pullout couch. The bedroom has its own sink, the bathroom is located within the living area.  There is also a small bar, fridge, coffee maker.  Its really nice actually. I was in room 321 and it was a bit noisy.  I'm not sure if it was the elevator or some construction going on.  It didn't really bother me at night when sleeping though. There is a full hot breakfast, NOT continental, with made to order omlettes and fresh melon.  The FishEye Grill has good food as well.  The pool area isn't huge but quite nice.  They also have the…

title: Love a Good, Made-to-Order Breakfast
review: Overall: I was here for a conference in September.  Talking to one of my work colleagues based in Florida, he said that there are two Embassy Suites in Orlando, and the one on International Drive is the better one.  Huge relief as it’s difficult to change these conference reservations!  Anyway, it’s a standard Embassy Suites set up, great daily breakfast and happy hour.  The facilities were a bit worn, but nothing unpleasant.  Service was average, although I thought the bell boys were friendly and good.  One offered a great suggestion of a steak house across the street.  Location to the conference center, it’s about a 10 – 15 minute walk, and depending on the weather could be miserable.  Across the street were several restaurants, in fact there were several restaurants all along…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Just arrived back from spending at a week at this hotel. Large suite more than ample for both of us. Extremely clean. Good breakfast with omelets cooked to order and plenty more to choose from. The position of the hotel was excellent , near to bars and restaurants and an I Drive trolley stop and Lynx bus stop near to the hotel entrance which is good if like us you don't drive. We had a room on the 8th floor at the front and weren't bothered by noise at all. All staff very friendly and when we come back would not hesitate to stay here again

title: Nice for orlando
review: It is what it is! This is a tourist town. The hotels here get used used and abused every day. I am a diamond member and used points to stay here for a week. Room is dated a bit, but are clean. The breakfast is fine....hey, it's free....and given the amount of money we have spent on other meals, I'll take free any day. The staff has been nice. They must have an elevator problem as I have seen many posts about that, but there are 4 of them. If one is down, pick another!

title: Never have I had a time like this
review: I have never stayed at a hotel and got to know the staff by name like this. This is a hotel that has seen many visitors I get that but the staff here makes up for that in a big way. Venessa, Luz, Alma, Jose, Robert, and Ron you people are the best. They made our stay up to Hilton Quality these people love what they do and want you to enjoy your stay. So if something is not up to your standards let them know they want to make it right  do not complain about it on Tripadvisor with out giving them a chance to make you happy.

title: Good surprise
review: Excellent location for convention center, across the road from many popular restaurants. Very friendly staff, spacious rooms, very clean, complimentary breakfast with eggs cooked at request, complimentary wireless in room internet, office center. It is definetly abp great quality price! Will return next time in town

title: Great hotel - definitely recommend to others
review: This was our first trip to Orlando and International Drive.  I cannot fault this hotel.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  The rooms were cleaned to a high standard each day and were spacious for us as a family (two adult, two children - 11, 14).  The breakfast is excellent with lots to choose from.  Complimentary snacks and drinks available from 5.30-7.30 pm each evening.  There was a courtesy shuttle to some of the theme parks and an I-Trolley stop right outside the hotel.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return in the future.

title: Request a room in the back!!
review: We stayed here last week for a quick trip to Disney for my 4 year old before she headed back to school.  The hotel was great and we were happy to get a room that was at the end of the hall, and how close it is to a variety of restaurants.  Went to the Managers reception at night and there was a long line with OK snacks, but the breakfast made up for this.  The major problem was we had a room facing the road and we could hear VERY LOUD music from Senor Frogs across the street uptil 1030pm.  If you are up till this time not a big deal but with a 4 year old this just did not work for us!

title: Great Hotel..will recommend it!!
review: I finish in the hotel after been disappointed at another hotel that I made reservation for more than a month ago and I look at the reviews and decided to go to the hotel without reservations. The staff although was not really talking a lot, book me and give me a room. As soon as I when to my room I was not disappointed. The room meets my expectations; it was clean, smell clean. The only thing that it bother me is that the curtains in the living room don’t close completely and if you are sitting in the living room and people walk in the hall they can see you inside and it made me feel uncomfortable.  I nice touch is having free breakfast in the morning is very good. Although the only think I will suggest is having an opportunity to also get sandwich, a simple sandwich such as…

title: Clean and inviting
review: Everything was top notch except the sleeping.   DO NOT stay near an elevator.  I didnt hear any people going up and down, just the mechanical noise of the elevator  Drinks and snack at night were well received. Breakfast was excellent   Walking distance to MUCH to include the convention center. I will/would stay there agaun

title: Noise.....
review: I've got to admit I like the Embassy suite franchise, normally. Unfortunately this particular hotel has a few comfort issues. Firstly the staff were great and when I requested a room move were very accommodating given that the hotel was full. The building is old and worn and once away from the lobby could be classed as worn out in places. The lifts are antiquated, slow small and noisy, I say noisy because they can be heard from the rooms at night when the ambient noise is at its lowest. The four lifts are located on the two sides of the atrium (not the front or back sides), oddly they make no noise descending on pneumatic jacks but are noisy on the ascent which is conventional (old) equipment. We got moved from a side room (lift noise) and sporadic a/c noise to a front (i drive)…

title: Relaxed
review: On arrival the staff were very pleasant and gave us our suite number.  The room was large with 2 double beds in the main bedroom and a pull out double sofa bed in the lounge. There were 2 large flat screen TV's, a microwave, coffee maker, fridge, table and chairs and plently of storage space. The bathroom was fine with a powerful shower plus there was an extra vanity sink in the main bedroom.  Breakfast is plentiful with as much to eat as you want, either omlettes cooked to order, a full breakfast, cereal, fruit,yogurts, bagels, toast, buns and drinks. Breakfast does finish promptly at 9.30 so it was a challenge for my kids to make it everyday, however it is fine to take food back up to your suite.  5.30 - 7.30 is the managers cocktail party where you can drink just about…

title: Embassy Convention center
review: Just what I expected and a great hotel, convenient location, free parking and a good restaurant for a business traveler. Staff was friendly. Outside pool was inviting. Free breakfast was very busy during this time of the year as there were lots of families doing the orlando scene. Easy to grab a muffin, banana and a cup of coffee. Lots of other restaurant choices in walking distance. Definitely would return on future business trips.

title: Nice people but run-down building
review: We usually use Embassy Suites because of the high quality. This hotel is the exception. Although the people were very nice at this hotel the building needs work.  We had small roaches and other bugs in our room (7th floor), the towels were worn and stained and the toilet seat was broken.  This place needs major work.

title: Would stay again
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this review!   I appreciate your candid thoughts and will be sharing them with the team.  I apologize we did not meet your expectations and I can assure you I take your comments with the highest urgency.    John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Work related trip but not a bad stay
review: Enjoyed the hotel in all , staff was helpful enough.  I would suggest stating on the very top floor where they were nice enough to move me after I woke to the sound of someone using the bathroom above me.  I guess that's just older pipes and walls.

title: Good for both conventions and amusement parks
review: I guess if you have to be somewhere for work, Orlando is not a bad spot at all!  Espicially on International Drive with all the choice to pass the time.  We are excited you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you come back to see us again soon.  We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando, and thank you for picking us!  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: HOTEL OF CHOICE EVERYTIME
review: Perfect hotel location in the center of International drive. Rooms are great, but a little old and dark looking. 2 swimming pools (indoor and outdoor). Breakfast buffet with a limmited selection, but a made to order egg bar.  I will definitely visit this hotel again.

title: Loved it so much, we came back again three weeks later.
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post your experience!  The highest compliment is earning your loyalty and we appreciate the very nice comments!  We are having a team building this week and building boats to race across the indoor pool, so I’m looking forward to a nice midday dip!    We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando and thank you for picking us!  Have a "Suite" day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great location
review: We stayed in this hotel/suites in September 2011. I can honestly say it was the best for location by a distance. Situated almost directly opposite Point Orlando and close to many many restaurants and shops!  The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially concierge Dee. He was amazing!! The rooms were spacious and very clean. There were 5 of us so we had to use the sofa bed which while not the most comfortable, was absolutely fine for the 2 weeks we stayed. To be honest, we were so exhausted at the end of a busy day in the park we could have slept in the corridor :) Every evening there were free drinks and nibbles, which was fantastic. The complimentary breakfast was a godsend. Ranging from fresh fruit to muffins to a full cooked breakfast! An excellant way to…

title: Very accommodating staff, nice rooms, and great options for rainy days!
review: I stayed here during the week of hurricane Debbie. We couldn't even make it down to Disney bc of the torrential rain. We were scheduled to leave tues and of course, weds the weather was to clear up. So embassy let us stay the extra day and leave our stuff in the room until we returned from Disney. We returned at 940 pm, no extra charge. Shuttles to Disney, free breakfast, and the indoor pool came in handy during a hurricane! Thank you for letting us stay the extra day! And ps, I'm very picky so this is a good one:)

title: Not the best Embassy Suites
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this great review!  Although very little damage, Debbie really brought the rain in full force.  We really needed it after an extended drought, but I know it can damper (pardon the pun) on a vacation. I'm so glad even through the bad weather you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you again for posting and we look forward to seeing you again soon!  John L Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Our stay in Orlando
review: I stayed at this hotel while attending at convention in Orlando. I am used to a bit more of a relaxed environment at the ES brand but this place was like tour bus central. The rooms too were a bit tired. This place just needs a total update if they want to be in keeping with the ES image.  I will say that everyone on staff that I interacted with was very cheerful & kind. Overall I would not choose to stay at the hotel again because it does seem to fit the perceived expectation that I have associated with the brand.

title: Thinking of staying here, Do it!
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this review!  July is a very busy month for the city and our hotel.  I apologize that everything was not up to your Expecatations, but thank you for the nice comments on the staff.  We are always striving to improve, and we will use your comments for just that!    John L Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great location
review: Having just returned from a holiday of a lifetime, which was enhanced by our stay at the embassy suites.  The staff were incredibly nice and efficient.  The suites were large and spacious, lovely breakfast and drinks reception.  The pool area small but adequate and very clean.  A special mention to Mark the concierge who was extremely helpful, Lenox the batman and Andrea the bar manger who were very friendly.  We would definitely stay here again

title: Fantastic hotel
review: My family and I stayed at  your hotel for almost three weeks beginning in mid June.We had a great experience and your hotel helped with this. Thanks so much to you and your staff who were at all times very friendly and helpful. I have no hesitation in rating the Embassy suits 10 out of 10 for clean spacious rooms, friendly staff, great location on I Drive, and an excellent breakfast. An added bonus was the Managers evening reception.

title: best hotel ever!
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this great review!  I’m so pleased you enjoyed your stay and will be sure to pass these great comments on to the team!  We really do have a great group of individuals working here who truly care about making our guests experience wonderful!  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you soon!   John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great family hotel
review: after a long day walking with the kids under the sun .....(by the way the lines were unbelievable in universal).......we were so lucky to get a suite at embassy.the staff is so nice and helpful, the room was awsome, clean and huge , the bathroom was paradise and the next morning....breakfast is out of this world: you get whatever you can dream for: omelettes, pancakes, fresh fruit, THE KIDS DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE and the swimming pool is great

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: Thank you so much for the great review!  Sorry for the delay in my reply!  We had a number of reviews hit in a short period of time and I must have not hit send on this one!  Not sure how that could happen to such an amazing review!  “Best Ever” is pretty cool!  Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review!  We hope to see you again very soon!  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: The main reason we stayed at Embassy Suites was due to past experience with this chain and overall value.  We just returned from a family trip to Orlando and stayed at this hotel.  As mentioned by others, the building is dated but well maintained.  We were very impressed with the friendly service provided by all the staff (from front desk to maid service).  Where most would just point out where to find things, the staff would bring them to you with a friendly smile.  The room was adequate for our needs and within walking distance to restaurants and shops.   Bathroom size was comparable to other hotels we have stayed in this price range.  Vanity space was sufficient to accommodate 3 females and 1 male.  We did see 1 bug in the sink.  Mild traffic noise could be heard in the back…

title: Friendly and helpful staff.  Good location.  Free self-parking.  Great breakfast!
review: As I read Trip Advisor it dawns on me that people like or dislike hotels usually based on that person's needs. As I read the negative reviews of this hotel that are posted now I can tell you this was not my experience in May 2012.  I never saw  cockroaches nor bed bugs.  I had never stay  at an Embassy Suites before so this was my first experience with Embassy Suites. I stayed there 6 days while attending a conference.  It is a convenient and safe walk to the Convention Center.  Self-parking was free so this was a benefit not provided by most hotels in the area.  I got there early like noon and was asking when I could check in (thought I would find something to do and come back) they told me I could check in then so I checked in early.  I spent a lot of time at the hotel because…

title: Great Staff - Nasty Run Down Property
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this super informative review!  You really hit some of the major points on our property.  The atrium is very nice to relax in when the temperature gets warm outside.  One thing I’ve always loved about this hotel is the construction.  We have concrete walls separating the suites vs. drywall in many hotels.  It makes for a quite bedroom at night.    Thank you again for taking the time pen this and we hope to see you again very soon!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Check your room!
review: My family and I recently stayed at this property for 7 days during June 2012.  The staff of the hotel were outstanding, very attentive to our needs but the building is flat worn out and is in desperate need of renovations.  We were there for 7 days and one of the four elevators was broken the entire time. Unless they were waiting on a critical replacement part from Bangladesh, failure to repair a stinking elevator car is simply lack of ownership commitment to maintaining high standards of the property.  Late one afternoon a thunderstorm came across the area dropping significant rain in a short time (can you say Florida).  Well the hotel lobby area looked like a war zone after.  The front lobby sitting area had (what looked to be) an inch or more of rain soaking the carpet in the…

title: This property needs some attention.
review: Thank you for taking the time to post this review!  We appreciate your great comments on the staff.  The recent storms found some areas on our new roof that are being addressed.  We recently did roof work and put the repairs to a water test, but It's impossible to replicate a Florida storm.  We know default areas and we have started addressing.  Thank you for all your comments!  Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Could not ask for any better
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suits International Drive at the end of May 2012, arrived at lunch time.  We noticed two rubbish bags and a tray with plates of left over food outside the room. Went out for the afternoon, when we returned at around 10.30pm the rubbish and plates were still there!  But worst, on entering the room we found cockroaches running around the fridge unit, around the bed area and across the floor. On checking the unit housing the fridge it was clear that they were getting in and out through big holes in the bottom.  The room was dim, shabby and looked like a $20 a night motel.  We did not stay the night and left....Would never have been able to eat here....  However, we know others that stayed and had a good time, and the picture in the brochure shows a room…

title: Best place to stay on International Drive (in our opinion)
review: We stayed for the first eight nights of our holiday in an excellent privately owned villa and were intending on moving to the coast for the remainer of our holiday, but changed our plans when we found out it was memorial day weekend, and decided to stay in Orlando.  Having chosen to stay in the Embassy Suites we quickly realised that we had made a very good choice and are happy to say that the six nights we stayed there ended our holiday on a good note.  We have stayed on International Drive several times in different hotels and we agree that this does appear to be the best place to stay. To start the location is brilliant with various places to eat and visit within walking distance or a short ride in car or trolley bus.  All the staff are very friendly, helpful and make you…

title: Exceeded expectations
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this great review!  I happen to share your opinion as well. I will be sure to share your comments with the team!  We are so glad you had such a great stay and looking forward to seeing you again soon!    Have a "Suite" Day!     John L. Parkinson General Manger John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Nice and Clean
review: Stayed here for 9 nights from 26th May.  Writing this on our last night.  The hotel is the best place I have stayed on i-Drive and I have been several times.  We arrived to sparkling wine and the biggest chocolate coated strawberries we have ever seen as it was a celebration of our 5th wedding anniversary.  The hotel manager John was kind enough to grant us a room exactly as we had requested too which gave a really good first impression.  All the staff were really friendly from front desk, to breakfast, housekeeping and bar staff.  The breakfast is plentiful and I respect that you should queue for your omelettes as this stops people getting lots of hot breakfast items and wasting them like you see in some of the chain 'all you can eat' breakfast places.  The managers reception…

title: Best Place to Stay in Orlando
review: You are very welcome!  Those strawberries are from near by Plant City, know for amazing strawberries. We are so glad you picked us for this important trip; we know you have a choice when visiting Orlando.  Good recommendations on the restaurants too.   Thank you so much for posting this review and we hope to see you again soon!    Have a "Suite" Day!     John L. Parkinson General Manger John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: First time visitor! Now lifetime guest!
review: Stayed for three nights during the Memorial Day holiday. This is not a very new hotel, but it is very well maintained and clean. It is obvious that the management and staff strive to keep the hotel in good condition. When I walked into the lobby it smelled and looked fresh and clean. This is very important to me since I had a very bad experience with the Embassy Suite in Jacksonville, FL earlier this year.  What I liked most about the hotel, beside the cleanliness, was its location, breakfast and happy hour reception. You can actually walk to restaurants and Pointe Orlando mall is only a ten minute walk. It is also very close to SeaWorld and Universal Studios. The breakfast offers a very nice selection of breakfast items, fruits and drinks. The evening reception offers beer,…

title: Very Nice
review: Stayed for our anniversary and very pleased.  Check in and out were both quick and easy.  Breakfast was good.  The first morning it was difficult to navigate but the next morning much easier having experienced it the day before (things are not well marked).  Indoor pool was great and our daughter really enjoyed going for a swim on a cool, cloudy day.  Also very convenient to have her on the sofa in the main area while we slept in the bedroom. We walked to restaurants and entertainment like mini golf.  On the down side I felt it was a bit overpriced.  We will likely stay here again.

title: Florida holiday 2012
review: Thank you so much for posting this great review! I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  Funny, even on sunny days that indoor pool is just as popular as the outdoor pool.  Hope to see you return in the near future. Safe travels.......  Have a “Suite” Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Good place to stay
review: Stayed at this hotel for two weeks in May,all the staff were very friendly and helpful.On arrival,Robert checked us in and advised us that the managers reception had just begun.Breakfast was good,rooms,although a little dated, were just fine with plenty of room for three adults and were kept clean by the efficient housekeeping staff.We were at this hotel because the new NV virgin hotel was not ready but we were glad because the location was just about perfect.The i trolley stop was just outside,plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.I must take this opportunity to thank the staff because we left some shoes we bought for our grandchildren in a drawer in our room.My wife contacted John Parkinson and he kindly arranged to get them sent on.In all i would highly…

title: A nice honeymoon
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this review. Glad you got your Chucks… that's what I called them growing up. Also, thank you for the great comments and highly recommending us. We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando and thank you for choosing us!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Doesn't get better.
review: I stayed for 4 days/3 nights this month. Checkin was quick and friendly. Lobby is clean. Room was clean and had everything I needed. I can see where previous reviewers spoke about upgrades/damage though-my granite counter near sink was cracked but repaired over. Breakfast was good, they were very on top of clearing trays and tables. Evening reception was nice. Pool area was clean, not overly crowded. Last day of room cleaning was late and I never got towels replaced. Otherwise good location for conferences.  Area is congested and there is no law that walkers get right of way in crosswalks so be quick!

title: Solid Stay
review: After a very long business trip in Florida, my husband and I had a couple days off before flying home. The staff was very friendly, and extremely helpful. We arrived at the hotel a couple hours early, and the gal at the front desk managed to check us in early. We were very grateful! Once in the room we were pleasantly surprised with the amount of space. A nice seating area with a mini fridge and microwave, and small sink. We stored our luggage there and spent most of our time relaxing in the comfortable king size bed. The two TVs in our room were good quality and large. A decent selection of channels.  We spent some time in the pool and the hot tub. Both were the right temperature.  We had one small problem with the toilet in the bathroom, something in the flushing system broke.…

title: GREAT HOTEL IN FUN LOCATION!
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this review!  Room Service, pizza and pool time sounds like a relaxing time after a long business trip.  I think I need one of those weekends soon!  I stay at Embassy's a lot as you can imagine and I found something very appealing with the TV's recently.  There are always two!  I can watch the Rays game while the others can watch cartoons, The Bachelorette...  OK, I really rented The Vow.  It was good!    Thank you again for posting your experience!  Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Second Visit
review: We stayed at this hotel Cinco De Mayo weekend. What a FABULOUS CHOICE we made!! First off, the hotel is fabulous for an Embassy Suites. The interior of the hotel is quite updated and trendy! We stayed on the 8th floor and had a very comfortable room. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodated every need we had. If your looking for a hotel super close to Universal (well this probably isn't it) however it is close but not walking distance close. This hotel is more so of the International Drive experience. It is located in a PRIME spot on International Drive. It located directly across the street from Senor Frogs Orlando, Bahama Breeze, and located next door to a Dave & Busters. SO MANY THINGS TO DO!! Across the street you will also find the world famous IceBar Orlando.…

title: I really wanted to like it!
review: Senor Frogs was a hot spot that weekend as expected!  I agree, International Drive is an amazing place to spend a vacation or just a fun weekend.  It’s really the only place in Orlando that all ages can have fun.  Don’t forget the free Trolley passes that you can use to get to some of the best shopping in the world!  Took a break at lunch the other day to improve my high score in basketball at Dave and Busters.           Thank you for taking the time to posting your experience!  Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Good hotel
review: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites and was even better than our first time! I emailed the hotel manager before our arrival just to ask for a suite on a high floor away from the lifts(for reasons already covered by other Reviewers) and also mentioned we were going to be celebrating my birthday. Not only did we get allocated a fantastic room on the 8th floor overlooking International Drive but I was also given a lovely cake on my birthday.   We stayed for 2 weeks and the hotel is in an excellent location - just a short drive to Universal (a bit longer to Disney but still an easy journey), a short taxi ride to some lovely restaurants on Sand Lake Road and easy walking distance to some lovely restaurants and entertainment venues on International Drive. We recommend…

title: Pretty good hotel
review: Ok so there were good points and bad.  First of all I am a 24 year old from England, UK and was travelling with my husband and his family ranging from ages 5 up to 60s. We arrived at the hotel about 1 am due to our flight being delayed and I wasn't feeling too well, so just wanted to get to our room as soon as possible. It wasn't until the morning that I realised we were in a suite with two doubles rather than a king size bed. The receptionist said there were none available, which is funny because we've had these rooms booked for over a year. Anyway we decided not to complain, we were in a nice corner of the 6th floor nowhere near elevators, overlooking a nice quiet area and our room was very comfortable so decided to stay.  The breakfast the bext morning was amazing. It was all…

title: Good Location- average experience
review: Thank you for taking the time to post this very informative review!  Like most hotels (other than on Disney property) we deliver to Epcot which is the main hub for all Disney parks. Dropping off at Epcot is very typical for hotel shuttles and prevents guests from having to wait while the shuttle goes park to park… which could take some time. We also have two, AM and two, PM shuttles to/from Universal. Where we really differ is we offer free Trolley passes to all guest which can be used for SeaWorld, Wet N Wild, Aqutica and anywhere else on International Drive; including the outlets. We shop other hotels shuttle service to make sure we are always one step ahead.  Some have more Disney trips, some more Universal; but we have one of the more robust transportation offerings on International Drive, if not the most.    Thank you again for this great review and have a “Suite” Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Not to same standards as previous
review: This hotel is well located for conventions and vacations.  I found the staff to be ok, some good and some not motivated, but no one excelled. The overall feeling is adequate. The rooms were cleaned very late most days, and breakfast trays piled up at tables many times. The cooks at breakfast grill were the highlights for the staff. I felt the property was a bit dated. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if room was cheaper than others in the area.

title: Busy Easter Weekend
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review! I will be sure to speak with the team and give kudos to the breakfast chefs.  I hope you give us a chance on you next visit to change your mind on our property. We typically start our housekeeping service at 8am, but in a high volume month like April, service can run until 5pm because so many guests are getting their well deserved rest in the mornings.  Of course, we are more than happy to clean any guests’ suite at anytime they request.  Thank you for posting your experience and have a "Suite" day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Not recommeded
review: We spent many stays in various Embassy Suites throughout the USA on business and leisure, hence we chose this one. Things are certainly different since the credit crunch hit? The suites are still a great way to holiday but the quality and standards of the Hilton group are just not there at least in this hotel. Some comparisons to three years ago are the easiest way to show the cut backs clearly evident: 1. Room decor: The decor has not been updated: these rooms have such a high turn over of visitors, they there for need to be kept up to date and managed properly with a good clean modern standard. This they are not: Our bathroom work surface was badly chipped and dangerous to touch! Clearly they had been smashed with a heavy object in the past! But long enough ago to round off…

title: Great Hotel, excellent location.
review: We stayed here for 16 nights on our first visit to Orlando and were not disappointed. Rooms are spacious and clean, pools are nicely maintained, staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is more than you could ever wish for. The shuttle service to the parks is well managed albeit slightly limited but a much better option than hiring a car in my opinion. The location is brilliant, right in the middle of some of the nicer restaurants and bars on I-drive and is opposite Bahama Breeze, our personal favourite.  Top that off with a lovely surprise Birthday Cake on my birthday and what more could we ask? Would (and already have) recommend this hotel to others.

title: A  little Resort on International Drive
review: Thank you so much for posting your experience and also recommending us to others!  I’m so glad you enjoyed your stay and had a nice Birthday!  Seems like people loving Bahama Breeze is the theme this month on our Tripadvisor reviews; I don’t blame them.  I hope you had the chance to check out some of the other great spots on International Drive while you were here!  A Fogo de Chao just opened within a 5 min walk and it is awesome!  It’s a Brazilian churrascaria steakhouse so it’s impossible to leave not stuffed! Just one more spot for you to try on your next visit!      Have a “Suite” Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Convenient
review: I selected this hotel for our  kids Spring  Break vacation  4/7-4/14/12 based on TA reviews, and we could not have have made a better decision. The hotel is located directly across the street from one of our favorite Orlando restaurants- Bahama Breeze..  and is surrounded by numerous restaurants, shopping & entertainment venues all w/n walking distance. Disney parks & Universal Studio are only short drives away. We were pleased from the moment we checked in until we departed. The check in lady ( Joanne) was so very pleasant, she reminded me of my sweet grandmother.  The entire hotel is clean, nicely decorated, and  has a very relaxing, laid back vibe. On Easter Sunday, the Easter Bunny treated the children at Breakfast to easter eggs... nice touch. The staff were friendly and…

title: Few issues, nothing tragic, would come again.
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this review!  Jo Ann (AKA the Easter Bunny) and Lennox are outstanding examples of great team members and I will be sure to recognize them personally.  I'm a huge fan of Bahama Breeze also!  I always look forward to a scallop special they run a few times a year. Lastly, Happy Birthday!  We always love to know when a guest is celebrating something special. Just because you are not at home, doesn't mean you don't get a cake!  :)  Have a “Suite” Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great Hotel for Kids & Adults
review: Stayed here with my bf to celebrate my Birthday. I requested a room away from the freeway and elevator and was given a balcony room with an awesome view of I-Drive. We stayed during the weekend and could hear people attempting karaoke at the bar across the street at night, which was pretty hilarious. The breakfast was very convenient and the parking was easy.  The staff was very friendly and would always greet us; they went out of their way to ask us how our stay was and where we were from, etc. It's a very quick drive to Universal Studios.   My only complaint is I personally notified the front desk staff that the phone in the bedroom was not working before we left for a late dinner our last night.  I was assured it would be fixed within 15 minutes since we were leaving. …

title: Convenient Hotel, great for families
review: Just stayed at the Embassy Suites I-Drive again for spring break with our son.  Great location.  Excellent activities and restaurants within walking distance.  Rooms and hotel were clean, staff was great and amenities were as expected from an Embassy Suite - free breakfast, manager reception, etc.  All in all - a great choice if you are in Orlando for conventions or theme parks.  As an aside, it is within walking distance of Dave & Busters - one of the best spots for kids!!!

title: Average Hotel, Above Average Staff
review: Thank you for staying with us again and posting your experience!  Looks like you had an enjoyable stay which is our top priority. Dave and Busters has been a great addition to the neighborhood, adding another option to help our guests create memories. Thank you for allowing us to once again be part of your well deserved time off. Hope to see you again soon!  Have a "Suite" Day  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: terrible service & junky pull-out sofa
review: This hotel is a little dated and is just okay. There is nothing really negative about it but it's not really an outstanding or excellent hotel.  The location is great and you can walk to a lot of restaurants as well as other attractions so that part was nice. The staff was very attentive and extremely helpful.   Including the breakfast is a nice but to say it's the best I've ever had would be a bit of a stretch. I probably would not stay at this hotel again only because there are nicer places in the immediate area for comparable prices that are either newer or recently updated.  With that being said, it's a perfectly average place to stay.  There is a bar that was close to our side of the hotel and this is kind of the party area for the city apparently and the noise was…

title: Excellent Place to Stay -- for Conventions
review: Thank you for taking the time to post this review!  I'll be sure to pass your comments about our service to the team.  As a consumer, I frequent establishments that provide great service; your comments about ours service levels is the highest compliment.   Thank you again for taking the time to review our hotel!  Have a "Suite" Day  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Even better than expected
review: We had a suite with two queens in the bedroom and a pull-out sofa in the living area.  I was on the pull-out and it was terrible.  The bed was junk, broken down and old.  And the worst was there was no blanket.  The airconditioning vent was just above so it was quite a bit cooler in this room than in the bedroom.  We asked for a blanket at 10pm, called back at 10:30 and learned the housekeeping room was locked and nobody had a key.  Finally after midnight the security guy brought me a blanket.  That's the worst service I've ever experienced in a hotel.

title: Excellent experience!
review: We absolutely loved this hotel.  The staff was attentive and helpful.  The entire hotel was clean and fresh.  We enjoyed the indoor pool as well as the outdoor, both are kept up nicely.  The location is perfect and the free breakfast was the best I ever had.

title: Luxury Hotel well placed for local amenities and access to attractions
review: Thank you for taking the time to review our property!  I'll be sure to pass your compliments to the breakfast team. It's really a bountiful feast each morning.  I have to exercise willpower each morning to walk past a cheese and ham omelet with a mound of pancakes and bacon.  The pastery is my weakness though!    Thank you again for your review!  Have a "Suite" Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: This hotel is situated on a part of International Drive which is a pleasant avenue replete with mature trees and a wide range of places to eat, drink and shop are in easy walking distance.  It is well served by public transportation and has good road access so travelling to and from the area’s many attractions and shopping venues is easy.  International Drive is in between the Disney and Universal complexes, so is well placed for those intending to visit both.  It is also only a short way (walkable) from the huge Orange County Convention Centre.    On entry to the foyer, you are greeted by a huge covered atrium surrounding which are the room walkways.  Above the ground floor level there are seven floors of rooms.  Public spaces and most rooms are non-smoking, but there are a few…

title: Great happy hour, lobby, breakfast.
review: This may be the single  most comprehensive and informative review I have ever seen!  I'm realizing that it will be impossible for me to write a response that will do your review justice. I actually don't think I could have written a better review myself... It flowed like a great novel. So now i find myself reviewing the greatness of a review of my hotel; so on that note, i will just say thank you for taking the time to write this! We appreciate that you have a choice when visiting Orlando and thank you for picking us!  I look forward to your next visit and review!    Have a "Suite" Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great base and breakfast too!!
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive this March.  We were in town for a swim meet and the hotel was just a 5 minute walk from the YMCA pool so this was very convenient for us.  There was no shuttle from the Sanford airport so we had to rent a car but the hotel was easy to find and it offered free self parking so it was not a problem. Breakfast was served from around 6:30 to 9:30 or 10 so there was reasonable time to eat and the food was always stocked and available.  The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, in fact more so than most hotels we have stayed at.  Our room was on the 4th floor in a corner area and it was really quiet and the beds quite comfortable.  The air conditioning unit at this hotel was so quiet we barely noticed it and this is…

title: another great holiday
review: Have stayed in this hotel several times before and as usual had a great holiday.  The rooms are of a very generous size with both bedroom and lounge.  Our room overlooked I4 which can be a little noisy if you have the patio doors open, but definitely not noticable with the doors closed and if you look passed the interstate you can see the firework displays of both Magic Kingdom and EPCOT in the evening.  Its nice that there are complementary drinks in the evening, a nice treat if we where back in time, and the complementary breakfast is more than adequate with plenty of choice.  The staff are faultless and nothing is too much trouble, it was my birthday on the day we arrived and a lovely surprise was a cake in our room.  The bar and breakfast staff are quick to remember our…

title: Great Value, great location, a nice stay.....
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this review!  I haven't watched the fireworks from the suites in a while, but remember it is a pretty good show.  We are so glad you had a great stay and thank you for choosing us! We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando.  Have a "Suite Day"  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Excellent Service & Great Location
review: We had an extended stay of 3 weeks in Orlando to make sure we did all the parks properly as we only visit Orlando every 10 years. This hotel was a great base, we stayed here 10 years ago and had a good stay then so we decided to go with what we know, only this time we had our children with us who are both under 9.  This hotel more than catered for everything we needed, good cooked breakfast every day included, a very good managers special every evening which we only occasionally took advantage of because of late stays at parks, the excellent Lennox was always very welcoming behind the bar, the lady occasionally in is place was not so friendly as Lennox and thankfully he was usually on hand to serve us. There are 2 pools, one inside and one outside. The atrium gives a nice open…

title: Not Bad (Disney Cruise Layover)
review: Thank you for taking the time to post such a detailed review!  It was a pleasure speaking with you while you were here!  I'll be sure to pass all your comments on to the team, including Lennox.  I hope you make it back sooner this time, and if you do we would love to see you again!  Have a "Suite Day"  John L. Parkinson General Manager John.parkinson@hilton.com

title: long long time ago
review: I booked a family 6 week holiday from Dec 2011 through to Jan 2012! We originally booked a villa which was not as advertised when we arrived. So we found this wonderful hotel and enjoyed our 5 week stay at this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, all helpful and friendly, the location was great for us, yes we did have a car but also used the free theme park shuttles, which again were great and the service good. With our small daughter it was easy to walk out at night and have dinner as there was lots right on our doorstep. We did have a small problem with a leak in our room and the staff were great at moving us to a new room, again great service. We would come back to this hotel again without hesitation.

title: Excellent Stay Close to Universal!!
review: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 2 nights while going to Universal in February.  I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a moderately priced hotel that gives you alot of amenities and a wonderful location close to restaurants, etc.  We have stayed at 5 star resorts in the past and felt more comfortable and at home here.  The suite (2 rooms) was very spacious and clean.  The atrium area was beautiful and the complimentary breakfast was fantastic.  In the evening we walked to the restaurants.  Especially enjoyed Bahama Breeze (across the street) and the Olive Garden (right next door).

title: excellent value and huge room!
review: Thank you so taking the time to post this wonderful review!  I can see Olive Garden from my office; I can also clearly see the hole in the hedge our guests (and maybe me too) have made walking over to it.  We are lucky to have a great restaurant on property and some amazing choices just steps from our front door!   Thank you again for taking the time to post this review!  Have a "Suite" Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Nice Orlando area hotel - close to lots of things
review: We stayed there just one night visiting my parents while they were in town for a conference. The room was very spacious and it was nice to have that extra little living room area. There were also two flat screen TV's, which was very nice! The front desk clerk had a little trouble finding our reservation so he gave us free internet so that was nice too! They had a social hour with free drinks every night. That was awesome! This hotel was a great value!

title: GREAT LOCATION
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to post this glowing review!  We know you have a choice when traveling to Orlando and we appreciate you picking us!  We hope to see you again very soon!  Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great Hotel, Clean Rooms, Slow Elevators.
review: We picked this Embassy (we like Embassy Suite Hotels) because of its location.  We were generally happy with it though the shuttle to the Disney property is pretty limited in its schedule.  The hotel could make guests more aware of the ameneties along International Drive and the Trolley that can take you to them (we had to figure it our for ourselves). A nice hotel with dependable Embassy Suites' features.

title: Location,Location,Location!
review: We stayed in this hotel early December 2011 and had a great stay! Rooms were large and comfortable if slightly dated. The curtains closing problem mentioned by other reviewers can be overcome by moving furniture but really is an issue which needs to be attended to by the management. Breakfast was great and the nightly happy hour was another bonus with unlimited drinks, although there were a few one evening who took the hotels hospitality too far!! Location is fantastic and we enjoyed great food at Bahama Breeze, Millers Ale House and Olive Garden without walking any more than a few hundred yards! This was a priority for us as December nightfall is before 6pm. Loads of other great restaurants in the area.

title: Wonderful
review: Location is key when picking a hotel.  Interesting fact, when this hotel was build there wasn’t much in the area of South International Drive; now it’s the hub of our visitor district.  It helps that the Convention Center has grown to one of the largest in the world and a few new neighbors (Sea World and Universal Studios) soon followed Disney’s lead to Orlando.  Now we are in the middle of a thriving, safe and fun area with tons to do.  I hope you had the Captain Jacks at Ale House!  If you missed it, it’s the best dessert around and worth a return trip!  Senor Frogs and Dave and Busters are two welcome additions within a two minute walk too!  I can go on and on, but what I really need to say is thank you for picking us and thank you for posting this review!           Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: 30th Birthday Party
review: Stayed for a little R&R... It was relaxing the people were friendly and accommodating.  Great Customer Service for the Breakfast bar....

title: Embassy Suites - Superb Location & Benefits
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this review!  I'll be sure to pass your compliments on to the team.  We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando and we appreciate that you picked us!    Have a "Suite" Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Fine hotel, but don't be misled....
review: We took our daughter and all our family (8 plus a baby) to Embassy Suites to celebrate her 30th. We rented two suites. Arrived at 4 for hot tub time (not very hot) and integrated it with the manager's reception by ordering drinks in plastic cups and transferring them to fun plastic themed goblets. The ladies wore black dresses with pearls to dinner and guys dressed up, too. Ordered Outback specials and sent one person to pick them up so we could eat in the hotel's beautiful atrium. We set up and decorated tables in the atruium with black table cloths, pearls, pink and black balloons and red petals. After dinner we cleaned up any messes and went to downtown Orlando on Church Street to the Dessert Lady and the younger crowd went to Ceviche's and a rooftop club at the Amway Center.…

title: Great location very nice staff
review: We stayed at the hotel for 1 week.We normally stay in luxury 5* hotels but since we were going to be out at the parks most days we thought this hotel would be o.k. My expectations we quite low and to be honest I was amazed. The staff we really helpful, the quite breakfast was great, they didn't charge us for wifi since we were on holiday. And to top it all off I went to reception to ask about a weather forecast and Zachary printed off the weeks for us. We went to parks for the day and came back to find a card from Zachary to say sorry the sineshine state was not very sunny at the moment but please enjoy so complimentary coffees on us. He had left a pack of coffee and hot chocolate with some Christmas sweets in our room for us. He also removed 3 movie charges from our room. The…

title: Great Location!
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to recognize our team for a job well done, specifically Zach.  He's been a great asset to the team and like so many on our team members, your experience is our top priority!  I'll be sure to share your experience with Zach and the crew!  Thank you again and have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great location...needs to work on their housekeeping and breakfast service
review: Friendly Staff, great location on International drive. Except for going to events, we never had to drive anywhere. Tremendous selection of Restaurants, Bars, and other shops, all within walking distance. There are two Embassy Suites locations on International Drive, make sure you book this location!  We were in town for the Capital One Bowl Game, and spent New Years Eve at Miller's Ale House, which was so much fun. Having a full Breakfast every morning, and the Manager's Cocktail hour every afternoon, is a great Embassy's benefit.   Staying at this Embassy Suites - AWESOME! Taking a great Airboat Ride - Great! New Years Eve at Miller's Ale House - PARTY!  Watching SC GameCocks win the Capital One Bowl! - Priceless!!!

title: Good hotel but don't turn up late
review: Great review!  Love it!   My grandfather was a proud Gamecock and would have been right there partying with you!  What a great game too!  Nothing like a late night at the Ale House and a bountiful breakfast made for you in the AM.  In my opinion, if you aren’t playing for a National Championship, there is no better bowl that the Capital One!  Thank you for taking the time to post this great review and have a "Suite" day!   John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: A friendly and smart hotel
review: This is the first time I've actually been disappointed with an embassy suites.  We paid for 6 guests in our room and only had 4 pillow 4 towels etc. we have had to call down to the front desk after every day of house keeping in order to get the proper amount of the needed amenities.   Not to mention is took an hour with engineering in order to local Channels on the TV so we could watch the NFL playoff game.    Breakfast is very good if you don't mind standing in line for 20 minutes to get any of the hot items...even the express items that are pre made.  Today every table was either  taken or was filled with dirty dishes.  We noticed that for nearly an hour not a single table got bussed by the staff and people were having to stack plates and trays all over the place just to…

title: Warmth of Hospitality
review: From the minute we arrived until the day we checked out, everyone worked to ensure our stay was the best!  In addition to the great hospitality, there are plenty of things to do, all within walking distance.  I would definitely recommend your property to anyone traveling to the Orlando area for the level of hospitality alone!

title: Great Christmas Stay
review: "It has been, and continues to be, our responsibility to fill the Earth with the Light and Warmth of Hospitality"  ~ Conrad N. Hilton, Our Founder.    This quote always brings me back to what our business was built on.  Not sure if you knew you were quoting our founder when you titled your review!  Mr. Hilton was onto something and realized one act of kindness, could domino into a more hospitable world.  It is truly our honor to service you and thank you for taking the time to post this review recognizing our efforts!     Sincerely,  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Good option for visiting Disney/Universal.
review: This was our 3rd trip Orlando but our first staying on I-Drive. We liked our previous hotel but fancied a change of area and had heard so much about I-Drive. This hotel was perfect for us why some people have to be so awful about this place makes me wonder why they bother going away as nothing would please them. We were 3 adults and a 13 year old. Our room was blissfully peaceful which surprised me as we stayed from 18th - 28th December and faced the front by the road. As the weather was wonderful we did use the outdoor pool area, lovely and clean and plenty of towels, also used the indoor pool again no problem. We liked the fact you could get a good breakfast and then be off for the day, breakfast choice good and something to suit everyone, unless ultra fussy and not pleased at…

title: Loved it... No complaints
review: Hello and thank you for taking the time to post this review!  You are correct; that is a busiest time of year for us.  We have a great holiday rush, along with the two bowl games played at the Citrus Bowl.  Glad to see with all the crowds we still helped you enjoy your stay!  I'll be passing this review on to the front office leadership to discuss further.     Thank you again for giving us an opportunity to serve you and have a “Suite” Day!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Great place to stay
review: First: I just read a recent review here on Tripadvisor that gave this property 1 out of 5 stars and complained about almost everything - ignore it.   It sounds like they just got unlucky.  It happens, and frequent travelers should know that.  That kind of unreasonable and picky traveler should just stay at more exclusive, luxury-style hotels.  Centrally located hotel on Int'l Drive, this property works no matter where you're headed in Orlando.  It's not the fanciest Embassy Suites I've been to, but it worked well for us.  Service at the front desk was good, and most staff we encountered throughout were helpful.  The restaurant has very good, if slow service, but the food is hit or miss.  Complimentary breakfast very nice with lots of options.  Great gym and indoor pool.  Also an…

title: we went back again
review: travelling were myself,husband and 2 teenage daughters,we went from 4th December/18th December.....there was no other Hotel considered when choosing our holiday for 2011,in the heart of i-drive,plenty of restaurants and shops close by and also the Pointe shopping center,shuttles provided by the Hotel were excellent,got us to the parks for opening and for Seaworld there was complimentry i-ride passes that lasted for 24hours....the breakfast as usual was a great start to the day and i must give a shout out to Carmen,even on the busiest mornings she kept smiling and always had a lovely "good morning" for everyone,yes some mornings there was a queue but hey,it's a great spread for free!and a good start for the day,the reception staff were very friendly,especially Zach and…

title: Home Away From Home
review: First, I love the profile picture!  What a sharp looking pup!  We always love hearing from our return guests and thank you for the email and we are excited you will be returning again next December! I'll be sure to pass all these great comments on to the team you mentioned in your review!  To remember all their names, they must have really left an impression!  They love to see their names on these reviews... kind of like a celebrity status thing I think!    Thanks again and see you in 2012!    Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Good hotel and good location
review: First let me say if you are able to get reservations at an Embassy Suites closer to Disney - Good Luck. The Embassy Suites on I-Drive location is a perfect fit to a families who want the Disney experience without all of the hussle and bussle.  Thank you to the following staff members of this location: Lennox, Ron, Sal, Elsa, Johnny, William, Denise, Robby and other names which escape me. All were pleasant and offered assistance without being asked.  Our family of 3 stayed the week after Christmas, and like many others mentioned the yummy breakfast in the morning, and the manager's social hour were very welcomed after spending HOURS in lines at the Disney parks...and I do mean hours :(.  Dave & Buster's is 2 buildings over, a welcome break from Disney. The hotel is walking…

title: Excellent service, great location!
review: I apologize for the delay in replying to your review; I recall writing it, but maybe never hit send.  Nevertheless, thank you for taking the time to post this review.  I'll be sure to pass your comments on to the team…thank you for taking the time to recognize them personally!    That might be the busiest weeks of the year in Orlando, so I bet the parks were a little more hectic than normal.  If you are looking to miss some of the busy season, feel free to contact us and we can guide you into some less hectic periods.    Thank you for taking the time to post this review and staying with us!  We know you have a choice when visiting Orlando and appreciate your trust in us!    Have a "Suite" Day!  John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Exactly what I was looking for!
review: This hotel is the usual Embassy Suites formula and is very good for family trips to Orlando. It is well situated on International Drive and is near a number of good resturants. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to the theme parks but operates on a restricted timetable.  The complimentary breakfast is good and hearty andof the standard that the Embassy Suites is well known for.  The complimentary Manager's Reception (aka "Happy Hour!) is a great way to finish a day at the theme parks.  Staff were very friendly. Rooms were clean and tidy and spacious. Beds were very comfortable.  There were a couple of minor cons. 1) The internet in the business centre was terribly slow. It took me 30 minutes to download some google driving directions and to "check-in" for our flights.…

title: A Good Hotel for the Disney Area
review: This past week I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 2 young children (4.5 and 1.5 years old).  We were also travelling with another family with same aged kids.  The Embassy Suites served our purpose very well.   We wanted to be in the Disney area without the big Disney prices and with flexibility to come and go on our own schedule with rental cars and to eat non-Disney food.  What we really liked about this hotel: --Rooms are good sized, amenities like kitchenette were very handy.   --Breakfast in the AM made the start to each day pretty darn easy --Pools were nice for our kids --Free parking --No resort fees --Clean and fairly comfortable --Quiet  What we wished would be different: --Pack and Play (aka crib) was tiny and rickety.  My son ended up sleeping with us which…

title: Great location!
review: Hello and thank you so much for taking the time to post this review!  I also am a fan of Bahama Breeze for the same reasons you are;  they have a great atmosphere and food!  Understand your comments on the softness of the beds; all Embassy's actually use  "super toppers" to soften the feel of the beds.  In the future, we can easily remove them if you prefer a firm mattress.  I’ll be sure to pass your likes and dislikes on to the team, so we can as always work to improve!  Thank you again for posting this review on our property!    Have a "Suite" Day!   John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Not up To Embassy Suites Name
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid December.  The hotel is in a great location, near parks and many, many restaurants nearby.  The convention center is within walking distance.   The weather was not optimal while we were there, so we travelled to Tampa *90minutes) and went to Busch Gardens, which was a great day.    The hotel itself was great.  There is a lot of room, and we usually stay at Embassy Suites for the separte sitting area.  The bed was very comfortable.  I specifically requested a quiet room, and we had one.  I agree with other reviews, stating that the rooms facing I-4 can be noisy.   The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the conceirge and bell man were both very friendly.   We discussed tickets to Busch Gardens with the…

title: Well-managed, great choice for OC Conv Center
review: I love Busch Gardens too!  Great rollercoasters!  I went on Manta at SeaWorld for the first time this weekend and rekindled my love for super fast rides!  Next stop is Busch Gardens.  BTW, thanks for posting this great review!    I’m not much of a coffee drinker …  but recently discovered espresso.  Here is a tip for all the readers: because coffee is so specific, we offer two types of coffee in the breakfast.  One near the milk and juice and the other brewed option in the atrium seating area.    I realize this doesn’t help you much now, but on your next trip to Orlando we will get your favorite coffee and have it ready for you.    Thanks again for taking the time to post this review!          Have a "Suite" Day!   John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: A great hotel and location.
review: To say this was the worst hotel experience I have had at a Hilton property or any property would be an understatement. I am a Diamond member at Hilton and stay at a Hilton property just about weekly. I spend usually 80 nights a year at hotels. From the second myself and my 8 year old got there it went down hill. We checked in at 4 oclock got the key from the desk clerk who barely said hello. I asked about getting a cart to get my luggage out of the car and he said to check with the person outside for one. I asked said person and the response I received was " I am too busy too help you right now if you can come back in 20 minutes you can have the cart" So needless to say I made several trips up and down to get our luggage. When we got in our room there was no remote for the TV,…

title: very nice
review: very nice hotel and free full breakfast friendly staff price is usually abit high but keep checking they usually drop if u book close to ur date i stay here everytime i visit orlando.

title: Most Enjoyable Stay
review: Firstly, I apologize for taking so long to reply to your post!  I was on a little vacation.  Thank you for taking the time to post such a great review!  We get so many guests from the Duval area as well and Tampa and South Florida who take advantage of our Florida Resident specials.  Proud to be your hotel of choice in Orlando!  If there is ever anything we can do in advance of your next trip, please do hesitate to contact us!    Have a "Suite" Day!     John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: A great time
review: Traveling alone can be challenging. My stay at the hotel was pleasant and the staff were very cordial and accommodating. I felt safe. The breakfast buffet was very impressive. The hotel assisted me when I arrived at the airport. I called to inquire about transportation to the hotel.I was given the name of a shuttle service that was economical for one rider and I used it as a round trip choice.  I enjoyed the two evening meals that I chose to eat in my room.  I did not experience a long wait.  I appreciate how my food had a very appetizing appearance on the tray. The waiters who delivered my food to my room demonstrated a sincere interest in inquiring whether further services were needed.  I enjoyed my room. It was clean and relaxing. My king size bed was quite comfortable. …

title: Great position
