They had promised me a crib for my toddler and when we arrived tired in the middle of the night, they informed us that they couldn't find one.  Desperate and in tears, I showed up a total mess to Embassy Suites at 1:30 in the morning and was kindly greeted by the front desk manager who went far above and beyond to help.  He loaned me a pack and play from their…

title: Great location, hotel needs updating
review: We stayed in this hotel for a week at the end of May, I have mixed feeling about the hotel and not sure if I would stop there again.  Firstly the good things.  Location excellent for bars and restaurants meaning no one has to drive if you want to go out on a night and everyone can have a drink.  Breakfasts where very good, couldn't  fault them and plenty of choice and to a very high standard.  Free drinks on an evening between 1730 and 1930 hrs very good and there were always nibbles (nachos and salsa, olives, crisps and popcorn for the kids).  Now the not so good, I think the hotel needs a bit of updating as we had problems with the plumbing. On our 2nd night there the toilet stopped flushing so we had to call maintenance, which to their credit sorted out straight away, but the…

title: safe and secure
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and the kind comments on our location and services!  There's nothing like a fresh cooked to order breakfast to start your day and a few cool beverages to end it.  I have no doubt we could have handled that room change better…we have trained our staff to handle it better!  I assure you I will work with the team and we will learn from our mistakes.  Our founder, Conrad Hilton once said “Success seems to be connected with action…make mistakes, but don't quit.”  We won't quit trying to make this the best hotel in Orlando!   Thank you for staying with us!  I encourage you to give us another try!  Please email me when you are planning your next trip to Orlando so I can personally see to it your stay is perfect!   John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Excellent service by all staff - outstanding hotel
review: This was a return visit to the Embassy Suites at Easter as we stayed there last year at the same time. We had already experienced all of the same as cypruslover 2008 reveiew which we recommend you read who were the couple we met this year. [ friends for ever ]  We returned as we felt safe, secure and welcomed by all of the staff and we enjoy the brilliant breakfast and manager's reception in the evening, also the quiet location.  This time we were extended 9 days due to the volcanic ash cloud and we were made to feel more like we were family  as opposed to guests. The hotel had a pizza party for all stranded guests which made us feel that they cared but we already knew this as it was our 2nd visit.                                                                                  …

title: fantastic service
review: I stayed at the embassy suites with my husband and 2 children aged 20yrs and 7yrs in april 2010 celebrating our silver wedding anniversay. We experienced outstanding service in all areas of the hotel with no exceptions. The staff we friendly helpful and the hotel was spotlessly cleaned and had a wonderful ambience. The managers cocktails were provided daily in the beautifuIl atrium. We were stranded in Florida for an extra 10days due to the hurricane. The staff were truly wonderful, and I think that it is a true test of service when things do not go to plan. The staff booked us into the hotel for an extra 10days and really looked after us. We were offered a discount in the restaurant lunch and dinner, and even provided the stranded guests with a pizza party one evening. I cannot…

title: The Greatest Hotel Family Stay Vacation
review: Hello and thank you for your very kind comments!  The team was thrilled to do something for our distressed guests and had a blast planning it.  Congratulation on your anniversary; we are honored that you chose us for this special trip!    Sincerely,  John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: GREAT HOTEL EXPERIENCE WILL RECOMEND TO FRIENDS.
review: Had a great Hotel experience. As soon as I walked in it was Very clean, quiet and friendly. The staff was very nice and the complimentary breakfast had a great selection of good quality food. The Room was spacious clean and had a great feel to it. The furniture was newer than most hotels and the bed was fantastic. I can recomend this Hotel with confidence.

title: AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!
review: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience!  I think you described our mission perfectly.  I will make sure to pass your comments on to the team!   We hope to see you again soon!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: Staff was nice ... but the facilities need improvement
review: The Embassy Suites Hotel Orlando is a very nice place to stay, my husband and I had a wonderful time, what we enjoyed the most was the breakfast, which was great every single day, the way we were treated by all the staff in the hotel was great, we also aprecciate the fact that there are free rides to the theme parks, that was a great plus due to the fact that we went to Orlando just to visit them, besides it was a great thing that we were able to buy the tickets to the theme parks right there . It was an amazing experience and we hope to come back soon.

title: Good location and rooms but the service was exemplary.
review: Well, it sounds like you had a true Orlando Experience!  Thank you for letting us know about your visit!  Many try to replicate, but none has been able to match the famous Embassy Suites Breakfast...what better way to start your day!  I'm glad you utilized the shuttle to the theme parks and our expedited ticketing at the hotel.  We are proud to offer transportation to all four Disney parks as well as Universal and Sea World.  See you next time!    John L. Parkinson General Manager john.parkinson@hilton.com

title: This Hotel is awesome, can't wait to return one day
review: At first, the hotel seems really nice.  It has an indoor plaza with plenty of tables and lots of plants.  The staff is friendly and responsive, from the waiters in the restaurants to the bell hops.  The rooms are also well furnished and clean.  However, there are some design flaws with the rooms.  For example, the entrance to the room has a tall window on each side of the door.  That seems like a nice touch until you come inside and realize that it's very easy for people walking by to look into your room.  They have curtains on both windows, but the curtains still leave a gap along the edge of the door.  If you like to lounge around in your underwear, you better do it in the bedroom.  See my photos to see what I'm talking about.  Another problem is the shower.  I am 6 feet tall.…

title: First Class
review: My stay at Embassy Suites was SUPERB.  The staff made a good impact on my family stay. Everybody was so kind.

title: does what it says on the tin
review: We stayed in a basic suite which has 2 'rooms and therefore by European standards is large.  It was clean and comfortable with flat screen TVs, kitchenette which comprised of sink, tea/coffee maker and fridge which is very useful.  The inclusive breakfast was good with eggs/omlettes etc cooked to order to supplement the buffet.  If you want to walk to bars and restaurants in the evening then Embassy suites is ideally placed with plenty of places easily accessible and as it's on the more 'sophisticated' end of I.drive walking is a pleasant experience.  The interstate I4 is behind the hotel, but unless you have the windows open there is no noise. and the 'sitting room' buffers any noise from the hotel corridors.  The managers welcome drinks between 5.30 and 7.30 evey night are…

title: not the best
review: Unfortunately this was not the best  hotel we stayed in( of the 4 on our recent trip).  Upon entering you are greeted with a distinct 'musty' smell.  It is a large hotel with a large atrium including waterfall (probably the source of the smell as it seemed a little old). Our room smelt very musty or moldy as soon as you entered also. The room was clean enough and reasonably spacious and our bed was very comfortable (one of the best we had on these travels).  However we backed onto a highway which was extremely noisy 24 hours a day.  The noise was too great to have the sliding door open, plus we got the smells from the kitchen below when we opened it in the morning. Breakfast was terrible, seemed like a lot of choice, but very poor quality. The young male concierge was helpful,…

title: Another lovely visit
review: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites International Drive, we have usually stayed at the Quality Inn Plaza just up the road, but now would stay nowhere else but the Embassy Suites.  Having had a good room last year we requested this one again this year and got it with no problems.  The suite was nice and large, the bedroom having 2 double beds and the lounge having a pull out sleeper sofa are more than adequate for our needs.  The rooms are nice and clean, housekeeping calls in daily, the towels and bathroom are alway sorted and the beds made (although they didn't make the beds on a couple of days),   The suite overlooks I4 and but the noise isn't too bad and quickly just becomes a background hum when the balcony doors are closed.  You also get a view of all the Disney…

title: OK - but I don't understand all the positive reviews
review: We stayed here for two nights in March.  Location is great, with many great restaurants around.  But when I got in the shower, I kept feeling dripping ice water on my head.  It took me a few minutes to figure out that there was a PVC dripline coming right out of the center of the bathtub ceiling.  Thinking it was a release from a bathroom leak above me, I went down to the front desk who told me that all bathrooms had this, and that it was the condensation drip from the a/c in the room.  The lady told me the only way to avoid ice water from dripping on my head was to turn off the a/c for 30 minutes before your shower, and to keep it off until after you stepped out of the tub.  This is really bizarre, and I'm surprised that A) the builders would have allowed this in the design of…

title: Great value
review: We have just returned from a great 8 night stay at this hotel.  The location is handy for restaurants.  We had purchased Lynx tickets in advance which were mailed to us in the UK before our holiday and got lots of use out of them.  The bus stop is convenient to the hotel.    The free breakfast is a bonus.  The hotel was fully booked whilst we were there but there was never a problem getting a table to sit at once you'd made your selection from the buffet.  We took advantage of the manager's free cocktails, beer and wine with snacks each evening.  We had requested, and were given, a quiet room.  Although the hotel was full we didn't heard any noise at night.      There is a small exercise room and indoor pool as well as the outdoor pool and we enjoyed relaxing there.  There is…

title: The best hotel for the price anywhere in Orlando
review: I will make this brief because there are plenty of reviews on here for you look through.We stayed here in December 09 for three weeks and could not fault the hotel in anyway.. The free transport to both Disney and Universal was great as is the free breakfast and free evening snacks and cocktails.  All the staff were great at there respective jobs and very friendly and helpfull but there were two who stood out from the crowd,Robby who sold the theme park tickets was very helpfull even though we didn't need to buy any tickets during our stay.He was happy to chat and give us some handy tips for each day.Robby is so good at his job we feel he is going to waste selling tickets and could be a huge asset to the hotel in another roll.The other stand out member of staff was Dee who was…

title: Great value, however be prepared for musty, moldy smell throughout the hotel.
review: Our family, myself, my husband and our two teenaged sons recently spent four nights at the Embassy Suites on International Drive in Orlando.  The hotel, with the help of the trusty GPS is very easy to find, and the location is great.  Near many resturants, attractions and shopping.  Upon entering the lobby the first thing that hits you is the smell.  While not disgusting, it is a rather strong musty/moldy smell.  Check in was very efficient, and the requested rolling bed was delivered to our suite in a timely fashion.    The suite itself is well appointed with a small to average size living area consisting of a double size pull out couch, a flat screen t.v. and a small kitchen area.  No stove, but a bar fridge, a microwave and a sink.  The bedroom was roomy with its own sink and…

title: A Welcome Refuge
review: We booked into this hotel after checking out of another nearby in order to escape the hordes of football shirt wearing British holidaymakers, who seem to have completely taken over International Drive these days. Compared to where we'd been, it was like paradise.  I was impressed with the whole layout of the place and the suites themselves were fantastic, beautifully clean and very spacious. Ideal for adults with families and who want a bit of privacy. There are two swimming pools, one of which is indoor, and at the time that we were there, both were very quiet. Not a British newspaper or Premier League shirt to be seen. What I found incredible, considering the standard of the place and the facilities, were the rates. Very reasonable indeed. I have paid far more for hotels of a…

title: The ONLY place to stay in Orlando
review: I hate to give away my biggest secret in Orlando, but its so hard not to smile after a stay at the Embassy Suites International Drive Orlando. Perfect location, perfect service, and perfert accomodates makes this a trifecta of happiness!   BESIDES getting the Embassy Suites standard of 2-room suites, cooked-to-order breakfast in the morning, lucious indoor atrium, and 2-hour happy-hour at night, this specific Embassy goes above an beyond to make sure that business and family travelers are well taken care of.  While Disney and Unviersal may give all the excitement during the day, this is a fun place to stay were you can feel right at home. The service and staff are supreme and we couldn't find anything wrong. Thank you!!

title: Pretty Standard Embassy Suites
review: I traveled with my DH for the weekend part of his business trip.  We've stayed in Embassy Suites in different areas over the years.  This hotel is pretty standard Embassy Suites fare.  Be aware that even though it's called "Convention Center"  it's over a mile away.  Check-in was easy and friendly.  Lobby was attractive and welcoming.  Our room was clean and not too bad for the wear.  The only thing that needed attention is the bathroom.  Paint on door is peeling and overall is looking worn.  If you're a light sleeper, the rooms along I-4 are noisy.  The traffic noise comes through loud and clear - all night long!  I'm sure that if I would have asked to be moved they would have moved us.  We were with 2 other couples and just decided to stay where we were.  Internet in the room…

title: Good hotel .. Bad customer service
review: I stayed in this hotel in January 2010.. It was nice and clean.. we arrived at the hotel after a 12 hour drive and found that they gave us a wrong room with double beds when we reserved a king size bed it was late and we were tired and they said there was no other room available that night without even an apology for their mistake instead the reception staff talked with an attitude as if it was not their problem.. it was frustrating having to stay in the wrong room and having to move our stuff again the next day.. and on top of that the internet is 10 dollars a day for each laptop .. which is too much considering some hotels offer internet for free.. I would not go there again..

title: Friendly, courteous, helpful and professional staff
review: Hello and thank you for your candid comments.  It's not typical that I get a negative comment on our customer service, but I can understand your frustration with that situation.  Our team normally does a very good job of picking up the ball when an error occurs and exceeding expectations with a resolution.  I'm very sorry this did not happen on your trip.  Nevertheless, I have already shared this with our Front Office Team to ensure we will be better equipped to handle this situation in the future!  I've send you a message via the TripAdvisor response function in the hopes we can dialog this further.    Sincerely,  John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: Very 'Ordinary' Hotel
review: Entire staff went out of their way to be helpful.  Even when lines formed for the complementary breakfast, servers, cooks and cleaning staff had smiles and moved like they had a purpose in life...to make my stay a pleasure.  They succeeded.

title: Great Orlando Option - we'll be back
review: This wasn't the greatest Embassy I've stayed at, it wasn't the worst...Somewhere unremarkably in the middle. The room was clean, the beds were okay, our room's bathroom needed a paint job pretty badly. Both TVs (parlor and bedroom) were flat-sceens, which was nice, and they had a nice selection of channels (I was there for business, so wanted to relax in the room most evenings). They offer both an indoor and an outdoor pool. The breakfast was among the better ones I've had at ES, although when they say it ends at 10:30, don't try walking up for seconds at 10:31, everything is taken away. The location is great for business travelers, just a few blocks from the Convention Center, and a TON of restaurants nearby. I wouldn't totally discount this hotel when I return to Orlando, but…

title: My Stay in Orlando
review: The Embassy Suites is in an excellent location on one of Orlando's busy strips.  It includes both an indoor and outdoor pool which is great during the winter. There are many places to go, and they're all in walking distance of the hotel. The service was great as well because when I forgot my toothbrush they immediately sent one up with toothpaste and mouthwash! The Happy Hour everyday was very relaxing, especially with a bartender named Patrick Parkes who made the drinks quick and spectacular; made my stay worthwhile. If you get a chance to be there ask for that guy.  Overall my stay was great! The service was excellent from check in to check out. As I said earlier room service waited on me hand and foot. The food at the restaurant was very good. Whether it was great seafood or…

title: The food and beverage team is fantastic.
review: The made to order breakfast every morning is unbelievable.  I don't know how the F & B team is able to pull it off day after day.  It is organized so well, the food is very good, and the staff amazingly accommodating.  In the omelet line one morning the guy in front of me ordered 6 omelets at once!!  Kudos for  a job extremely well done.  I was in the hotel over the Xmas holidays when everyone would probably like to be with their families.  Yet this team never stopped tendng to the customer.  I even noticed the Managers (I think that's is what they were because they were not in uniforms like the other employees) clearing tables, greeting guests, and filling chafing dishes.   You are very lucky to have such a good team. The same behavior was shown at the Manager's Reception @…

title: Dirty beyond belief.....shocking for a Hilton Hotel
review: We booked our 6 night stay at the Embassy suites on International Drive thru expedia.ca therefore we never really know what your getting into until its too late.  We arrived about 9 PM on  Sunday night after a long drawn out flight from San Juan PR to Orlando. The room was ready on the 3rd floor,,right accross from the elevator as well, rom 303! The curtains inside the room do not close all the way to the door so theres about a 7" gap on either side so that people caould see in the room when they walk along the hallway.  Anyway at first glance the room was clean and we were so tired so we hit the sack right away. Breakfast in the AM is acceptable for a Hotel breakie,,,more cafeteria style but it did the trick. Eat beofre 7 30 AM or be inundated with kids and pushy people who…

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: First of all let me respond by saying we are truly sorry you had such a poor visit.  I’m not going to sugar coat it or try to explain away that fact that the person responsible for your suite dropped the ball.  Not removing a glass is against our standards and I’m embarrassed that a customer experienced that.  We will use this as a coaching experience for the team and person responsible for your suite.  We take your complaints very serious and have had this room inspected thoroughly by experienced internal and external professionals who did not find any heath hazards.  This hotel has a sparkling record on inspections by both Hilton and Orange County.  If given the opportunity, I’d love to have a second chance to show you how truly wonderful this hotel and its team really are; evident by other posted on this forum.  I’ve sent you a message through this website hoping you will give us that opportunity!  I guarantee your next post will tell a tale of warm service, great people and a hotel and location second to none in Orlando!  That offer stand for all incoming guests.  Email me personally if you have a special occasion, have a special need or just want to know something about the area.  We will make it happen!  It’s what we do, so don’t feel hesitant.              Sincerely,  John Parkinson General Manager John.Parkinson@Hilton.com

title: disappointed
review: My family and I have been spending our Xmas and New Year holidays at this Hotel for over 10 years.  The staff is always wonderful and willing to help with whatever is requested. The pools and workout rooms are always great.  We stay at a lot of Hilton properties during the year, but this is by and large our favorite.  The breakfast is always fantastic and the wait staff very attentive.  The General manager is always available and often stops and ask about our stay and if there is anything that he can do.   I recommend this hotel to all of my friends visiting Orlando.  It is near everyting, reasonable price and most important in Orlando, KID friendly.

title: Would definately recommend this hotel.
review: We have just returned from a 3 week stay at this hotel and i can honestly say that i have not found 1 thing to complain about. From the guys at the front of the hotel to the speedy check in, housekeeping and the complementary breakfast everything was 1st class. The room was clean and the beds were so big and comfy we slept really well. It was also reassuring that the rooms all opened into the hotel rather than onto the outside. I would definately recommend this hotel.

title: Great Embassy Suites
review: My spouse and I stayed at this property during the week of 11/18/2009.  It was a business/leisure trip.  I found the property a little dated but well maintained.  The room was clean and well maintained.  They had flat screen TVs in each room, and furniture looked to be recently replaced.  Our maid was very nice and did not come to clean the room and some ungodly time.    The evening reception was nice and enjoyable.  The only thing that could be improved upon would be timing of the snacks provided.  The hotel staff did not get them placed until way after the 5:30 pm time and then was very discourteous when asked about them. It could have been that  my stay was also during the Florida Classic between Bethune Cookman and FAMU.    The cook to order breakfast was great.  Just as…

title: Enjoyable stay but could have been better
review: My husband and I stayed ay this hotel for a two week holiday for my 40th birthday and this was our fourth trip to Orlando. Check in was speedy but we were not given any information on the hotel ie breakfast times or location of hotel facilities, we had to work that out for ourselves. Our room did smell a little musty on arrival but that soon wore off (or maybe we just got used to it). Housekeeping was a little hit and miss......our room was not hoovered for the whole two weeks, we know this because it became a joke between us about the same bits left on the floor. The milk and coffee was not topped up every day but the bathroom was left very clean and the bed changed regularly.  The hotel is in an excellent location, we have stayed in other hotels at the same end of I-Drive but…

title: Great value, location and well maintained with excellent friendly staff!
review: Kid's loved the combination of an indoor and an outdoor pool and it was great to come back to the hotel and relax by the pool after a long day at the theme parks. Many great resturants are within walking distance of the hotel.

title: perfectly located, well appointed & friendly
review: worked really well for us with i-trolley service right outside, drugstore a short walk away and easy access to the parks & shopping; free shuttle for Disney, Epcot, Universal & SeaWorld was useful; inclusive breakfast was of a decent standard and the evening manager's reception with comp drinks was a nice touch. used both the indoor & outdoor pools which, whilst small, were a good additional amenity; the staff were helpful and friendly throughout our ten day stay .... we'd recommend & return the next time we head to Orlando

title: THIS HOTEL REALLY DELIVERS THE ''WOW'' FACTOR
review: Our family  visits ORLANDO twice every year March and Oct, so you can imagine how many hotels we have stayed in over the last 19 years. We stayed at the Hard Rock at Universal last visit and we missed the Embassy Suites soo much, we vowed never to stay at any other hotel. WHAT WE LIKED From checking in to having our luggage escorted to our suite,the customer service we received at this hotel is simply outstanding.Charlene who runs the bar at the popular managers cocktail reception always has a smile for us and remebers our names including our son.little personal touches like this make all the difference to a hotel stay. t HE MANAGEMENT TEAM always make us feel welcome and that nothing is too much trouble for their team to help us whatever our requirements. The concierge service…

title: Recommend this hotel
review: Close to retaurants and transportation.  Free parking.  Good breakfast.  Loved the rooms, clean and lots of space.   It had a seperate room for sitting / watching tv.  Very much enjoyed the stay.  The outdoor pool / hottub could use a little upgrading however.  We used the indoor hottub and enjoyed it.

title: Convenient, great value.
review: We stayed here from 10/03 through 10/10.    It was a very convenient location, lots of restaurants within walking distance.  We ate at the Crab House once.  We were the only people there due to the time of year.  They have a happy hour from noon until 7:00 PM with 5.00 drinks and appetizers.    The hotel rooms need a little updating.  By that I mean that the "wood" furniture is starting to chip and the shower head needs to be moved up about 6 inches.  I am 5'11" and the shower head come up to my chin.  I had to bend over at the waist to wash my hair.    Room was still great though.  All rooms consist of a living room with a sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker.  Separate bedroom with sink vanity.  Bed was a little firm for me, but perfect for hubby.  Both TVs are LCD…

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review: We stayed here for 2 weeks and would hghly recommend it to friends.  The hotel is clean and the staff are extremly helpful and nice. My son celebrated his 9th birthday while we were there and he was really suprised to come home from the parks to a birthday cake and balloons from the hotel it made his day.The breakfasts are great and the managers cocktails are a great way to end a busy day from walking round the parks or shopping. Will defo be staying here again.

title: A great experience
review: We recently stayed here for a short vacation and found it to have exceptionally friendly service. Everyone went out of their way to inquire if we needed anything. Kudos to Stephanie at the front desk for offering help with boarding passes and routes to Disney. Plus, it was exceptionally clean and well maintained and the made to order breakfast had wonderful food. Keep up the great work.

title: WONDERFUL!
review: Accommodations were superb;  location was very convenient to parks and various attractions;  great breakfast not only saved us time but money as well.

title: Superbly Surprised
review: Great place to stay in Orlando especially if on a budget.  Rooms are spacious, well designed; storage space is plentiful. Not only was everything clean, smelled very fresh and airy, and everything was in almost new condition. The staff were smiling, warm, very welcoming, and ready to handle all requests and needs. The breakfast was great (we indulged in the custom omelets) the coffee was always available, and basically we wished that we had more time in the area. We will repeat our visit often.

title: Enjoyed my stay at Embassy - International
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive in order to go to Universal Studios the next day after going to Disney.  I think we used everything that this hotel has to offer.  We used the computers with free internet, manager's reception, breakfast and fitness center.  This hotel was comfortable and clean.  We love having two TV's and a separate room.  The rooms have been remodeled within the past few years and it was a good hotel.  I would stay here again when in Orlando.

title: Superb
review: Just got back from 21 nights stay at this hotel, having previously staying at a couple of the TA top ten I honestly cannot understand why it is not ranked much higher.  As well as the quality of the amenities and services this hotel provides a couple of unexpected kindnesses provided by the management and staff added significantly to our holiday.  The suites are comfortable and clean and the maid service was excellent.  The breakfast, particularly the made to order items gave us all a great start to every day and the managers reception each evening made a return from the parks a very relaxing experience, the fact that both of these can be taken in a lovely atrium with palm trees and waterfalls added greatly.  Only used the shuttles on a couple of occasions but they where bang on…

title: Good Choice on International Drive
review: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for 10 nights 11 to 21 September. This was our third holiday in Orlando. Having stayed on previous trips at the Holiday Inn, International Drive, including our visit last year.  Looking for somewhere different, we used Trip Advisor to assist us in making our decision where to stay this time. We where not dissapointed.  A rarity in America is a hotel including breakfast. This was a deciding factor in choosing the Embassy Suites. Plus all the positives we read online. We arrived mid evening and found the hotel reception very efficient and within minutes we where unpacking in our allocated room. Fortunatly our room was facing the swimming pool and not the i4 freeway - which I understand can be noisy with the non-stop traffic flow. The room…

title: A Warm welcome awaits
review: This was our first time to stay in this Embassy Suites and initial impressions were good: one of the most efficient check-ins ever.  The first night we were exhausted from jet lag but were unable to sleep due to the noisy air conditioning. As soon as I mentioned it at reception, Tiffany (the duty went out of her way to make sure we were moved (to a superb 8th floor room) and couldn't do enough to make sure that everything was ok for us.  Every member of staff we encountered was very friendly.  The complimentary breakfast included cooked to order eggs & omlettes as well as bacon, sausage ,scrambled egg, potatoes, pancakes....a veritable feasy. Also very pleasant was the managers reception each evening. My sole gripe about this is the limited range of cold snacks. The choice of…

title: Well Located
review: We stayed in Embassy Suites for 10 days from September 7 to 17. Service was good and staff very helpful.  Roby, the person in charge in selling the tickets of the theme parks was great! He provided too much help in selecting the parks and providing advice and other details. Also, the lady servicing  on the bar for drinks during managers reception everyday at 5:30 was remarkably polite and caring to remember always that one of my kids wants to drink his everyday pineapple juice without ice. Location of the hotel was good too. there was a I Ride stop just in front of the hotel. Close to many restaurants and at the same time in a quiet area. If you are looking to a more crowded area you have to go up north for about a mile or more. I suggest for some rennovations in the hotel. It…

title: Well-equipped hotel near Convention Center.
review: The hotel was close enough to the Convention Center that I didn't need to rely on the city shuttle.  The Manager's reception (held after work hours during the week) is a nice way to relax and unwind after a long day.  The pop-corn is freshly made.  The salsa for the nachos needs work, but the free drinks make up for it.  The rooms are spacious, which either allows you to spread out or comfortably accommodate your family.  The made-to-order omelette for breakfast was a treat.  Noise and activity level was high because we were in town on business over a weekend and had to put up with lots of families and teen groups that might not have been there during the week.

title: Embassy Suites - A true American style reception
review: This was the first time we have visited the USA, and were pleasantly surprised by the very helpful and attentive staff who not only did all the basics extremely well, (i.e smooth check in and helping with luggage) but they also acknowledged us when walking around the hotel which helped us feel very much at home. The staff, on the whole, greeted you with a smile and were very hospitable.   Upon entrance the hotel boasts a spectacular lobby with ornamental fountains and foliage. The room was comfortable and cleaned daily, with the maids also leaving towels in the shapes of swans on the bed, an appreciated touch. The breakfast was substantial with omelettes cooked to order along with other hot and cold buffet style items. The only disappointment, which I do not blame the hotel for,…

title: Best accommodation we have stayed at on International Drive
review: From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms were a good size with plenty of storage. Very comfy beds and pillows.  We had a welcome basket of snacks upon arrival and  also for our daughters birthday.The breakfast that was included in the price was really good, it was nice not having to go out in search of breakfast along International Drive every morning. The two hour free cocktails and snacks each evening was great with friendly bar staff. The Embassy Suites are really well placed with easy access to local resturants and shopping malls. ( Free shuttle bus to the theme parks.) This was our sixth visit to Orlando, we have always stayed at good hotels along International Drive, but we think that this was the best and plan to go again soon (Need…

title: Perfect Location on I-Drive, Huge Rooms, But Needs a Makeover!
review: Stayed here in July '09, for exploring I-Drive and visiting the Disney parks!   The hotel is in an excellent location, right in the middle of the action on I-drive with great cheap pubs and eateries, bars and activities all within short distance. Positioned right next to an I-Trolley stop for easy access to the rest of I-Drive including all the great outlet stores!  Rooms are very big and nice, but the rooms as well as the whole place looks like it was built in the 80's and the decor is pretty old and worn. The cocktail hour is a complete joke with 0.00002% cordial mixes and plastic cups of cheap beer being given out along with popcorn and plain nachos with tomato sauce (no meat) .. thats literally all on thats on offer, so we lasted about 2 minutes on the first night before…

title: Best Customer Service I Have Ever Encountered
review: I had the pleasure of staying at your establishment Embassy Suites on International Drive Orlando, FL. from August 24-28, 2009. On the evening of the 27th, I had decided to find a store within walking distance from the hotel where I could purchase a couple of movies for the trip home. I went down to the front desk to find out where the closest location would be.   At the front desk I met Stephanie. I told her my plans and she spent several minutes trying to think of locations and even researching possibilities online. When we had eliminated all other possibilities, we decided Wal-Mart would be my best bet. Stephanie proceeded to draw me a map, but explained it would be a fairly long walk. She then made an offer that completely took me by surprise. She said if I told her what…

title: Superb Value
review: This is the first time my husband and I had visited Florida with our young daughter. We had specifically waited until she was four years old so that she could really enjoy all there is to offer. We did debate on whether we should get a villa but this was an ideal compromise. A suite with two very spacious rooms so our daughter could go to sleep in one and we could sit up a little longer without disturbing her. The accomodation was clean, spacious and included everything needed for a small family. There was a large sofa bed and dining table in one room with a small kitchen too. Loosely termed kitchen as it consisted of a full size fridge, microwave, coffee machine and sink. The other room had two queen sized beds and a wash basin area. Each room has two large flat screen tv's.…

title: talk about "gettin it all" on a weekend getaway
review: A Saturday night getaway gave us more than we ever expected. To start we get to the hotel and already a savings as parking was complimentary. Then we were warmly greeted by the front desk and checked in. We entered a beautifully appointed suite (granite wet bar, micro,frig,etc) and headed down to the pool. After enjoying a relaxing afternoon we did plan on heading over to Pleasure Island but first.. some great service by our bartender Patrick at the managers reception. Now I don't always count pennies but come on!-we had 4 cocktails total and in todays world that equals at a minimum $20.   Upon our return to hotel we had  enjoyed the rest of the evening before turning in for the night and then we wake up to a fabulous breakfast buffet. So we did have it all !!! Lois and Frank

title: Had a great stay
review: I've used this Embassy in the past, tried other hotels in the area and keep coming back.  We make quick trips to Orlando a few times a month for business/parks and always find this hotel clean with a helpful staff and one of the best locations in Orlando.   Chain hotels are all about the same; so you will like the breakfast, happy hour and suites if that’s what you are looking for.  They have 2 pools, indoor and outdoor which is what I like.  The main reason I stay here is location.  It is in the middle of International Drive with anything you want in walking distance.  It's a very safe area (I feel), with lots of life, but not like a downtown with noise.  I'll stay again!

title: Good base for Orlando family holiday
review: As others have said, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast staff and cooks. My wife had her birthday on first day and was touched to enter the room and find cards, balloons, cake and (strangely) a little disney piglet.  Negatives (all minor): the rooms were a bit dated, occasional stain on carpets, behind bathroom door.  Odd having windows to corridor allowing others to look in on lounge and kids bed area, needed some ingenuity with curtains and coat hangers each evening to get privacy.  Fridge temperature varied. No towel racks for bath towels, despite notices to use racks to avoid replacing towels daily!  Positives: Complimentary breakfast was a great start to each day. Rooms were large and regular cleaning good. 2 large TVs. Service could…

title: Not a good hotel for business travelers
review: The Embassy Suites was a decent enough place with a good location, a nice breakfast  and happy hour.  The staff was helpful as well.  That being said,  I wouldn't return here as a business traveler.   It's just too geared toward tourists - which is okay if you are a tourist.  A decent spot for families with kids though.  BTW,  the mini crabcakes in the Restaurant are excellent!

title: Great hotel with great service!
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us!  I’m glad you enjoyed your stay.  You bring up an interesting observation that many people don’t realize about Orlando overall.   Although we are the #1 family destination in the world, the city, and our hotel has a very strong business travel mix as well.  Ours is about 55% annually since we’re so close to the convention center.   It’s all about the ‘season’.  During July, August and major holidays, the business travel stops and our market is predominantly leisure.   And, while this can sometimes change the ‘feel’ of the hotel, we find that our brand ‘traditions’ are truly enjoyed by all…including the wireless high-speed internet access, complimentary full-service business center, meeting rooms, restaurant and an ideal location in the heart of International Drive.  Thank you again for sharing your stay with us!           Sincerely,  John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: Fantastic Location & Staff
review: Check in was easy. Much easier than if you go with a Disney Hotel! Disney Hotels are great, don't get me wrong, but staying off property has its benefits, too. Since I was there for business at the convention center, it was a no brainer to stay off property. However, getting to Disney was easy, on our days free. They have great shuttles. We shuttled to Disney and another day, took the city trolley to a mall. Both were pleasant and easy to figure out. The food at the hotel was great, although some days were really crowded. The people were really pleasant and helpful. Had a great trip. Not one complaint about the hotel!

title: Reposting
review: This hotel is ideally located within easy walking distance of numerous shops and restaurants and also offers great dining options at the hotel as well. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful and a great cost savings. The staff continually went above and beyond to make certain our stay was enjoyable. The rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable and appear to be recently updated.  I would certainly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

title: An unfair review
review: In the beginning, I do not belong to the right target group of the hotel. Especially during the summer breaks. I stayed in the hotel for five night with my son (16 yrs). The purpose of my trip was a conference, and my son accompanied me. The location is good, the suites ok. Nothing fancy, but spacious and comfortable enough. Hotel services seemed to be good, the friendlyness of the staff average except the bell boys or valets who were much friendlier and had a personal touch compared to the rest. The hotel was quite fully booked that caused a lot of queing in the breakfast, director's cocktail and for the elevators. The computers of the business lounge were also very busy. Anyhow, I do appreciate the complimentary breakfast and manager's cocktail in the Embassy Suites, but this…

title: A bit of false advertising
review: Thank you for sharing your positive comments on the hotel, staff and location; as well as areas we can improve.  We continually strive to expedite service in our complimentary amenities, breakfast, evening cocktails & business center.  Typically, our breakfast is at it’s busiest in the last 30 minutes of service.  You are correct that we enjoy a location that is second to none in Orlando, highlighted with local knowledge from staff like the Bellmen and Valets you mentioned.  I will ensure all your comments are shared with our leadership team to help us improve in the future!    Thank you for your patronage,  John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: Good location, lots of restaurants and night life within walking distance.
review: I stayed for 7 nights with my 3 children.  I had read many wonderful reviews and I had certain expectations.  Some were on the mark - the breakfast was good, but could get very crowded.  The room was nice and the staff was accomodating.  However, a few things on their website should have been clearer.  They advertise "free transportation to the parks".  This is true - but VERY limited.  There were 4 times you could leave from the hotel & 4 times you could get back from Magic Kingdom & Epcot.  There was only ONE time for all of the other parks.  None of the times were appealing, and most of them would have caused you to miss some of the coolest things in the park - like the Electric Parade and the Laser Show.  We ended up driving ourselves and paying for parking.  Also, one of my…

title: good value hotel
review: Thank you for your comments and I’m glad you found the hotel and our staff accommodating.  We frequently review the bus schedule and currently offer three morning pickups to the Disney Theme Parks and one to each of our neighboring parks, Universal Studios and Sea World.  Logistically it saves our guests time to have one drop-off point (for Disney parks) at Magic Kingdom or Epcot because of Disney’s swift on-site transportation system vs. hotel charters that all must travel the highway between parks.    We also regret you were unable to access Facebook on the business center computers.  Since every parent has a different preference of ‘parental controls’ for computer use, Hilton Hotels currently blocks all social media on its workstations.  The complimentary business center includes a laptop docking station allowing guests to surf the web without filters free of change.   Thank you again for your comments and concerns.  As always, we will used your experiences to improve our fine hotel!    Sincerely,  John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: Embassy Suites - fabulous!
review: This was not one of the nicest Embassy's we have stayed at but it was a great location with plenty of options for food,drink and activity.  Univeral, Sea World and Disney World were all within 10-15 minutes away.  We did have a rental car but noticed plenty of bus pickups at every block. We love the Embassy for their incredible breakfast and free manager's reception.  AKA-happy hours!!  The rooms are very nice, love the bedding and very spacious.  You really can't go wrong.  You MUST go eat at Maggiano's!!!  (Across the street) The only downfall is the onsite restaraurant--just not that good.  But tons of options around you.

title: Great Location / Good Hotel
review: Hotel is situated at the southern end of International Drive within walking distance of several good restaurants, definately the quieter & more relaxed end relatively speaking. Its a good location for driving to Disney as you can avoid the worst of the traffic & still convient for both Sea World & Universal.  The hotel suites have plenty of room for the average family & are fairly well equipped although the bathrooms needed updating & the curtains shielding the living area from the atrium need improving. As has been mentioned by other reviews there is a gap at the sides which allows people to see in when walking past your room.  Recommended restaurants within walking distance are:  1) The Olive Garden - Right next door, good Italian food excellent service/value. 2) Bahama Breeze…

title: Wonderful staff and service!
review: I have stayed in a lot of hotels but have never stayed at a hotel with such wonderful staff and service before. We stayed for 2 weeks for my 40th birthday and thanks to this hotel it will be one I'll always remember. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and the valets and concierge were so friendly with lots of good tips and advice. The reception was very helpful. It has been said on here that the breakfast is very samey but I'm not sure what people expect for breakfast? They had everything 'breakfasty' you could possibly want. They have a little shop and again I'm repeating myself but all the ladies working in the shop were so friendly. The rooms can be a little bit noisy but the location of the hotel is great for getting around. On my 40th I returned to our…

title: Excellent for conventions
review: The complementary breakfast was excellent - made to order omlete - yum! The juices and yoghurt were fresh and tasty. I did not really try amything else. Rooms are quite spacious - it's a suites after all, have 2 big LCDs - and there are a LOT of HD channels in the states! So if you have to be in the room, you will always have something on the background - would it be news or a movie. Location was fine - especially for a convention center. It's basically a walkable distance - a taxy would cost 6-8$. But what's more important - it's located right in the middle of all bars/restaurants on the international drive - so if you wander out in the evening, you will find yourself right in the middle of very busy bars/live music/dancing/etc. Pretty nice. Room service was great - with swans,…

title: Great value hotel
review: Hotel was in the perfect location for us in the middle of I.Drive,room clean tidy spacious but could do with updating. Bed comfortable,shower had good pressure. Free breakfast included a first for us- normally never see this in the States saves a few dollars. Outdoor pool very small so is indoor but managed to get an uncomfortable lounger for a while. Shuttle to theme parks (which we never used as we wanted to beat the crowd's and got up early on most day's)We used the I- Ride which is not as frequent as was told sometimes waiting for 45mins.Taking the number 8 and then a 50 lynx bus to Disney was far more faster-but you must have the correct money to board. We hired a car the second week which was great, the sat nav was worth paying the extra as became invaluable for our first…

title: Reception & down stairs great, bedrooms complete rubbish
review: Reception Staff good and friendly.  Evening drinks a nice touch.  Breakfast usual selection but quality good and hot...  Accommodation the worst I have ever stayed in. We were allocated a room overlooking the highway on the first night and unless you were on sleeping tablets there is no way you would get any rest from the noise.  Walls paper thin and no sound proofing what so ever.  Musty smell that would make you feel ill and the bathroom so small you have to duck you head!  We got moved on the second night to a less noisy room, better but accommodation still equally as bad. Toilet blocked on first use and excrement ran all over the floor.  I am surprised by previous comments and I am not usually so critical - see my comments on the Floridays Resort.  I have stayed in cheap…

title: Outstanding Service
review: I am not one for writing reviews, but when you get excellent service on multiple occasions it must be commended. The staff at Embassy Suites is easily one of the friendliest and most accomodating staff's I've ever seen in the industry. Not only are you given a FREE great breakfast (eggs cooked to order, pancakes and fresh waffles just to name a few) but managment consistently walks through each mourning greeting all those in the dining area with genuine conversation.   The most impressive part for me and my family, who I've recommended this location to many times is that the actual General Manager of the hotel John Parkinson goes above ane beyond to make everyone feel welcomed at his hotel. My aunt recently stood there and had a slight issue with her refrigerator and he not only…

title: What a Great Stay!!!
review: This hotel was wonderful. Prior to our arrival the hotel contacted my dad and offered to combine both reservations into one and give us a 2 bedroom presidential suite because they were expecting a sellout. The room was very spacious and offered the privacy of two separate rooms. The complimentary cocktail hour was good drink and service wise. The snacks left little to be desired (stale tortilla chips & pretzels and salsa that seemed to be pizza sauce with peppers in it). The complementary breakfast in the morning was very good. Both food and service were great. The hotel features 2 pools, one outdoor and one indoor. We had our six month old daughter so we decided to stay out of the sun and go indoors. Both pools seemed to be taken care of properly and had plenty of towels. Self…

title: Excellent Value - Would stay again
review: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2009.  I would have no problem staying again at this hotel.  The beds, pillows, and were extremely plush and comfortable with high thread counts on the lines.  The rooms were well soundproofed and I received a full night of sleep each night.  The breakfast, as usual, was perfect with cooked to order eggs, meats, fruits, juices, tasty coffee, danishes, etc.   The rooms were very clean and "as modern" as other Embassy Suites in this price category.  The location is one of the beauties of this hotel:   10 minutes to either Universal &  Sea world, or around 15-20 minutes to the Disney parks.  For the price, you'll want to put this hotel on the short list.  The area in which the hotel is located seems very safe and family-oriented, which is important me. …

title: Great Get Away
review: My husband and two teenagers enjoyed a spring break get away.  The hotel check-in was the fastest service ever.  The lobby of the hotel was a tranquil retreat from the harsh Indiana weather.  The outdoor pool is beautiful with palm trees and nice sitting area.  The indoor pool and hot tub were great after walking through the attractions all day. We were able to walk to dinner and shopping in the evening.  The business center was very user friendly. The kids enjoyed the hotel pools and breakfast. The hotel staff was very eager to help us when we had rental car trouble. The hotel is centrally located between the major attractions. This hotel is a keeper!

title: Shame Joseph and Mary Couldn't Have Stayed Here
review: This hotel was perfect in every way! From the size of the rooms to the fabulous breakfasts. No pancakes made from box mix at this place! I had my best Florida coffee there. Would not hesitate to return, especially for the pancakes!

title: It was a FANTASTIC experience!
review: The hotel staff was courteous and always willing to help in any way. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to many shopping areas and restaurants, which was great for my family of 4. The breakfast and happy hour is always great at the Embassy, and is something my family looks forward to when we travel for vacations. Our room was in great shape and it was big enough to where we did not feel that we were “on-top” of one another. The bell-hop is great and does amazing flips for the kids. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Orlando for business or vacation.

title: A Wonderful Stay
review: Stayed the first 2 weeks in March,  have stayed in other Orlando hotels over the years, but none have been a patch on this hotel.  From check-in to check-out the staff were helpful and always friendly.  The atrium is a lovely setting for the complimentary breakfasts and evening drinks.  The room we had was on the top floor overlooking I-4, but this wasn't a disadvantage, as if we were in the room at the right times we had lovely sunsets and had great views of the finreworks at EPCOT and Magic Kingdom.  Our room was very spacious and spotlessly clean, I couldn't fault it. The complimentary breakfasts were very nice, the omelette station was lovely and very efficient,  and the buffets were plentiful and fresh. The complimentary drinks each evening were a nice added bonus, pleasant…

title: Disapointed
review: I had made reservations for a room with a balcony since I really enjoy sitting on a balcony in the evenings. However upon my arrival I was givin a room without a balcony.  They put me on the second floor with a small window and the view was looking at the roof of the kitchen. When I asked for a different room they said no more rooms were available. They had the window bolted shut so you couldnt even get any fresh air.  the Maid only showed up one day out of the 4 days we were there. By the time we left we had 3 extra bags a trash laying around.  The price for a room like this was very pricy. Charging me $220.00 a night. The High Speed internet is very slow. Then they charge you 9.95 a day for the service.   Then when we left I asked the bellHop to call a cab for us. He said  he…

title: Great value - great hotel!
review: Hello and thank you for your candid review.  I am very sorry for the inconvenience you encountered while visiting us in Orlando and I can assure you these are not typical experiences of our guests'.  We take great pride in what we do and I will personally follow up on each of your problems; in particular, the housekeeping service (or lack there of) and taxi situation.  Our service scores consistently rank as a top performer with Hilton, the Embassy Suites Brand and Trip Advisor so I can assure you we take customer concerns very serious.  To clarify, the housekeeping error is totally unacceptable and uncharacteristic, but $45 is the going rate for a town car to the airport from International Drive (depending on the arrival/departure gate and tolls).  Our valets do not receive any type of gratuities from the drives, but often are asked to provide change and smaller bills.   I will follow up with you via email and hope to earn you back as a valued customer.    Sincerely, John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: We Really Enjoyed Our Stay!!!!
review: While I am an Orlando resident, I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel Orlando, as I was spending the evening enjoy the attractions on International Drive. I have stayed at this location before, and was always incredibly impressed. The rooms are spacious and a great value; and the staff members are all friendly and attentive. I will definitely return to the hotel and recommend it to anyone that is traveling to Orlando.

title: A staff that went above and beyond
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites International Drive for Christmas break with our grandkids ages 7 and 9 and had such a good time.  The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  My husband sprained his ankle two days into our trip and the front desk helped us rent a motorized wheel chair during our stay that was delivered right to us! They also sent a nice get well basket to our room with goodies for our family; they went above and beyond to make our vacation memorable.  You could tell the staff really cares about the people who stay there.  Not to mention the wonderful free breakfast!  We will be returning next Christmas and wouldn’t stay anywhere else!

title: great stay but few flaws
review: We stayed here over Christmas and New year for 15 nights. The best thing about this property is the location, it is very close to lots of great restaurants and well located to get out and about without a car. The area is great and lovely for walking around . We used the lynx bus service and the I-ride lots and found this to be fine. Breakfast at the hotel was mayhem most mornings and became very repetative. Managers reception offered free drinks and nibbles for two hours every night, we dropped by a few times but the lines for service were a bit much (one bar person only) would have been better if they had more bar tenders at this busy time of year. We ate only once in the Fisheye grill and found the food to be very good and reasonably priced. Overall the hotel served it's…

title: Great Hotel, Location and Staff!
review: We stayed for our 3rd two week stay in Sept/Oct 2008.  Previously we stayed here in April 2006 and Dec/Jan 2008.  The staff always provide excellent service, are helpful and approachable.    The rooms are good sizes, breakfast is typically American – great selection and portions!  The location is ideal for theme parks, shopping (Florida Mall, Mall Of Millennia, and Outlet stores) and main highways to Miami / NASA etc.  Varied and quality restaurants minutes away and having the Olive Garden next door is a must for dining on the first night.  The location is much better than others on International Drive.  We will always continue to stay at this hotel whenever we visit Orlando!

title: Good value, quality hotel in good location for parks
review: This hotel is clean, good value and above average. The rooms are large and we were given a room on the top floor so nice views with the lights. The breakfast was decent with variety and good coffee. The hotel was pretty full but we managed to get breakfast quickly and found a table. Pretty civialised. Hotel was walking distance to Olive Garden Restaurant and Bahamas Breeze restaurant and bar - good cheap cocktails. 15 minute walking to cinema but wasnt impressed with the shops. We went to Prime Shopping outlet - good shopping. Hotel is definatley in the better area of International Drive and is a great location to Universal and Disney etc etc

title: Another great experience at the Embassy Suites
review: We have stayed at the Embassy Suites 4 times now and the last time we were there was in 2003.  We did not know whether we could expect the same high standards as we had experienced before but we were not disappointed.   One member of staff (Charlene) remembered us and gave us a big welcome back.  All the staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them.  The restaurant/bar had changed from Hurricanes to Fish Eye Grill but the meals and service from the waiting on staff were excellent.     Some reviews I have read on this site mention the damp smell in the rooms but we found this to be coming from the air conditioning and it was not that bad.  The hotel has undergone extensive renovation and the outside of the hotel was being painted a shade of terracotta (see…

title: Great Place!!!!!
review: My family and I stayed here for christmas 2008.we were in a 1 bedroom suite with our 2 kids (10 & 13).the check-in was quick and there was no wait.the staff were very helpful. the kids were supposed to share the sofa bed but they decided to fight over who had more room,blankets etc and I mentioned this at reception the next morning and they had a rollaway sent to the room.the hotel provide a complimentry cooked breakfast with omelettes,cooked breakfast,fruit & cereal etc.they also had a managers sundowner reception every evening between 5.30pm abd 7.30pm.they had free cocktails,alcohol and soda for the kids. they also had a few non-alcoholic cocktails for the kids.there were snacks also.chips and dips,pretzels and a popcorn machine.the pool was lovely but small.It was a 10…

title: fantastic
review: just got back from a two weeks stay with the wife daughter son in law and two grand children the suites were exellent the food also the staff were out of this world nothing to much trouble and the managers free bar put the icing on the cake indoor and outdoor pools superb cant waite for 2009 to return keep up the exellent work reguards k and d henson and family

title: Friendly Hotel
review: Myself and family stayed in this hotel for 16 nights and I cannot fault it at all. It is a nice hotel to look at and is very clean and comfortable. The staff that we came in contact with were all very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet had something for everyone and the free drinks/snack's for a couple of hours each evening were an added bonus. If I had a complaint it would be that the swimming pool was freezing and although checked over by the helpful maintenance man no problem was found even though he agreed it shouldn't have been that temperature! That aside I would stay there again and highly recommend it.

title: Great Experience!!!
review: I just came back from a three night stay at the Embassy Suites. It was wonderful. I had read ALL the reviews regarding the hotel and almost all of the positive reviews are true! The hotel is easy to find and located near everything. TGIF, Bahama Breeze, Walgreens, a movie theater, stores, Friendly's, Tony Rama's, and many other eateries are nearby and within walking distance. We never took the Trolley so I’m not sure about that but I did see a large bus every morning and evening outside the hotel for Disney/Universal transport. Now onto details regarding the hotel: The outside is currently in the process of being re-painted into a pretty yellow/gold color, which I must say is much more appealing than the blue and white theme they previously had going on. The outside looks great…

title: Great Hoterl, Great Location 10/10
review: I have just returned from a 16 night stay at the Embassy Suites IDrive South with my Husband, 3 children (aged 9,7 & 2) and my Mum.   We stayed in a corner suite which is apparantly a bit wider than the average suites. I was a little apprehensive about the 6 of us staying in one suite but it absolutley fine. My family slept in the bedroom (there is 2 beds and we made up a bed for our youngest using the two sofa pads from the sleeper sofa on the floor) and my Mum slept in the living area on the double sofa bed. There is a flatscreen tv in each room and we also had a vanity unit in the bedroom. There was also a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The rooms were well kept and clean.  Every morning there is a complimentary all you can eat breakfast, hot and cold food, this is served…

title: Unbelievable.....
review: We stayed for a few nights and had a wonderful staff experience. Our room was on the 7th floor, (I recommend a higher room for the view of downtown Orlando) and it had apparently been redone very recently. The LCD was nice and so were the granite bar-countertops. We certainly enjoyed the happy hour, free and the breakfast buffet which was one of the best i have ever had, free. We even got a late check out so that we could go across the street to the Pointe Orlando and watch a 3D-movie and have some drinks. Clearly we enjoyed ourselves but surprisingly spent more time in our room then normal.

title: Great Value! Book it!
review: Booked for four nights prior to a cruise and one night post cruise. Everything was really fine and I am suprised the hotel is not rated higher on this web-site? Suites are really spacious clean and modern with "two" flat screen televisons in each room! Central for all locations and no need for a car at night as you can safely walk to bars and restaurents. The "managers special" of two hours of free drinks between 5.30pm & 7.30pm is a fantastic way to get your evenings off to a really great start We must offer a special mention to "Roddy" on the information desk who help plan our travel route each day "what a star" use him! Also try the Embassy Suites at Deerfield just outide Fort Lauderdale if you are doing a cruise as this was another good hotel (on the beach)

title: Nasty Experience
review: First the positive:  the hotel is in a great location.  The rest of the experience was dire.  The check-in staff were rude and insolent, even though I was staying as an Hilton frequent stayer.  The girl could hardly be bothered to communicate with me and I'm sure she never looked at me.  She was the perfect excuse to install automated check-in desks, as the experience would have made me feel more welcome. The rooms, as a few other reviewers have said, are really tired and in serious need of refurbishment, in fact the whole hotel is.  The breakfast was a typical basic breakfast that you would get from a far cheaper hotel. If you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and spend the minimum f time in, then I suppose it is OK, as you can walk out to restaurants etc, but you can…

title: Excellent Hotel & Facilities
review: Hotel is ideally situated within easy walking distance of quite a selection of restaurants. Free transport to all parks provided, but, if you need it Bus stop & IDRIVE Trolley stop immediately outside hotel. Hotel staff extremely friendly, and breakfast buffet & Managers reception were excellent. Swimming pools clean and well maintained. Would recommend Hotel to anyone and would certainly go there again..

title: Great Place to Stay, Most Pleasant Staff
review: Stayed at this hotel last weekend, the complimentary breakfast is great and fresh every morning.    As far as location goes, it is very easy to walk to entertainment and the best restaurants that International Drive has to offer.   The rooms are great as well, plenty of space and the beds are very comfortable.   The best thing about the hotel is the staff, they are very friendly , attentive and will do anything to make your stay a pleasant one.  Great Job!!

title: Not a big fan
review: I stayed at the Embassy for 1 night before a business conference at the Convention Center. The staff was very friendly, check in was quick and efficient and the looby was very nice. That is pretty much where the "nice" part of the hotel ended. My room was right across from the elevator doors which made for a pretty noisy night. Couple that with the fact that the front door has 2 large windows on either side made privacy pretty much non-existant. I on several occaisions looked up to see people peeking in around the blinds into my room. The room was very dark and smelled like a basement...damp and moldy. I have no allergies whatsoever and this room had me stuffed up like I had a bad cold! I finally turned off the A/C, opened the window and let in the 90 degree humid air just to…

title: fantastic !!!
review: Thank you very much for your review!  I am very sorry for your inconvenience while staying with us and I have sent you an email.  I can assure you I will personally look into all your concerns.  I am however proud to report we have recently installed two (living room and bedroom), 32 inch flat panel high definition TV’s in each of our 244 suites.   Sincerely, John L. Parkinson General Manager

title: Some drawbacks, but not a bad place overall
review: We have just returned from our holiday and it was brilliant  We have stayed in Orlando before, but never at the Embassy Suites, so this was a first and everything was perfect.  The suite was clean, the free breakfast was really great and the managers free cocktails every night was the icing on the cake. The staff were polite and helpful and nothing was too much bother.  We were so impressed that we have just booked again for next year and thoroughly recommend it  to eveyone.

title: Great room, nasty staff
review: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in June of 2008.  I chose it specifically because I've always liked the Embassy Suites hotels; I like the hot breakfast and the full suites.  I arrived after a grueling 8-hour flight and an over 2-hour wait for a shuttle to the hotel (there were 14,000 people in the area for the conference), and made it just barely in time to catch the last five minutes of the manager's reception.  I took my glass of wine with me up to the room before I even dropped off my bags.  ;-)  I caught that manager's reception every night, and the bartender was great; by the second night, she was pouring my wine as soon as she saw me, and was unfailingly friendly and efficient.  I was a little taken aback by the room; it was very dim and smelled extremely musty (I…

title: No problems and good value
review: The female staff at the desk were very condescending, but the men were much nicer. The  women didn't feel like answering questions and made that clear. The room (after my fight with one of these women) was clean, spacious,and well appointed. Overall, the hotel was good, but we were disappointed in the shuttle service and its limited schedule.  The website implies that the shuttle goes to all of the parks, but you have to transfer at the transportation center. The breakfast was disappointing, and the lines for the Manager's Special were always way too long. I've stayed at other Embassy Suites that were much better.

title: NOT Impressed at all
review: Just returned from our vacation today. I was quite dissapointed with the rooms.They were very humid and musky. The A/C was very loud. The floor was damp.    The rooms need to be updated.The bathroom sink was broken and the paint was chipped on the wall and door.  The first day we arrived we had breakfast. It was so awful that we decided to eat out the remainder of the trip.    I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and never experienced anything like this before.   I certainly wont do it again.

title: Definitely recommend this hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for 12 nights in June 2008.   We wanted to go to the theme parks and also to relax by the pool on a couple of days and this hotel was just perfect for what we wanted.  Firstly, the hotel staff were so accomodating.  The concierge were really friendly and helpful, as were the reception staff.  The reception staff took some postcards from me that I needed to mail and they didnt charge, its nice to get something for nothing now and again!!    The staff in the breakfast were very friendly aswell.  Every morning we had the same experience, staff coming over asking us was the breakfast ok and did we need anything else.  Breakfast was lovely.  Omelettes and Pancakes cant be beaten and they have a good range of juices/cereals/fruit too.   The outdoor pool is…

title: Just Checked out
review: We make the quick trip to Orlando a lot and always stay at the Embassy.   We love the location; there's a ton of places to eat in walking distance, attractions, a mall and a movie plaza.   They have a great staff and breakfast each morning.  There are 3 of us, so the extra space is great.  They should paint the building through, but the atrium is very lush.  Try Oeanair and Roys is you like Seafood.  We love them!

title: Nice Hotel
review: A very nice hotel, but the only downfall was getting transport to Disney, NOTE: You will have to hire a car, lucky for us we got a nice convertible, it is such an easy place to drive around once you have the sat nav!  Hotel very clean and safe, downfall was the breakfast but we got over that.  Overall enjoyable!

title: Great hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel for a convention at the convention center.  The location of the hotel is great because you can either walk to the convention center in 10-15 minutes or take the convention shuttle.  International Drive is filled with restaurants and bars, so after the convention, it was pretty easy to walk anywhere to eat and drink.  Walgreens is located about 5 minutes away, so if you forgot something that hotel couldn't provide, you could get it at Walgreens.  Closer to the convention center, there are the more upscale restaurants, like Capital Grille and the Oceanaire Seafood Room.  Across the street from the hotel is Howl at the Moon Piano Bar and Bahama Breeze.  Early check-in does not exist at this hotel.  Although I had requested early check-in, I waited about 1.5…

title: Not bad for business
review: This one's for the business travelers looking for a place to stay near the convention center. First, it's not too far to walk to the convention center if the weather isn't too hot. With the heat and humidity it could be too far, especially in a suit. The wireless internet was good--it was nice to be able to use it out in the atrium, and it was better in parts of my room vs. others. The hotel as a whole was pretty quiet, even with families and non-business vacationers there. You really didn't get noise from other rooms, either. One thing I loved is that they had plenty of outlets for chargers. I hate having to hunt around behind tables just to plug in my cell phone. The restaurant downstairs was pretty nice for grabbing something quick, and there are a ton of places around the…

title: Nightmare On I Drive
review: I was moved to three rooms in 1 night.    AC died in the first room.   Engineering fixed it and left me with a system that was actually producing heat.   It was hotter in the room then it was outdoors.     I was move to a second room.    The water didn't work.     They moved me to a third room.   Upon entering I discovered that I lost my reserved king bed and was now on the highway side of the building and was able to enjoy the sounds of traffic on my full size bed.

title: Great location.
review: We just returned from our trip yesterday from this hotel.  It is in a great location on International Drive.  There is an Olive Garden next door, a Denny's, Bahama Breeze and a few other restaurants across the street.   It is less than 15 minutes to Disney World Parks and much less to Universal Studios and Wet n Wild.    The only minor problem we had with this hotel is that the room we stayed in faced I-4 highway and we could hear the traffic passing by at night.  Most nights we were so exhausted from our days at the parks we didn't notice the noise.

title: Nice Hotel
review: My fiancé and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights from May 15th-17th.  When we first arrived, the hotel room was clean and cool.  It was a bit musty and a little humid but nothing too bad.  There was a sitting area with a couch, TV, table and bar area with a sink and refrigerator.  The Bathroom was clean and the shower had great pressure.  The bedroom was separate with a dresser, TV and large closet.  There is also a vanity area in the bedroom as well which make it nice for two people getting ready in the morning.  Because the room was a bit humid the bed felt a little damp.  The lobby area is nice as is the bar at the hotel restaurant.  We didn’t visit the pool but it looked decent. It is very close to many attractions and restaurants on International Drive. Be sure to visit…

title: A little high priced for what you get
review: We often stay at Embassy Suites as my husband travels often for work.  This hotel was nice, but compared to other Embassy's it was not as outstanding as some.  We usually stay at the Downtown Orland and it is outstanding.  This hotel was not worth almost $200 a night  Anyway, about this one,  The pool is small, but very nice.  Always clean and has towels on the chairs waiting for you.  There is also an indoor pool that is nice.  The outdoor area's hot tub is not hot at all and is about the same temp as the pool.    We picked this one over other hotels because it said they had shuttle service to Universal Parks, but they do not say that they only offer it one time in the morning, so we ended up driving.  If we had known this, we would have stayed downtown as we usually do, but…

title: Nice Hotel-Would Recommend
review: Stayed here in Feb 2008 for 4 nights. Upon check-in they gave us a room (220) which was right next to the elevator motors. The noise was unbearable and unending, so we requested another room. In addition, we recommend asking for a room on the front side of the hotel away from I-4 which can be heard from inside your room especially in the evenings. This is true for most hotels on International Drive.  The hotel restaurant service was very good--the restaurant delivered my lunch right out to me at the pool (even thought it's not a restaurant at the pool).  Also, they opened up the restaurant a little early just to get me a cup of coffee, which was going above and beyond.
