And, you can't beat Embassy Suites free breakfast and evening manager's receptions.  The pool chairs had…

title: Nice place to stay
review: This is the second time I have stayed in this location.  I was attending a seminar and wanted something close by.  The first time I stayed the price was about $105, I felt that was a really good deal.  This time I guess because of the season it was $198.  for that price, I would say stay somewhere else.  Although the location is good Embassy is could stand for some improvements.  For $198 you could stay at a Westin or hotel with a heavenly bed.  Embassy has pretty good beds but those old fashion cheesy bed covers, rooms not up to par with other hotels at that rate.  I guess I'm picky.    I'm rating it above average because they have a great breakfast with Omelets etc...Good happy hour with excellent Pina Colada's and friendly staff.      Across from some great restaurants-…

title: very nice Embassy Suite
review: Stayed here for 5 days while attending a convention.  Hotel is very convenient to the convention center, which was perfect for us.  Plenty of restaurants within walking distance to the hotel.  Easy access to hotel from I-4 via Sand Lake.  Hotel staff was perfect and very helpful from check in thru helping us find different restaurants to eat at.  Room was very quiet and comfortable , could not hear anyone in the rooms on either side of us, above or below us.  You could sometimes hear room doors being closed, but this was not annoying.  Morning cooked to order breakfast was always good and the evening managers reception was very nice also.

title: Loved the Embassy Suites
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week in December and really enjoyed it.  The staff were extremely friendly from the receptionists (who gave my son a little present and posted a christmas card for us) to the concierge (who kindly organised a town car to take us to Port Canaveral).  The cleaning staff were also very friendly and kept our room very clean and tidy.    The 1 bed suite was great.  The only issue we had with the room is that it smelt a little musty when you first walked in but you soon got used to it.  The room was a good size, a huge king sized bed and a comfortable sleeper sofa in the lounge that my son slept in.  There was a fridge which was handy to store drinks and a microwave but we found it strange that they didn't have any plates or cutlery in the room. …

title: Embassy Suites Paradise!
review: When it comes to trip planning, researching for the perfect hotel is something I spend hours on. After days of researching I came across this Embassy Suites, which I had overlooked previously for various reasons. I sure am glad I came across the official hotel website. The rooms looked fantastic and roomy - something I was looking for - and the rest of the hotel looked very nice too. The newly renovated rooms, free breakfast, shuttles and evening reception helped to seal the deal for me.   The hotel website pictures do not do this hotel justice, It is absolutely gorgeous! You walk in to a very nice lobby and right beyond that is a water fall and a stunning atrium. The atrium was one of my favorite things about this hotel. We spent a lot of time relaxing there. There was also a…

title: Very impressed
review: We normally stay at a hotel with more stars, but on this occaision we were taking my 8 year old nephew so wanted a more child friendly hotel with rooms that had doors inside the building rather than facing on to grounds or carparks.  We were very pleasantly suprised when we arrived, very very friendly and polite staff in every department, non of the usual "whatever" expressions we have experienced in previous years especially at the Wyndham Orlando down the road.  The room/suite was newley refurbished, fresh and clean and had lots of room. The little one had the lounge area and found the pull out double bed comfy and loved having his own TV.  Not normally one for breakfasts we were actually quite impressed with what was on offer, some reports suggest that its a bit stodgy and…

title: Great quick trip
review: We live about 40 min outside of Orlando and often make weekend trips to Disney.  I've stayed here before and have anyways been happy.  We tried to cancel, but were within 3 days of arrival so would have received a 1 night penalty.  We changed our other plans and still made the trip.  We had a great time.  I knew they were renovating, becuase it was a little loud on my last stay.  Looks like they are done now and the rooms are very nice and they have a great staff.  We have stopped staying in the big resort hotels, in a medium hotel like this; you get great service and most of the sercives of the big ones.  They had a big Army group in which was cool because I am in the Army.  Overall, great suite, very clean and great new renovation!  Looking forward to our next trip here!

title: Embassy suites fantastic
review: Staff were excellent, room clean and spacious. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice. Swimming pool a little small but o.k.It was a very pleasant two weeks holiday and would go back again. Great for a family stay.

title: Just what we wanted!
review: We stayed at this hotel in April for seven nights, and really enjoyed our stay. We were on holiday with our two year old daughter and needed somewhere with a bit more space, so the suite we stayed in was ideal. The rooms were well furnished and well equipped, and were kept spotlessly clean all the time we were there.   There was a spacious lounge and dining area with mini kitchenette, a nice bathroom and large bedroom with comfortable king size bed. There was plenty of space for clothes etc in the bedroom, with large wardrobes and drawers provided.   The service we received from all staff we encountered could not be faulted, everyone was very friendly and eager to please. The complimentary breakfast, although not the best meal we've ever eaten, was more than adequate, with a…

title: Go to the other one on Jamaica Court
review: We were there from July 26-July  31.  This is not the embassy suites quality that I am used to. The hotel is remodeling the rooms. They started with the 8th floor and they were on the 6th floor when we left. The first two nights we were staying on the 5th floor until the smell of must/mold got too unbearable for my dad who has allergies. He sneezed and wheezed while we were in the room. My mom complained and we got moved to one of the remodeled rooms on the 8th floor. If you MUST stay here, get one of the rooms on the 7th or 8th floor. They are remodeled and they smell SOOO much better. But, beware of the noise from the remodeling going on below. Once on the 8th floor we couldn't even take a nap because of all the banging, sawing, just a racket from the workers on the 7th floor.…

title: Not Embassy Suites Standard
review: This hotel is old and in need of renovation.  The free deluxe breakfast was anything but.  It had a school cafeteria feel and there were only a few ingredients for the omelets (not to mention the ingredients were buffet style, yes buffet style, so everyone gets to breathe on and touch them. The room did smell musty, but I saw no mold.  We reserved the room for a week, but checked out after one night.  The hotel staff was very nice.

title: Very old
review: This hotel was not ok for the price. Our room was so old and musty, it smelt horrible like old mildew. It also had a very damp feel to it. The suite was smaller than pictures. It was not clean, the shower rings that were supposed to be silver were totally covered in rust. The room was very very old and I would not recommend this hotel. The only thing good about the hotel was the check in staff and the breakfast. I would not have stayed there more than one night.

title: Not bad for the price
review: We stayed there during Memorial Day weekend. We were greeted upon arrival by the friendliest and most entertaining vale/ bellman. They did acrobatics, smiled, and interacted with the children.  The hotel was attractive, yet older and a little worn, but still it was clean. We loved having a suite- plenty of sinks and spaces for adults and children.  Kids loved the  beautiful courtyard lobby and fountains. I would recommentd this hotel to budget minded travelers. By the way the free hot breakfast was definitely institution style food. It filled us up, but not delicious by any means. Having said that- the front desk was very accomodating with an early check-in.  also good location for restaurants and Sea World. A positive experience in all.

title: Great hotel, great staff and excellent location
review: Back in Manchester UK today after 2 weeks in Florida (and yes it's raining here!).   Our first 3 nights were spent at the Embassy Suite Convention Centre and what a great hotel this was, nothing was too much trouble, the staff were fabulous and extremely polite and helpful.  It was our Silver Wedding Anniversary and not only did they give us a voucher for a free meal in the restaurant, but when my boss rang the hotel to organise a bottle of Champagne, the HouseKeeper personally went to the local store for him and bought an Anniversary Card to go with it !  Suites were big , nice comfy bed plus a  large fridge to allow you to bring and store own drinks/food if required but as others have said between 5.30 and 7.30 every evening it's Managers hospitality time and drinks are free…

title: Outstanding Hotel
review: This hotel is probably the best I have ever stayed in.  The front desk, housekeeping and breakfast staff were attentive to service and friendly.  The free hot breakfast was better than many breakfasts I have purchased at restaurants.  It is a large, hot, made to order buffet.  Rooms were clean and well taken care of.  Part way through my stay they even left a basket of snacks!

title: Never Knew you could use a towel like that!
review: At first I thought this holiday was going to be a disaster. The coach left us to the embassy suites at "Jamaican Court", rather than the "convention address". The guy on the desk was totally un helpful . I was really glad when we were able to identify the mistake and quickly escape being treated very badly (I could not begin to imagine what 2 weeks of his abrupt unsurley treatment would have been like). Fortunately a very short taxi ride sorted the problem.  On entering The 'Convention suites' it was blatantly apparrent they were offering far superior treatment to guests.  The staff were all, without exception extremely pleasant and helpful.  The maid created a different towel oragimi each day, swans, elephants, bears etc.  The kids  looked forward to opening the suite each day…

title: Great time had by all
review: Just returned to Scotland after staying 17 great nights at the ES. We travelled with another family , both families consisting of 2 Adults & 2 children , neither family could fault this hotel in any shape or form.  The high points were the breakfast that catered for everyone's taste and the the managers drink reception was enjoyable, during our stay which included the Wireless convention, Spring break & Easter holidays ( very busy to say the least)  we never had to wait long for breakfast or a free drink. Some people on previous reviews complained they had to wait up to 30 minutes for a free drink, but if they were that desperate for a drink they could have nipped to the Hurricane bar in the hotel and bought one, simple as.  With regards to the up keep of the hotel , again i…

title: Great Hotel to be near attractions and away from kids
review: My wife and I stayed here to be near Sea World, Discovery Cove and Universal Studios (this location is smack dab in the middle of those, all 2 miles apart).  Across the street are tons of restaruants and they are building a mall and movie theatre, but it isn't finished yet.  Good news about this hotel is it is clean and not many kids.  Only bad news about this hotel is that hotel bar is pretty boring and outdated and happy hour line is long (but you can't really complain since that part is complimentary.

title: Rooms are quite dated; breakfast same every day
review: We booked the Embassy because we have two kids and thought the suites would give us extra space.  Actually the 'suite' is probably smaller than other regular hotel rooms we've stayed in.  The living room fits barely the TV, dining table, and sofabed.  Everything felt like a tight squeeze the whole time we were there.  We were also disappointed that the bathroom fixtures and room furniture/decor were so dated.    Hot water was inconsistent from day to day.  Hotel staff was very friendly and it was a plus to have both an indoor and an outdoor pool.  As for food, we were surprised that the breakfast menu was exactly the same every morning.  We were there for 9 nights... it would have been nice for them to alternate between pancakes, french toast, waffles, etc.

title: better for convention goers  than amusement park attendees
review: While Embassy Suites is my preferred hotel chain,  I'm not sure this is the best choice for an Orlando stay if you are going to the amusement parks.    On the postive side, the hotel has the amenities that ES always provides--two-rooms, and a  free buffet breakfast.  There is a small outdoor pool (the picture made it look so much larger) and a larger indoor pool, hot tub and sauna. The front desk staff is friendly and housekeeping quickly provided a missing blanket and pillow.  Parking is free.  There are numerous chain restaurants  (Fridays, Red Lobster, Dennys, etc) in walking distance, and even some shopping.  The convention center is close.   A few smaller things kept this from being one of the nicer ES's.  The hotel restaurant/bar  quit serving by 11pm, even bar type foods …

title: Good Value Hotel
review: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from the 18th-28th November. Our room was very spacious and clean. On our 1st night there were a lot of exhuberant teenagers staying due to some big annual college football game and we thought that we were going to be in for a noisy night! Due to the room layout we heard no noise and slept soundly on the comfortable bed.  The suite we were given was spacious and clean and everything worked. We were in room 624.  The free breakfast is excellent value, with a varied choice including cereals, fresh fruit and cooked to order Breakfasts.  The Atrium/solarium was large with plenty of space to sit and it is here that you sit and have breakfast and Managers evening drinks.  The free evening drinks does have a queue at busy times but the longest wait we…

title: nice enough hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel for fourteen nights and enjoyed our time, the rooms here are large and spacious and big enough for us two adults and three not so small kids (ages 9,11,and 12) the air conditoning worked well and the rooms were freshened daily.. breakfast was only ok and We found the Managers Reception to be a gimmick., only one bartender which led to 30 minute queuing and a poor selection of drinks. The games room was good for the kids and the solarium is lovely with each and every suite overlooking it. The outside pool is small and overshadowed but fresh towels are abundent. Even though I found this hotel ok I would not rush back and feel there is better value in neighbouring hotels

title: good price/ lots of work to be done
review: Stayed seven nights here for mixed business and pleasure with family.    The room was spacious, but not great.  It was a good place to rest after playing or working all day.  Never got to use the pool.  The one day we were going to stay around, the outdoor pool was closed for construction on the roof.  Bad timing for us, but earlier notice would have been nice.    Breakfast and manager' s reception were nice as was location for going to Universal--less than 10 minutes away .  Bus stops in front of hotel and takes you right to convention center door.  Bahama Breeze restaurant across the street was excellent and we could jsut call down and give our name and did not have to wait.  The $79 internet rate we got was a good deal, but it is certainly not worth the regular rate of $135…

title: A Nice Embassy Suites
review: I would have never booked this hotel if I hadn't gotten a good deal.  I stayed on a weekend and after experiencing other Embassy Suites in the Northeast where children are left to run, scream, and misbehave without parental supervision on weekends, I was worried.  I was gladly mistaken.  There was a wedding reception in a ballroom on the ground floor and several children present in the hotel, but the hotel was very quiet with the exception of a few feet from the ballroom doors.  I had a very large suite that overlooked the interstate, but I never heard the traffic (I also don't travel to look out the window either).  The suite had a very large living room area with a bar area that was larger than most Embassy Suites.  The living room was also larger than normal.  The breakfast…

title: Wonderful!
review: We have stayed at this hotel three times and cannot fault it. Please don't let negative reviews put you off. This charming hotel is in a great location at the quieter end of the drive with restaurants, bars and shops on its doorstep. Our children love the Hawaiian crazy golf place which is virtually opposite the hotel.  The suites are clean and spacious, the inclusive breakfast is great and the managers cocktail reception each evening is a lovely way to end the day.  We find the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. We are staying at this hotel again in October and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Orlando.

title: Can't wait to go back
review: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Embassy Suites Orlando this was my second time to stay here I stayed here in 2000 it hasn't changed a bit.  The all inclusive breakfast is a brilliant idea, the staff are very friendly they would bend over backwards to help you.  Had lunch and dinner there a couple of times the menu had a lot to choose from.  Centrally located.  The only downsides to our stay were not enough safety deposit boxes to go around we didn't get a box till 7 days into our stay,  the hotel bar wasn't the best any type of drink we asked for they were out of so we drank in TGI Fridays bar which was just accross the road any type of drink you wanted they had. The room had a very musty smell in it I think it was down to the air conditioning after a few days we got use…

title: Horrid Place - Do Not Stay!
review: Well where do I start? Well lets begin at when me, my husband, my sister and her 3 children arrived at the reception desk. I gave my name Karen Sonners but they said that they had nothing down on computer. I told them we had booked over 8 months ago but she wouldn't listen, saying we had no reservation at the hotel. She said that she would have to see the manager and we had to wait. We had to wait around 10 minutes for her to come back and tell us we were in fact on their records! At this point I was sick of waiting around and wanted to get to my "suite". After all that torture they put us through, they then put us on the FOURTH floor! I was disgusted. The least they could do was give us a room on the bottom floor after all the messing about they had caused us. Got the room.  …

title: Great Hotel, idea spot
review: This hotel is excellent, rooms, staff, service.  It is a great location for good restaurants and easy access to Sea World and Universal.  However, its Disney shuttle leaves a lot to be desired although they do provide one and its complimentary.  Still, it didn't spoil our enjoyment too much and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Love the Staff
review: Outstanding location!  Close to Disney, Universal and Sea World.   Great staff, lots of restaurants in walking distance...everything from Subway, Olive Garden and TGI Fridays to a number of very highend Steak, Seafood and Italian.  The staff has great local knowledge and is very willing to help.  We have stayed in the Disney area a few times, the prices are high and you need a car.   Try City Walk @ Universal for nightlife...fun for all ages and tastes.     If you like fun in the sun and great food, this is in a great spot!   Free breakfast and a large suite too.  Good deal!

title: Cockroach!
review: Hotel was just fine until we found a live cockroack in our room. Front desk was definitely not helpful and adopted a "welcome to Florida" point of view.  Didn't offer me a refund, a new room, or an exterminator.  Had to harrass three different people over three different days to get any sort of result (partial room refund).  Even when I got a refund, they only gave me one day free.  When I told them I wasn't paying anything for the room their response was "Did you see any cockroaches on any of the other nights?"   I definitely will not be staying here or at any other Embassy Suites in the near future.

title: Great hotel but not really child friendly
review: My mother-in-law, husband, 7 year old, and I had as great 2 night stay at this hotel.  We all enjoyed the free hot breakfast each morning.  The rooms were very nice and clean.  The pool area was pretty much clean as well.  The drive to and from Disney World was great.  Access to the interstate (I-4) was very convenient.  This hotel is really within walking distance to gift shops, a pharmacy (Walgreens), entertainment and restaurants (Olive Garden right next door, Bahama Breeze is across the street, and many more near by).  The hotel is in a great location for those who just want to do other things besides going to Disney World.  Oh, I almost forgot to mention that this hotel offers free shuttle service to the Disney World Parks.

title: Great location, great hotel
review: Had an excellent stay at this hotel last year and have just booked up for another 2 weeks in October this year.  Really good location for all the parks with Disney parks just a 20 minute drive away and Universal and Wet N Wild only 10 minutes.  Plenty of good quality restaurants close by - no need to drive so you can get stuck into your free drinks at the hotel in the early evening after a hard day at the parks before going for something to eat. Breakfast is good and our 3 children always found plenty to eat.  My only gripe would be that when there is a conference on at the hotel it can take a bit longer to be served at breakfast and for drinks. Can't wait until our return visit later this year.

title: Excellent hotel in Orlando / Disney area
review: We were so pleased with this hotel - I decided to write my first TripAdvisor review about it.  Clean, roomy, and quiet - in spite of being next to the freeway.  Great breakfast and cocktail hour!  We love being able to have a cup of coffee in the morning, and a beer at the end of the day, without being charged high hotel prices.  The breakfast was delicious.  The pool was well stocked with towels, and very clean.  We will continue to look for Embassy Suites in future travels.  Well worth the money!

title: Not What You Would Expect At An Embassy
review: I stayed there in early January.  The Heat/AC system was very poor in my room and apparently in others based on a comment from a traveling business associate.  The food service at lunch during a non-busy time of day, after 1:00 PM, was extremely slow as was the Manager's Reception in the evenings.  Only one bartender and a long line of guests.  The breakfast was normal.  I wrote a letter of complaint and have not received a reply in over a month now.  I won't go there again.

title: Great Hotel!
review: Just got back from a ten night stay in this hotel and I cannot praise it enough. The suite was an excellent size, and was spotlessly clean on our arrival and kept the same way by the daily maid service.  Our room overlooked I-Drive and unlike other reviews, which I have just read, we couldn't hear any noise - I didn't even know there was a helipad a couple of hundred yards away until I saw one take off a few days after we arrived! The breakfast buffet was delicious and there was loads of choice...my 3 year old daughter had something different every day, she was particularly thrilled that she could eat mini muffins at 8am! The managers reception is such a bonus...free margheritas after a day at Disney? Yes please! The pool was great both inside and outside and lovely thick clean…

title: Great time
review: This hotel was clean and tidy the rooms are very clean and the staff are very friendly. A excellent hotel.

title: Great location, great staff.
review: This hotel is located in a much quieter portion of International Drive but very close to the most popular Orlando attractions (Sea World, Universal Studios & Disney).  The rooms were clean and spacious.  As with other Embassy Suites there was a manager's reception nightly and complimentary cooked breakfast.  The pools were small and cold but felt good on the warm summer afternoons.  One other drawback is that while it did have free wireless internet connection if you are traveling with a pc, you needed to pay for any use of any hotel provided computer to check e-mail etc. if you didn't have a pc.   I would recommend this hotel to everyone, especially if you are traveling with children and need the extra room.  I am already planning my next Florida trip and this hotel will be…

title: Great Value, Great Location
review: We just returned from this hotel yesterday and were pleasantly surprised.  I never book a room without checking out some photos and reviews but we had no choice.  It was spacious (especially the bedroom) with a great view of Orlando.  We were on the top floor and had an entire wall of window overlooking the city.  It was an unexpected plus.  The rooms were clean, the towels were plush, and the staff was friendly.  Those are all the pros.    The only cons were the small bathroom, the breakfast (cold and bad) and the fact that the heated pool was freezing cold as well as the outdoor jacuzzi being broken.    The staff was wonderful though.  They were everywhere eager to help and with a smile.  We only paid $129 for the night so it was a wonderful bargain.  We were only 2 miles from…
